hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Nothing disappointing about this hotel. Staff and service were friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is very convenient, near the Tokyo station and a 10-15 minute walking distance to Ginza. Very spacious rooms for Tokyo standards. Look forward to returning!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The reception staff seemed genuinely pleased to see us. They were exceptionally courteous. The room was immaculately clean. Whilst proximity to the rail station had the downside of some noise, it was more than made up by the convenience of getting to the station for onward travel. The reception staff even accompanied us to the station to make sure we found the rought platform.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This Four Seasons is definitely a 5+ star rating experience. It's conveniently located in a safe and central area of Tokyo. The train station is located foot steps away with access to plenty of restaurants and shops. I look forward to returning to this location next year. Don't miss the opportunity to feel pampered, greeted and supported while staying with an incredibly professional and detailed oriented staff.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: On our third and fourth visits to this lovely hotel, my wife and I stayed 3 nights at the end of January and 2 more nights a week later in February. This hotel remains our favorite hotel in the world. From the moment we were met at our train car on the Narita Express to our escorted departures at Tokyo Station, we were greeted by name and treated warmly by the hotel's friendly and attentive staff.We got off to a great start each morning at the hotel's breakfast buffet enjoying made to order poached eggs along with their selection of fruits, pastries, and other fine assorted delicacies. The hotel's reception and concierge assisted us anytime we had a question and helped us book tickets to the teamLab Tokyo Digital Art Museum. From hailing a taxi for us and providing directions to the driver through providing us with a description of how to take the monorail and train to return to the hotel, the entire team made our stay a pleasure.If you're looking for warm, gracious, and personal service, quiet and elegantly appointed rooms with lovely L'Occitane amenities, and the magic of traditional hospitality and care in modern Japan, you will enjoy your stay here as much as we did.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hats off to the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi for an amazing stay with incredibly genuine and caring service. From the moment we were met at the station by two wonderful staff members to help with our big ski bags we knew we were in for a treat!The hotel is lovely - luxurious rooms, beautifully appointed with wood, leather and gold leaf accents. Spacious and stylish bathrooms with every amenity.The main restaurant on level 7 is spectacular. Great city views and watching the bullet trains pull in and out of Tokyo station is great! Food is beautifully prepared and a great variety of both western and Japanese dishes - perfect for our Family.But what makes this hotel more special than others is the service of the staff. The genuine and caring service of the staff is absolutely beyond what we’ve experienced at any other Five star hotel. Always making sure we have everything we need; giving great tips for restaurants and things to visit....and probably most importantly helping me when I was ill. The staff walked me to the doctor surgery; spoke with the surgery staff in Japanese so they knew what I needed and even showed me were the pharmacy was located. The service was above and beyond and made a real difference when I was feeling unwell. Thank you Four Seasons Tokyo. We will return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We arrive earlier than expected, but the reception staff checks us in within minutes, and during our stay, every need I call are met by the most friendly staffs and faster than I experienced in other hotels, the Room is big and well cleaned everyday we return to our room, thank you for your service

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We chose this hotel for for the first 2 nights of a 2 week trip due to its proximity to the train station and other areas we planned to explore before heading to Kyoto. The room was spacious and well appointed, super quiet and well insulated from exterior sound (considering we were only 7 floors up and adjacent to the train tracks), very nice breakfast buffet included with our stay. Friendly staff. I have nothing but positive things to say.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons Tokyo was excellent. Attentive, friendly and capable. The staff is amazing, my room was wonderful and the food was fantastic. The staff made every effort to cater to my requests for tours, restaurant reservations and transportation.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staffs are warm welcoming. Location is convenient Too noise to sleep at all the times, only one restaurant for the luxury hotel it will be difficult cover variety dish and favor.Only suggest for the short period quick business trip at that high room rateEspecially, concierge staff was poor with non-sense on the smart phone while 2-3 customers waiting in line.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is an oasis. The gardens are beautiful, the rooms are incredibly comfortable, the staff were amazing. The level of service provided was second to none. We had an amazing time and we will definitely recommend this to all of our friends who will be visiting Kyoto.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Even without asking they will hand over the umbrellas if the knew we going walking!!! One of the staff walked with us to the station to help us purchase a ticket and to make sure we ride the correct train!! It was an amazing stay I really enjoyed it and my family and I highly recommend.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hotel is conveniently situated. Accessible via all forms of transport (train, bus and taxi). You can take a walk to Shopping Malls or subway malls. In-room dining is superb. Reception is great. Staff are accommodating and tends to your need with urgency.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our stay was wonderful and staff went beyond our expectations.Will highly recommend to any one planning a trip to Tokyo.If we come back will definitely stay here again.Mari greeted us at Tokyo train station and also helped us to board train for the airport.Food was great and Spa and fitness was wonderful.We asked hotel to arrange us a guide and Machico was our guide and was very knowledgeable and friendly.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We walked the 2 minutes from the train station as we arrived, and someone from the hotel ran out to the street with umbrellas so we wouldn't get wet. As we checked in the staff gave the kids personalized booklets with tokyo info and activities, and then they were able to pick out a Japanese gift from the treasure chest, like origami paper and hair clips. The staff even walked with us to the subway station to make sure we were able to get on the right train when we went out exploring. Not the grandest hotel in Tokyo, but they really go out of your way to make you feel like royalty, Japan can be tricky to navigate with small children, as many hotels and restaurants won't even allow them, but young families will be welcome here. Significantly less expensive than the Kyoto property, so I felt that it was a pretty good value. Great Ginza location. Note: you can hear the trains at the station from the room, but it didn't bother my family, and I sleep with bose noise cancelling earbuds and these blocked the sound so i was fine.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Was looking forward to my return to the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi. Again this property exceeded all expectations. Had a unbelievable suite with a bathroom overlooking Tokyo Station. What a truly Japanese experience to relax in the bathtub while watching the Shinkansen come and go. Motif always delivers even if you are having a simple meal at the bar. From arrival to departure I was treated with courtesy and professionalism. I need business gifts wrapped and the team graciously took care of it and had at the ready upon check out. For me there are many fine properties in Tokyo but the boutique business model, Japanese traditionally and service combined with the Four Seasons brand make this property number 1 for me. I am here on business for three months at a different property but I will be sneaky away for overnights .....

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: this was my second stay with four seasons in tokyo. the reason i came back to the same hotel was CONVENIENCE. we were meticulously taken cared of from booking restaurant, taxis ,our breakfast, to wine selection where to go for a bite and the bar

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I had a great experience at the Four Seasons Tokyo. All of the staff was very pleasant and welcoming...in fact, they met us at the train station and walked us to the hotel. When it was time to check out, they walked us to the JR desk and helped reserve our seats, then walked us to the platform and offered to buy us snacks. We arrived around 11:30a and waited 20min for our room which is nothing considering check in is supposed to be at 4p! Since we booked with AMEX FHR, they upgraded our room by 2 categories...that was nice! Late check out also helpful...although Tokyo gives you plenty of options to store luggage, it was nice to get up and go the morning of check out and not worry about our bags until it was absolute time to depart. Breakfast was included with our stay since we had room credits and it was delicious. They offer a buffet or Japanese style breakfast or made to order omelettes. Since the omelette would take 20m my hubby just got made to order eggs. The room itself was spacious and clean. No complaints. Last thing, because it was his birthday, we were greeted with a cake and photo op. Excellent customer service and would recommend!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I’ve stayed at numerous fabulous FS hotels and resorts and I would classify this property as a bare bones facility for this chain but still with wonderful service and great location. The lobby is very small and there are not great public spaces other than a small restaurant and bar area. The spa is minimal, there is not a pool and the fitness space, though with a nice view was just okay. The dining options for dinner were either super pricey or average bar-type food. The restaurant was great for breakfast though and service was excellent throughout the hotel. Our upgraded room was extremely expensive compared to a much better basic room we stayed in before at The Peninsula. Just wish we could have had the great FS service at The Peninsula!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Just stayed here with my wife and 13 yr old daughter. We had a great time! The staff was so helpful and courteous. They really went the extra mile to take great care of our family. Th location is right beside Tokyo station so it is very convenient to get anywhere in the city. Also, the shops and restaurants in the subway are amazing! Ramen Street is right beside the hotel!No question that I would stay here again

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staff are very professional, friendly, welcomingHotel location is very good, transportation is very convenientThe room is very neatly furnishedRestaurant food is very refinedThe overall accommodation experience of the hotel is very satisfactory

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hotel location is perfect. It is only minutes away from Tokyo station. All hotel staff are helpful with caring. Room is clean. There are different pillow choices to choose for sleep. Truly enjoyed a wonderful holiday in this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo is a lovely property. The team went out of their way to assure comfort of our party. It was a business trip and I traveled with a team, in addition to bringing my daughter. The hotel balanced the full party with seemingly endless ease and perfect dispositions.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Simply not good enough.Having visited many other FS properties this was poor, I will not be back. From the quality of drink to the level of service.Must try harder. Much harder.There are many other high end hotel bars in Tokyo, I would encourage users to visit them.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My first time in Tokyo , I loved this hotel , in a really great position near all the shopping in Ginza and right by the train station.The staff couldn’t be more helpful, they took me to the station helped me buy the ticket for the bullet train and escorted me to the platform. I had a lovely room, floor to ceiling windows lovely and light.Breakfast was excellent with the most unusual marmalade ever. A whole orange cut and turned into a wonderful fresh topping for your toast.I love all four seasons and this one especially is a star.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is located on the "Yaesu" side of Tokyo Central. Perfect for walking to the trains including the Shinkansen and also walking distance to Ginza. The room was excellent and perfect. I had 6th floor room facing the train tracks and had absolutely no noise issues. I had made a few calls before my arrival and the staff were prompt with my questions and requests. The breakfast is very good at the restaurant and you feel well taken care of by the staff there. The spa could use some additional staffing as I noticed other overseas visitors not knowing the local etiquette when entering the onsen bath. Alternatively some clear guidelines could be given to overseas visitors in the room etc to avoid embarrassing moments in the spa. For example, i noticed one such visitors with dirt on his feet and his undergarment jump right into the onsen bath without even bothering to shower first. This however does not reflect adversely on the hotel or the staff but some guidelines will help for these lost visitors not understanding local or standard culture and practices. Not sure if in the US and EU, anyone jumps into the pool without a shower first. Every amenity for a business traveller was perfect including the WiFi which was very fast anywhere and everywhere in the hotel premises. FYI, I have stayed at most of the other luxury hotels in Tokyo before and this hotel with its location etc is the best. Look forward to staying again at this property soon.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent two nights at the Four Seasons Marunouchi, following a cruise. Everything, from the pre-stay communication, to the in-hotel service, room, and food, was outstanding. This was our first visit to Japan, and whereas Tokyo Station could be a bit overwhelming, the Four Season's magical staff could not have made it more simple for us. The evening of arrival, they walked us over to the station and purchased our Shinkansen tickets for us. The next morning, a member of the staff purchased a pass to enter the train area so that she could walk us right to the entrance of our car. When we arrived back later that night, another member of the staff was waiting for us, just as we walked off the train, to escort us back to the hotel! The breakfast was delicious, and service very attentive. The room had a great view of the high speed trains, and was immaculate. A tremendous combination of luxury, service (and when compared to other hotels in the area) value

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The front desk and concierge staff was beyond compare. They greeted us by name upon arrival to the hotel an every single time we walked through the front door. We felt very well taken care of. The staff handled our transportation from Narita to hotel. a full day of private guide and driver as well as personally escorted us to and throughout the train station for our train back to Narita. Mari should be commended for her nurturing, sweet, service oriented demeanor. She was truly a delight.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location next to Tokyo station and 10min walk from Ginza.Very fast check in and check out.Amazing service : our room was all secured for our 14-month old baby to protect sharp angles of furniture, we were escorted to the Narita Express which definitely smoothen the process.The breakfast could be a bit enriched but the lovely staff and amazing service make you forget this little detail.We will definitely come back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Simply the best. I've spent 3 years of my summer vacations at this hotel. Exceptional staff, delicious food, small boutique-sized hotel, low-rise hotel structure, near convenient Tokyo Station, and very nice and cozy rooms. I also love that the hotel is not glitz, gloss and glamour, but instead is understated decor and comfort.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Amazing hotel with attentive staff and high customer service. Every detail was perfect. The staff escorted us to the train station and to the exact platform to wait for the train to the airport. The rooms were spacious, modern and luxurious.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service at the Four Seasons is amazing: there are lots of staff to assist you in the lobby and in the restaurant/bar. They are all very professional, friendly, and helpful. When we ordered an iron/ironing board, it showed up within minutes, and when we called to have them picked up, they also showed up immediately. They know how to provide impeccable customer service and seem to take pride in doing so. The location near Tokyo Station and the Ginza district is excellent. The room and bathroom were large with floor to ceiling windows, and it was very quiet – never heard any of the neighbors.The breakfast buffet was delicious with Greek yogurt and fresh blueberries/raspberries, as well as tasty pastries (I loved the chocolate croissants). They will take your order for eggs cooked however you want and deliver them warm to your table. Someone is always there to refill your water and coffee, and they come by your table with fresh apple jam (that they make in-house) served in a scooped-out apple. The Happy Hour was very reasonably priced (considering it’s the Four Seasons): Y800 drinks with gourmet treats to nibble on: Parmesan cheese with seasoning, popcorn with truffle seasoning, and spicy mixed nuts. It’s very relaxing to sit by the large windows for a drink in the evening overlooking the trains coming and going to Tokyo Station.Although I didn’t use the Spa with Onsen bath, we did get a tour and it looked very inviting and relaxing. My daughter worked out in their gym that had floor to ceiling windows looking over Tokyo – it also was a nice facility. The only negative thing was the roll-away bed: my daughter said it was the most uncomfortable bed she’s ever slept on: hard as a board with the springs poking her in the back. That was unfortunate considering how much we spent for the room. We should have complained – they probably would’ve replaced it, so it’s our fault for not asking.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our second time in this hotel. Our main reason why we stayed here again was because of the location,right outside Tokyo st. Rooms have a decent space compared with what Japan spaces are. They are comfy, clean and super quiet. Unless you have a crying child as a neighbor. However for the second time we confirmed that the service during breakfast is terrible. If you want to order pancakes be prepared and have enough time because they will tell you that will take 30min. Also 30min for a bowl of oatmeal and 10min for coffee. And this was not just one day, this was every day that we stay there. Waitresses get distracted very easily even though sometimes there was only a few tables occupied, they’ll give you the oatmeal but forgot to give you sugar, raises or what ever. However the concierge service is one of the best if not the best. There was nothing we’ll can ask for that they provide. We arrived from Beijing sick and they even took us personally to the clinic. They help us with our luggage and took us to the Shinkansen st. and pick us up on our way back. Although location, rooms and concierge are superb. Next time we will look maybe for the Shangrila hotel wich is nearby Tokyo st.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Had four nights in Four Seasons Tokyo and couldn't have been happier. The service was top class from the moment we got there till we left. They even walked us from the hotel to the platform of the Tokyo-Narita express to ensure we got the right train to the airport. The room was lovely. Very spacious by Tokyo standards. Bar and Restaurant on Level 7 well worth a visit.Really great location as you can get a train from Tokyo Station to anywhere and the surrounding district is full of shops and restaurants. Would definitely go back next time in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service at this hotel was impeccable. It is a real boutique hotel and has a very high employee to guest ratio. If you are arriving to Tokyo Station make sure you email them to have someone meet you at the platform. This was so helpful for someone who is not familiar with one of the largest train stations (I’ve seen). We were lucky to be met by Mari, she turned out to be our favorite throughout our trip. She is really a gem! The gym and spa were amazing. They did not charge you to use the Japanese spa. The breakfast was real good, especially the Japanese breakfast! The same restaurant at nighttime has a lounge with a nice view, great for a nightcap. We were leaving for Kyoto and Mari asked us how we’re flying back. Once I told her we were taking the train back to Tokyo station and then switching to the Narita express, she made sure to get our tickets and arrange for someone to meet us on our return to guide us to the Narita express. It was a blessing to have 2 team members waiting for us and helping us to the Narita Express, we probably wouldn’t have made it on time without them. BTW a huge plus is your 2 mins away from all the awesome restaurants in the station!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We are back again and the Four Seasons Tokyo is still completely awesome. Huge double queen room with a great view of the train system which my kids love. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. Now onto the rooms: my family has asthma issues and this hotel is clean and no smoke. Everything in the room is immaculate looks fresh and new and I’m terribly picky. The hotel is right at the Tokyo train station you can’t get better than this location. And if you’re interested in Disney you just hop on the train at the hotel only about 15-20 mins to Disney. Love this place!! It’s so calm and quiet too makes you feel at home after long days of trains and walking!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The best service of any Four Seasons. The staff went above and beyond all expectations for our family. Pre-trip the concierge suggested and booked wonderful restaurants and events for the whole family. We were picked up at Tokyo Station and escorted directly to the hotel from NRT. During our stay the staff was engaging, kind and greeted us by name. On a number of occasions, the staff walk our family to the train, the JR Ticket Office (helped us book the bullet train tickets) and restaurants - all just to make sure we were having the best possible experience. Sad to leave but will return after a brief visit to Kyoto.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I went to the Four Seasons Tokyo after staying at another hotel in Tokyo for a night, and the differences were striking. All I can say is that every single thing was great: checkin, room size (huge for Tokyo!!), bed, cleanliness, service, concierge, breakfast, room service, and location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I cannot recommend this hotel enough. It has a boutique feel. We stayed in a deluxe suite, which was an upgrade. The room was well appointed and extremely comfortable. As with all Four Seasons, the service is what sets them apart. However, the service here was beyond any I have encountered. It was warm and friendly as in all FS, and it was delivered with authentic kindness. On our last day we were to take the bullet train to Kyoto. We had quite a lot of luggage (probably too much) as we were going to China, Singapore and Bali as well. The train has an underground connection from the hotel, however, it is not a short walk. We were escorted with all luggage by staff from the hotel directly onto the train. It was quite difficult I imagine. They were lovely and kind and truly seemed to be their pleasure to help. This was above and beyond any expectation. They stayed to watch our train depart. I will not soon forget this. They surpassed good service to kindness. This place is a gem and the people working there are what makes it sparkle.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: One of the most fabulous hotels in the world!Room with a train view is a must!Great location!The most friendly & helpful staff!!Everyone knew our name & went out of their way to help celebrate our anniversary!Definitely the place to stay!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: After visiting Tokyo last year for the first time, it was so awesome that our family decided to do it again this year! And because we were so happy with everything last year, we booked our stay again at the Four Seasons Tokyo!!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We really enjoy our visit.Location in Ginza neighborhood was great.close to the main train station....perfect to move arround the country.Shopping in Ginza is ameazing.Staff at hotel always with a big smile trying to help

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Maranouchi-Tokyo Hotel is a small gem in a big city. The location right next to the central train station may be a plus for some travellors. The service is polite and professional. The rooms modern, clean and luxurious.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My two children and I celebrated my son's graduation from college with a trip to Japan. Our stay at the Four Seasons could not have been better. As noted in other reviews, the staff was so helpful--meeting us at Tokyo Station from Narita and then taking us to Tokyo Station to help purchase tickets to Kyoto. The room and bathroom were very large, elegant and well appointed with special features like electric drapes and 3D glasses. The hotel sent us a bottle of champagne with a card signed by the staff to celebrate my son's graduation. The breakfast buffet had a large and plentiful variety of delicious food. Thank you, Four Seasons, for such a special experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have been to many nice hotels, but this is for sure one of the best hotels. Especially because the team there is really welcoming and warm as well as everything is as you would expect it to be. I recommend this hotel (and the Aman) in Tokyo (not so much the Mandarin).

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had a business meeting in the restaurant of the 4 seasons. We were seated in separee in the back of the restaurant. The quality of the lunch menu was impeccable, all cooked to the point, great service. It came at a price but was worth every ¥.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: If you are going to be in Tokyo and you want exceptional help with your day to day activities you can't beat the concierge and reception staff at the Four Seasons. In fact, I can say without reservation it was the staff in the hotel that made this place excellent.The motif restaurant was very good but not xtr4aordinary I think our large group of 13 might have been a challenge. However, again the wait staff was superb.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This Four season hotel is at the top of my favorite hotels. This is the 4th time i have stayed in this hotel. The rooms, ambience is soft, quiet, clean lines and its simple ways make it so comfortable and friendly. Always a favorite.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great little hidden boutique gem in the heart of downtown Tokyo. We spent two nights at this wonderful property in between our flight into Narita and a trip to Kyoto. The location is excellent - right next to Tokyo Station and on the edge of Ginza. We did a nice three mile run around the imperial palace, shopped in Ginza and ate luscious sushi. At the bell desk, ask for Mari - she is wonderful, excellent English, and super helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is small enough that you feel personally cared for. The staff is just fantastic, they will go out of their way to make your stay perfect, especially the concierge team. They booked all the restaurants that we wanted to go, including some that are deemed impossible for foreigners to book. A special thanks to Xing!The location is just perfect, steps from Tokyo Station, a major transportation hub, and within walking distance from Tokyo's best restaurants and shops in Ginza.If you are looking for luxury with a small boutique hotel feel, don't think twice. This is the place to be.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I would recommend a stay here. Its location is convenient (close to Tokyo Station which if you a frequent visitor know offers so much in terms of eating and shopping in addition to Shinkansen access to other major cities; Ginza shopping and top notch sushi.) Service is top-notch Four Seasons, which you only realize the importance when you don't stay in one (ie, our previous stay at Conrad Tokyo, a similarly ranked hotel, did not come even come close in comfort).
user_name:
Camper625441
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have stay 2 night in four seasons and it is a wonderful stay in Japan. It preformed a standard 'Four seasons' style service. I would like to say that i would expect more in Japan as the service standards in this country is always high but still this is a comfortable, warm hotel I have stay in Japan

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I've stayed in about 10-12 Four Seasons in various places, and this is the only one that I would not return to, and wouldn't recommend to anyone. It's small, bare bones, tired, and depressing looking property that appears to exist only as hotel of convenience for nearby businesses. I booked here without reading all the reviews, figuring that I couldn't go wrong with a Four Seasons. Believe me, I went wrong. Read some of the other 3 star and less reviews, and you'll notice a common theme of people feeling ripped off. Add me to the list. The hotel is on the bottom few floors of a nondescript boring glass office building. There is no main entrance on the street, you arrive by driving down what looks to be a service road that leads into the building's parking garage. Go on Google street view and take a look. Taxis that picked us up here had to literally drive down into and out of the parking garage to turn around. A warm welcome this isn't. The lobby is so sad. It's the size of a two car garage, with a tiny front desk just barely big enough for 2 people. It looks like the checkin desk at an airport gate, except smaller. The decor in the lobby, and throughout the hotel, is 1990s corporate on a tight budget. Our room was small, dated, and generic. In addition to the fake wood laminate on the walls, there was also some fake wood that looked like formica. It was well worn, as were the leather cushions on the bench, which were scuffed from years of use. I've literally stayed in Mariott Courtyard rooms that were nicer. There are no good views. The bathroom was nice, that's the only thing that looked modern. There was actual real stone in the bathroom. The AC worked fine, although there was a small plastic dehumidifier in the corner of the room that was running the whole time. How weird is that? It made me wonder what the problem was that they had to solve it by plugging in a dehumidifier. I've never seen that in a hotel before.Breakfast was shockingly bad. The entire breakfast buffet is set out on a small table, maybe 10 feet long, and they don't replenish things very often, if at all. One morning when I arrived, they had two tiny muffins left on the tray. When I left, the same two tiny muffins were there. Bread was prepackaged sliced bread, like Wonder bread. Seriously, this was the worst hotel breakfast I've ever seen, bar none. Maybe if you order a la carte it's better. I don't even eat breakfast, just coffee, but still this was crazy bad. The hotel location says "Ginza", but it's actually about a 20 minute walk to the main 4-Chome intersection. There's a subway stop about 5 minutes away, which is convenient. It's also convenient to the train station, which is right next door.The only good thing about this hotel was the staff was typical Four Seasons quality, meaning they were very nice, helpful, and warm. They seemed very used to dealing with complaints. The experience of staying here was as if you took a typical Four Seasons staff and had them work at a derelict Holiday Inn Express property. And to top it off, you pay a hefty bill. When I left, I felt like I had been swindled. There's no way this can be considered a "five star" hotel. Not even close. If you're used to the Four Seasons experience, I recommend staying at the Peninsula or Mandarin in Tokyo to find it. The Four Seasons should just close this property, it's ridiculous.
user_name:
BillGibson1
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Incredible level of service and excellence at this property - very impressed by the staff's dedication and graciousness, and the facility - upon our next visit to Tokyo, we'll be staying at the Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I highly recommend the Four Seasons in Tokyo. The staff made my family and me feel like the only guests in the hotel and comfortable from the moment we arrived. The location is central to everything and right by the Tokyo train station.It is expensive but absolutely worth the money.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I hade amazing experience,very helpful personal high professional!!!would like to recommend to ppl who like comfort and high quality!! Очень приятно то ,что разговаривают на английском и любезно могут помочь.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We recently stayed at the Four Seasons in Tokyo and were extremely pleased with our stay. The front desk staff and concierge tended to every need and made our children feel very special. From the Tokyo station pickup and the welcome gifts for the children to the great dinner recommendations and assistance navigating the city, the staff went above and beyond. We can’t wait to come back!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From the understated intimate lobby...welcoming seamless check in...refreshing lemon tea...personal escort to spacious well appointed room...all done with sense of pride in a job well done. When someone sent us flowers...the team members immediately provided cutting shears and a vase for the flowers. When we left the hotel for Hakone...two team members walked us underground (the hotel is most convenient being next door to a major train station) to the entrance for our train in the cavernous massive train station. When we returned the next day...the team members greeted us by name...brought our luggage/still fresh flowers...and ordered a taxi to our next destination. The dinner at the French restaurant Motif was decicious...the steak juicy tender...the best steak ever. When we tried to give gratuities to the team members...they graciously declined...in keeping with the country’s traditional custom. Four Seasons Tokyo is the best hotel we’ve personally visited worldwide...the cordial pleasant impeccable service and attention to details are exceptional !

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four seasons ideally located for a visit to Tokyo, great for first time nervous visitors as well as seasoned travellers. Close to the entertainment and shopping areas and very close to the Tokyo train station.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Room - we had large corner room that was around 500 sq ft, with a great view of the trains coming and going from Tokyo Station. Room was very quiet and insulated from train noise. Beds were heavenly. Service - the staff go above and beyond making you feel welcome. Breakfast staff remembered what we had the day before, concierges were knowledgeable and got us reservations at short notice, housekeeping was super responsive and room service was excellent. But the thing I love most is the platform greeting service, where someone walks you from the Narita Express to the hotel. That is just so thoughtful, given the labyrinthine nature of the enormous Tokyo Ststion.Extra Kudos - on the return leg of our journey, we passed through Tokyo Station and needed to change trains from the Shinkansen to the Narita Express. This was 5 days after we had check out of the Four Seasons. They had a staff member meet us at the Shinkansen platform to take us to the Narita train. That is the kind of thoughtful service that makes me such a fan of the Four Seasons.
user_name:
Tribecamom
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent service and accommodations... Especially wonderful is the escort to the train station on departure. Gym and spa facilities are well maintained and clean. Restaurant and staff are terrific and can't be beat.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We really enjoyed our visit. The staff went out of their way to make sure that we had a good time. This is a small hotel with only 57 rooms. They really try to cater to each customer. The location is convenient and near the Tokyo train station. The rooms we had were nice and spacious and clean.I wish the breakfast was better. The buffet is very limited and small in comparison to other 5 star breakfast buffets.I wish there was a pool.Overall it is an excellent hotel and we would love to go back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff at the four seasons are what sets it apart.We were seamlessly greated by two fantastic staff when we arrived by train, and not only did they escort us to the hotel, they even escorted my in-laws to their near by hotel. When our room was not available on arrival we were escorted to a nearby store I wanted to visit.The rooms were very large, huge by Tokyo standards. The breakfast was great, but perhaps would become monotonous after more then 3 days.The location made sightseeing really easy and it will be the first place we think of when we return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There’s nothing massively wrong with the hotel, but there is also nothing really right either.It needs a modernisation in the rooms badly, the entrance is also underwhelming.The “city view” room looked straight into an office block, there was certainly no view.The staff do their best and are great, but something isn’t right about the whole hotel.The breakfast (and food in general) is very very average by Tokyo standards.With better options everywhere in Tokyo, I won’t come back to the four seasons again, that’s for sure.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: If you want to experience the ultimate hotel service, I would recommend Four Seasons Tokyo. Some people might complain hotel being old, but they still kept their hotel at the best condition.Quality of the room service was also very delightful.
user_name:
Seric10069
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Coming back from our recent trip in Japan, we brought so much good memories and great experiences, one of them is at The Fourseasons Tokyo Marunouchi. Many people might think the hotel is really small especially the lobby. But for us, the feeling is like HOME. Finding ourself exhausted from the flights and/or a day of walking exploring the city, going back to the hotel was just like going back to our home. Being greeted by everyone in the lobby, felt wonderful. We traveled with my 7yo son and he went home with full of memories. He was treated like a VIP, despite the hotel was labeled as Business Hotel, but we didn’t treated differently as w’re on leisure. Everyone still do their best to make us comfortable. My son feels that he’s an important guest as everyone always ask how he was, wether he feels comfortable and happy in the hotel. For us, our children’s comment are most important as they’re pure and honest. It really matters for every traveling family that some hotel might missed this details, but FS Marunouchi proven did not missed it!The hotel’s greatest treasure are the people, they’re genuinely kind and friendly. I may not remember everyone’s name as i must say everyone has been great to us and we can’t thank them enough. But i would specially thank Mr. Kim in the concierge for his endless assistance! We’re amaze on how humble he is and he has greatly showed us great hospitality gesture. We will never forget him,he is surely a gem for the hotel. And also Ms. Midori at the Spa for helping me wrapping my last minute souvenir shopping :) she’s such a wonderful lady and sweet. Nevertheless, I thank everyone for making our stay memorable and making my little man, feels special and come home with such a pleasant memories. We definitely would recommend this hotel for any kind of traveler, the location is definitely the best!Last but not least, we really love the view of the infamous Tokyo railway!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I had a great sleep. The room was well decorated and bathroom + toiletries was very nice. The only problem was the noise from the street outside. Location was very convenient , only short walk to Ginza and few minutes away from train stations.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is my second stay in this hotel, experienced again the excellent service from the concierge team and reception, everything I requested is well arranged, the staffs in this hotel will offer the most intimate care to your request with no doubt. Price may be more expensive but room size is big in Tokyo compare to most of the other hotels in Tokyo, and the 2 queen beds room that only exist in only few hotels inside Tokyo.This time i took the dinner on 25th Dec, enjoyed a happy dinning at restaurant Motif, food quality is fantastic and comfortable area let you can spent the night time there. Also would also like to special thank you to Mr. Enkelmond Ng for his wonderful arrangement for my birthday breakfast on 28th Dec 2018!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a conveniently located business hotel with good service and decent rooms. I think it is important to note however, that it is not what you may be thinking of when you think Four Seasons. The lobby is tiny, and there is little common space or amenities. It's not one for a leisure trip I think.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I booked the four seasons through Amex Centurion travel. The disappointments about this property are many. This hotel should be removed from the AE fine hotels program. Immediately.First, It is not a five star hotel. The people are friendly and helpful but I do not have anything else positive to say. The Four Seasons in Tokyo is a apartment building. Not a hotel. It is a office tower with rooms on floors 4-7 over looking the train tracks of Tokyo Station. Upon arriving you are down an alley way. It is obscure and uninviting. It really presents as an apartment building. The lobby is nothing more than a front desk checkin and a concierge desk. The bar and restaurant are located on the 7th floor and have been empty. The Mandarin Oriental by comparison is a true 5 star hotel that has a wow factor that can not be beat. The management should head over there to see what 5 star hotels should be. The room we were originally given was apparently an upgrade but was small and without a view. For the last nights stay we were upgraded to a larger suite but over looking the train tacks from the 4th floor. The furnishings are old and tired and look cheap. The safe in the room looks to be from the 90's. The "spa" is not worth the call. Appointments for services were difficult to get and the spa itself was sub par to say the least. The hotel should not be offered as a Four Seasons. It is rare to be this upset with a property not to mention the Four Seasons brand but this will not stand with me. I have contacted AE Centurion services and voiced my concerns as it is not fair to contact the AE travel program and get stuck in a property that is clearly not what it was or ever wanted to be for a trip of this magnitude.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a fantastic four seasons. High quality service all around. Nice fitness center and spa. This is a small hotel approximately 50 rooms and the service shows- everyone knows you by name by the second day. When you travel to a restaurant reservation they have maps printed to give your taxi drivers. Anything you need they literally run to get it. Rooms are very nice with all the amenities you’d expect from a four seasons. Concierge responded to countless emails and requests within minutes. Special thanks to Noriko and Xing concierges and Enkelmond a fantastic restaurant manager who took his time to give us great recommendations. Fantastic staff and hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Having stayed in several FS Properties, this one is a class by itself. Returning after 8 years, the property is still very well maintain. The staff from the moment you step in makes you feel welcome, and always helpful in every way. The FS Mobile App is a great tool, esp. the messaging function - is instant response. We had a wonderful stay, and hope to be back soon.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: For those who are a fan of the Four Seasons you will find Tokyo Marunouchi to deliver all the brand stands for. What make this property unique is the boutique nature of the hotel. In a city where you can easily get lost in a large property the Tokyo Marunouchi feels like an oasis. Spectacular service, finally appointed rooms and the perfect location for business or spending a few days exploring all that Tokyo has to offer, this hotel has it all and does it with style and great Japanese customer service. The restaurant Motif is not to be missed if you are staying on property or if you are looking for a unique foodie experience. Thank you Yuki, Saya, Kaoru and Mieu in the Motif lounge for making my stay extra special. Can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were in Hong Kong for two weeks when we decided to hop over to Tokyo for a visit. Not sure where to stay we booked ourselves into the four seasons, figuring we couldn’t go wrong with that choice.They were amazing. They took down our flight information and met us off the Narita express (train from airport). She wheeled our luggage to the hotel and they upgraded us to a larger suite. The room was facing the trains but we never heard them. The room was very clean and large. My kids felt comfortable right away. Not all Four Seasons look the same in every location but the service is always the same and so is the experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent service ( They personally walked us to our train from the hotel. For breakfast they let us pick out a table everyday, which we selected best for the best view.), attentive to requests, quiet hotel, great attention to details. 5-10 minute walk to Ginza Core. 1-2 minute walk to Tokyo station for trains & subways. Spa is small.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here for holidays in August and it is a solid option in central Tokyo, very close to the Tokyo Station, Ginza, etc. The hotel feels like a business hotel, is minimalistic and although the service and amenities were great, it lacks a bit of warmth that you probably need when going on holidays with the family.It would be a perfect choice to stay for business in Marunouchi.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have stayed at four seasons resorts around the world, and this one ranks right up there in terms of meeting expectations. the hotel itself is smaller and more quaint, which i prefer. the staff as usual is amazingly attentive. the concierges particularly to make your stay perfect. the location near tokyo IMO is PERFECT. would stay here again definitely.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Outstanding Service, Location and Facility. Everything you would expect from Four Seasons. This hotel is located very close to Tokyo Station and the staff is particularly adept and helpful with getting guests on to trains for the rest of their journey.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our first stay at the Four Seasons. We also stayed at the Kyoto location. Though the Tokyo location is a nice hotel, it was not nearly as good as Kyoto. Mostly because of the location/views. The location is super convenient, but we had views of the train station and we would have preferred views of the city. We loved the staff at both locations. Love the mobile app--it makes it SO easy to communicate when them from anywhere. You can ever order in room dining with it. They are building a new Four Seasons in the area for the 2020 Olympics. So I'm sure it will be fabulous. As far as we are concerned, Four Seasons is a great hotel and we would definitely stay again. But we will probably like the new larger facility better.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We have stayed at various four seasons locations before which made us chose it again I will review the positive first:-Excellent location (couldn’t be better)-Fantastic gym -Breakfast area has a breathtaking view -Staff is phenomenal ( I want to thank specially the concierge for making all our restaurant reservations weeks in advance)-Spacious room with beautiful design and excellent beds, they use occitane productsI would not call them negative (that’s why will give 4 and not 5 stars) but if you are looking at a fancy four seasons hotel (like other one we have been to) it does not fall in this category.Breakfast was kind of your average continental meal without any Japanese twist.I did order Japanese breakfast which was good.Would I go back if in Tokyo?Of course without any doubt, we enjoyed our stay a lot.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I don't usually stay at Four Seasons, but stayed here due to the close proximity to the train station. I was disappointed that there wasn't more Japanese food offered here, and the room service food portions were incredibly small. We ordered a cheese platter and got maybe 3 bites of cheese and a bunch of crackers. The pasta had very few noodles and all meat sauce. The breakfast buffet was disappointing, and wasn't even refilled when it got empty. However, Japanese breakfast was decent. The staff here were all very nice and helpful but unfortunately I have to rate it down in terms of food and value for what you pay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed for seven nights at the Four Seasons Marunouchi. It’s a wonderful hotel with nice, clean rooms and centrally located. It also has excellent service. Ask for Mami at the front desk. She’s very special and can do everything, including recommending restaurants (when the concierge is busy). The concierge people also are very helpful. Great place. We highly recommend it. We really liked it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My family (2 adults and 2 children age 9 and 10) stayed for four-nights at Four Seasons at Marunouchi for our first family trip to Japan. After getting off the train from Narita in Tokyo Station, we walked a few minutes to the hotel rolling 2 large suitcases. It was easy. We were welcomed by a perfect English speaking staff. The lobby is small and intimate. Don't expect the Park Hyatt scale. If you are looking for a grand hotel lobby with hustle and bustle, this isn't the right place. They serve complimentary Nespresso coffee early morning in the lobby and spa/gym area. The room has all the essentials for coffee and tea as well. We really enjoyed the restaurant for breakfast but the Tokyo station offers so many options, we were overwhelmed with excellent food choices. We even walked to Ginza even in the scorching weather and brought awesome food from various department stores. One of the largest Muji store was located within a 10 mins walk.I used the gym which has top of the line equipments. Due to jet lag, I woke up at 5am so jogged around the Imperial Palace which was about 5-10 mins. What I remember the most about this hotel are 1) excellent Japanese breakfast both in-room and restaurant, 2) friendly and professional staff, 3) comfortable beds, luxurious Frette linens and L'Occitane toiletries, 4) intimate hotspring/onsen located in Spa, 5) proximity to Tokyo Station and Ginza and 6) plenty of complimentary bottled water.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A sure bet for great service and great atmosphere. The staff are some of the best I've come across, they immediately know your name and do all in their power to insure a great stay. The room is most comfortable and simply but beautifully decorated. If you want a special view, get a room with a view of the bullet trains coming and going.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We loved our time at FS at Maranouchi. Since it's located steps from Tokyo Station, it was very convenient and a wonderful place to come back to at the end of each day. Our room was beautiful and the bathroom was especially lovely. We soaked in the onsen in spa at the end of each day, which felt especially good after doing so much walking and siteseeing. The concierges were very helpful in making reservations for us in advance and helping us with luggage shipment and transportation needs.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Never having been to Japan before I had no idea where to stay. I always have great luck with the Four Seasons so that helped in my choice. Secondly I was told that the staff would walk you right to your train which seemed helpful. As my trip got closer and I was reading guide books and looking at reviews I was getting worried. This hotel is rarely mentioned in the guide books and then I read the (crazy) one star review. I loved the hotel. It has everything I want in a hotel—great location, excellent concierge, the best sleep quality, and a good gym. (They had my favorite kind of Precor elliptical.) We stayed in a premier deluxe room—very comfortable, great natural light. The hotel is small—only 57 rooms—and does not have a crazy busy hotel feel. It is calm and elegant…a perfect oasis in the middle of Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at four season for 3 nights. They location of the hotel is very convenient, close to shops, restaurants and most importantly the station. The room is very spacious! The food was high quality! Out of all, the service is beyond excellent! We arrived by Narita express, Yuki met us at the train station and took our luggage to the hotel for us! My son had blood nose, the house keeping staff was there to help change the linen within 5 min of my phone call... our Shinkansen service was delayed because of typhoon, the reception staff took us to the platform to make sure everything is fine! It’s a great stay and we’ll highly recommend this hotel to anyone!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Good for business, near the central station of Tokyo and near a shopping mall. accessible through the underground tunnels in case of rain. restaurant on the roof has very good food and a corner where you can enjoy a cigar

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A small lobby as others have said but a very warn and genuine greeting from all staff. They escorted us to buy ekiben and find our shinkansen - in such kindness. And the room was stunning looking over the station so we could see the Shinkansens sitting there waiting to leave. A wonderful anniversary gift in our room completed this fabulous stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I can't say enough about our fabulous stay the the Four Seasons in Tokyo. Our family of four (2 adults and 2 children ages 9 and 11) arrived in Tokyo after our long flight from Boston. We were met with such a warm greeting when arriving at Tokyo Station by Hiro, a representative from the hotel, who helped us navigate through the maze of the station during rush hour. Hiro was amazing throughout our stay and my kids adored him. He, and the rest of the staff, always greeted us so warmly when returning from our many adventures and were always ready to help when needed. The rooms were very comfortable and spotless. We loved the breakfast and indoor pool. Really everything about our stay there was perfect. I hope to return some day soon!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: What a great stay. Location was great, next to train station and blocks away from Ginza area, full of restaurants and amazing shops. The staff very professional and the friendliest, both at lobby and the restaurant,food was very good and with a variety of choices for everyone. I especially enyed the Japanese breakfast and the hot croissants they bring to your table,

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I just spent five luxurious nights at our world's favorite hotel. Hurricane Jebi delayed our arrival by a day and the earthquake on Hokkaido extended our stay two nights. Reservations and Reception were able to accommodate our last minute changes without an issue and we were able to remain in our beautiful Premier Room without moving.From the moment we arrived, the service was outstanding. We were consistently addressed by name at Reception and at the Motif restaurant at breakfast which was included in our rate. The hotel concierge advised us that the best way to the National Museum near the Ueno Station was to take the JR train, not the subway. My wife enjoyed a fabulous Spa treatment. We enjoyed an evening drink in the bar overlooking Marunouchi and lights as the trains zipped in and out of Tokyo Station.Our room and the hotel was wonderfully quiet. With the translucent curtains open, beautiful afternoon light streamed into the living room area. At night with the drapes lowered, the room was darkened for great night's sleep. The bed and linens were as heavenly as we remembered from our first visit 3 years earlier. The bathroom contained a separate bathtub and shower. The weather was warm and humid during our stay and the hotel's central location made it easy to go in and out to cool off and fresh up. The room temperature and fan speed was easily adjustable allowing us to make adjustments to suit our preference during the day and night.When it came time to leave, Reception sent two team members to assist us with our luggage through the maze of Tokyo Station to the Narita Express platform down to the exact car. We couldn't have asked for a more comfortable and pleasing stay. The entire staff was lovely and we eagerly await our next opportunity to stay here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: All the comfort and luxury you can expect from a Four Seasons hotel with an excellent location, right next to Tokyo Station.Room was spacious and comfortable with great bathroom.Concierge was very helpful and service was globally perfect.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Traveling a lot, I can honestly tell that this is one of the best hotels I have ever experienced. Great location, great staff, great room. If I have to criticize one thing, breakfast service would have been better, with more variety of food and faster serving times. But again, if I ever stop by Tokyo again, this is the place I will stay for sure.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi got it right for our 5-day stay (family of 4).Staff was hugely attentive when we asked for any type of assistance (many kudos to all of you!!!). Our room was great for Tokyo standards (but you pay for it accordingly). Super great sleep. Floor to ceiling windows, corner room, top floor. Two great concierges, and quality food (at restaurant and room service). Greeting at train platform and sendoff was super special. Our family appreciates the attention this hotel staff provided. Great memories - would stay again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From check-in to walking me all the way to the train platform after check-out this was one of the best hotel experiences I've ever had. The room was clean, the bed incredibly comfortable, and the staff from the restaurant and bar were friendly and knowledgable.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I’m in disbelief of all the 5 star ratings here. I was really fooled by these folks and will think twice about the 5 star ratings people give to hotels when I’m considering properties for vacation. Let me make it easy for those of you who are thinking of paying for a 5 Star stay here: Rooms are severely outdated. I repeat... Severely OUTDATED. Like by 20 years. The floors have scratch marks all over, the walls have this ugly dark wood with light brown highlights, the tiles in the floor of the shower don’t properly fit so they lean in different directions when you step on them, the shower has mold stains (check the photos), the TVs are fitted with 3D and blu-ray DVD capability (what year was that cool- I forget), the AC controls are from 1982, old smelly carpets, wires from in room appliances are in plain sight,and there is no pool. The shower head is the size of a baseball, (no “rain” shower ), the toilets don’t have a flush button( unlike 95% of toilets in Japan- even ones in public restrooms), and even tho the bed is comfortable for me- this “Four Seasons” hotel is a scam. The service is the saving grace for this hotel. Mr. Yura, a manager at the hotel, was extremely patient in listening to our complaints and did what he could to make it right for us. But avoid this place If you’re looking for a 5 Star experience. I give it a 2 because of the people who work at the hotel but the hotel itself needs to be renamed cause it is most certainly not even close to par with the Four Seasons brand. I was upgraded to a higher category room and I’m still so disappointed. It’s just more old worn down stuff in a larger space /area. What was Four Seasons thinking?! On what planet is this a 5 star hotel? If they were charging 35,000 yen per night, this hotel would make ALOT more sense. But 100k yen per night is a complete scam. ABSOLUTELY AVOID!! If you want to spend on a 5 star hotel, I would seriously consider the Ritz Carlton. I stayed there when I first landed in Tokyo and can assure you that you will be 1000000x more satisfied( very similar pricing btw the two properties). **I do want to reiterate that the people who work at this hotel were attentive to our needs and tried to help as much as possible. They are the only reason we decided to stay our last night in Toyko at this hideous disaster of a Four Seasons property.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had a flight delay in Tokyo due to a tsunami and missed our flight to Hanoi so stayed overnight at this wonderful hotel. Noted as the smallest Four Seasons in the world, this place is huge on service. The bellman offered to take us and our luggage to catch the train the next morning. Initially I declined but since we were short on time the next morning, we accepted. The young man graciously walked with us and helped carry our luggage, purchased our tickets, then walked us directly to the train platform and put us on the train. We would not have made our flight to Vietnam without his assistance as the train station is large and complicated. Of course, as in all Japan, he would not accept a tip. My only regret is that I cannot remember his name. I would definitely recommend visiting Tokyo and staying at this four seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Returned to Tokyo and returned to this fantastic Four Seasons. Amazing room, and location in the Ginza district, but incredible staff doing everything they can to help you, and to make your stay perfect. And they achieve.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: our room was phenomenal. the location is walking distance from the main train station which is VERY convenient on your way to the airport!!!! I HIGHLY recommend it. The service is what you would expect from a 4 seasons

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Is Four Seasons and in Japan , imagine?Quality topService topIn Japan these Four Seasons have a diferent upgrad , because the unique way of take Care of the guest in Japan.Very beatifull gardens inside and around .You can see in some Seasons of the year a lot of couples making they party of marriage there.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Foursasons’s location is always perfect ! Located main downtowns.(5 minutes from Tokyo station)Staff is so kind and they offer complimentary ice water at front desk for check in guest.It i was considered hot weather.I was so touched!Room was a little bit small and rate was too expensive ( of course it is Fourseasons ! ) .

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Wow. This hotel was just perfect. We had a short two night stopover in Tokyo on our way from the US back to Sydney. We approached Tokyo station, tired from our flight and a bit uncomfortable by the heat and humidity of Tokyo. Waiting at our train carriage door was Yosuke. This smiling young man was grabbing our bags and putting them onto his luggage cart to escort us to the hotel. He stacked our four 32kg bags and started leading the way, even as the flat tyre of his cart squeaked and he had to push harder to make progress. We offered (and were declined) to take at least one bag, and then finally insisted to take one each. He kept smiling, despite the oppressive heat and humidity. We were welcomed at the front desk by the most friendly staff imaginable, and offered a cold and refreshing drink. Check in was efficient, and we were in our room before we knew it. We were disappointed that an upgrade was not available (a benefit, although not a guaranteed one of booking through virtuoso), but were not disappointed by our room. Beautiful, modern furnishings made our premier room perfect anyway. The bathroom was very large as well (I think the room was over 60m2). Others have mentioned outside noise heard from the rooms (from trains?) and also of outdated and tired decor, I can only assume they were staying elsewhere as we found the rooms quiet and well appointed. The shower had excellent pressure and I could have spent hours in there!Breakfast at Motif was wonderful. Although its a very small buffet, they make up for size in quality of the food. We especially enjoyed the confit fruit "jams" provided at the table. Service was exceptional. We had drinks at the living room. I tried their "truffly tini". A fun twist on a classic cocktail. I also had a Japanese whisky tasting with our bartender, Satoshi. Thank you so much for the lesson on Japanese whisky, and opportunity to taste some of your favourites, you made some grea choices and it was the perfect end to my 2nd and last night in Tokyo. This stay was faultless, and was a true example of Four Seasons service. We can't wait to come back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It is obvious that the Four Seasons Marunouchi would be a great business hotel, but what may be less obvious is that it is also a truly superb hotel for travel as a couple. My wife and I spent several nights here on our honeymoon. The service is absolutely world-class, possibly the best hotel service we have ever encountered. From check in (they gave us a bottle of champagne and a framed photo of us to celebrate) to the concierge (who booked several great restaurants and helped us find a medical clinic nearby) to the spa staff to the breakfast/Motif staff (who managed to be the perfect level of attentive without being obtrusive), everything was executed skillfully and expertly; this hotel should be truly proud of itself. Unfortunately, we didn't take down everyone's names, but a special nod is due to Mei and the gentleman who helped bring our luggage to and locate the platform for our train trip to Osaka. (The room/bathroom/bed were also private and wonderful.) If I could give six stars, I would.
user_name:
Metropolitan2889
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: When traveling for a city as busy as Tokyo. We enjoyed the personal touch of the Four Seasons! Fantastic place and fits the four seasons brand! Definitely worth every penny. Location was excellent as well.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were here for 5 nights and it was amazing! Large rooms with full amenities. Staff is super helpful with no issues in speaking English! Helped us to organize tours and restaurant bookings! All were excellent!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I cannot give this property and their staff enough compliments - it truly is an exceptional experience to stay here. From the front desk, to concierge, to room service to the restaurant/bar - the staff are without fail friendly, helpful and grateful for your business. The location is perfect - right next to Tokyo station, so convenient to navigate throughout Tokyo and to Narita airport. It is within walking distance to the Emperor's palace, Ginza shopping district and a number of other sights. The restaurant breakfast buffet was really well thought out and the quality was great. Four Seasons hotels typically end up being surrounded by cookie cutter steakhouses and 'business man' food, but there is a plethora of options from fine dining to ramen shops to the underground maze of restaurants under the train station. I can't recommend this property enough - yes, it's on the expensive side but you get what you pay for here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From our wonderful greeter Hiro-San upon arrival we just loved this hotel. The rooms are so large and the beds are just amazing. Service is top notch we cannot wait to return next year!!! For a family with children they are very accommodating.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is the most amazing hotel!! Our family have stayed here twice and we cannot fault any aspect of this hotel!! The staff are all so friendly and helpful. Absolutely nothing is too much trouble. The room and common areas are clean and modern. The housekeeping service is exceptional. The hotel location is very central to the Imperal Palace, Tokyo Station, Yurakucho and Ginza. The rooms are large and the bathrooms are luxurious. The hotel staff offer beautiful refreshing drinks on arrival and icy cold bottled water as you leave the hotel every day (during summer stays). I cannot fault this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The location is ideal for sightseeing. You can go to most sights without having to transfer. It was great to be able to come back midday to rest especially when it was in the mid 90’s during our stay. The hotel was very quiet in spite of being in the middle of everything. The personalized service, comfortable beds, and ideal location made our stay in Tokyo wonderful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Finding a place while vacationing in Tokyo was made enjoyable and relaxing Staying at Four Seasons Hotel Marunouchi. Staff is Point On from Arrival, During Stay and upon Departure, Excellent Location Location Location Centralized by Tokyo Main Shinkansen and Subway Station along with Ginza, Tsukiji Market. Easy access via Subway to go to the other parts in Tokyo for a few dollars or buy an Economical Rail Pass if you’re staying for several Days. Thank You Very Much Four Seasons Marunouchi

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We just arrived today with our family. I have been to many luxury hotels worldwide and this room with two queen beds is perfect. It is so nice and clean. Very large for Tokyo! The staff is amazing the rooms are super clean and there is zero smell of cigarettes which is a rarity in any upscale Tokyo hotel or hotel in Japan period. They met us at Tokyo station and escorted us here. There are high end restaurants but also a McDonald’s and local mart to feed picky children. You will not be disappointed and I am a super picky hotel guest/mom.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Don't get me wrong, it's a good luxury hotel. But unfortunately, that's about it. When you book (and pay for) a Four Seasons you expect nothing but the best and sadly, the Four Seasons Tokyo is not. It made me want to either pay more for another hotel, or definitely pay less and stay at the Inter-Continental or Grand Hyatt, where I'm sure I would've had a similar experience.When we arrived we simply couldn't believe the lobby -as it is- was all there was. Sure, well designed, but completely uninspiring. The room was nice and very spacious, but again, nothing special. The size of the bathroom was probably my favorite part. Welcome amenities were cute, but you only get them on your first day. I got excited when I saw hotel-made cold-pressed juices in the mini-bar, but nope, not complimentary either.There's only one restaurant and it overlooks the Shinkansen rails, which are a cool touch, but no luxury by any definition. The food was good, however nothing to write home about. Breakfast was the best part (particularly the french toast -super yummy).The spa? No availability during our stay. I'm sorry to say that the concierge, even though friendly, was not even as knowledgeable as Google.Location however is really, really good. Probably the best thing about this hotel.Overall, this may be a very good hotel for the business traveler, but if you're on vacation and looking for an amazing Japanese experience, you'd better look elsewhere.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Location: 40 minutes from Haneda airport to the hotel. 6 minutes from hotel to the JR station, 8 minutes to Kurakucho & 10 minutes to Ginza on food.Concierge: Very good service, transport your luggage to the room, carry good smiles.Reception: Very efficient, good smiles.Room: most likely is the biggest hotel room in Tokyo Station area, room is very clean, bed is big and very comfortable, washroom is also good & clean.Breakfast at Motif restaurant: Not too much variety of choice, but you can order whatever you want, they will do it if they can, a excellent restaurant. This hotel considered every details for the guest, suitable for family or business stay.However, since this hotel only have 7 floors so the view will not be as good as hotel Shangri-la, but the full glass wall at room will let enough light come from outside so you will not feel like trapped.General speaking, this is the best service and best smiles at the face of all staffs among the hotels in Tokyo Station.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I am a big fan of Four Seasons hotels around there world. However, how this one can keep its affiliation with Four Seasons, I cannot explain. While clean, the rooms are tired and in need of refurbishment. Worst is the breakfast. The “home made” ham looks decomposed. The crispy bacon as well. - Pastry, yoghurt etc. would be semi-acceptable for a US (!) four star hotel, not an Asian five star. The selection of food is very limited. Do not book a rate including breakfast. The food court in Tokyo Station has much better food. Also, there is a Tully Coffee Shop right below the hotel underground. Again, the service at breakfast is appalling. An hour before the end of breakfast time, staff starts to prepare the room for lunch. They don’t focus on the guests. Perhaps the worst breakfast I have had in many years. Food at bar time was so-so. Not disgusting but not good either. We stayed for a few days. Usually, at Four Seasons special care is taken to make the stay enjoyable. Not so here. Sadly, I cannot recommend it. If you want to stay close to Tokyo Station, go to the Shangri-La. Not perfect but far better than the Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: One of our favorite hotel groups along with R&C. Not too big and very efficient and friendly service. Great concierge team and very good meet & greet service from the door of your carriage if arriving by Shinkansen. Been here before and happy to return. Very central and an easy walk to so much

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The location of the hotel is very close to the tourist attractions of the city, just a few minutes on foot from the metro, many walking distance. The hotel staff are the best I have met up till now, they serve you with the best smile. The room service and the motif restaurant were delicious and the service was fast, we feel comfortable and happy.
