I would like to thank the hotel staff, I would certainly prefer the same hotel again on our next trip to Japan.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We did not plan anything but simply book a well known hotel that is also renowned in HK. Both the service and staff are excellent. We came by Haneda Airport so the travelling time is like HK - 30 min and that's very nice as we used to go by Narita.Walking distance to both Yaseu and Ginza shopping area as we did not want to go too far away and found 90% of things that we need to buy.. If there is one thing that we need to put a dent to it is the price but it surely match the service provided.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There is lots to love about the Four Seasons Tokyo.First, the location is fabulous sitting next to Tokyo Station. You couldn't get a bettter location in terms of transit and getting around the city. Next, the people are some of the best - their service standards and care skills towards guests is exemplary, and that's after 2.5 weeks in Japan where we experienced world-class service standards (setting a new standard in our travels). The staff here - from the front desk - check in experience - follow up on questions - concierge - bartender - the the entire service staff at their restaurant, Motif - amazing. We didn't have a single experience that was less that impressive.The only reason I'd "ding" the rating a bit is the property is beginning to look a bit tired and dated. We have stayed in many Four Seasons properties around the world and this is the least impressive facility. The lobby is very plain and that is the fanciest part of the entire place. Rooms are a bit worn (we had two rooms, a suite and connecting room for our kids). This is not the Four Seasons quality you would expect if you visit their other properties.We spent the first week of our trip at the Ritz-Carlton Tokyo (and then the Ritz in Kyoto after that). The Ritz facility is vastly superior to the Four Seasons - it's not even close. Then again, that is surely not the fault of the staff here - they are some of the best we experienced and we wish them well in the future and appreciate making our final night of our Japan odyssey so special.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at this hotel while in Tokyo for three days. The location next to Tokyo Station was ideal...we walked from the train to the lobby in less than five minutes. Check in was efficient and our room was spacious and well appointed. Staff were extremely kind and helpful. Our room looked over the train tracks and you could hear the trains all day long. If you love trains, you'll be in heaven. The hotel lobby was very small and not characteristics of other Four Seasons hotels that I've stayed in. Location was not convenient for sites and tourist activities (except the Imperial Palace) and Daimaru Shopping Mall (next to train station). There are also plenty of stores and restaurants in Tokyo Station. The overall feel of the property is that of a business hotel. I would not return to this property if I have the opportunity to return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi. We stayed at another luxury brand hotel previously, never again. The Four Seasons hits all the right notes. Normally, one would avoid a hotel next to the train station. Not in this case. The hotel has a very boutique feel and the service is spectacular. The rooms are lovely have floor to ceiling windows that look out on the hustle and hustle that feels miles away as they are perfectly soundproofed. As we were taking the Shinkansen train to Kyoto, the bell man escorted us all the way up onto the track and helped us onto the train. Next up, the Four Seasons's Kyoto. Another gem!
user_name:
Robin W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We enjoyed our 4-night stay in this hotel, which is a small hotel inside an office building. The concierge staff were extremely helpful in making some arrangements prior to our arrival and also made us some excellent recommendations for local restaurants. The suite was spacious, tastefully appointed, and very comfortable. We would definitely stay again the next time we are in Tokyo.
user_name:
NYC-mom-500
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here as a first stop on my first trip to Tokyo. We chose this location based on convenience to Tokyo Station and were pleased with our choice. All of the staff that we encountered were extremely helpful and genuinely warm and friendly. Although the view from our room was of the train tracks, the room was quiet and peaceful and any sounds from the train station that we could here were not disruptive. The room was very comfortable, well-equipped and spacious for Tokyo. The hotel staff will greet you upon arrival to Tokyo station and show you to the hotel, as well as see you off when you depart. Breakfast was great and location was convenient for getting around the city.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Let me start by saying that the staff of this hotel were wonderful. The shortcoming, is the hotel's location. The view out of window was of the train tracks which were busy from early morning to late at night. Food service was less than satisfactory. From the hotel you would have no idea you were in Tokyo. Could have been in any city by a train station. It feels like a business hotel. The lobby was small and had none of the beauty that one is accustomed to seeing while staying at a Four Seasons, although we paid Four Seasons prices. Check out a hotel that is in the city for a true Tokyo experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel was pristine and the service was excellent. Specifically, Taka was incredibly helpful and made the experience seamless (he even walked us to the train to the airport)! Would stay here again in a heartbeat, best location and service at a hotel I can remember.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent staff service - caring and personalized. Location is very convenient - always enjoy the stores and restaurants connected to the hotel in the Tokyo Station basement. Gym and spa are immaculate and I especially enjoy the Onsen. Room service menu can be improved but given the restaurant choices in the basement of Tokyo Station, there’s no real problem.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hotel is small and luxurious. Customer service and attention exceed expectations. Our room was beautiful, comfortable and quiet. Would not stay anywhere else in Tokyo. This hotel is the best and the location can not be beat.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A Four Seasons Hotel is always a good choice, and Marunouchi was great... The welcome was beautiful and Service just great, (Hiro was the best) all the Hotels MUST have a Hiro.  Can’t wait to visit in 2020 the new Four Seasons hotel in Tokyo, but in the meanwhile sooner to Marunouchi

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We arrived at 7am after an overnight flight and as the Taxi pulled to a stop at the front door the staff immediately knew my name when the Taxi door opened. A big welcome from the staff and a basket of toys for my 2 and 5 yo to choose from. Check in was smooth and the hotel arranged in room breakfast for us without my knowledge which was excellent after a long flight. The room was beautiful, two queen beds and a single, very clean and the view was great over the city. The hotel put kids toothbrushes and sponges in the bathroom which they loved, the bathroom was so clean and lovely, plenty of room with a full sized bathtub, shower and toilet. After refreshing we went to hit the streets and the hotel staff were more than happy to give advice on where to eat. Underneath the hotel is a maze of restaurants and shopping which was shown to us by one of the staff it was amazing. The bar is excellent and Will the bar genius will give you a great drink and also give advice on the best places to see in Tokyo. Will gave me some great advice on where to shop in Tokyo he is an asset to the Four Seasons. Breakfast was good but lacking variety until you ask for it, ask for pancakes, hash browns, hot chocolate and cappuccino because there is more to breakfast but you need to ask for it which I thought was puzzling, it should all be presented. Overall I would recommend this hotel and stay here again the hotel is worth every cent and the staff can't do enough for you. Thank you Four Seasons for a great stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: While the Four Seasons may not be the newest or most trendy hotel in Tokyo, it is everything you'd expect from the brand: beautifully appointed rooms (although they are starting to show some wear), sound proof windows for a good nights sleep, fabulous bathrooms with large fluffy towels, comfortable beds with lots of fluffy pillow, doting but practically invisible staff and amazing food! We opted to stay there for its proximately to the train station, which offers a surreal futuristic view with all the Shinkansen's coming and going! The hotel stored some Ginza purchases, as well as an extra piece of luggage and the bellman even assisted in wheeling our luggage to the train station. Upon our return from Kyoto, Mt. Fuji and Nagano we were welcomed back like long lost friends! We also enjoyed the proximity to the Ginza shopping district and all the superb restaurants in the area.Side note: the fall colors in Japan are unreal! Definitely worth seeing if you're considering an trip in Oct-Nov.Also, the 4Seasons bar with its beautiful views is a nice respite after a day of sightseeing.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a smaller property of Four Seasons Hotel however the comfort level is still there however the room is relatively small comparing with other luxury hotels in Tokyo. The French restaurant and bar over looking Tokyo station is very good, breakfast spread and food quality is on par with other FS.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Upon arrival I already had a good experience with the hotel staff welcoming me and knowing my name! It was a little before 8am and I was immediately allowed to check in which was a great surprise coming from a red eye flight! Most hotels would not allow this and with no extra costa at that!The room is very spacious and top quality furnitures. I had a view of the trains coming in and out of Tokyo Station but it was not noisy at all! The bathroom is very big too with separate areas for the shower, bathtub and toilet. Special mention of the bed and pillows which allowed me to have the best sleep I’ve had in a long time! The location is very near to Tokyo Station and nearest exit would be the South Yaesu exit. So it’s very central and allowed me to buy last minute souvenir shopping before I left. My only regret is not knowing the names of the staff I interacted with but I am very thankful to them for the amazing service provided!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is not a grand hotel, the entrance is back off the street and the reception small and uninspiring but this also helps the intimacy and the feeling of being one of a small number of guests able to stay. The welcome was a perfect blend of Japanese formality and Four Season's friendly professionalism. Concierge extremely knowledgeable and, partly because it is a small hotel, willing to spend time with guests.The room was large, certainly big enough to spend time in it without feeling hemmed in. Decoration was of course nice but not memorable. Lots of little convenient things built into the design that lesser hotels either don't think are important or won't pay for. Bathroom was also large, something that can be a problem in Tokyo hotels.It doesn't offer much choice of amenities but given its location and this being Tokyo it is better to experience this amazing city not the inside of a hotel. Not wanting to stay in the heart of Ginza the four seasons offered a fantastic alternative. Located next to Tokyo train station the Four Seasons is an 8-10 minutes walk from Ginza providing immediate accessibility without the glare, noise and cramped conditions. It's proximity to the station was perfect for the subway system and the bullet train. Our room was on the third floor overlooking a small plaza and the tracks but it was quiet, really quiet thanks to the quality of the building.All things considered you can't really go wrong with this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Right next to Tokyo Station (super handy for both bullet train and Metro rides), the Four Seasons manages to deliver both luxury and intimacy. The small lobby is staffed by an invariably friendly bunch - special shout out to Hiro, who is maybe the most irrepressibly cheerful guy ever to grace a front door. We were in Tokyo twice during our recent trip. For the first stay, we had a King room that combined a sleek Asian flair with western-friendly features. For the second stay we were upgraded to an absolutely spectacular one bedroom suite overlooking the train station. Fabulous fun watching the Shinkansen come and go! Both rooms were beautifully decorated and in perfect condition. The only tiny quibble I have (totally in the spirit of constructive criticism) is that the closet needs more light. Seriously, other than that it was spectacular. Thumbs up also to the breakfast buffet, which has a lovely balance of eastern and western delights. And in the best Four Seasons spirit, special touches like coffee ice cubes in my iced coffee, and absolutely delicious fresh made marmalade and apple jam, presented in carved out fruit. Excellence all round.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This isn’t my first visit in Tokyo and I needed to stay 2 nights in Tokyo very close to the main Tokyo station so i can exchange or Japan Rail Pass, book our tickets, and just walk to the station for our departure. I always go for luxury hotels, so after hearing good reviews about this hotel, booked a room. The room was really expensive but that’s expected during the high season. The hotel is small compared to the one I stayed in before. But it was the perfect choice. We used the Narita Express train from Narita Airport. We had to walk a bit inside the station but when we left the station it was a minute walk to the hotel! Very convenient. If you contact the hotel about your arrival details and using the express train to Tokyo Station you will find someone there from the hotel to transport you to the hotel. Upon arrival, the staff were extremely sweet and helpful from the time of checkin until I left. They help you transfer to the station too, so you get help boarding your train.Food was great in room dining and restaurant. Everyone I came across spoke perfect English. I booked the deluxe room, the size was good!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is in perfect location, just steps away from Ginza. It’s super easy to take train to anyway. The station is very near and there are many entrances that reach the station. Staffs are so polite, friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First of all this was my second stay with FS Tokyo, this time for 3 nights with another friend whom I was trying to convert to the FS brand.In order to put their level of service in perspective, a brief outline of the two mistakes they made with our room and restaurant bookings will be elaborated on. 1. Room cancellation mistake - friend had emailed to ask concierge to cancel a sushi booking in fukuoka for him and keep another (he was planning a day trip for this specifically)- member of reservations team replied saying the ROOM had been cancelled and a penalty would be charged due to sakura season likely misunderstanding the email- friend clarified that it was a RESTAURANT booking to be cancelled and advised in no way did he say he wanted room cancelled- outcome: we were upgraded to suite for 2 nights2. Wrong sushi restaurant booking cancelled - after the above had been rectified, the same member of staff proceeded to cancel the sushi restaurant booking - however for some reason, the one cancelled was the one friend had planned his entire trip for - to understand the gravity of the situation, this sushi chef is ranked as one of, if not, the best in japan, usually fully booked MONTHS in advance and it is widely considered impossible to get a booking again until months later- the mistake was not realised until friend arrived at FS tokyo and wanted to confirm his bookings; the fury was there as it was the basis of his trip and the emails were double checked on his part for any error, of which there were none. - outcome: -- from the chef we understood the general manager called him and gave it his all with sincerity to request for the chef to allow one more pax for that day; chef also asked that friend not to hold it against FS Tokyo and stay there again in future (you can imagine what went down over that phone call)-- for anyone familiar with similar establishments in Japan you will understand how much effort that would have taken the FS GM and hence appreciate it -- it worked since friend had the sushi meal of his life (I kid you not) and enjoyed it tremendously - we were also given 1 night stay complimentary as it was not until quite late the night before he was due to travel when they could confirm they had managed to get a seat There were smaller things too:- service was exemplary henceforth - late check out was issued without hassle - all staff could address friend by name on sight A small niggle but may I suggest, whilst I understand the focus was to repair the relationship with one of the guests, it would have been proper to address and acknowledge both by name. It was slightly strange and bemusing to both of us that one of us was ornamental when we were together.To conclude, still an excellent hotel located just next to Tokyo station, connected to it and Daimaru by a staircase leading downstairs right outside. Walkable to Ginza area and several metro stations within 10-15 mins. Pleasant, safe upscale area mainly populated by large MNCs and their workers hence compared to their sister properties in HK and Russia perhaps not as centrally located for leisure travellers. Room wise, ask for those away from the train station for quieter sleep, their pillow menu and mattress toppers are to die for. Bathrooms were beautiful both in their suite and premier corner room, the window views in particular of the latter were spectacular.The pick up service for those arriving at Tokyo station is a treat especially for first timers, do not miss it. Will be returning soon, if only for the feat of service they displayed this time. Well done FS Tokyo, I thank you for the effort put in to repair the fractured relationship with my close friend.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is a great place to stay with a family. The service was outstanding. The rooms was huge and well appointed with a massive bathroom. Very comfortable beds. The breakfast was awesome both Japanese and American food. The staff very fluent in English and very attentive. They provide outstanding service and even walked(escorted) our family to our train when we left, helping with our luggage. Looking forward to our return visit and staying at this hotel. Well worth the price.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Like all 4S properties, this location is wonderful. Well located and we loved watching the trains arrive/depart from our room and the restaurant. Windows are well insulated so noise was not an issue. All service personnel are exceptionally well trained and the best in the business. However, the bellman/bell-woman personalized assistance with arriving and departing trains was absolutely critical for us. They literally took our bag, brought us to our train, explained how everything would work, brought us to our seats and stowed our very heavy bags for us. Then they waited until our train departed and saw us off with a enthusiastic

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our family of four (2 adults, 2kids) absolutely loved our stay at FS Tokyo Marunouchi! The location was perfect, each & every one of the staff was a pleasure to interact with, the hotel itself was lovely & the boutique vibe was perfect for us. Overall we would highly recommend a stay here. Our trip to Japan had a great start, thanks to FS Marunouchi. The concierge team was a big help in planning out our daily activities, and was always there to provide suggestions. Thank you to the incredible FS Marunouchi team and for the highly personalized service! We hope to make a return visit sometime in the future...We also went to Park Hyatt for dinner, and was glad we made the choice to stay with FS Marunouchi. The location and the FS hotel itself cann't be beat.Our experience at FS Marunouchi was a complete contrast to our experience at FS Kyoto unfortunately :( Out of all the FS hotels we have stayed at, Marunouchi would be at the top and Kyoto would be at the very bottom. We are waiting for FS Kyoto to ask for our feedback.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This Four Seasons hotel provides spectacular service and is an oasis of calm in a crowded, hectic city. The staff goes out if its way to make sure guests get the most from their visit to Tokyo - everyone who stays here will feel like a VIP.
user_name:
kathyyeu
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great time at this boutique Four Seasons Hotel in the Centre of Tokyo. We walked everywhere and had the best time. The staff at the hotel were amazing which we have come to expect from The Four Seasons but still surprised by how good they are. Skip the bigger hotels and stay here, you won’t be disappointed.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I stayed three nights in August 2017 and loved it! The staff was amazing, the food and restaurant bar service was fantastic and the views are amazing. When we connected back through Tokyo Station to Narita, a hotel staff met us and walked us between trains even though we'd been checked out for several days.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service at this property is unmatched. Im a luxury travel advisor and this property set the bar so high, I have not found any other hotel that can match the level of service we received. Simply amazing.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I've stayed at this hotel many many times and for good reasons:- the service is impeccable- the location is right by Tokyo station, you can get anywhere from there, very convenient- the views of the train station are an absolute idiot's delight, watching the trains come and go at night when jet lagged is very relaxing and fun, if you like that sort of thing- the decor is gorgeousI very much recommend this hotel

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: So the location is ideal, right near Tokyo Station, plenty of Dining and shopping, great hotel staff. The Room was very specious looking out over the street, probably one of the bigger room sizes in Tokyo, Bathroom is grand as well, with great pressure and amenities. One bad thing is that the hotel sits on the bottom of a building and does not get a view over the highrises around nor great city views. During breakfast we had nice view of the Station & all Train lines. The staff was fun and well informed of the area, we used their bikes to go around the area for a day. The breakfast was limited but when made to order dishes they were the best *french toast on point. Great room overall.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife, my son and I returned to the Four Seasons Marunouchi after my wife went into premature labour during our stay here in 2015. On that occasion the Four Seasons Marunouchi staff were wonderful in looking after us during one of the most stressful periods of our life and on our return 3 years later, I am happy to stay nothing has changed.Thankfully our visit on this occasion was a bit more relaxed - a 10 year wedding anniversary - but the hospitality and attention to detail remains exemplary. I can honestly say that I have not experienced service like this anywhere else in the world. Nappies in our sons size were in the room before our arrival, foam protectors in the corners of tables to protect a toddler against bumps and bruises, an unforgettable meal with great service and a personal card signed by the staff in the wonderful Motif restaurant just a few of many highlights during our stay there.The service has to be great to stand out amongst Four Seasons properties but the Four Seasons Marunouchi provides a benchmark against which all hotels that aspire to a 5 star rating should be measured against. We can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Each time again I love to stay at Four Seasons Marunouchi. The provided services, the extreme atentioned staff and spacious rooms are really the best you can find in Tokyo and far beyond. The breakfast is served at the 7 th floor and the calm atmosphere is a guarantee to have a sucesfull day

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at the Four Seasons Marunouchi in January 2018 and we weren’t disappointed. We knew we only had two days in Tokyo, so wanted to stay as close to Tokyo station as possible.What sets the Four Seasons apart is the service. The incredibly wonderful Marina picked us up from the carriage of our train and helped take our luggage through the enormous train station to the hotel. The rooms themselves are large and well appointed - although the views of the train tracks as you can imagine were a little underwhelming. Overall however we would definitely recommend the Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent services to foreign tourist for guiding the complected Tokyo Shinkansen systems, and a very kids friendly luxury hotel in Tokyo ( I think it’s the best one), and finally, very friendly and helpful front desk staff team , which makes our stay and trip even more enjoyable!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff had just astonishing attention to detail and responsiveness, very professional and slick. At the same time they really listened and looked for ways to help. They are especially good with children, fitting in some genuine open hearted play between the service standards!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I decided to stay at the Four Seasons due to the short time I had to plan my visit. Since I wanted to eat at few good sushi places I decided to “invest” in Hotel that has a powerful Concierge service. And indeed I had 2 success within a week notice. The hotel is great although I’m not sure that in next visits I’d like to stay in this area. The room was very spacious and the service from the cleaning to the front desk was perfect. PS - I loved the pajamas concept... ;-)
user_name:
Noam J
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: great location, great space .... food could be better .. but still great , i actually work in the hotel business industry and .. i personally had experience working in four seasons .. and let me tell you that the follow up great all the standard in this hotel ...the greetings for me and my family (special my baby girl) was awesome they even had a little toy for the bathtub in ..!!! i will definitely recommend and come back

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My three-night stay at the Four Seasons - Tokyo was wonderful! Staff and accommodations were top-of-the-line. Excellent location. I loved the service and the atmosphere. I felt very comfortable (even though I do not speak Japanese).

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is our go-to hotel in Tokyo. The amazing staff will meet you at the train platform and take all of your luggage and you to the hotel. If you've ever tried to navigate Tokyo station, it's a daunting task. The rooms are great. The food is delicious. And most importantly, the staff cannot do enough for you. Top three in my rank of hotels world wide

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Don't forget to use their free meet and greet service at the adjacent Tokyo train station when you arrive and depart.. If you come in via the Narita express or any other train, they greet you right at the door of the train car you are in. The station is very busy and confusing, and they help you navigate to and from the hotel with ease. The hotel and staff are great. It is fun to watch the shinkansen from your window.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is in a very nice location, very close to a very big subway terminal so it's easy to move around, the staff and concierge is very helpful and are always willing to help. I believe is one of the best options to stay in Tokyo

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We previously visited Four Seasons in January 2015 and would not stay anywhere else this time. Everything is streamlined, from the train station pick-up, the greeting on arrival, the concierge assistance - all is done with cheerful professional perfection. The restaurant Motif is a great restaurant with window views over the city, service is impeccable and food options extensive.Location is super, the hotel is adjacent to the station and can be reached without going outside, the underground has great restaurants and you can walk to Daimaru department store and a short walk to Ginza area, great for shopping and restaurants.Rooms are large and well appointed and quiet - surprising for Tokyo !We will definately be back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is one of those Four Seasons that I would definitely avoid when you come to Tokyo. It's not awful but I definitely prefer Park Hyatt Tokyo or Mandarin Oriental Tokyo which I had pleasure to stayed at. I remember awhile back, I stayed at Four Seasons Hotel at Chinzanso which was lovely. It had a beautiful garden. Unfortunately it has now been rebranded as Hotel Chinzanso Tokyo so I thought I would give this Four Seasons a try. This one is literally right next to the train tracks which unfortunately I can hear from my room all day and night. The hotel put up four panes of glass but you can still hear it. While it is at a very convenient location when compare to the Chinzanso one, but there is absolutely no soul at this hotel. It's a business hotel just like the one at Palo Alto. Although at least the Palo Alto one has a decent lobby. This one has a tiny check in counter and a small reception area that they might as well eliminate. The room finishes is dated like the one at Four Seasons New York. 1990s is calling and they want the blond wood finishes back. The breakfast buffet selection is also limited when compare to what I had at Mandarin Oriental or Park Hyatt. Most of the time, I don't put Park Hyatt and Four Seasons in the same category even though Park Hyatt likes to lump itself with Four Seasons and Mandarin Oriental. In this case, unfortunately, Four Seasons Tokyo is below Park Hyatt Tokyo. Service standard is still high at this Four Seasons but it's the facility that was a great let down. The best place to stay for me in terms of location and facility is definitely Mandarin Oriental. The only reason you will want to stay at this Four Seasons is because you have a late night flight into Haneda and need to catch a bullet train to other parts of Japan the following morning.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed for 6 nights (5th floor) in a deluxe one-bedroom suite (very large; ~1,000SF corner suite). There was a sofa bed in the common room and a king bed in another room. The king bed room has its own large bathroom (dual sink; tub; shower stall; heated toilet seat) and TV. The common room has its own bathroom (heated toilet seat; desk space) and TV. There were electric blinds and curtains throughout for privacy. The king bed mattress, topper & pillows were extremely comfortable. There were plenty of closet space and drawers. There was turn-down service. The hotel only has 6 floors with the restaurant and spa on the 7th floor. We did not use the spa or have dinner at the hotel. There was no discernible outside noise factor.  Upon arrival, hotel personnel was able to greet us at the bus stop (Narita airport to near Tokyo Station) which was a 3 minute walk to the hotel; you will need to contact hotel for this service. It is much easier to take the bus or train from the airport to the hotel.  We had breakfast at the restaurant (7th floor) almost every morning. It is a continental breakfast with the same menu everyday - it would be nice if this was changed up every so often. They do have a Japanese breakfast which consisted of a cooked salmon, rice and some side dishes; you need to order this from the menu but it's included if you have the bed & breakfast package. The food was really good and the service with exceptional.  The hotel is part of a larger commercial building which is common with the Four Seasons hotel. It is a 4-5 minute walk to Tokyo Station (regular trains, buses and bullet train). Tokyo "subway" has many different lines so be sure to get a good subway map - which has both the letters and numbers of the station. Please get a portable wi-fi (eg. Pupuru) so you can use Google Map - although it's not as accurate (or direct) as for some other countries so double check with the subway map. Overall, an excellent hotel that is on the quieter side (which is what we wanted) with exceptional service!
user_name:
PYLI19
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a luxury business hotel, as opposed to a luxury hotel per se. So the lobby is small and functional, and the rooms don't have much of a view. But the location is excellent, on the edge of Ginza while being in the business district. Rooms are large and well equipped, and service is top notch. Restaurant on top floor is great for breakfast and dining as well. Gym is also well equipped. Overall a great business hotel, but don't expect a luxury-holiday type place.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Comfortable beds and excellent service were the aspects that stood out for me. If you plan to utilize public mass transit (subway) the location is perfect for Shinkansen and Tokyo Metro journeys because Tokyo Station is less than a 5 minute walk. You are also close to good restaurants and shopping in the Ginza area. Fresh fruit in the hallway was a nice touch as well as the handwritten welcome note from the general manager. Rooms have high ceilings and nice floor to ceiling windows with city views.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very nice smaller hotel. Don’t be put off by small reception area. Nice rooms, great restaurant and excellent service. Location is great right next to Tokyo station. Concierge is excellent. No complaints at all.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Poor service at check in and again at departure. Unhelpful and confused service in the restaurant. Noisy rooms as Hotel is by the train track.Room size is fine although bathroom is tight.Staff can be curt and unhelpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The location is too close to Tokyo station and as a result the noise of the trains is unsatisfactory. That’s especially the case if you are ‘lucky enough’ to be given an upgrade to a track facing suite. The upgrade point insulted my intelligence - the noise is terrible in the mornings and I insisted they move me to the other side of the hotel. Bearing in mind my stay was for 12 nights or so, I would have left the hotel if they couldn’t have moved me. The lack of a pool lounging area is a pain! But on the plus side the staff were great (if they weren’t then the hotel should close). Apart from one Indian member of staff on concierge who was English speaking but wandering around like he owned the show - the staff always tried hard and got everything over the line with efficiency! I would like to see a member of staff who can uncharacteristically in Tokyo think outside of the box and smash buckle a little when it comes to restaurant bookings and specialist requests. I had a request (because the room dining menu is dull as dish water) that the hotel go next door (3 minute walk) with some containers and pick me up a take away from a great little Izakaya.... unlike the Staff at the Fullerton Bay Hotel Singapore the staff couldn’t make that happen..... such a shame!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: location near Tokyo station excellent, room size and amenities good, restaurant & bar really bad. Nouvelle French food only, obscenely expensive even by Tokyo standards. bar small and not well attended by staff, lounge small and allows smoking. breakfast - worst ever and for the Four Seasons should be an embarrassment. Small selection of western buffet and Japanese menu items taking 30 minutes minimum to prepare, like dinner be prepared to feel fleeced after paying $50+ for weak omelets with few fillings and a mealy glass of burcher muselix. Couldn't even get a decent slice of toast and jam.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I travel all over the world and the four seasons in Tokyo was perhaps one of the top five hotel experiences I’ve ever had. Every person every encounter was world class and 5 Stars and I highly recommend this location to anyone visiting Tokyo who wants an exceptional experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: In contrast to the typical Four Seasons hotels we've frequented, Four Seasons Marunouchi has a rather intimate setting, lending itself to be more in the boutique category. While it's a smaller hotel (50 rooms, give or take), the deluxe one bedroom suite we stayed in proved to be rather spacious and accommodating. Since we were travelling with our nephew, the large living room, dining room and two full spa like bathrooms were definitely a welcoming amenity for the eight day stay. Although we didn't have a chance to visit their restaurant, the dishes prepared from the in-room dining service were delectable. Like all Four Seasons we've visited, the rooms were clean and well kept. The multilingual reception and concierge staff were extremely courteous and most helpful. When it comes to concierge service though, unlike many of the other Four Seasons, confirmation of reservation made through their desk, unless specified otherwise, will be kept there for pickup rather than typically delivered to your room. Nestled within Tokyo's business district and within a 10-15 minute stroll to the popular Ginza shopping area, Four Seasons Marunouchi is ideally situated for both the business and leisure traveller. For guests who wish to explore the greater part of Tokyo, the countryside or other major cities, Four Seasons Marunouchi is within a short walking distance to the main railway hub, Tokyo Station. We enjoyed our stay at Four Seasons Marunouchi and look forward to our return visit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Strategically located near Tokyo maronouchi station & walking distance to Ginza shops & restaurants Excellent Concierge servicesGood Housekeeping service Good room serviceBreakfast selection a bit limited

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is outstanding in all respects. The Four Seasons has a great staff and this particular property is an incredible location. In a short stay we were able to walk to the fish market, the Imperial Shrine, tour the Marunouchi Station and find great restaurants nearby, all within a 30 hour stay. I recommend this property highly. - Pete from North Carolina

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very efficient. Wonderful location above Tokyo station. You can literally get anywhere in Japan from here. Great food and bar. Rooms are VERY small, but typical for Japan. Spotless housekeeping. I would stay here again no problem.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Season Tokyo at Marunouchi is an absolute gem! It's a short walk from Tokyo station, shopping and great restaurants. The rooms are nicely appointed and very comfortable. I spent a quite a bit of time in my room as I was under the weather, and couldn't have been happier. There is plenty of space to work and I enjoyed using the 3D television.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We love staying at the Four Seasons. The staff are super friendly and speak impeccable English. The rooms are spacious with terrific city views. If you love trains like I do, the view on the west side of the hotel includes the shinkansen tracks at Tokyo Station. In poor weather, you can get to the department stores, restaurants, and shops in Tokyo Station, without ever going outside. Food in the Four Seasons is delicious, although quite pricey. The onsen and massage are other options for making your stay a lovely experience, and the deep soak tub in your hotel bathroom gives you an especially convenient way to relax. We chose the Four Seasons Marunouchi back in 2013 as one of the few hotels with two queen beds, with a good location for catching trains to various sightseeing spots around Tokyo. Every trip since, Four Seasons has been part of our plans.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The concierge staff was super helpful planning activities for us. The service at the hotel is outstanding. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. The location was very convenient to trains and metro. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed recently for a day. The rooms are quite good and the service was better. They anticipated an early morning arrival after a red eye and had a small breakfast waiting in the room. Much needed and appreciated. The lobby is quite small, as is the hotel. Would definitely go back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Beautiful hotel, and convenient location to many wonderful restaurants and entertainment. I can’t say enough about the staff. My luggage was lost for a few days and they did everything they could to make sure that it was found. We had room service it was fantastic. If visiting Tokyo this is a must stay hotel

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I stayed at the property for 4 nights with our 2-year-old and had a wonderful stay. The concierge helped arrange an English speaking babysitter one night and a nice sushi dinner for our wedding anniversary. My daughter loved the toddler amenities (bath toys, toddler sized robe and slippers, and welcome snacks), and felt right at home. My husband asked for directions to the Ghibli Museum and the hotel offered to send someone to escort us next door to Tokyo station to assist us with purchasing tickets and guiding us to the correct platform. The service was top notch and the room was comfortable and spacious enough for our family. This is the third FS property we have stayed at, and by far our favorite. The service felt really warm and personal and we can't wait to return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is simple , elegant and spacious! Great place to stay ! It’s location can’t be better and the service is excellent ! The rooms have lots of space and the bathroom too which not the usual in this cities .The breakfast is good and have enough options .The concierge helps you get good reservations for dinner which is a plus
user_name:
Erika F
San Jose, Costa Rica

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Won’t be disappointed by their service since the first day to check in till the last day of the trip to check out. Staffs are always attentive and helpful.Breakfast buffet and the Japanese style breakfast was excellent without doubt. They serve special condiments in breakfast. Love the orange one, although I prefer without the peel. Special thanks to the gentleman who escorted us with our luggage all the way to JR station, leading the way, help us with tickets, seeing us on board the right train to airport. Saved us lots of trouble in looking for the way inside the busy Tokyo Station. Big big thanks and deeply appreciated.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I like this Four Seasons very much - it’s one of my favorite Tokyo hotels (for a large chain, anyway):Pros- very nice rooms. The decorations and feel if the rooms are perfect; very tasteful and relaxing.- great service. As at most Four Seasons, the service here is outstanding, particularly as this is a smaller hotel.- very nice facilities. Cons- really nothing of note. I’ve stayed here a few times and have always been extremely happy. I plan to return in the future.Overall, a very quiet and relaxing hotel in a good location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First time staying here on a business trip and it definitely lives up to its name. The comfort of the room and the warm service of the staff makes you feel right at home. Check-in and out was all done quickly and smoothly, and the staff even offered to help you with your luggages to the train / bus stations. Though its located just beside the Tokyo station which makes it very convenient, one would think that it would feel rather busy. But it's tucked away inside and the moment you step in and back to your room, it has a peaceful, calming feeling. Away from the hustle and bustle just at its doorsteps.My room was located on the 4th floor facing the main road. It was a good view of the busy streets with the sun shining into your room while you sit by the windows watching the world go by...Overall, absolutely lovely experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stay here every year when I come to Tokyo on business. It is always consistent quality, incredible service with personal touches. Beautiful, clean, easy. Excellent food. The room is a relaxing coccoon amid the busy weeks of meetings.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: it is hard to achieve perfection, but this hotel certainly comes close. Our room on the sixth floor faced the railway (below), yet you could not hear a thing. The staff is so friendly that you wonder how they do it. The room was decent she and everything worked perfectly. The bathroom has only one sink (the only real drawback), Super comfortable bed. You will be very happy here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed for several nights at the Four Seasons and we loved it a lot. To explore that district it's in a good location, you can do a lot 'on foot'. The staff is impeccable and very kind and the service is just the best. We were with our two children and we booked two rooms, the rooms were very big and had a tasteful interior. We also enjoyed the bar, it had a great view and a very nice atmosphere. We really recommend the Four Seasons Tokyo if you're looking for a hotel in that district!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very convenient location next to Tokyo station. The comfort and decor of our room was excellent. Staff were very professional, attentive, and made every effort to provide a personalized experience. Very "kid friendly" hotel - which is hard to find in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Concierge team was really good, manage to book a lot of the restaurants requested.All the reception staff were really welcoming & nice.The hotel has a great location, lots of train options near & walking distance to Ginza.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As there are only a limited number of rooms, this is an ultimate personal Four Seasons experience. Service is truly amazing. A special thank you to Yui who picked us up from the train and negotiated our way to the hotel through busy Tokyo station. She then assisted us upon departure to place us on the bullet train. Staff always addressed us by name and were helpful with any request. Do remember you are next to the train station so can hear them starting in the morning especially if your room faces the tracks.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the service was impeccable the location is a bit difficult to find, but the views are interesting, of incoming and departing trains from the largest train station in all of Japan the proximity to the station also is optimal for convenience as well as dining options we had a personal escort to and from the train station prior to check in and after check out

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent one night at the Four Seasons and couldn’t have been happier. A staff member was there to greet us at the Tokyo Station platform the moment our Narita Express train door opened and then she escorted us to the hotel, steps away. Another staff member later escorted my husband to an ATM machine in the train station and waited off to the side till he made his transaction. Multiple other staff members remembered our names even though our visit was short, under 18 hours. Our room was double upgraded with a wonderful view. Excellent breakfast buffet too.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First four seasons experience, and it was really impressive. Staff service here is really great and nice, hotel’s location&envirnment is good, quite close to Tokyo station(few mins walk), the only downside is that the hotel entryway/gate is small and tiny concierge(this is acceptable for Japan though). Anyway, very good first experience at four seasons and if I’m traveling to Tokyo again, definitely gonna visit here.
user_name:
YZinnovator
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: An expensive but truely amazing personalised luxury hotel. Staff were attentive, didn't become distracted by other guests when dealing with our issues. Used collar radios to coordinate their workforce to deliver excellent levels of service. Well done.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Enjoyed the spacious room and the view of the trains coming and going. Great location for exploring out of Tokyo station. Nearby Ginza district and Imperial Palace area are also great for walking and shopping.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: What a wonderful hotel! With a convenient location, solid hard product, and warm, genuine service, it's hard to beat the FS Tokyo. The property is ideally situated, just steps from Tokyo station. For a Four Seasons, this hotel is relatively unassuming and at just 57 rooms, it feels like a boutique hotel, which makes for a pleasantly intimate stay without compromising on luxury. Upon check-in, I was upgraded to an executive suite, which was extremely spacious, featuring a living room/desk area, bedroom, a guest powder room, plenty of storage/closet space, and views overlooking the train tracks. It doesn't sound particularly glamorous, but it was actually pretty enjoyable to watch all the different trains zip by. Soundproofing was excellent - the noise was minimal and I wasn't bothered at all. I also loved the decor, which struck the perfect balance of elegance and minimalism. As always, the bed was very comfortable, and I enjoyed relaxing in the living room as well. I was also pleasantly surprised by the minibar, which featured an array of teas, some interesting fresh-squeezed juices (including yuzu), and a Nespresso machine equipped with a milk frother, with fresh milk in the refrigerator. I also couldn't resist purchasing the cute (albeit pricy) teddy bear that was perched on the minibar shelf. Amenities were quite good as well, with high-quality slippers, Etro toiletries, pyjamas, and a snack plate with fresh fruit and some tasty sweets. I ended up eating breakfast and lunch at Motif, their sole restaurant, which offers quality cuisine with some decent views of the surrounding area. The Japanese breakfast was excellent, and I enjoyed the uni pasta that I tried during lunch. However, I did wish they had some more traditional options to choose from. Service was wonderful in all aspects. The concierge was very helpful and responsive, helping to secure a dinner reservation with just a few hours' notice and dealing with a bit of email back-and-forth while I was out during the day. The station escort service was a thoughtful touch and I highly recommend it. I booked my trip pretty last-minute so I didn't end up using the arrival service, but I did take up their offer to be escorted to the Narita Express station upon check-out, which ended up being super convenient. The very friendly staff member assisted me with my luggage, reserving my seat (and even scrolling through all the screens to find the best seat), and guiding me through the maze that is Tokyo station all the way to the platform where my train car was.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at the hotel for one night during a visit to Tokyo in April. Although it is not your typical Four Seasons hotels, the service is equally impeccable. The hotel is small and the facilities are great. The room was very comfortable and the location is quite convenient if you are going to be around Marunouchi and/or want good access to Tokyo Station and/or other connections. The service at the hotel was great and definitely the highlight of our stay, and even though we did not get to have dinner at the restaurant, the breakfast was delicious and worth every penny.
user_name:
mariao688
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is located very close to the Tokyo Station, 2 min walk. Hence, transportation from/to Narita via Narita Express is very convenient. Royal Imperial Palace is 5 min walk. Hotel also offers complementary bikes, if needed. Though, the hotel is in office building, first 7 floors. So don't expect the hotel/lobby or restaurant to be typical flashy Four Seasons style. Lobby is so small that they have just one table for check-in which in my opinion very sub standard for 5 stars hotel. Rooms are ok size. Gym has necessary equipments. I think this hotel has may be 50 rooms. So gym was not crowded at times. Overall, locations is great but I was expecting more, compared to other Four Seasons. So bit disappointed. Else, all good.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Amazing hotel & location! Always thrilled to have more stays in different FS of the world! Beyond expectations! From luxury, spacious room, breathless wide views from room, amazing staff loving people speechless culture!!! Service top class and staff so friendly, happy and welcoming ! Respect to you all! Anazing restaurant and bar with thrilling views above overlooking tokyo's heart! Thank u so much for everything ! We love you FS ! We love you Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent service and very spacious room. Never thought about the room is so big in a very expensive area in tokyo. Staff are all very polite and friendly. They have upgraded us when we arrive and the decor are just so decent.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is great location if you are new to Tokyo and arriving at the nearby JR station, I spent my Birthday here and the team were very efficient and friendly, wonderful breakfast. Great rooms, efficient luggage service as we were traveling around for 2 weeks we had the hotel transfer luggage to Four Seasons Kyoto , easy and efficient. Concierge service, was a let down, not the most advanced guidance on travel to Kanazawa, but one of the stand out services came from Bell Hop, who on check out took as all the way with our bags to the our platform for our train, as this was one of the busiest travel days in Japan this was above and beyond, I wish I had his name , but regardless thats what you call service, thank you so much

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location. Comfortable beds. We Saturday with children and they were very welcoming and accommodating to them. It was raining and they even provides umbrellas to use which was so helpful. We would come again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We selected the Four Seasons because of its proximity to Tokyo train station. After having stayed there, though, I'd travel further yet to reach this hotel. The service quality is simply outstanding. The room is thoughtfully appointed and spotless. What a first class hotel.
user_name:
SEFLJ
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: They dont accept tips 20dls But offer 100 dls and they doso if you need help do not ask they will send you to turist trapBetter give them 100 dls a lot cheaper than getting taken for 1000 dlsfor a bill that they cant even understand

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at the Four Seasons Tokyo for the first leg of our honeymoon and they took great care of us. This property is on the same block as the main train station in Tokyo so it was very convenient to get around the city by subway. We slept great despite being jet lagged. The bar is gorgeous at night and the cocktails are fantastic. The western and Japanese breakfasts were delicious. We would absolutely stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The location is perfect, next to Takyo Station, a complex of shops and restaurants are part of the station. The hotel staff is extremely attentive and careful with the details. We were delighted with the service. Amazing breakfast and a very nice spa. When we return to Tokyo, we will certainly stay at the Four Seasons again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons is a hidden gem with an A+ location for sight seeing, located next to the central Tokyo train station. Service, rooms, dining are incredible. The staff even assisted us in navigating the train station on our departure. It has the feel of a boutique hotel, but with all of the luxuries you expect from Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I stayed at Four Seasons twice in August, at the beginning and end of our Japan trip.The hotel offers pick up service from Tokyo station which is very handy when you first arrive. All you need to do is to let the concierge know a day in advance and advice of arrival time. Staff meet you at the station with a luggage trolley and take you to the hotel. The location is very good, you are 10 mins walk from Ginza and the Fish Market. Imperial Palace is on the back of the hotel (5 mins walk) and it is well connected to other parts of Tokyo and the airport by train, metro as well as buses.The check in was quick both times, second time the staff remembered where we visited in Japan and asked us about our travels which was a nice touch. The rooms are very specious with a view of the train station. Each room has a 3D tv and guests can rent 3D movies for free. That was great way to relax after a day of sightseeing in Tokyo.The absolute highlight of our stay was their spa and onsen area. Their hot-spring bath was fantastic, gym well equipped and changing area had lovely cosmetics, from make-up remover to rose oils, face creams and body lotions.Breakfast was included in our room rate and consisted of a la carte selection (eggs cooked to order, Japanese pancake, french toasts) and American buffer. Buffet was on a small size and I would expect a much better selection from a five star hotel. There were fruit, a small selection of breads and cuts of cold meat. Overall we had a lovely stay in this hotel and would recommend it to other travellers.The only reason why we gave it 4/5 was because their concierge service was shocking. It was one of the worst concierge services we've ever had in hotels. Whenever we needed transport recommendations he just told us to take taxis (at the cost of £50/£70 each way) and told us that there are no metro or train options which was not true. He didn't know any of the local restaurants and overall struggled with our queries. I gave up after the first stay. The hotel should look at his training or replacement.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Amazing hotel and service. The staff were impeccable. I was so impressed. The rooma were beautiful and very very clean. The restaurant was lovely with an amazing view, and the breakfast buffet was very good. The staff were amazing with the children as well

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I experienced the high level of service of Four Seasons Tokyo well before we arrived. It was impossible to purchase tickets online for Disneyland Tokyo from outside Japan and concierge bought them for us in the shop in Tokyo. I also requested them to make Japanese restaurant reservations for us and they book one with Michelin star (Ginza Okuda) which was phenomenal and one with amazing city view (Kozune, at Park Hyatt) where both the food and service was excellent. The people at concierge desk I was communicating with were Misato (Suzuki), Akhil (Tiwari) and Xing (Huang). The hotel itself also has a great restaurant where we had dinner on the day we arrived to Japan. We also had breakfast there on each morning and could enjoy the bird's view of the Shinkanzens passing by. Whether you want to discover Tokyo by public transport or taxi, the hotel is well located as it is next to Central Station. Ginza district with all the shopping options is also very close. One day, one of the hotel employees walked to the station with us to help buying train tickets and explaining which route to take (sorry for forgetting his name). The rooms are sufficiently big and clean. Check in was smooth and when I wanted to give tip for bringing our luggage to the room the hotel employee (again, sorry for not remembering his name) told us that it is not customary in Japan to give tip at hotels, restaurants and taxis and they are perfectly happy with an "arigatou" (thank you). This attitude, the politeness and kindness of Japanese people marked our whole journey in Japan. We definitely would return!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The quality of chopsticks are not good. The PS-3 machine crashed several times during our stay. All the staff are enthusiastic, helpful and nice. We are grateful to the female staff who escorted us to the Tokyo station, helping us with the tickets. However, she is obviously not familiar with the kiosk machine and we almost cannot get on the train in time. It's not her fault, but I hope there is room for improvement.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: and one of the best fourseasons we've stayed. staff service is warm and personalized. room is very comfortable. Not a lot of choices for breakfast but each meals were properly made. My children liked the mixed juice! Truly luxurious hotel. We should go back to this hotel once a year.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Love the hotel. One of the best hotel I've stayed in Tokyo. Very kids friendly. Crib is provided and the room is child proof. Excellent service, fast, efficient and tentative. Staff are all very caring and personal. Nice room layout and super clean. Excellent location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I stayed here with my niece as part of her 16th birthday trip. There is not a thing I would change about this hotel. For me the key differentiator at nicer hotels is the people working there. Everyone we came into contact with was very friendly, efficient and went above and beyond what you would expect. The first example was after a getting to the hotel we wanted a casual lunch as we had reservations for a nice dinner. One of the staff actually escorted us to the mall and explained what each restaurant did and his recommendations. Our niece really wanted Japanese pancakes and he found us a spot that made her very happy. This will be my hotel of choice for future Tokyo visits.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I'm only staying at Four Seasons Tokyo whenever I come here - amazing hotel!PROS:i) Front desk staff - reception, managers - world-class - best of any Four Seasonsii) Incredible room with astounding night views iii) Very comfortable American bed which I requestediv) Wonderful shower and bathroom - world class againSuggestions:i) They should have a Japanese breakfast too - so much better than Americanii) Nowhere in Asia can they cook bacon better than the U.S. unfortunatelyiii) Shower is very confusing - this is a problem with all Four Season hotels - they have two buttons - always have to spend time figuring it outAnyway, GREAT HOTEL! Look forward to staying again!!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We have just returned form a family trip to Tokyo staying at the Four Seasons. Even before we arrived the concierge team was extremely helpful with ideas and suggestions for visits and activities during our stay. Arriving at the hotel we were greeted with smiles and this didn't change during the entire stay.Our room was superb and the little details like having a breakfast ready for us after and overnight flight and personalized treats for our daughter were very much welcomed thoughts and a great way to start the holiday. Throughout the week every member of the team went out of their way to help and from starting the day with breakfast and finishing with a nightcap in the bar, every interaction was a pleasure. Whilst one might expect this of most hotels it was the above and beyond's that make a difference. Being shown the way through the maze that is Tokyo Station by a team member to ensure we could to the right train in the quickest time was a massive help. Likewise, the enthusiasm shown by the staff to help organise tickets for baseball even given seat suggestions was fantastic. Being more boutique in nature also added to the experience as unlike mammoth hotels we felt we got to know a number of the staff and being greeted by name just makes the experience that bit more special.The hotel itself is superbly located for Ginza and other nearby department stores and retail activities but the direct access to Tokyo Station was fantastic for days were we ventured out exploring all that Tokyo has to offer.I'm not sure when we will next be back in Tokyo but will certainly return to the Four Seasons when we do. Thank you all for making the stay so pleasant which made our time in Tokyo that bit more special.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I love the hot spring inside the spa. Very tasty breakfast. The concierge young man helped to bring luggage to train station and accompanied us to the platform. Declined the tips. I salute to their humble manner and friendliness and superb service. Thank you!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There are bigger hotels in Tokyo, there are hotels with more sweeping views but I don't think there are any better luxury hotels that also cater so well to a family of four. We wanted service and comfort and adult aesthetics but we wanted to take our two little ones and it worked out great. The hotel was extremely family friendly. The girls got little booklets about tokyo, sweets, toys, kid pijamas and the room was big enough for all of us. Since I had huge trouble finding hotels that took two kids in one room in Japan, they get a thumbs up just for that. Compared to other Four Seasons they don't have an amazing view or huge pool or other amenities like that BUT the comfort and beauty of the rooms is all there, the service was excellent, the room service food was excellent, and ultimately the funky view of the train station and departing trains was kind of cool. My kids actually really loved it. I would definitely go back. Ask for a corner room with train view if you like that sort of thing. We loved the huge windows that opened up onto the futuristic station.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We have stayed at many Four Seasons before, however, the atmosphere was much different to the other Four Seasons which we have stayed. The moment we entered, the lobby was very quiet and small. This Four Seasons had a more boutique and quiet vibe.The room was very spacious although it felt very much like being in a fish tank as it had floor to ceiling windows that formed a L-shape and we were facing the main street. Cleanliness was superb and amenities in the room faultless.The service was fantastic. The staff were warm, could speak very good English, assisted with all our restaurant and train reservations. They even helped carry our luggage to the bullet train platform which was very helpful as we had a kid in tow.All in all, was a very pleasant stay although we felt that it was a little pricey.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is seriously one of the best hotels (and rooms) I've stayed in - and we've stayed in many Four Seasons and Ritz Carltons. We debated for a long time about where to stay in Tokyo and I'm so glad we made this choice. It is a boutique hotel, so it is about intimate service and an amazing room - not a spacious lobby. If you're looking for private in the city - this is it. We were two adults and two children (it's hard to find one room for that number in Tokyo) and we all fit easily in the two queen room. There was plenty of room for them to add a rollaway bed as well. We were on a corner, and a higher floor, but otherwise it was a standard room. And it was amazing!! On the corner, two entire walls were floor to ceiling windows, giving us an amazing view of the city toward Ginza area as well as the trains coming in and out (no, we heard no noise at all). It was stunning to have the walls of windows (and an easy touch of a button closed privacy shades and/or blackout curtains. Huge room and bathroom. My parents traveling with us had a connecting king room - and they had a very large sitting area - these are not your typical city-size hotel rooms. They are incredibly large even by US standards. We were there a week, and if you can get the breakfast rate, do it! (If you can't, definitely try breakfast there anyway.) The breakfast was full buffet with western and Japanese options. Amazing juice options each day. The adults in our group went to dinner at the hotel restaurant once, and it was simply incredible! French cuisine, with some Japanese flavors. Staff spoke perfect English, which was a nice way to ease into our long trip in Japan. The location is amazing - we used public transportation the whole time. People said Tokyo Station (which is right next door) would be intimidating, but we found it pretty easy - but we've traveled a lot. If you've handled the UK underground and train lines, this is pretty much the same concept - it really wasn't hard, although the hotel concierge is more than willing to get you a taxi. Tokyo Station and surrounding area also had a million places to eat in every price range. I can't imagine a better location from which to explore Tokyo. We were traveling for a while, so needed to do a large amount of laundry before leaving - and the concierge pointed us to a coin laundry (it was a couple of metro stops away, but doable). They even had a printout about it - so don't be shy about asking. The cold waters as we departed and arrived at the hotel every day were wonderful. The spa and onsen were lovely and private. My 10-year-old daughter was welcome in the spa area, which was a treat for her as many hotels have age limits. To be fair, we were the only people in there every time we used it, so I don't know if that had something to do with it. Wonderful to have a hot soak and be pampered a bit after walking the city for the day. It was complimentary, and we used it almost every evening. Espresso in the room was fantastic, as were the toiletries. Bedding was heavenly and definitely a western style (beds were soft and plush - which I love, best sleep of our trip!!). If you're not into that, they had a pillow menu that might help you find something firmer. I can't say enough about the room and the service. They took care of our kids with toys, gifts, and welcome amenities. An amazing family luxury hotel that is personal - I would stay there without question the next time we are in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff at this Four Seasons absolutely made our trip beyond fabulous! They went above and beyond with their hospitality, help and recommendations. The rooms were beautiful, spacious, and well appointed. The location is central to everything in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staffs are very kind, room is comfortable & clean, and hotel location is prefect! It's very close to Tokyo station and a lot of department stores, nice restuarants. The gym and SPA are very good too! Nice hotel for business or family trip!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons has a great location right in the exclusive shopping district Marounachi, but thats basically it. There is nothing really bad, but also nothing really nice to say about this Hotel, I am sure there are better Hotels in Tokyo. The Breakfast was very poor with a very small variety to choose from. The service was far behind, compared to other Four Seasons Resorts which we visit a lot- no little assiduities which suprise you, no warm welcome when arriving and the concierge couldn't even recommend us a nice sushi restaurant which we could visit with our 9 year old child.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is located conveniently right next to Tokyo station. There are many department stores and restaurants around the area and a huge underground shopping mall that you can spend the entire day in. All the staff in the hotel are extremely well trained, speak fluent English and are incredibly friendly and helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: What can I say? I love Four Seasons. This particular establishment is not the usual FS hotel. First, it's smaller. The lobby is not as spacious. But you're immediately greeted by the fresh scent. Smelled really clean.We arrived at 7:00 am from Haneda. We knew that our room won't be available until after lunch. Our plan was to just drop off our luggages and head straight to Tsukiji fish market. To our surprise, they had a room ready for us! The room they assigned was meant for kids. It had a great view of the bullet train tracks. My kids loved it!  Details such as baby-proofing the suite, the breakfast buffet, room service, little treats during turn down, housekeeping, the view, the service....all embodied the Four Seasons brand. We stayed for a total of 8 days. My kids enjoyed every minute. Yuki and all the staff were especially helpful in getting our Shinkansen tickets, showing us to the platform, sending our luggages to another destination, finding a babysitter while we had our date night, and even packing our most prized souvenir - yamazaki 18! We would definitely come back to this friendly, relaxing, conveniently-located establishment.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I recently visited this property with my twin sons (age 10). Tokyo was our final destination on a trip that included various stopovers in Malaysia and Japan. I knew that my boys and I would be road weary at that point in the journey, so I purposely set out to choose a location that would be both easy to access and would promote rest and relaxation. In my mind, Four Seasons is the pinnacle for dependable luxury and the Marunouchi location not only lived up to my expectations, but far exceeded them. From being met at Tokyo Station upon our arrival around 11pm to being personally escorted to our airport bus transportation upon departure, we enjoyed wonderful care during our entire stay. We returned to our room one evening after a long day of sightseeing to find personalized chocolate chip cookies, chocolate covered marshmallows and juice boxes for my boys. Our hearts were warmed (and bellies delighted!) by this thoughtful touch. Tokyo is one of my favorite cities in the world and I simply can't imagine staying anywhere else for my next visit. Arigato Goziamashta!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo is a splendid hotel in a superb location. The staff were very helpful, and all around amazing; the spa is blissful; the room (mine was a Corner King) was heavenly. This is one of my favourite hotels anywhere, and I cannot wait to return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service was absolutely amazing we couldnt have had a better holiday. Yuki showed us how to use the train system and picked us up on arrival from the station and took us back . Helped buy our tickets for every train ride until we knew how. Booked and recommended our restaurant for Tokyo Tepanyaki.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Just spent one night at the Four Seasons Tokyo in late June 2017 at the end of an 8-day trip to Japan with my wife and her two teenage nieces. My wife and I previously stayed at the hotel for 8 nights in November 2015. This review is based on both visits.This is one of the two or three best hotels I've ever stayed at. The service is flawless-- attentive, thoughtful, kind, and thorough without being obsequious or overbearing. The food -- breakfast in-room for nine days and dinner for three nights (twice in-room and once in the outstanding top-floor restaurant) -- is first-rate. The rooms are tastefully decorated, well thought out, easily navigated, and impeccably clean. The bathrooms, well, they are Four Seasons bathrooms. We especially enjoyed the rooms overlooking Tokyo Station so that we could watch the trains come and go, especially at night (don't worry, it's not noisy).
