The location is close to many attractions on the east side of the city and convenient to subways and trains to reach other parts of the city. On the last trip, we were upgraded to the two best rooms in the hotel, a real treat, but the standard rooms are fantastic. I'd think that over an 8-day stay, and two stays over a one and a half year period, you'd find a weakness or a mistake -- there weren't any. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough, and I think it provides good value for the prices it charges.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We decided to turn my latest business trip to Tokyo into a family trip with my wife and 4.5-year-old son joining me. The first challenge was finding a hotel in Tokyo which could comfortably put an extra bed in a room with a king bed. The Four Seasons was a among a few hotels (mostly luxury hotels) which could do so. But more importantly, the Four Seasons has a number of rooms which have an amazing view of Tokyo Station (particularly the Shinkansen trains heading west from Tokyo Station), and since my son _loves_ Japanese trains, it seemed like the perfect pick. We used the Amex Platinum Card "Fine Hotels and Resorts" travel benefit to get a reasonably priced room with breakfast included for two, a complimentary fourth night, a $100 credit from the spa, and a potential room upgrade. (Note that we received an upgrade, when it became available, from a Deluxe room to a One-Bedroom Suite.)Prior to arrival, to confirm our reserved room had the best view of the trains, I contacted the Four Seasons Marunouchi local reservations email, and they were extremely helpful in working with me to find the very best available room. And they did an extraordinary job. We literally looked right out onto the trains (without any noise concerns)--my son was able to watch the trains from his bed (we're convinced he wouldn't have slept if we hadn't lowered the mechanical blackout shades). He could even see all of the trains lined up at the station (which you can't do from the other nearby hotels that are on higher floors)... and every morning, they saved us the table at breakfast where he could eat and watch the trains. My son was in heaven, and it was as if we had a silent babysitter (JR) with us.If trains aren't your thing, this hotel is perfectly situated--close to lots of great areas, and a short walk to almost every subway and train line (not just Tokyo station, but the surrounding stations as well) you could need. But the real reason to stay here, in our view, is the talented, dedicated, and loving staff. It is a smaller hotel than most of the luxury hotels in Tokyo, and they shower guests with extra attention as a result. Because they knew our son loved trains, when we arrived, each staff member we ran into had something train-themed to give him. There was a cookie with his name on it waiting for him in the hotel room, a step stool for the bathroom sink, bath toys, a kids robe and slippers, and even a little booklet with his name on it that he could use to record his fun experiences in Tokyo (along with a way for him to write a note to the hotel manager). We all felt like we were extremely well cared for, but he felt like he was home--and as parents who were still anxious about taking a 4.5-year-old on his first trip outside of North America, we cannot possibly thank the staff (Mari, Mami, Ricky, Kasumi, Soon, Fumiya, etc.) at the Four Seasons enough, which is at least part of the reason we are writing this review--something we do not ordinarily do.The breakfast is perfect, with eggs, cereals, yogurt, fresh juices, bacon, different kinds of sausage, mushrooms, vegetables, salad, fresh baked goods, various kinds of toast, tea (including several very nice herbal teas), fresh fruit and berries etc. And if you're in the mood for something divine, order the pancakes or french toast--it's not obvious if you order the buffet, but if you ask, they'll bring you those special treats! We hope this review helps other families with young children have just as great an experience in Tokyo as we did.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfect location, great service. The limousine airport pickup is great and the in room checkin a big plus that I really enjoyed. The room quality is great, big and features a nice dressing. Lobby however is not very welcoming.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent 07 nights this june in a group of 08 people. Everyone was always trying to help in what we need. Breakfast was realy good and with a great view of Tokyo Station and Schikansen departures. Lots of restaurants and stores near by. Walking distance to Imperial Palace. Since you are near the biggest Metro Station in Tokyo you can go easy to every place in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent 3 nights at the hotel. The Deluxe room, which has a King size bed and city view, is spacious and bright. Sleep quality is extremely high. The hotel knew that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary and gave us a very nice champagne when we arrived, complete with hand written notes from the staff. This is a gesture that we appreciate greatly. Nothing beats the warmth of the staff - those who meet us at the airport bus bay as well as those who sent us off at our last; those who fuss over our type of coffee and eggs at the breakfast table; and those at the check-in counter, noting our departure date and time for transport arrangement. I can see and feel their genuity in ensuring that their guesta are well taken care of. The fact that the hotel is small added charm and allows the staff to call us by our name. The room rates are high and so it could only be our occasional indulgence.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Hotel always thought about all customers. Always thinking in customers way. Very good service. Strongly recommend choose Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo while you stay in Tokyo. Best hotel in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Right next to the Tokyo Station & Gibza. Station pickup and drop off are super convenient. Breakfast was decent. Views from the Lounge level were fantastic. Highly recommend this hotel - they took great care of my two young sons

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The best service. They even walked us to our train platform to Kyoto. Breakfast was amazing!! The food quality was excellent and presentation was beautiful. We ordered room service one night and that was excellent also.
user_name:
Sara F
West Menlo Park, California

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is like a mini-version of the FS properties we stayed at; FS-Tokyo has a small lobby, tight elevators and packed gym. But if you can look pass the "smallish" public spaces, you will find the same top notch service and room amenities one expects at FS. The staff greeted us at the platform inside the crazy busy Tokyo station, carried our luggage and showed us to the hotel. We started our daily adventure with strong latte, warm croissants with house-made marmalade and incredibly good juices (gosh I miss them!) at the breakfast buffet. Every staff we encountered was helpful and attentive. I look forward to staying at this property again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo is a terrific hotel. The Four Seasons Tokyo provided great service as well as great food and great accommodations. The Four Seasons Tokyo also provided great information regarding my visit to Tokyo and recommended great guides. I was very impressed by the fact that they personally take you to the train station to ensure that you get on the correct bullet train. I highly recommend the Four Seasons Tokyo. It was a fantastic experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel did a great job. Staffs and services are great. The only bad thing is when time to leave. If I could, I don't want to check out from this hotel. Located by Tokyo station and at Ginza area which is luxury shopping area. A lot of restaurant nearby. Not too far from Imperial Palace and Tsukiji Fish Market.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Within the first hour, everyone knows your name- how, I don't know. Service level is so good I can't compare it to any other hotel. Rooms are very large, comfortable,totally automated down to the electric remote drapes. Go to the bar- have William make you something special- just let him use his imagination- incredible. Bubble gum Martini- sounds horrible but great. Christina at the bar- best service, super friendly, makes you feel like you are in a private club. Front desk staff fantastic- somehow via their headsets your cab is called, the doorman knows your name, takes care of all. A must stay if you are in Tokyo

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The location is perfect. The service was amazing. The concierge was incredibly helpful in planning our vacation. Very family friendly with special welcome gifts for our two kids (11 and 8). Breakfast was yummy. I guess the only complaint, such as it is, would be the lack of a pool. (But the gym was very good.) This is the perfect place to stay for a Tokyo trip!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I had a great stay at The Four Seasons Hotel in Marunouchi. The staff has been exceptionally friendly and helpful: it is a great hotel with an outstanding staff. the interaction with the staff was memorable and I'd love to come back one day

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff. From check-in to check out reception and concierge service had been very helpful and always friendly. Great location for shopping, sightseeing and travel. Hotel is a bit aged and spa is too small.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Positive:Concierge / Front Desk went out of their way to assist me with our itinerary including all reservations, tour guide, and directions. Private tour guide recommended by hotel, Ms. Hiragi, was a 5-star tour guide! The room is relatively big, clean, and definitely better than the 4* hotels weve tried in Japan so far. Despite staying on the 3rd floor facing Tokyo Station, we didnt notice any noise from the main street nor the station. Things That The Hotel Could Improve On:The main lobby is relatively small. Signage is also a bit hidden, and unlike most 5* hotels, Four Seasons didn't have a driveway leading to the main entrance. This makes the hotel look more like an office building (which it is, as it shares the same building as Pacific Century) as opposed to a real 5* hotel at first glance. Breakfast Buffet spread is good, but could use a little more variety. Internet is also a bit choppy, and I constantly had to connect and reconnect. Internet speed ranges from 256kbps-1.2mbps, which is shockingly slow by Japanese standards. Tv channels are also mostly in Japanese; and CNN was playing with two languages simultaneously (a female japanese kept translating whatever the anchor said) so I had to turn the TV off. For a 5* hotel, it could use more channels. And for a family hotel, it had "0" channels for kids. Summary:Superb Staff. Big Rooms. Good Location. Small Lobby. Slow Internet. Lack of Channels [ENGLISH]. Breakfast Buffet spread is exactly the same as 4* hotels.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Tokyo Four Seasons Hotel is a beautiful hotel located very close to the Yaesu exit of Tokyo Station. The room was beautiful, the breakfast food and staff were excellent, but most importantly, I have to commend the front desk and bell staff. They went out of their way to help us in any way possible, including walking with us over to Tokyo station to make sure we got the right ticket for the right train. There are other luxury hotels in Tokyo but the staff puts this one over the top in my opinion.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very clean and modern hotel. Guest room/bathroom are large nicely decorated. Hotel staff were outstanding, taking care of anything you ask for and were very friendly. Restaurant and bar at the top of the hotel had a great variety of entrees to choose from and the meal was fantastic. I stay in a lot of luxury hotels on business/pleasure and this was one of my favorites.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed in this lovely hotel for our final night in Tokyo after a long trip around Japan. The staff made my family, and especially my 1.5 year old feel welcome. This hotel has amazing amenities for children, plus all the accoutrements you come to expect with a Four Seasons property.Finally, they provided an escort to help us buy tickets to Narita at Tokyo Station which is one block away. Yuki helped us with our bags and took us right to the correct platform. Thank goodness for this service, as Tokyo station is an absolute labyrinth and we might have been lost for DAYS without Yuki's help. Little services such as these make the difference. You better believe I'll be coming back here for our trip to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is perfect!! Good service and food! Location is perfect, walking distance from Ginza a 5th avenue mixed with times square kind of area, the hotel offers really good service, walking distance from the Tokyo metro station! Loved staying at this hotel

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I was extremely pleased with my entire experience at the Four Seasons Tokyo Hotel. A small version of a Four Seasons it has full size quantities of service, personal attention, comfort, quality and great food. I would return here again and again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Thank you for the great staff and this hotel in Tokyo is not good enough ... the hotel speaks for its self as the four season but this hotel in specific is the best I have ever tried . The services are amazing along with the great helpful staff , every night when we are off , they come and prepare the night wares and prepare the room for the night I had a reservation at hotel in Fuji area , I just asked them about the public transportation , next day the brought me a very professional report on how to get there and return with all possible ways .Also,They have figured out my wife birthday them self and brought a surprise cake to the room with card that have all the staff's birthday wishes Amazing and unforgettable gestureThe hotel is located next by the Tokyo JR station and only 10 minutes walking distance from Ginza I highly recommend this hotel, you will never feel like a stranger ...

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four seasons standard located in a very convenient area. Easy for taxi drop off. 5 mins walk to Ginza and easy to find good food at Marunouchi. Hotel ambient is relaxing and very private as there are not many rooms. Great facilities for example onsen, spa and dining room. Staffs are very helpful and all able to communicate in English. Room is excellent and in good size.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Top standard service and perfect location on a boutique Four Seasons.Large rooms even more in relation to room sizes in Tokyo, with great views of the railroad. Maybe just some improvement needed in the in-room dinning. The menu is short although the quality of the food is good.Breakfast buffet not to good either. Maybe the least Four Seasons quality standard of all things.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Good location on the edge of Gonza and adjoining the train station. Excellent service as one would expect at the Four Seasons and good sized rooms (a luxury in Tokyo). The only negative is that the facade and public areas of the hotel could use a facelift - looks a bit dated

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons hotel in Tokyo is amazing. Location is perfect next to Ginza and the service was perfect. There is some noise at nights with the train station nearby but it's not too loud and the hotel staff make up for this shortcoming through exceptional service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Located steps away from Tokyo station, it can also be reached via underground passage, from Nex, Jr, subway and Marounuchi, a great option during inclement weather. Excellent quiet room, all the trimmings including humidifier, pillow menu, nespresso, etc. Friendly and v helpfull staff (thank you again Mamy) made our recent stay most enjoyable. Shopping, sakura, Ginza, fish market, imperial palace all within walking distance.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: After 3 weeks i Japan this was our final stop. The hotel was perfect. Well located near transit and shopping, extremely comfortable, the best concierge service on our entire trip and the most functional, well laid out rooms of the entire trip. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Dining, both the included breakfast and a delicious western style dinner were exceptional in terms of quality, variety and value. Highly recommended and I don't say this often.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a 3 star hotel masquerading as a 5 star hotel. Breakfast offering is truly terrible and an embarrassment to the Four Seasons brand. Room sizes are on the small side and across the board the service offerings are highly limited and token (eg spa; massage and gym). One French restaurant means we had to eat out each nite even though at times we would have preferred to stay in. There are no views from the hotel to speak of and the quality of staff service was all over the shop.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staffs are extremely helpful, really appreciate their assistance on guiding us to and fro the hugh Tokyo station. Very friendly to our kids that make it very different from other six stars hotel. Several Suggestions 1. Automatic Toilet Flush 2. Rain shower In summary, we , especially our kids love this hotel and will definitely stay here if we fly to Tokyo next time

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service-oriented culture of Japan is on full display at this Four Seasons property. From check-in to check-out I had a very positive experience. Room is clean and spacious and well laid out (friendly to the US traveler), restaurant was excellent, meeting room was set up perfectly. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Loved the location of the hotel, but the concierge service was the worst I have ever experienced. I have never had a concierge whose recommendation is to walk around and look for restaurants. All in all we were really disappointed with this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was going to be our last night stay in Tokyo. I purposely chose the Four Seasons as a little splurge, however I was left feeling a little disappointed with the hotel. I have come to realize that America is far behind Japan when it comes to toilets. At all the hotels I stayed at, including small boutique hotels, the toilets were automatic and censored. I love this because it is much more clean to not have to really touch anything. However, Four Season was the only hotel where I had to manually flush the toilet. I know that may be picky, but from all my other hotel stays that is what I had come accustomed to. The hotel is very small, and the hotel room was clean but nothing noteworthy. However, the service staff was amazing. They really do go above a beyond when it comes to attention.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and were impressed with the level of attention and care that the staff provided with assistance to the train platform and various restaurant reservations. The hotel rooms are comfortable; the hallway decor is a little dated on some floors, but overall if you need to stay in this area, this hotel is a good choice.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I was there with my girlfriend and it was her birthday on the second day of our stay. I secretly asked the concierge to sent in a small cake at around 11pm at night. they sent in the cake together with a camera and sang the birthday song. We were having an inroom massage and were in pajamas. Very warm and friendly service, they did not charge us for the cake. they remember our names and greeted us every morning when we went out.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed at the deluxe bedroom suite. The room made me feel like home away from home. It's large at 1000+sq ft yet the hotel is situated at the center of Tokyo - 1 min away from Tokyo station and 8 mins away from the Imperial Palace, where I had my morning run.Compared to other hotels of its class, Four Seasons' decor is much more subtle, rather than grandiose which fits my taste. Elements of Japanese sincerity are present in every corner of the room. It's a good breakaway from the busy Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Spent three nights at the Four Seasons which is right next to Tokyo Station which was easy to navigate. The bellboy Taka created the best impressions at the start by patiently walking me through the room facilities. The gym was well decked out and want for nothing. In short I would love to be back!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Professional, friendly and helpful staff. The location next to the central station and close to Ginsha is excellent. There are a lot of restaurants and shops in the neighboourhood. The restaurant is good and pleasant. The breakfastbuffet needs some improvement.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: When you travel, especially with children/family, your experiences make or break your trip. The service at this hotel from start to finish made our trip exceptional despite the chaos we experienced with traveling with two small children. Everyone was warm and friendly and welcoming, there were amenities for our children (both under 4), service was quick, and the overall amazing experience and customer service really helped after a long day out or as the first thing in the morning at breakfast.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Was a good experience but did not feel special. The guy checking us in kept on telling us and my kids that the items in the mini bar were not free and they not touch them. After the third time I wanted to tell him I could afford anything my kids consumed from that bar and to shut it. Really pissed me off
user_name:
Y2843KZamitk
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great service, perfect location, everything was well done! We had really good service and good time! Next time in Tokyo we absolutely come back to Four Seasons Marunouchi! See you then and thank you so much,!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location. Walking distance to metro stations, restaurants, shopping areas. Hotel in general and rooms in particular are very clean. Staff is extremely friendly and they do make sure that you would have the smoothest experience during your stay.
user_name:
Dilshad T
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Pros: centrally located, Four Seasons top notch friendly and helpful service. Only hotel that could accommodate a family in a big room with 2 queen beds.Cons: It's squeezed into an office building and even with all the Four Seasons decor - still feels like an office building. Lobby looks like they were lucky to just get a sliver of it for check-in. Very unmemorable. We stay in Four Seasons around the world, this one is very forgettable in atmosphere.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First visit to Tokyo and personal discovery of an exceptionally vibrant and progressive city. My wife and I enjoyed 5 nights here recently and used our time to experience as much as we could. Our days were filled with exploring the city's neighbourhoods, gardens, markets, stores, restaurants, and culture and it was always nice to start and finish each day at the Four Seasons in Marunouchi, so conveniently located to Tokyo Station, Ginza, the grounds of the Imperial Palace, and the excellent subway system. We appreciate smaller, boutique hotels that provide more of a couture experience and we received that at the Four Seasons Tokyo. The service and facilities were five star all the way, and though not inexpensive, we felt we received good value for what we paid in one of the world's great cities where the level of sophistication, safety, and variety has few peers.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It was truly fantastic experience. The hotel is brand new (or at least look like it) the rooms are nice and comfortable. However the service is what makes the experience great. The staff prepared a whole room for my 3 year old with bumper on each corner, a kid size bath robe etc... . The restaurant on the top floor of the hotel has a nice view and the food is worth trying the breakfast is really good. The hotel ideally located in the heart of Tokyo above the Tokyo Station with a dedicated team ready to meet guest highest expectations. I doesn't feel as the usual Four Seasons it has a more boutique feeling.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed for 5 nights for 2 periods as we went out one night for hot spring, we left our luggages at the hotel. When we come back, staff already reconaize us, call our name and said our luggages already in our room. Hotel is not big and they don't have a big lobby but the service is very good.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We traveled to Tokyo with a group of friends to celebrate a milestone birthday and stayed at the Four Seasons in Tokyo. From the first point we contacted the hotel about coming with a group they were terrific. Always professional, responsive and very helpful. We can highly recommend the hotel to anyone going to Tokyo. The rooms are lovely, the staff is exceptional, restaurants were excellent and the location of the hotel next to the train stations was ideal.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons has the location, service, amenities and the insight to keep all your travel plans stress free! My overall experience was exceptional! The service goes to another level that I personally did not expect! The train station next to the hotel is very confusing to say the least, and hard to understand to the layman traveler. The employees at the front desk took me over to the station, help me buy my tickets, then directed me downstairs to the proper platform and then waited for me to load! Awesome is all I can say to these great employees!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: One can only imagine what a perfect hotel experience looks like when you are bringing 27 of your closest friends across the world. Staff, hotel, service, food, drink...all amazing. Pre-planning trip for 6 plus months with your help was flawless. They made our planning easy, painless and in the end spectacular.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo is a very comfortable, kind and great hotel. Thanks for all of your staffs. We have a nice trip and wonderful wedding ceremony with our friends. And the meals are creative and delicious.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We returned to the Four Seasons Tokyo for our second trip to Japan. I far to often find that a repeat visit to a hotel or place of which I have very pleasant memories ends in disappointment. Not so with our second trip to the Four Seasons. Several familiar faces (some with promotions - congratulations Yumi!) greeted us with as much attention and care as the previous year. Nothing was too much trouble for the concierge staff (as previously) and the hotel breakfasts are still some of the best I have ever experienced. The care that was put into making our children feel welcome was, once again, fully on display, with appropriate sized bathrobes and slippers, little treats to eat, as well as a message from the manager addressed to them (they were too nervous to write back to him, I'm afraid!) resulted in the Four Seasons being cemented in the minds of our children as our "Tokyo Home".Our room was delightful - a suite with views of Tokyo Station. The main bed was comfortable and the bathroom was well stocked with toiletries - once again with bath toys and novelty sponges for our little ones.The location of this hotel is fantastic, almost on top of Tokyo station, making access to Tokyo's marvellous underground railway for local trips as well as the Shinkansen for day trips or departure a matter of minutes. Once again, we were overcome by the level of service we received on departure, with a member of the concierge staff assisting us to our train and ensuring we were comfortable, even ensuring we could swivel a pair of seats so that we could sit together as a family of four.My wife enjoyed a trip to the spa, but unfortunately experienced a skin reaction to one of the ingredients in the facial treatment. The staff were extremely apologetic. The treatment was immediately refunded and rapid assistance in obtaining appropriate medication was provided. I went to the pharmacy to obtain the medication in question with one of the staff, who insisted that the hotel cover all costs, despite my offers. While unfortunate, this situation was managed in the best manner possible by the hotel staff.My only criticism was that the sofa bed in our suite was not well suited to two children due to its tendency to sag in the middle, causing late night cries of outrage about who was invading whose "side". In retrospect, our more humble room with two queen beds the previous year would probably be a more comfortable option with two children, notwithstanding the need for whispered conversations after lights out!.Overall, a wonderful experience again. Thoroughly recommended!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: we stayed here around 5 nights, and loved itwe had a big corner suite, with 2 king sized beds and an extra bed added for our 2nd child. there was plenty of space, beds were perfect, stunning bathrooms.the hotel is modern, elegant, welcoming and very stylish.the breakfast was beautiful, impeccable service, perfect foodthe location was great, directly access to Tokyo Station which made travel very easy.a lovely introduction to Tokyo

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: 4 service star with 5-star pricing. Food is good but wish i bit more choices. Location is very good as it is central to many things to visit and do. Our room was quite big. we will stay again but price is a bit high...

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We loved this hotel...incredibly comfortable beds, great bathroom/shower, perfect location by Tokyo station, very attentive staff. Breakfasts were not included and expensive but in a nice setting. Would stay here if in Tokyo again.
user_name:
jasper25rocks
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We traveled to Tokyo from Kyoto via the Nozomi Shinkansen. We were greeted at the Tokyo Station train platform by two professionals from the Four Seasons Tokyo. I really wish I remembered their names because they both were tremendous helping us with our five heavy suitcases all the way back to the hotel. Check-in was fast, and the staff who greeted us upon arrival were so kind and welcoming. We were escorted to our Premiere room, which was quite spacious. I really liked the clean, minimalistic decor of the rooms, which reminded me of the Toronto FS property. The bed, which I believe was one of the newer Simmons beds offered at some of the FS properties, was comfortable, and my back was happy every morning. Being in the middle of the winter, the room was quite dry, but the humidifier provided some relief.We had booked the room many months prior to our stay in January. One of the biggest attractions Tokyo had to offer was the world class cuisine. We were well aware that competition for seatings was fierce and that reservations most often will only given to individual who spoke Japanese. Akhil and his colleagues (Miki, Xing, and Misato) with concierge were absolutely amazing from the get go. We were lucky enough to be secured a seating for lunch at Jiro's restaurant in Ginza, as well as other top choices of ours. That experience alone made the trip to Tokyo worthwhile!We only ate breakfast and mid afternoon snacks at the on-site restaurant, Motif. I loved both the breakfast buffet and Japanese style breakfast (make sure you have a big appetite). I'm a huge fan of fresh juice and Motif's juices were amazing. Service, again, was top notch, and the gentleman who took care of us at the restaurant, Ricky, was a really great personable guy. The Four Seasons Tokyo is quite different than the majority of their other properties. With 56 rooms or so, I believe it's the smallest hotel in their network, which gave it a "boutique" hotel type of feel. The lobby is small with minimal seating areas. Thus, if you're the type who loves to lounge around in the lobby, this may not be the ideal hotel for you. The service and overall experience, however, was the best I've experienced at a Four Seasons property. Kishi-sama does an exceptional job taking care and managing the property. Thank you, Kishi and the rest of the Four Seasons staff, for making our first trip to Tokyo a memorable one. We are already planning our next visit!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Last May 2016 while travelling from California to Japan in order for my dog to have open heart surgery, I was fortunate enough to be a guest of the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo. Due to unforeseen circumstances, I was desperate for last minute accommodations that would accept me and my dog, and make our stay in Japan a positive one. Although the Four Seasons wasn't in our budget, our stay was worth every single penny. Everyone from the front door to the registration desk, concierge, and the restaurant, were absolutely amazing. I know having a dog in the hotel was definitely a new thing for a lot of the staff and not commonly accepted among the establishments around Tokyo city, but the staff treated us with the up-most respect. I was constantly pleasantly surprised with the amazing treatment we both received. Being in woman in Japan alone, not knowing the language and having a sick dog in tow was incredibly hard, but the experience of staying at your hotel made it bearable. I am forever grateful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very nice hotel property. Steps away from the Ginza and the the Imperial Palace. Nice gym (small) equipped with a wonderful and relaxing Onsen. On-site dining ids great and the staff second to none (legendary Four Seasons quality)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Well placed hotel. Staff at the top of their game, very helpful and kind. Arranged to purchase our tickets for the train to Osaka. Accompanied us onto the train and met us at our return. Will be back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We are a family travelling with a 3 and almost 6 year old. We chose this hotel so we were able to get a suite and the children sleep in one area and us in another. The room was sensational and huge, the service incredible and the food excellent. It is only a small hotel so doesn't have all the trimmings of larger hotels but for a trip to Tokyo it is in an excellent area and very comfortable. It is also above a shopping mall so it is easy and convenient. The beds are incredibly comfortable, the service excellent and staff were very helpful. Would without doubt recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: And this is my favorite hotel. Center of city, you can watch Shinkansen come and go all night in your jet lagged fog. Or close the curtains and sleep in perfect quiet in the center of Tokyo. The hotel is smart, the rooms perfect. The staff exceptional, anything you need or crave, they'll figure it out. Seriously, it does not come better.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First and foremost, as often mentioned in the other reviews, the level of service of this hotel is just a step above any other hotels in Tokyo. The welcome and sending off service at the train station is wonderful and makes you feel really special. It s like having a private butler service right in the middle of Tokyo. I guess the small number of rooms, 50+, allows them to provide this unique service. But on top of this, every staff we ve come across was smiling and made you feel like you were a special guest. We stayed with our 16 months toddler and not only was the baby crib provided but the whole room was secured with sharp corners of every furniture covered with a foamy protection. The level of detail in service and attention was just unparalled.As for the room, it was of a very good size especially considering the fact it is right above the Tokyo station. We had a room facing the tracks and even though you could hear the trains it didnt feel like a major disturbance especially as the view was just wonderful with a great view of the different Shinkansens and also the Yamanote line trains so symbolic of Tokyo. We spent a great amount of time watching the trains coming and leaving and felt so lucky for that view.Bathrooom was great with great amenities, with only a few points to point out if being picky, which were the lack of rain shower and the fact the washlet was not so advanced compared to what is now the norm in Japan but overall it was just great. The bed was super comfy and was just perfect after a whole day roaming the city. Locationwise, it is right above Tokyo station with its pros and cons. Pros being the easy access to all the trains, the closeness to Ginza, the imperial grounds or Nihonbashi and the underground mall with the famous Ramen street a short walk away. Cons being the fact you are in the middle of a constant hustle that comes with being in Tokyo station and which can become kind of stressful at times. We also used the Spa which was also of a great level and actually very reasonable in terms of price compared to spas of hotels of the same category in Tokyo. Some other reviews mentioned the very small size of the lobby and reception desk which is true. When we first arrived we were suprised at the reception desk but felt that it gave a more personal feel which i think is the keyword of this hotel. This hotel is more about providing a personal and exclusive service rather than being grand or with made to impress designs. Pricewise we felt that though it was on a higher range it was somehow reasonable considering the price range of average hotels in the same vicinity.  Overall it was just a great stay and we would definitely go back. There are some downfalls in terms of location if you dislike the hustle of Tokyo station or if your business is mostly in the Western part of town but the level of service is just so high that it makes up for all the downfalls. If you have the budget or can stretch it a bit, do not hesitate, this hotel is definitely worth it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights in December. Very difficult to give an overall rating for my view on this property is mixed ! Let's talk about the good:1. The service level is beyond comparison. Example number 1, a staff from concierge escorted me to the Shinkansen platform at the Tokyo Station - this made the 4 minutes walk from the hotel to Tokyo station with a roller luggage in tow so pleasant and stylish, this also saved me the hassle from trying to figure out where the platform for my train was. Talking about travel in style ! Example number 2, the first night during my stay, I asked for firmer pillows, yet the pillows housekeeping could offer me was not firm enough for me, and so I settled with their Japanese buckwheat pillows and I was happy with them. The next day when I returned to my room, the housekeeping had curated a set of firmer pillows for me without me ask them to. This showed how the hotel care about whether their guests can get a good rest and took initiatives to try to help, this really impressed me and was really above and beyond my expecatations.2. The Location: Very conveniently located. On top of being near Ginza and next to Tokyo statio, there are 3 big high-end shopping malls nearby with full range of restaurants, convenient stores, and supermarket ! 3. Room is spacious - I stayed at a city view king bed room, even with a rolled away bed added, the room did not feel cramped at all - very spacious room in Tokyo's standard ! Now the not so good part: This is a small property with an inconspicuous entrance, and a very small lobby with the reception desk tuck behind a huge pillar at an awkward angle - the reception desk in my apartment at home is better than this ! I mean this is Four Seasons hotel - I expect something better, with more design, better quality and more style - their lobby is no better than a 2 star business hotel ! Breakfast: The hotel's breakfast offering not only was very underwhelming and was way too pricy. A very basic continental breakfast was about US$ 45 dollars, and if you accidentally ordered an egg, than you will have to pay more than US$50 dollars ! I usually does not complaint about hotel food price, however, the offering was so sub-par, let's say, even if it was for free, I would not touch it - such a shame ! I am very torn in giving 3 stars to this property, but I think Four seasons Marunouchi at this price point has let me down - and I want to let reviewers know what they are getting when choosing a hotel in Tokyo - There are a lot more better offers out there ! Chose carefully !

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location near tokyo station and the ginza! Excellent service!Literally as soon as we walked out of the train, someone was waiting for us to help us with our luggage back to the hotel. We had 7 pieces of luggage including 2 oversized bags that a young female insisted she push on a dolly through the train station and several blocks to the hotel. Our room had a view of the train tracks and we could see the trains speed on by. Bathrooms could use a renovation and no pool.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel has a great location, short walk to Tokyo Train and other metro stations, also 5 minutes walk to Ginza and other tourist area. Service is exceptional, all the staff people are incredible. My room was really a comfortable suite with street view so the trains didn't bother me. The hotel doesn't look as other Four Seasons properties but it is ok for me, it is modern with a minimalist decor. The only thing I don't like was the breakfast buffet, it is better to choose a la carte. But I recommend this Hotel to any business trip or short stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From check-in with the best concierge I had the pleasure to meet - to the sad check-out day, everything at this 5 star property was perfect. We really enjoyed our stay and we have been many Four Seasons and 5 star properties around the world and I think this place sets the bar on service. Everyone from the bell-boy (actually bell-girl) to the fabulous concierge went way beyond to make our stay a comfortable and a memorable one. We were upgraded to a corner room with a nice view of the train station. We loved watching the high-speed train go in and out of the station.Also on our check-out day - the bell-girl (a nice young lady) helped us with our luggage to the train station and my wife forgot to buy some Japanese mountain peach (yamamomo). The young lady said "No problem. Please wait here and she ran to the nearby store to try to get some." Now that's service!The next time we come back to Tokyo, we look forward to staying at the fabulous property again. See you soon Four Seasons Marunouchi!
user_name:
JamesBCH
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great service from all the team, very comfortable property. The singular service of the property team was amazing. We had a great experience in the food and beverage. The concierge service was great and knowledgeable on our needs to visit the city.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is different to other Four Seasons I have stayed in as it has the look and feel of a boutique hotel. The rooms are large by any standards. We had a junior suite which was still spacious even with a rollaway bed. The amenities are fabulous - they provide pyjamas! The service is wonderful. They walk you to the train station and help you to buy tickets! The only fault I could find is with the breakfast. The buffet is small and not particularly good. Overall, however a truly memorable stat

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There are many good staffs,remember my name and call friendly.Location is just walk 5min. to Tokyo station. Very convienient.And on 7th floor there is good resutraunt, I could enjoy good foods and drink.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Ideally located beside tokyo station and walking distance to ginza. Fantastic view of the tokyo station rail that make my kids days watching the trains zooming in and out. Friendly and attentive staff. Will definite revisit again

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I recently spent 1 week at the Four Seasons Maranouchi on a business trip. The room are spacious and its extremely well located above Tokyo Station. The amazing shopping of Ginza is a short 5 minute walk away. The hotel is all around great but the service is not up to normal Tokyo standard. The hotel seems deserted and there is not a proper lobby to relax in while waiting for meeting. Other than those two small issues the hotel is just about perfect.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed at the Four Seasons for seven nights while in Tokyo at the beginning of December and had a wonderful experience. To my surprise, my room was huge by any standard, and although I was on the third floor I heard little outside noise. In fact, this is one of the quietest hotels I've ever visited.Pros: room size & simple design, bathroom, comfy pyjamas (!), friendly staff, convenient location near Tokyo StationOpportunities: bed was sunken in on one side and needs to be rotated or replaced; I should've mentioned this to the staff after my first night and didn't // As is usually the case at luxury hotels, breakfast is far from inexpensive, and the continental breakfast didn't taste as fresh as I would've expected from the Four Seasons.When I return to Tokyo in a few months, I will absolutely look to stay here again.
user_name:
CCinNYC
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The way it should be. Enjoyed the stay after arriving from a long haul. Best service we had all week. Lobby is not great but rooms and bar/restaurant area make up for that. Room and bathroom really spacious, unlike what one expects in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Not the typical Four Seasons that you've always known. This one is somewhat hidden right outside the main (and extremely busy) Tokyo Central station. But as soon as you step into the hotel foyer, you can immediately experience the Four Seasons service. In fact, they also have a pick-up service from the NEX platform right to the hotel - just in case you're afraid you'd get lost in the maze of platforms and people.The room was large by Japanese standards, and was quite elegantly furnished. Loved the sleepwear they placed on the beds in the evening - super comfy. You can hear the trains and the traffic from outside, but it wasn't much of a bother. Slept like a baby.It's very much a business hotel, and a very comfortable and convenient one too. Will come back if on business.P.S - they send you back to the platform too if you're using the NEX

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: missed flight from Narita as arrived too late at Tokyo station. This Hotel was nearby so booked in. Shocked at price £550 a night. Sevice superb though. Nothing was too much bother. Even carried my cases to station next day. Booked a NEX train ticket for me. walked me to platform. Shook my hand, refused tip and said it was his pleasure. Great place. But at a cost.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I am generally a big fan of the Four Seasons hotels, but this one does not work for me. I was kindly upgraded to a large suite, but surprisingly the sound proofing was not sufficient. The train noise of permanent train traffic (hotel is overlooking Tokyo station) effected my sleep and required ear plugs. Service though was impeccable and facilities superb as expected. Suite was extremely well appointed.
user_name:
Thomas443
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent a week at Four Seasons Marunouchi with our 10 and 12 year old children and are so happy we chose to stay here. This review will be mainly geared toward families. This was my second stay here, please refer to that review from Feb 2016 for more on a non-family visit. Traveling with the kids, I felt that we would be more comfortable at the FS, rather than a couple other luxury hotels in the Marunouchi area which are more ostentatiously decorated or have such minimalist decor that they make me feel like I'm in a museum and have to whisper. The kids were able to be themselves here.Location: For families, FS Marunouchi's ideal location is walking distance to the Imperial Palace, bright lights of Ginza shopping district and Nihonbashi. Tokyo Station, with tons of shopping and dining choices, not to mention easy access to subways to take you anywhere in Tokyo and shinkansen for farther excursions, is next door and there is a convenient interior elevator access which is especially nice during cold and rainy weather. The hotel has several complimentary bicycles for guest use (including sizes for both kids and adults). We rode to the palace and shopping streets of Marunouchi and the kids really enjoyed dodging people on the sidewalks. Hotel Service/Amenities:Staff are very accommodating to families and we were welcomed back each day with special treats for the kids and adults in our room. Dining options in their restaurant and in-room dining range from typical kid menu items, to special kid-sized Japanese breakfasts and anything can be customized to your tastes. There is no pool and kids aren't allowed in the small spa, but there is so much to do in Tokyo that they didn't miss it. Concierges are very helpful and were able to get tickets for several activities prearranged before our arrival. We took the Narita Express N'EX train from Narita to Tokyo Station and we love love love the Tokyo Station train platform greeting and departing service. Rooms: Our corner suite looked over the shinkansen lines of Tokyo Station. Housekeeping set up the sofa bed and a rollaway for our kids who decided sharing a queen sofa bed wasn't an acceptable bedding arrangement. Kid robes and house slippers were already in the room and mom and dad enjoyed the hotel provided pajamas. We look forward to our next stay!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here for two nights and cannot recommend the hotel more highly.LocationThis was our first trip to Tokyo and the hotel was ideally located for exploring the city with Tokyo Station, the Imperial Palace Gardens and the Ginza shopping district all within easy walking distance.RoomsOur room was spacious, well equipped, spotlessly clean and very comfortable. We arrived in the morning and there was a light breakfast waiting for us in our room. The views aren't stunning however we had a fascinating view of the Bullet Trains coming in and out of the station (do not worry, about noise from outside, the sound insulation is fantastic).Breakfast and BarWe ate breakfast at the hotel every day and also used the bar. I tried the Japanese breakfast which was delicious and there is an extensive buffet and à la carte selection too.ServiceWithout question, the best part of our stay in the hotel was the service. It was simply impeccable with everyone doing whatever they could to give us an enjoyable visit. From helping us with our many questions as first time travellers to Japan to small touches like giving us umbrellas when it rained, we could not have asked for anything else. Particular thanks go to Akhil on Concierge who helped us arrange everything from a fantastic tour guide to booking our Bullet Train tickets as well as checking all of our onward bookings and always ensuring we had maps with our destinations written in Japanese to give to taxi drivers. Yosuke was also incredibly helpful and came with us to the station to make sure we got on our train to Kyoto safely. Our sincere thanks go to the whole team.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very convenient location in the heart of Tokyo next to rail (Xinguangsan) & JR station and also huge underground shopping malls. The room is large & well design to offer very comfortable stay. Staffs are very friendly and always take the initial to offer help/assistance. The restaurant at the top of the hotel with very nice view and meals is a must try!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We are experienced and adventurous travelers and selected the Four Seasons hotel because of it proximity to the rail station.The hotel is beautiful and modern.The rooms are typical Four Seasons full of pleasantries,and we were upgraded to a suite under the Amex reservation program.The staff was very focused on helping us with all our needs to visit Tokyo .They went us far as to help us with train reservations and also help us to get into the station and train.Breakfast is very organized and very well staffed to the point of complete satisfaction to all of us.What impressed me more is the general attitude of the staff of wanting to help you with all of our plans.I will strongly recommend this hotel specially if you are and independent traveler, it will make your life easy in Japan.JW.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Best bed i have ever slept on so far. Very nice of them for setting up our honeymoon goodies. Service was excellent, good location, only quite a walk for the metro subway, but overall was excellent.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: motif has outstanding lunch semi-buffet, with great selection of fresh vegetables from Hokkaido. location is great, loved the cozy hotel. good and friendly staff, professional services, personalized tailor made experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfectly located near Tokyo Station and Kiyobashi Station which made getting around Tokyo easy. The walking tour with guide, Tomoko, was invaluable. The best way to see the city and get insiders knowledge is via the walking tour.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Can I just say I LOVE Tokyo, and love it even more when I get to stay at the Four Seasons. Service is always excellent and concierge is above and beyond. The gym is small but nice with showers/spa/onsen available. Convenient location next to Tokyo Station. Staff speaks English, but will humor my broken Japanese

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great room. But trying to arrange a car to pick us up at the airport was difficult. Even after lots of communication w/hotel, the driver thought he was picking up 3 people from one flight instead of 2 from 2 flights(different terminals). Hotel insisted we needed a van so we were picked in van that seats 16pp. There isn't a lobby. Had light dinner upstairs -unremarkable & inattentive service. Love this hotel chain but feel lack of English speaking skills made this a poor experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I went back to Four Season again this September and the service is always the best, I must say. We are lucky that our flight landed in the morning and there is room available for our early check in. Location is the best as it is adjacent to Tokyo station.Only thing I'm not used to it is that the bed is abit too soft to my liking.I will definitely return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Loved the hotel. Haven't really ever gone wrong with a four seasons, and this is no exception. Conveniently located next to the Tokyo train station (but don't worry, you can't hear them) and near many sights. Very friendly and accommodating staff as is almost everyone in Japan. They even offered to escort us to the train station to buy tickets, etc (tho we didn't take them up on it as really is very easy to do on your own). Breakfast was great and included, service was perfect. Wifi was included for two devices. Hard to find anything negative to say, so I won't!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: we loved our stay at the Four Seasons Marunouchi. The hotel, room, restaurant, fitness center and spa facilities were wonderful. But best of all was the kind and attentive service of its staff. Would definitely stay again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Located near the Tokyo Train Station, this hotel is the place to stay in Tokyo. You expect outstanding service at a Four Seasons, but here it is delivered with no expectation of anything in return other than a smile of satisfaction. Our Deluxe City View room was extremely spacious and the bathroom was large, and the room was very quiet. The bed was the most comfortable we had in three cities in Japan. The bell staff will greet you at your train and escort you to your bus or train at departure. They make you feel like family. The hotel restaurant (Motif) is excellent.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Beautiful boutique gem in the center of Tokyo. Staff is terrific and rooms well appointed and comfortable. The staff spoke English well and were very helpful. Has more services than I had time to avail myself of.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We enjoyed 5 wonderful nights here using the hotel as a base from which to see Tokyo and beyond via Japan Rail and the Shinkansen. The hotel was perfectly located for this. The hotel is really nicely appointed with good sized rooms. Ours comfortably accommodated 2 adults and a teenager.It was our first time in Tokyo so we appreciated the meet and greet service at the train on arrival and the assistance getting us and our luggage to the hotel from there. The staff were so friendly and helpful and everyone spoke excellent English. We were greeted by name and offered assistance whenever we entered or left the hotel. The concierge also helped me to send a package to a friend in Japan at very reasonable cost. The breakfast buffet was a great way to start the day and the juice of the day was a highlight.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I enjoyed afternoon tea here with my family. Taste of tea,coffee,cakes is moderately good. One of my family is handicapped person. She is using wheelchair. But there are no handicapped accessible toilets in the hotel. I was so shocked because here is one of the great and luxurious hotel in Tokyo. On the other hand staffs were courteous. But I wouldn't like to stay this hotel again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I had a wonderful stay with a group last year.The best hotel experience ever! The customer care is fantastic! They have nice rooms, quite big for the Japanese standards, the laundry and room service is impeccable.As we arrived very early in the morning, it was great to walk in my room and realize they had just served breakfast for me.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I was so impressed with the level of service at this property. They have over exceeded my expectations of hospitality. I had "not" one bad experience from any of the hotel services that I have requested. I have stayed at other Four Seasons properties, but this property and staff top the cake. This hotel is the reason why Four Seasons is always my first pick of hotel for its "Quality of Service" and "Hospitality". Platinum Limousine Hawaii- OwnerKurt Tsuneyoshi

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Service here is truly exceptional...what one expects of the Four Seasons brand. We called from the airport and gave the hotel the time we would be arriving at the Tokyo Station. 2 staff members were at the station to take charge of our luggage and escort us to the hotel. We had taken a dinner package which included a gourmet multi course dinner at Motif, which was wonderful. Enjoyed their bar with engaging bar tenders. The next day their staff again escorted us to the Tokyo Station to get our JR pass activated and drop us at our train for you day trip to Hakone. This is a great location if one is planning to do day trips on the Shinkansen. Loved the location of our room overlooking the zipping bullet trains. The spa is included in the hotel room rate. Nice to use the onsen in the evening after a hectic day sigh seeing. Many hotels charge extra for spa usage in Tokyo (The Prince Gallery charges appox. $45 per person per day). This hotel is relatively low key. If one is looking for lot of action I would recommend the Mandarin Oriental or Park Hyatt.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This place is really good, especially considering there are about 55 rooms in total. Pre-arrival concierge was spot on; we wanted romance train tickets in the front observation car, which is almost impossible to get from outside the country. Not only did their concierge go to Shinjuku station across town to get the tickets, they were honest with us and didn't charge us for the running fee because they said their person doing the errand had other reasons to be there. Compare that to the Park Hyatt hotel concierge who said he had no way to get those special tickets. The hotel provided good recommendations for things to do in Tokyo with kids; we wound up having a lot more fun with our kids in Tokyo than anticipated. Concierge also arranged an excellent city guide that worked well with our kids. The hotel rooms are oversized; our two connecting rooms felt like an apartment and the gifts provided to the kids on arrival were really nice (ie: cookies with their names on them and stuffed animals). I had been concerned that there would be no views but the rooms and common areas were bright and this was really not a problem (we also stayed at the Park Hyatt which had great views but which also had its downsides). We also liked the decor and wall art which was sensible and very tasteful. Breakfast buffet and things that came from the kitchen were excellent; anything we asked for we got without any nickel and diming. One evening we came to the hotel at 9pm after failing at the Imperial Hotel to find food we and our kids wanted to eat despite their dozen restaurants, and the restaurant staff were most accommodating and made up whatever we wanted, which is one of the most important reasons why I chose this hotel in the first place. The hotel has a very good gym and a beautiful sauna area, which feels like a private area and for which they don't charge extra, unlike the Park Hyatt which wanted $40 a day extra to use the sauna and which was pretty crowded. Privacy also is helpful in Japan which is totally nude in sauna areas. Spa treatment was also excellent. We really enjoyed the meet and greet service at the train upon arrival and the assistance getting us and our luggage back to the train upon departure. Tokyo station is particularly intimidating to a foreigner who has just arrived for the first time; it is huge and confusing with many entrances and levels until someone shows you the ropes. The assistant helped us get our train tickets to Kyoto at the station, took us to the track and helped us around the station get food to take on the train. People here don't expect to be tipped which makes all this service even extra special, because people are actually providing service to provide service. The concierge got us a table at Kyubey ( a top sushi place) on half an hour's notice. English was not a problem in terms of communicating with the staff; this is important because at other hotels such as the Park Hyatt we had problems communicating with most of the staff and getting simple things done such as making a collect call to the US. If you came to the lobby at 4am with jetlag and wanted something to eat, people were nice to you and gave you something. At the Park Hyatt, they simply kicked you out of the breakfast area. This hotel is easy to get in and out of; the Hyatt is on top floors of a skyscraper so you have to go up and down to get in and out and the hotel is a taxi ride from the train station; here you can walk to a major station. I also liked this part of the city better than Shinjuku; less chaotic and no matter where you stay you have to take a taxi to get anywhere so you might as well be here. You can get to Shinjuku from Tokyo station in 15 minutes with an express train or in a taxi at off hours. The Park Hyatt has more food options and a bigger gym and a pool; but all of these (except for lack of a pool) are perfectly adequate here and overall this is a much better property in terms of service and accommodation and it is all the more impressive considering the rates we paid at both properties. Here we felt like guests of a residence rather than tourists in a large hotel. When we returned to the hotel after an activity, the staff knew where we had been and asked us how we liked what we did. It is just no contest. This is a perfect place for a visitor to use as a base for Tokyo with or without families.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is my second trip to the hotel and it's better than I remember. The level of service provided by the staff and amenities included in the room are incomparable. Many items are complimentary like the fitness center, spa access, and wifi. I recommend the breakfast buffet. There are some nice views of Tokyo station while you enjoy your $50 breakfast. You get what you pay for however, this level of service does not come without the appropriate price point.
user_name:
X2183ZAtomk
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our first trip to Japan. Everyone at the Four Seasons helped to make our trip to Tokyo very enjoyable. The staff even helped us book train tickets! They provided a snack everyday of fruits and desserts. I can't say enough good things!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfect location in the heart of Ginza. Absolutely perfect, great and personalised services combined with the Japanese refinement. A relatively small hotel which make it very friendly with a great services and a wonderful breakfast with a great urban view over the city.Greta help from the bellboy with the lug gages to go to Tokyo station which is 5 minutes walk

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As others have said, this hotel has a great location, beautiful rooms, and incredibly helpful staff. An example of the latter - we needed to reserve a half-dozen different train tickets off of our JR pass. The bellman "Mike" walked us to the station, and he made sure the ticket agent knew exactly what we needed, even securing us the 'Mount Fuji View" side of the train. He then bought a local ticket so that he could walk us to the platform to make sure we got on the right train! All of their restaurant recommendations worked out wonderfully as well.Don't be put off by the location being next to the station - it's actually an excellent neighborhood (right next to Ginza) with a ton of restaurants and shops. Moreover, the train station proximity makes it perfect for day tripping, and the "Hato" tour bus pickup is a block away. Helpful tip #1: Tokyo Station is a huge maze, and you arrive from the airport in the sub-sub-sub basement. You're looking for the "Yaesu South" exit (you'll see Yaesu Center first - follow that until you see Yaesu South). Go out that exit and take a right. The hotel is in the second building you'll pass.Helpful tip #2: If you're a light breakfast person, there's a Starbucks right across the street down the alley with the Yaesu Book Center on the corner.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Loved the beauty of this hotel and its restaurant. Service staff at the restaurant learned who you were were and greeted you warmly each day you returned. Food quality was over the top! They even prepared a very beautiful breakfast cookie platter for my son when I mentioned his birthday was the next day. Located right next to train station- you do not even have to go outside!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spend 4 nights to the four seasons we had a very good experienceFirst the emplacement of the hotel is very good when you need to move in Tokyo it is just close to the subway and train stationStaff of the hotel is perfect, they really take care of every request. I shared with the hotel that it was a special occasion for us and they had some beautiful attention with us The concierge was extremely in assisting us on our restaurant booking - they got us a table the day we asked to kyubey restaurant!Room are spacious, well equipped but the decoration is a little bit standard you have the impression to be in a business hotelBreakfast at the roof top is perfect, lot of choices very tastyI definitely recommend it !!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We just returned from a business/pleasure trip to Tokyo. My wife accompanied me as she was celebrating a "significant" birthday and she loves Japan. We stayed at my "home" residence in Tokyo, the Four Seasons Hotel at Marunouchi. While there we were contacted by Paul Gardian who is the Director, Guest Recognition, Operations for the Four Seasons Corporate organization in Toronto who happened to be in Tokyo. He graciously offered to meet us for lunch or a dinner to introduce himself as I am a member of their Elite Guest program. I graciously declined and told him that we had a busy schedule due to my wife's special birthday itinerary. We took a side trip to Hakone on the weekend to play some golf and enjoy some cool air which is hard to find in Tokyo. When we returned to the Four Seasons we were greeted with a surprise Happy Birthday Party arranged by Paul and the hotel staff! It was a lot of fun, very thoughtful and over the top service!! Cake, Champagne, Cards and a complimentary Spa Visit!!Where do you find that kind of service today?!?! The only place I will stay while in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Everything about this hotel is excellent - the rooms, the food, and of course, the service provided by the staff. Your whole visit is pampered and luxurious, from the exquisite Japanese sweets in your room everyday to having someone meet you on the train platform to escort you to the hotel (Even if you've been to Tokyo before, the train station is enormous and the signs to the correct exit are confusing).We selected the hotel for its location next to Tokyo station not only for the convenience of taking the Shinkansen but also for shopping and restaurants. Character Street in the station itself is a fun place for kids to look around and is classic kawaii culture. Nearby are the Marunouchi and Ginza shopping areas - the latter is more Western luxury retailers while the former has more Japanese brands. We also ate in the restaurants at the top of Daimaru department store or grabbed a bento dinner in the food hall (just like the locals on their way home) if the kids were too tired to go out. We had an Executive suite with a connecting king bedded room for our family. My kids are too old now to want to share even a large bed, and it would have been nice if they offered double beds in the connecting room (we were aware of this at the time of booking). This is one aspect of the Four Seasons chain I've noticed at even the resort properties. Although they have wonderful amenities for (younger) kids, the bed configuration is always less than ideal. For that price and paying for a second room each kid should get a real bed, not a rollaway. Unlike some of Tokyo's luxury hotels, this is in a low rise building. The Four Seasons type of traveler may be bothered by the noise of the trains going by, but this wasn't a problem for us.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I cannot praise this hotel enough. The service here was beyond my expectations on every level.Being picked up from Tokyo station on arrival was wonderful but on our return to Tokyo at the end of the trip and even though we were staying elsewhere to be close to Narita airport, wonderful Mike met us at the platform once again to take us to return a mobile device we had rented.This was most appreciated. The room with two queen beds was spacious and well appointed. The location, close to Tokyo station and Ginza, was perfect and I would choose to stay nowhere else. We didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on that but there are plenty of other dining options in the vicinity.It's a small hotel with under 60 rooms so far more intimate than you'd expect. There's also a small onsen which we tried. First class and I can't recommend enough.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel. Clean, well appointed rooms with all the standard amenities expected of a four seasons. Spa was wonderful with multiple offerings. Restaurant was good if a bit on the high end of the price point for Tokyo (the wine list is particularly steep). The escort to/from Tokyo station is a great touch.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: great experience! perfect location - right by all the shopping/business areas and close to the Rail station, amazing service. Concierge was very helpful and responsive. I can recommend to anyone. One of the best Four Seasons hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The first time we ever had a hotel staff pick us up and then drop us off all the way to train platform. Enjoyed every staff's warm welcomes and smiles. Concierge was efficient and helpful. Location worked perfectly for us because we wanted somewhere quiet from all the actions. Even though we can get anything and everything we needed in the basement floors, street level seemed quiet and less congested. I recommend this hotel is you are also looking for something on a smaller scale with less traffic.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Just back to home last night and I must extend my special thanks to the Concierge staff who accompanied my family to the NEX Tokyo Station platform upon our departure. Everything looked smooth on our departure and the staff settled us at the platform and said goodbye to us. However, we saw him coming back in a hurry and told us that the NEX to Narita Airport was out of service due to sudden accident ahead. From that moment, the young guy kept on searching which is the best way to send us to airport. He brought us together with the baggages to the Airport Shuttle Bus Station upstairs but it has departed already. Although we finally need to take the most expensive taxi in the world to airport in order to ensure to catch up the flight, we really appreciated for his utmost effort to solve the problem. By the way, highly appreciated the service in Motif as all staff are attentive and it is so glad that you can see their smiling face every morning.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staff and service were wonderful - top notch.Room size, amenities, technology, etc. were excellent.Gym/Fitness room was adequately furnished and much better than similar hotels in Tokyo.Enjoyed the "small" size of the hotelPerfect location next Tokyo station. Breakfast buffet was lacking in selection and was missing many items seen at breakfast buffets in similar Tokyo hotels.I stayed under the AMEX Fine Hotels & Resort program and felt the benefits offered by the Four Seasons were lacking. Would have preferred a $100 property credit instead of a spa credit especially as the Four Seasons has no executive type lounge.Overall, except for the above two items, a wonderful stay and very much appreciated the excellent service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The things that are great about this hotel include large rooms (Deluxe Premier rooms are corner rooms > 700 square feet with two queen-size beds); nice bathrooms (walk-in shower and soaking tub); comfortable beds; location (a block away from the Yaesu entrance of Tokyo Station, so easy to subway and trains as well as the many casual eating options in the Station); friendly and extremely helpful staff. The prices are somewhat, but really not insanely high, and in keeping with the quality of the hotel. Shopping around online for the best price is worth it. It's definitely on the smaller side (< 100 rooms), so it kind of has a bit of a boutique-y hotel feel. Overall, a very nice stay!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very beautiful rooms with lovely bathtubs overlooking the railroad station. That might not sound wonderful, but it is truly unique. The spa with an Onsen bath,the bar and dining room with excellent and most generous portions for Tokyo is what made me fall in love with this hotel. But most of all the service was unbelievable. I was greeted at the rail road station and escorted to the hotel by a very friendly hotel employee who knew my name and also carried my suit case.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
