review_body: Great locationTailor made serviceHuge roomNice boutique hotelPerfect place for the shopping lover and for the first time in Tokyo.The bellboy are amazing and very helpfull.The place is next to the Tokyo station and you do need any taxi to move in town.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A rather small hotel - but perfect. Rooms spacious comfortable, switched and air-con easy to use (not confusing like so many hotels) and staff absolutely delightful. When we checked out, a young man from the check-out desk escorted us and our luggage to Tokyo Station (very close by) and helped us by the appropriate tickets for train and monorail to Haneda Airport.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: 55 Suites located in the heart of Tokyo near Tokyo station Reception and restaurant located on the 7th floor Big room well furnished and very well designed The staff is really professional and goes beyond all expectations High rate but u know what are you paying for !
user_name:
Roger Georges D
Noumea, New Caledonia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel was amazing from the moment we booked. They even offered to meet us at the NEX train to help us with our bags. The family rooms are big and nicely layed out. Even with two queen beds and a roll away. Easy walk to Ginza and the train station is under the hotel so you can get anywhere. The team go out of the way to help you without asking. We borrowed the bikes and went for a ride. Before we even asked someone came out with water to take with us and directions for the best way to get to the bike track. When we checked out someone came with us to the train station booked our seats and took us to the platform. Again nothing was a problem (not that we had to ask for much!) We would go out of our way to stay at the Four Seasons again. We have stayed in a lot of luxury hotels but the service here is second to none.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Beautiful hotel in a great location with sincere, generous and warm service. We love the thoughtful items in the rooms from the usual toiletries to Nespresso coffee pods and machine, Evian waters and the turn down service. However, the most memorable moment for our daughters was coming back after an adventurous day to find cookies, fruits and other treats waiting in the room for them with a very thoughtful personalised note. Our daughters want to live there! One of our favourite hotel and we will certainly return with family and friends. Thank you Four Seasons Tokyo for a wonderful stay!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Concierge was extremely helpful, reservation staff efficient and responsive, rooms immaculate and well appointed, Good decor throughout, great 24 hour gym/fitness center, excellent breakfast serving all tastes, superb location. Greeting service at station is a plus. Top management truly at the top of its game. Great stay. We were two adults and one child of 12. Third stay at this hotel though quite familiar with Four Seasons hotels throughout the world. Thanks again to the team.
user_name:
Ran_Mad
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very convenient location just outside of Tokyo Station, and walking distance to Otemachi and Ginza. This hotel is very quiet and the service is excellent. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone who is looking for a 5 star hotel in Tokyo.The hotel offer "Platform greeting and send-off at Tokyo Station". The staff will come and greet at the train track (have to contact the hotel beforehand) and take your luggages to the hotel. No worries about finding the way either. This is very nice service.The buffet breakfast is highly recommended too. One of the nicest one we ever had.My husband and I enjoyed every minutes at this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Small hotel in a convenient location near Tokyo train station. Rooms are large for Tokyo. Small lobby, one restaurant (didn't try). Nice home base for outings in Tokyo or for day trips from nearby train station to outlying areas.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The stay in Four Seasons Tokyo was nothing we have experienced before in terms of impeccable, personalized service and was truly service from the heart. We were blown away including my 2 young children who felt special and pampered by the little toys in the bath tub and all the fine details with them in mind. We are very well travelled and always stay in luxury hotel but i must say this experience was one of the very best and very memorable for us as a family. Thank you sincerely.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is clean,quiet with excellent service. Staffs did provide all infos i needed. foods are great and not expensive. It is very convinense to travel to other areas in the country.Sound proof construction is vey good. The noise from trains were minimal.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons is usually "the best" and this experience was no different.Excellent location right next to Tokyo station with a great view. We were there as tourists in the middle of formal, downtown Tokyo. And believe me...we often looked the part. We were also still learning the formalities in Japan. I've been to hotels where all of this would have been frowned upon.But the staff was great--very friendly and helpful. They kept us from making several rookie mistakes with the trains and had plenty of tips for what to do in the area. It was an excellent experience and a testament to the excellence associated with this brand.You will not be disappointed with a stay here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I can't say that I have stayed at too many hotels where staff knows you by sight. Four Seasons brand is perhaps the only hotel group where the service staff can greet you by name. Four Seasons Tokyo at Marunouchi is not exception. Perfect service and excellent location. Situated next to Tokyo Station, you are minutes away from all that the station has on offer of shopping and dining. Marunouchi and Ginza are both walkable distance away so more shopping and dining.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Special thanks to all staff in Four Season for being so helpful and even got our baggages sent right to the train track.Room wise, abit old but clean. I would still prefer shangrila but service by four season is impeccable. Very much better than Shangrila. More personal attentive IMO. I've been staying in Shangrila for few times and first time with Four Season. I will still come back for its services.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The location of the hotel very close to the station is smart. It allows greater mobility through Tokyo, albeit located in the business district. Rooms were luxuriously huge compared to typical Japanese rooms. Large windows make it all the more spacious. There are a lot of excellent points about the hotel but the amount of anticipation they put in the guest experience is highly commendable. There were fresh fruits in the rooms and in the hallways. MORE AMAZINGLY, I went to Japan without gym clothes and was saddened that I couldn't go for a run. When I raised this, they had the complete gear readied - down to shoes for my size and a ponytail for my long hair! Jogging trail maps were also supplied. Very thoughtful!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location close to station, Ginza and the financial district. Quality hotel. Food choices a bit limited, but many restaurants nearby. Seems to have lost some of its Japanese character, but great quality and perfect for a business trip. Possibly less so for a vacation - it is not a resort!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is probably my favourite hotel ever. The staff were great. the rooms huge. It wasn't cheap. Well worth it. The bar upstairs was amazing, the Saki splendid. A beautiful hotel. Would love to go again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great business hotel in very good central location. Good food, good breakfast room, nice bar and good location. Very nice and large bathrooms and clean and good service. A good place in Tokyo, recommendable. I stayed there for 2 nights and would always come back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Smacked right at the Tokyo station. So if you are planning to take JR line especially the Shinkansen during your stay, this is right where it is. Underground shopping at the Tokyo station, Daimaru is right there, Ginza is just next door, you can never ask for more.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A perfect Hotel with great location and big rooms. Tokyo station is steps away and the famous Ginza street is a 5 minutes walk from the hotel. Everything was perfect except for the house keeping as it is done so late in the afternoon.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Ok, first I have to be honest. While clean, comfortable and understatedly luxurious, the hard product isn't the most cutting edge in Tokyo. But having said that, the soft product, i.e. the service, is faultless. Where do I begin? I did some shopping on Amazon Japan before I arrived, and one of the whiskies that I ordered came in a box with the drawing of a wine bottle printed on it. The hotel saw that, and proactively emailed to ask if I would like to have it stored in the hotel's wine chiller. As others have reported, guests are addressed by name. How they manage to remember all the guests, I really have no idea. The breakfast buffet offers a decent spread of hot and cold food, but only small quantities -- refreshed frequently -- are displayed at any one time, so that the food remains fresh and the presentation doesn't appear too "mass". After I checked out, I stood outside while my colleague went to retrieve the car from the car park (the ticket was misplaced so it took quite long) and the concierge, an older Japanese gentleman, came out to the driveway after 15 mins to check if everything was alright. The Japanese are famously hospitable people, but this hotel brings that up to another level.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very Nice Hotel, perfect location and good staff. Concierge is very helpful. Rooms are big and very new. One block to Tokyo Station where you can take subway lines. Lobby is not so big but it is not a big issue. I recommend this hotel for sure.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Highly recommend this hotel. Great service, great location, terrific restaurant/bar. Very good experience. We had our 10 year old with us and they treated him like a king. Business or pleasure this hotel really measures up.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at the Four seasons Tokyo ,for two days. Upon arrival I had a dental emergency which required immediate visit to a dentist clinic. Luckily enough I came across Midori San , a member of the reception staff. Midori took upon herself to make sure I will see a dentist right away, while escorting me to the clinic assisting by translation , supporting and not leaving until it was behind me. One expects a known high level service once picking the Four Seasons chain, but Midori San took it one level up by showing a big heart and warmness. No doubt she made me again a loyal guest at the Four Seasons in my future trips. Thanks to Midori and her colleagues ,you get the feeling of being at home-away from home. We stayed in a superb room at the 6th floor, very comfortable and nice to be in. Breakfast buffet is very nice and tasty, large variety presented in a pleasant way. We recommend the Four Seasons Tokyo from the bottom of our hearts.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Every detail was perfect, they take the time that you can fell like home, amazing ubication very near to Tokyo station just a few steps and 3 blocks away form ginza district, and the complex is really nice it seems like a new hotel. If I have the chance to return to Tokyo difenetly I will stay again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great hotel, superb location and many small size advantages. I have experience in many business hotels in the heart of Tokyo that don´t deserve criticism thanks to the traditional japanese hospitality, but Four Seasons at Marunouchi is definitely my first choice.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here several nights during our first trip to Japan. It's a fantastic hotel in a central location. Service is absolutely world class with small little extras that make it easier for first time visitors.The hotel sits next to Tokyo Station, so it has very easy access to/from the Narita Express airport train, the Shinkansen high speed lines, and the Tokyo subway system. It's also just a short walk to the Ginza district.The rooms are spacious and well appointed, just as you would expect from the Four Seasons. Bathrooms were modern, complete with a Japanese electric toilet/bidet. It's a different experience if you're an American, but hard to go back once you've tried it.For us, service was top notch. One thing this hotel does which we really appreciated was they will escort you from your train to the hotel when you arrive in town. Likewise, they will take you to your train when you leave. Tokyo Station is absolutely huge and can be very hard to navigate, so this was one less thing to worry about. They will also help you send your bags on ahead if you're on a multi-city vacation (you still pay for the delivery). Apparently, no one in Japan travels with their luggage on the trains, and we could see why. There literally isn't enough time to futz around with your bags in the short amount of time the trains stop at a platform.Restaurant at the top of the hotel was very good. Again, service was great. We stayed at the hotel for the 1st 3 days of our trip, and then again on the last day a week later. They still remembered our preferences (and our names) when we got back.Spa was pretty great. There was a warm/hot soaking pool as well as sauna and steam. Everything done in a dark granite.Great stay and definitely one of our favorites.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location, next to the bullet train station, small boutique hotel but thats why I love it, almost feels like exclusive country club but not snobby and after dealing with busy Tokyo street all day, when you coming back its like your own quiet oasis. Everybody on staff are beyond attentive, patiently answer every question and ready to help in any way possible and like in every SFH after you check in everyone knows your name and I still don't know how they do it. Our room was very spacious and comfortable I felt immediately at home, everything was over the top - very clean, enough bathroom amenities for our entire stay ( I don't know why I bother to bring my own ), great breakfast buffet but you can also order anything you wish and they will make it for you, try any type of eggs - they cook it to perfection. This is the only hotel I would stay again in Tokyo!
user_name:
Mysza2016
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As a girls retreat, we spent a week at the FS Tokyo at Marunouchi. First of all, the staff at the hotel is top notch. When we decided to take a day trip to Yokohama, Mike at Guest Services, walked us throughout Tokyo Station and waited for us to board the train to ensure we were on the right train. (Tokyo Station is a maze and the personal guide was greatly appreciated...and necessary!) Azusa in the Spa was a great therapist and I had one of the best massages ever. The spa is very small, so be sure to book your treatments in advance. There is a small onsen in the hotel, too, which was a nice way to relax after long days of walking. Emi and Shoko at Concierge worked tirelessly to make arrangements for our day trips to Yokohama and night sight seeing tours, many dining reservations, and transportation. We loved finding surprise treats for us in our guest room when we returned to the hotel. And love the fresh pajamas the hotel provides for each guest. The location is walking distance to the Imperial Palace and Ginza and has an interior stairway direct into Tokyo Station.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I reserved through Amex Fine Hotels for 1 night stay and arrived at the hotel on Sunday around 2 PM. Amex Fine Hotels program provides guaranteed noon checkin but this hotel did not have my room ready. While this is quite expected and normal at 3 or 4 star hotel, I expected better than the bait and switch marketing from Four Seasons as they consistently offer good service compared to some others. Early guaranteed checkin as promised was important to me as the rest of my plans for the day depended on it. What redeemed them in my eyes was the concierge was able to get me a reservation at one of the sushi restaurants I wanted via email before I arrived. Also when I was leaving, the bellhop was amazing as he walked all the way on to the train platform at Tokyo Station next door with my luggage. That was great. Had breakfast and it was quite decent. They had 3 different kinds of homemade jams that was the highlight. When I had adjust my schedule to accommodate the hotel, then its no longer characteristic of a luxury hotel.
user_name:
trippynappy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed at Four seasons at Marunouchi for a week in October 2015. Very comfortable and enjoyed my stay. Modern furnishings, best location right near Tokyo station and Ginza district. Really enjoyed breakfast at the top floor restaurant overlooking the Tokyo train station and downtown.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very unfriendly and not accommodating at all ...hopte something get changed....I happen to travel a lot for my (usually)business and have very good memory of Four Seasons Hotels including the magical Four Seasons in Guangzhou China.This particular experience I had in Marunouchi topped my 20 years experiences of being a guest in a hotels of all sort...as one of the most difficult and frustrating.Trust me, this is the first time I ever leave a bad comments on internet of any purchase I made.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Good hotel with excellent service Rooms are a good size modern and the hotel is well located Only disadvantage is no airport bus stop at the hotel Staff were really helpful - some of the best service you could hope forDidn't try the restaurant so cant comment on food but it looked good

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was a gem! A small boutique hotel in a great location. The customer service was over the top - outstanding! They knew my name as I walked to check in for the first time. They escorted us personally to the train station to buy our tickets to ensure we purchased the correct options. They walked with me to a drug store one evening when I needed some medicine. Every one of the staff knew our names and took the time to read our passports - in doing so, they surprised us with in-room dining - a piece of cake for my husbands birthday. The view from the 7th floor bar is great - you can watch the trains come and go from the station - very pretty at night. Everything about this place was top notch.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Location: Central - close to train station and major shopping. Service: Impeccable – we were escorted by the hotel staff directly to the train station to be shown which train we needed to take. Facilities: Small gym….Amenities: Grossly overpriced breakfast. Design: Comfortable and hi-tech, as most Asian hotels. General: staying back at the hotel during 2016 Japan visit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Super Modern, crisp, chic hotel right next to Tokyo Station. A little different than other Four Seasons given that it's a little smaller than most Four Seasons, but nonetheless, very memorable. As always, the service is impeccable and like no other. We had arranged a car service to pick us up from the airport and our flight was delayed by almost one day. I alerted the hotel that we would be late. The driver ended up waiting on a different level than where we exited (not his fault). We couldn't find him and figured he had left so we caught a cab. When I told the front desk the driver was not there, they couldn't have been more apologetic. You'd think they were going to fly me to back to Tokyo so they had a chance to "make it up" to me, even though it was just bad timing and no one's fault. In Four Seasons fashion, they escorted us personally ON to our trains to Kyoto later in our trip, and when we returned to Tokyo at a different hotel later in our stay, they insisted on arranging and paying for a transfer to Narita for all four of us. Wow. Four Seasons, I wish you were located everywhere. Great hotel overall. Probably ideal for business travelers and as a starting point in Tokyo close to the rail station if you headed elsewhere in Japan.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We took the express from Haneda to metro station, and then taxi to hotel. The hotel is a great location. Hotel is very nice. Huge awesome nice modern bathroom. The most comfortable bed I have ever slept. As for the staff, the service was friendly and helpful. No language barrier.Small smoking area outside the hotel entrance. Convenience store and vending machines across the street.The lobby is small with nothing much there except the staff. Stayed June 2014. We stayed in the most basic cheapest room (which still meticulously awesome) and took advantage of a promotion staying 4 nights with one of the four nights free. had a king bed, and they brought in a smaller bed for my son, which was a very comfortable solo small single bed.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo is quite small - only 57 rooms. As a result there is not the same array of services that can be found at much larger hotels (e.g. pool, multiple restaurants, grand lobby). However, the location (next to Tokyo Station) is excellent for exploring the city via the metro or JR lines or for travelling outside of Tokyo via the Shinkansen (bullet train). The hotel is probably most obviously designed for business people, however it is also very welcoming to children and has a range of excellent room configurations for families, which can be difficult to accomodate in Tokyo. The hotel has strollers available, but the restaurant is limited to those 12 years old and above - so eating out is recommended.The rooms are very well appointed and generously sized, especially by big city standards. But As ever with Four Seasons, the best aspect of the hotel is the service. It is impeccable. All of the staff were extremely friendly and accomodating. In particular the chief concierge (Akhil) and one of the deputy concierges (Shoko) are a tremendous credit to the hotel and will go out of their way to assist.One small area for improvement is the free wifi, which is limited to 2 devices per room. That is fine for someone travelling alone on business, but if there's more than one person in the room, up to 5 devices really need to be allowed for the free wifi to be meaningful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were looking for a boutique hotel to spend a week with my family and it was an excellent choice: the location it was the most convient for family tourism and the service was just exceptional. We really felt comfortable!!! The view of the Tokyo Station entrance was spectacular and my son loved it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Although I had travelled to Tokyo as a teenager, this was our first trip to Tokyo as a family with 3 young children. We chose the hotel for its room size (they were one of a few to allow 3 single beds in the interconnecting room) and its proximity to Tokyo Station. It was also our first ski trip to Japan as we had plans to travel from Tokyo to Hakuba by bullet train. And all this during the busy Japan New Year period (we were travelling to and from Hakuba in late Dec 2015 to early January)!We knew that we would find language and cultural barriers, and that we would need help to get us seamlessly from city to ski fields without getting lost at one of the world's busiest train stations. The concierge consistently met our expectations, from accompanying us to pre-purchase the shinkansen tickets, to waiting with us on the departing platform, to sending our ski gear in advance by courier to our Hakuba accommodation.During our 5 nights' stay at the Four Seasons, we enjoyed a delightful degustation dinner on Christmas day, and their elegant buffet breakfast every morning. Their staff also helped us book a sensational tempura degustation style lunch at tenichi in the Sony building in nearby Ginza. We got tips for travelling to the Maraikan museum to see the Asimo robot demonstration, for taking a walk to the Fish markets, and for shopping in the Ginza and Shinjuku area. There were hotel bikes available to ride to the Imperial Gardens but we chose to get there by foot and encountered many locals jogging around the Gardens on a sunny winter day. The late opening hours of the Four Seasons day spa meant that the helpful staff there could accommodate mums who wish to enjoy a relaxing massage after putting the kids to bed!The Four Seasons staff helped to make our first trip to Tokyo a success and we now have the confidence to return to Japan for another ski trip.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This boutique Four Seasons is located a few steps away from the Marinouchi Station. Since the moment you arrive, you feel a wave of happiness and service from the employees. Misato, if I'm not mistaken did our check in, she was so nice and willing to help, she remembered us daily by last name.We wanted to buy a few paintings that had a Kanji on them, we didn't find any, however the Front Desk had it done for us! And they look amazing at our house! Every morning I had cherries waiting for me at the table... I mean that is recognition and true 5 star service. On our last day we weren't to sure which train to catch to go back to the Aiport, the bellman (which was a very nice young lady) took us there! She literally waited until the train left!!! Wow!!!!We can't wait to go back to this property!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Just returned from a 2 night stay at the Four Seasons. Small hotel with great staff and service. Arrived on the Narita Express from airport. Easy walk to the hotel from Tokyo station. Was unable to check in early but they quickly escorted us to the Spa so we could shower and change before heading off to Easter Mass. Staff was very helpful and cheerful.  Finally made it back to our room after mass and shopping, beautiful room with 2 queen beds with a view overlooking the train tracks. My youngest son could watch the Shinkansen go by all day. The toilet was a japanese bidet type toilet with heated seats. I did not want to leave :). Shower had great pressure and hot water. The mens spa was small with nice showers, hot showers and a nice onsen type hot water tub. Very relaxing. Overall a great stay, walking distance to great shopping, imperial palace and Tokyo Station .

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: One of the warmest and most welcoming (top 3 ever) i have ever had was at this hotel. This is my first time staying at this hotel in Tokyo. Spacious rooms, very well equipped gym to beat the jet lag, and unsolicited (but much appreciated by me) offers from desk staff to help me navigate the train station when I asked about the bullet train.Breakfast at roof top restaurant to die for, including the succulent homemade marmlades. Three minor downsides: hotel is not a high-rise so the Tokyo skyline view I have accustomed to in other hotels doesn't exist. This hotel is not on drop off route from Narita bus service. Taking a car after 14 hour plane ride is not ideal. Lastly, bus is off-set from the main road and most taxi drivers default to dropping off the road and not turn into the street unless you tell them to turn left and drive up to the front door. All minor issues, and I would definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Bottom line - this hotel is worth every penny! Elegantly understated and bespoke; its small size, in my opinion, is a huge advantage - you do not feel lost compared to the crowds of guests at other hotels. Rooms are large, modern, well-appointed and impeccably clean. Its strategic position (just a block away from the outer perimeter of the Imperial Palace gardens; you can actually walk into Tokyo Station without setting foot on the street - use internal Pacific Plaza elevator; 3 blocks away from Ginza and all the shop-till-you-drop places and eateries) is within convenient distance to attractions and transportation. But what makes it truly a must-stay place in Tokyo is its spectacular staff: everyone, without exception, made us feel like family. Our children were thrilled with treats and small gifts from the staff. Concierge was wonderful in arranging last-minute dinner reservations, called the place ahead to let them know we were coming and provided us with a map and directions on how to get there. We were greeted by the staff at the train platform upon arrival, and helped with Shinkansen ticket purchase and send-off upon check-out. They even walked us and our children to assorted toy stores to help us find the coveted Pokémon cards. A huge "Domo Arigato Gozaimasu" to everyone at the Four Seasons Tokyo - we are looking forward to future visits.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel was rather expensive, but that's par for the course in Japan. This hotel was amazing. The service was spectacular; they even picked us up and dropped us off at the train platform! The bar upstairs and spa were great. The gym was clean and had all the machines I'd want with a great gym to boot! I will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent personalised service is one of the hallmark of four seasons. Location next to tokyo station is very convenient if you plan to do day trip by shinkansen to various sightseeing areas or simply to roam the city of tokyo by JR or subway. We booked the "Trains for Tots" package in Deluxe Premier Room (700 SQF) with two Queen Beds, perfect for family of 4 with two small childrens (7yo & 5yo). First, there are not so many luxury hotel that has two Queen Beds in tokyo to begin with. Second, the big sets of train toy on track kept my kids occupied while in the room. The constant view of trains coming in and out of tokyo station next to the hotel made them even more excited to play the train toys. Third, hotel is relatively small so the level of personalised service can be kept extremely high, this becomes evident compared to much bigger Peninsula Tokyo's for example.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed 4 nights in January - right next to the train station, staff from the hotel were waiting at the Shinkansen platform when we arrived. A short walk to the hotel. The room was spacious and well appointed. The hotel breakfast and bar was great.But it's the location that just can't be beaten - a short walk to Ginza, v close to the train station. Local eating and shopping options all good.Hotel concierge also great for helping out with restaurant bookings.We couldn't have asked for more - in the event that we find ourselves in Tokyo again this would absolutely be our #1 choice. (This was our 4th trip to Tokyo in the last 8 years.......)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Good location, wonderful breakfast, very good consierge. I was very irritated to hear that free wi-fi is for two devices per room. I was travelling with my two teenagers so we had 6 devices. Hotel did not flex on this. They also communicated to us several times that. Breakfast is included for everybody in the room when in fact it was not.It was included for two. Otherwise good service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Good hotel but it felt very much like a business hotel. We were only there for two nights so it suited us but had I been there for longer it may have felt a bit constraining.Good concierge that helped book local restaurants up to the 3 star level.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I had a wonderful stay at the FS Marunouchi whilst traveling for work. The hotel was under a bit of construction, so the restaurant set up was a bit odd- however the food was great and the service/hospitality was 5-stars. They did the best they could with the inconvenience. Room Service was timely and felt like a little luxury- the brought a toaster to my room and toasted my bread on the spot so it was warm and as fresh as possible! Impressive. I also NEVER saw one maid while I was there, not even in the hallway. They were desecrate which I loved, so the whole stay felt very quiet and private. Definitely centered around business travelers with all the complimentary toiletries and pajamas. I don't speak much Japanese, so the concierge was extremely helpful in assisting me with taxis and getting around. I appreciate these little things so much. I just cannot say enough nice things about the staff. They have a spa which smelled lovely, though I was unable to experience it. I think the only thing missing is a rooftop restaurant/bar or something fabulous like that. Overall this was a convenient hotel near my office as well as the Tokyo Station. Beautiful rooms, traditional feeling, highly recommend.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The concierge staff were extremely helpful in setting a reservation at a 3 Michelin Starred restaurant for me. We communicated via email weeks before my stay and they were always responsive. Knowing it was our honeymoon the hotel staff also threw in a few surprises for us that really made our stay special. It was definitely worth every penny, the level of customer service was unparalleled. We wish we could afford to stay there longer!
user_name:
Calvin N
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I stayed here together for a week recently when I tagged along on one of his business trips (he stays here regularly). The location is great for both business and tourism. The Narita Express train brings you directly from the airport to Tokyo station, right next to the hotel. The Shinkansen and other trains to outlying areas originate there as well. And local subways are very close, too. The hotel is an easy walk to the Imperial Palace grounds, with their beautiful (and public) East Garden. The hotel staff provide absolutely exemplary service, and my husband tells me they have done so consistently during every one of his stays. As a non-Japanese speaking first time visitor to Japan, I relied much more heavily on the concierge, doormen, and other hotel staff than I normally do when I travel. They arranged a tour guide for a couple of days at my request, asked for feedback on the (excellent) guide, gave me clear and helpful instructions for days I went sightseeing on my own, made restaurant reservations, hailed cabs and gave directions in Japanese to the drivers (since cab drivers as a rule don't speak English), and always made sure when I went out that I had a card with the hotel name and location written in Japanese to give to cabbies if needed to get back. When we left on the Shinkansen, a hotel staff member even helped us walk our bags to the station and buy a ticket.I ate breakfast most mornings at the hotel restaurant, and have to say how very good it was. I don't usually care for other hotel's breakfast buffets because the food is often not terribly good or fresh. But the buffet here was completely different. Really fresh, really good, great variety, and the staff were very gracious. Love the hot croissants! And a colleague on the same trip reports that items ordered off the menu are equally good, especially the French toast.Even the housekeeper who covered our room did an impressive job. He was English-speaking, unobtrusively took care of the room around our unpredictable jet-lagged sleep schedule, and kept things absolutely spotless and orderly.The management and staff of this hotel should give lessons at other hotels. They are an important reason my first trip to Tokyo was so relaxing and enjoyable, and I'm looking forward to coming back.
user_name:
Susan L
New Paltz, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Where do I begin with? I love absolutely EVERYTHING about it! (Except the price, but I still bite the bullet and indulge... 3 times, and counting...) We have always been Four Seasons fans. Have stayed in Four Seasons Hampshire(UK), Merrakech, Hong Kong, etc.. All had wonderful experience. When we decided to take my daughter(3 yo at that time) to Tokyo(Disneyland) for the first time in June 2014, we stayed in Four Seasons Marunouchi for 4 nights. Everything was perfect. So when we planned a family reunion trip to celebrate my father-in-law's birthday in Tokyo in June 2015, we decided to stay there again. This time with 6 adults and 3 kids stayed in 3 rooms. Our family members fly to Tokyo from 3 different countries(different arrival times). Lots of logistic needs to figure out : 3 young kids are all in different age and have different needs. They asked our needs before we arrived and prepared everything in each room perfectly. I called it a "Four Seasons moment". (Most Four Seasons I stayed, I experienced different and wonderful Four Seasons moments.) This stay, I forgot to bring my 4 yo daughter's shampoo and lotion. I recalled they provided a very good toiletries at previous stay. So I asked if they can provide kids amenity kit. At first, they wasn't sure what I need. But very soon, there were 5 hotel staff appeared at my door with hands full of any kids amenity I could possibly think of: baby bath tub, step stool, towels, bath toy, sponge, dipper disposal bin, toiletries, etc.. for me to choose from. They wanted to make sure I got everything I need. Isn't that a great service? The reason drove me to write this review even it was few months ago is that recently we stayed in another 5-star hotel( I admit it was the price factor to drive me tried another brand) in Hibiya/Yurakucho area, we found ourselves missed Four Seasons every minute. We couldn't help comparing everything to Four Seasons's gold standard. We realised that once we stayed here, it is very difficult to stay anywhere else. Next time around, I think I will still choose to bite the bullet and stay at Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: All rooms in the Hotel are located below the 6th floor. We, standing by the window in the City View room, are almost completely seen from the street when the drape nad lace is fully opned.Room facilities are simple and luxurious and comfortable.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This property remains our overall favorite of city hotels for service and facilities. Management and staff truly know what five-star service is. Their pro-active and "yes we can" attitude makes the difference here. Since our visit last year, the hotel has opened its renovated restaurant/lounge space, now with sweeping views of the Marunouchi area and the Tokyo train station with its Shinkansen and local trains. Motif has become a popular place for power breakfasts and lunches, and on weekends, locals love it for brunch. At night, the lounge area features cocktails and live music, perfect to view the city's lights. One niggle about the renovated space is the step up/down into/out of the restaurant and lounge. It can be very dangerous if you don't notice it! Thankfully, staff will warn you of it!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We as a family stayed here in early February. We chose the Four Seasons as it was located right next to Tokyo station, as we were planning to take the Shinkansen to Kyoto. And we were overwhelmed by the level of service. Although it's in a busy stretch yet you never feel the crowd. The room was of a high standard and their breakfast is great. The buffet doesn't feel like one because the service is great. Quiet and private.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel has a great location, next to Tokyo Station.Rooms are comfortable and spacious. They provide with Pajamas.Service is awesome.Special thanks to Tatsuya and Emi from Guest Relations. They were amazing!Love the property and their breakfast!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I came to Tokyo to celebrate his 50th. I spent alot of time researching the best hotels and decided on the Four Seasons for their impeccable service.They did not disappoint and lived up to their level of excellence in every way. So many wonderful touches and surprises during our 3 night stay. Great location. Very convenient- next to Tokyo Station. Take the complimentary platform greeting service especially when arriving- no stress! The breakfast buffet was beautiful and amazing for fresh and delicious offerings. Hotel is small and very quiet- only 7 floors with a well- equipped gym and spa! A superb stay that truly enhanced our birthday weekend in Tokyo. If you are researching hotels in Tokyo book the Four Seasons. You will love it! Happy travels!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here while at a conference in Tokyo. Hotel is well located close to public transport. Staff are very friendly and accommodating, nice lounge and restaurant. The rooms a big and spacious, the rooms are automated to suit the guest. I had a corner room with a great view of the city. I am never disappointed with a four seasons hotel, classy, clean and the service in Tokyo was exceptional.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very nice location near the train station, the hotel has great rooms and a very good service. Of course it lacks a bit of atmosphere but apart from that it is very nice. Price is hight, tough, and you have to pay addidionally for breakfast.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This small, intimate hotel in the heart of the business district was the perfect choice for our family of 4 kids for the last leg of our month-long Japan trip. Tired from the flight, the kids were immediately given toys (from giant apples in the lobby!) and personalised books and snacks up in the room as well as the usual kids amenities. A WiiU was brought up quickly at the request of our 10-year old- another reason why our kids love the FS group. The boys were thrilled to see views of the Shinkansen right outside their windows and loved watching all the trains go by. The rooms were all spacious and comfortable with huge windows overlooking the trains and avenue. Wonderful beds as is the norm in FS. Location was great for shopping at nearby Ginza (and the big toy store), and Tokyo station next door gave easy access to the rest of the city. Only wish they would offer free wifi for unlimited devices as 2 in each room does not quite cut it these days. Service excellent and the food good, would definitely stay here again next time we are in Tokyo with the children.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We went with our two young boys & the staff were absolutely wonderful helping us with restaurant reservations, pick & drop offs and train platform for Narita Express, recommending places to see. Breakfasts was amazing, the fluffiest omelettes ever eaten & the restaurant was beautifully fitted out with fantastic views. Central to Ginza shopping district and right next door to Tokyo Central Station. I can't recommend this hotel enough, 11 out of 10 for our family.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I can't rate this hotel high enough. The staff throughout the hotel (restaurant, concierge, room service, reception) are warm and welcoming will happily assist you with anything from train bookings to postage or restaurant recommendations. We have stayed here a few times with the Plarail package which is perfect for children. The hotel overlooks Tokyo Station which is within walking distance so it is extremely easy to get anywhere in Japan from here. They will even assist you with your luggage to and from the station. Some may not like overlooking the train tracks but for our small boys it was very exciting to watch the trains coming and going. Our room was stocked with a train set for the boys to play with, children's toiletries, a nappy bin, and even a step stool in the bathroom. The boys even received small gifts when they arrived. We were always greeted with a smile and nothing was ever too much trouble. The rooms are modern and extremely clean. The service in the restaurant was fantastic and they always brought my morning coffee just as I like it. If you are coming to Tokyo with children, this is the most child-friendly and welcoming hotel I have stayed in.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfect location & service! Very helpful staff especially the pick-up at the platform of the Narita Express train platform upon arrival & accompany down all the way with our luggage to the train platform after checkout.Generous room size in Tokyo standard.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our big trip of the year and also to celebrate a big birthday. It couldn't have gotten off to a better start than a stay at the four seasons Tokyo.We were finding it difficult to decide between various hotels and in the end the superlative service one expects from a four seasons hotel made up our minds.We were not disappointed. The service is legendary right from check in to being accompanied all the way to the train at the station after checkout.The porter even offered to help us on our return from Kyoto though we would only be transiting Tokyo station.The location is very convenient and we managed to walk to many of the attractions and easily avail ourselves of the efficient underground.The hotel staff made it a point of marking our special occasion with champagne and cake.The food at the restaurant was excellent and we couldn't find fault with absolutely anything.We are waiting to go back when they open a FS at Kyoto for a two city stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The best Four Seasons in the world! We arrived early before our room was ready and had booked massages to help with jet lag. Most amazing massages ever, followed by a soak in the onsen. We stayed in a lovely suite where we were given kimonos and slippers. Room service breakfast each morning was an excellent way to start the day. The concierge arranged tickets for us to see a Sumo tournament, which was a real treat. The bar/restaurant at the top of the hotel was a lot of fun - the bartenders got into an old-fashioned making contest after finding out it was my husband's favourite drink. All in all, a great stay and cannot wait to return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff was super helpful and friendly. We purchased our shinkansen tickets through the concierge, and we had a lot of luggage heading to our next destination and they helped us get onto the train and navigate Tokyo station upon check out. They also helped us two days later after we checked out by calling us a big taxi to Haneda airport after we returned to Tokyo.Our kids loved it so much they asked to stay there indefinitely as their "home". Lots of great attention to detail like child proofing, personalized kids' gifts/snacks, and loads of smiles. I don't generally give reviews but this experience was so good it propelled me to write one!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our experience at the Fours Seasons was utterly delightful. The staff were extremely helpful and hospitable to our family. Our children (6 and 3) were treated as guests in their own right by the staff, and were looked after wonderfully - nothing was too much trouble! The hotel is located right next to Tokyo station and is extremely convenient for getting around Tokyo by subway.Our room had a great view of the comings and goings from Tokyo station but was beautifully quiet.Breakfast was extremely good, with familiar items (pancakes!) for our children.In room dining was acceptable - the sushi and sashimi were particularly good. There are many restaurants nearby with a large variety of cuisines. The staff and concierge were exceedingly helpful and made our short break in Tokyo feel marvellous. Our children made us make a note of the room number so that we can request it again and they are keen for us to visit again soon!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: When we first got off the NEX from Tokyo airport, the hotel staff were there to welcome us and carry our bags all the way from the train station to the hotel in the 92 degree August heat in white suits. When we got to the hotel, we were offered welcome drinks and snacks. They promptly checked us in and we were off to our room. When we got to our room, there was a nice entry hallway leading into the bedroom. After we got settled in ( about 30 minutes ), one of the hotel employees came and offered us a wide array of snacks again like when we first came in. But instead of making us choose, they gave us the entire basket! The hotel itself is very nice, and my only complaint would be that there weren't very many staff. There were only 4 total for our entire stay. We stayed in a standard room.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service and hotel were just amazing! I could not believe how friendly the staff were!The beds were also excellent, very soft and comfortable. All the amenities were in working order, and dimable lights in the bathroom made for a relaxing shower time.All services were just impeccable! I will definitely be staying again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I am a big fan of Four Seasons chain but this hotel exceeded all my expectations.The service was perfection; the staff was professional, efficient and courteous; the food is one of the best I ever had and the suite we stayed in was spectacular.I love the airport pick up service provided by the hotel. The best and fastest way to get to the city from the airport is by train but I was worried about finding my way around and handling my luggage but the experience was seamless. I was greeted at the airport by an English speaking hotel employee who helped me with the luggage and with buying a train ticket. Once in Tokyo station, a hotel employee was waiting for me by the train car and escorted me to the hotel.We enjoyed our stay very much.
user_name:
Sasha S
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This Hotel was amazing...Very nice room, wonderful view and excellent customer service. The Concierge was extremely helpful and very good recommendation for restaurant. After diner outside, the Bar was a very good option.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent customer service and convenient location next to Tokyo Station. Staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Concierge was more than helpful with dining reservations. Staff walked over to the train station with us to assist us in purchasing tickets and luggage assistance to the platform. Wonderful view at the restaurant, even though the selection was limited. Will definitely stay here again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Absolutely amazing property. Second time in two years visiting Tokyo and 100% needed to stay again at FS Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi.From the reservation process all the way to check out, was perfect. Very good location, minutes from Tokyo station and 100's of food options.Concierge team so helpful... even before we checked in, they planned so many dinners for us.... excellent communication.We did not eat at the hotel restaurant, but did order room service several times... always arrived hot and delicious!Truly love this hotel.... can't wait to return to Tokyo and our favourite hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Location: is right next to the tokyo station, so you are connected to everything.Service: excelent service. For my birthday, they sent me a bday cake and took a picture; at check out they gave me a printed copy of that picture. They also, at check out, guided us to the tokyo terminal and they even carried our luggages throughout the tokyo station all they way around until we arrived to the shinkansen. At last, whenever we requested something in a matter of seconds they delivered it.Bar/restaurant. Nice restaurant with very good cocktails drinks.Room: spacious room with a beautiful bathroom. The room is modern and includes a 3d tv with glasses. Tips: they exchange money for a good rate. They also have very good english.Concierge explains very well and provides good information.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff and property were above and beyond our expectations. From our greeter at the train station, to the concierge, we were beyond impressed with the level of attention to detail, service and genuine appreciation of their guests.5 stars across the board.
user_name:
Ryan G
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We have stayed at many FS around the world, but during our stay at FS Tokyo in November, we were quite impressed with the level of refinement and perfection. The best metaphor for FS Tokyo would be a Bonsai tree. It is small in size, but every detail is precise and deliberate. And most of all, it is aesthetically pleasing!We split our stay at FS Tokyo into two segments: 2 nights at the start of our Japan excursion AND five nights afterward. Over the course of the stay, we got to know the team quite well. The two individuals that stood out most for us were Mr. Kishi (Hotel Manager) and Ms. Kumoda (Guest Relations Manager). Both have exceeded our expectations by going above and beyond in ensuring FS Tokyo was our home in Japan! We started to email Mr. Kishi to customize a package for over two months. And thanks to his leadership, we experienced the best FS location! With Ms. Kumoda, we considered her our guardian angel at the hotel. You do not notice her, but you are always aware of her smiling presence. In one instance, I mentioned that I wanted some latkas instead of hash browns for breakfast, not thinking too much of it...but guess what I had the next day for breakfast….LATKAS! Turns out, she googled the recipe, past it to the kitchen and asked them to have it ready for me. Other concrete examples that the FS Tokyo team had exceeded our expectations are as follows:***Concierge Team***They gave us great tips in getting the much prized vests at the Tsukiji Market to see the tuna auction. They were also our personal “trip-advisors” for things to do, places to eat, and where to shop. All their recommendations have exceeded our expectations!***Front Desk Team***Despite being well seasoned travellers, we were overwhelmed by the subways and underground shopping paths. Thankfully, we were able to rely on the front desk team to: 1). Escorted us all the way to the counter that rented us the mobile wifi (must have for all visitors! and was highly recommended by the concierge team). And on route back to the hotel, she took us to the subway station to get me a subway card and assisted with loading it with some money (I was grateful as that machine was only in Japanese)2). Escorted us to exchange our JR pass to actual tickets, and took the initiative to assist / help us to book our tickets to Kyoto and Hiroshima. And to ensure we don’t get lost or missed our train, he showed us to the platform and waited until the train arrive. Helped us with our luggages and waved goodbye from the platform as our train was leaving. ***Spa****By the end of the excursion I was in need of a pick-me-up. I took advantage of their Annivesary Total care facial and body treatment. It was, by far, one of THE best facial and body treatment I have ever gotten. As a testiment, I was literally glowing for days! ***F&B Team***Due to dietary restriction, the F&B team was quite watchful of the requirements. But in one occasion during the breakfast buffet, where I took some food that I thought it was safe...when I arrived back to my table, one of the team member apologized for the interruption and told me that the kitchen had modified the recipe and as such, it was unsafe for me to eat it. He assured me that he already informed the kitchen to prepare a dish that will meet my dietary needs.  Conclusion. FS Tokyo is a city hotel. It is small in size. It does not have a swimming pool. But they have won the hearts of two well travelled and particular people! A job well done FS Tokyo. Planning an excuse to see the team again soon.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Tokyo is a mind expanding experience and staying at the Four Seasons Hotel made it a very enjoyable and memorable one for us. It was more expensive than what we normally outlay but on many levels it was well worth the extra money The location was excellent as it is beside the mammoth Tokyo Railway station thus providing easy access to any of the many areas of the huge city and we could also walk to the Imoerial Palace and its gardens as well as the Ginza. The hotel overall has an understated but luxurious and intimate atmosphere. Our room was very spacious with every thing necessary for comfort and enjoyment. Good design and top quality was the standard and it was scrupulously clean. We had a terrific view including of the bullet trains coming and going and it gave a great sense of being in an exciting city but it was quiet and serene. We ate a buffet breakfast every morning, again with a fantastic view, At first we thought it a tad pricey but found it such good quality food and service that we returned every day and we found it satisfied us for most of the day. The thing that really impressed us the most though was the care and attention we received from the staff. Without exception they were warm, friendly, personable and willing to go to great trouble to make our stay a pleasant experience. Someone accompanied us to purchase our ticket for our on journey to Kyoto and on our departure took us to catch our bullet train. They said they would meet us on our return and accompany us through the enormous Tokyo Station to our train to Hakone even though we were not returning to the Four Seasons Hotel. When we did not appear on the train (we had inadvertently booked tickets for the wrong day)they followed up to see what had happened, contacted us and then met us the following day. I mean, this is REAL customer service and dedication. We can highly recommend the Tokyo Four Seasons hotel as a wonderful place to stay and enjoy the excitement and fun of Tokyo

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here for 5 nights straight and then another night after spendinga week in Kyoto. The location right by the Tokyo station is impeccable. I was worried that it'd be noisy from street traffic, which is constant arounnd this part, but the rooms are surprisingly quiet. I suspect it's partly because of the new Pacific Century Plaza building, even the ventilation system that plagues most hotels is dead quiet. The hotel is minimalist in style and tastefully done. Love the room, not sure if the "deluxe king room" is any different, and there's definitely enough for the two of us to stretch the legs after "Ginbura" (a walk through Ginza). Young and friendly English-speaking front desk staff & concierge - better to take advice they offer, esp. when it comes to what to eat. We went to Tsukiji market before 3AM local time, and they helped us catch a cab. Lots of little things require attention for vacation travellers like us - for example, how to catch the Shinkansen to Kyoto - the Tokyo Station is highly disorienting esp. during rush hour; having the hotel staff walk us through till we boarded the train was one of the most reassuring experience we had during this visit. Also very helpful is having the concierge call the restaurants to make reservation. The more exclusive restaurants (esp. Sukiyabashi Jiro) requires advance booking the month before your dinner date. All in all Tokyo has so much to offer to different types of travellers. This Four Seasons is a small boutique hotel (not a resort) that offers Four Seasons comfort without fail (reminds me of Fairmont Gold, other Four Seasons hotels). For first time travellers from N. America to Tokyo via Narita Airport, esp. if you arrive during your normal sleeping time but rush hour in Japan, use the hotel's airport pick up service. It would save a lot of aggravation if you want to go by the Narita Express to the Tokyo station. In retrospect, I wish I had asked the hotel staff to pick us up, even though that service seemed a bit pricey.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Well-situated to explore Ginza/Chiyoda by foot and with easy access to Tokyo Station (and, thus, anywhere in the city), the rooms are quite nice with lovely baths and showers, a selection of pillows, and screens that keep out the noise and lights of the city. We were also close enough to the Imperial Palace to jog around the grounds every morning.What really sets the Four Seasons apart is the staff. Anyone working there went out of their way to be helpful in whatever manner we needed with smiles on their faces, regardless of the request.The food is excellent, but expensive (as you would expect). The views of Tokyo Station from the restaurant and bar are interesting and worth a viewing.I have never understood why high end hotels require people to pay for wifi, but they do. So expect to pay if you need to connect with more than 2 devices.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We only spent one night, but the service certainly left a great impression. We left an extra suitcase with them when we departed for Kyoto, which they kindly stored for us. Upon our return, they had an bell person meet us at the train station, with the suitcase, who then escorted us to a cab since we were spending the next three nights at the Mandarin. That was absolutely brilliant, so easy, and kind. Plus, their meet and great service upon our first arrival was so easy for jet lagged travelers. Next time we're in Tokyo, we'll be staying at the Four Seasons for their service, and for the great shopping in Ginza.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We made our reservation online. They said free dinner was included,they didn't state clearly how many dinners, We stayed there for three nights and turned out that we only had one free dinner for the first night we stayed. The hotel should stated that clearly in advance within the website, so we could make our plans beforehand,

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I usually stay at the Peninsula in Tokyo for business trips but always wanted to try out the Four Seasons in Tokyo. Was very excited when I finally booked it in.Overall - was incredibly disappointed with the stay and definitely wouldn't recommend anyone going back until the property is properly completely renovated.The property lacked the grandeur of a Four Seasons - the lobby was tiny and understaffed. I arrived late in the evening (11pm) and there was two staff manning the entire lobby and had to wheel in my luggage myself.The rooms were very dated and small in comparison to the price. The corridor leading into my room was narrow and claustrophobic, the curtain looked more like a wrinkly blanket, and worst of all, the bathroom was full of MOLD (unbelievable until you see the attached pictures!). Room amenities were lacking compared to other hotels in Japan - TV was very small, internet was 1000+JPY a day, iron was outdated, only an electric kettle for coffee and the temperature/fan controls were old school analog dials!The location was right in the heart of Tokyo (right above Tokyo Station), but unfortunately on the 'wrong' side of Tokyo Station (esp. from the Narita Express). To get to the hotel, you actually have to cut all the way through the station, through another building, walk outside and then into the Four Seasons. Because of the close proximity to the train station, right outside my window was the rail tracks - you'll hear train noises late into the night, and right early in the morning. To make matters worse, when the trains stopped, maintenance works came out to perform noisy repairs on the tracks (see pictures).The staff was uninspired and understaffed. Many times returning at night, the only staff in the lobby had his/her head buried in the computer and didn't bother to greet the returning guests. Cleaning was definitely an issue (given the mold all over the bathroom). But all throughout the property, you could tell that the management of the property lacked the attention to detail you'd expect from a Four Seasons. For example, the shower only had Shampoo and Conditioner - no shower gel! The shower gel was placed beside the bath tub and no one had thought that perhaps someone would want to use shower gel in the shower.There were also numerous little things wrong with the property, and simply not enough reason to return. It's a shame as the hotel standards in Tokyo are always sky high and you'd expect the Four Seasons to put in much better effort than this.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: They took an extra mile to meet my impromptu request!! At the time of my arrival, I was on the tight schedule for my next appointment, but I needed the Japanese traditional condolence envelope with a specific calligraphy pen. While I was trying run to get them from the nearby store, the concierge had them prepared for me!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Simply the best place to stay in Tokyo near the Ginza. Convenient to Tokyo station, shopping, dining. It's quiet, secluded and exclusive in nature. Excellent, friendly genuine service. The remodeled dining room and bar truly have added to the ambiance for this boutique hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Location is fantastic for Narita/Haneda arrivals. A quick and painless change at Shimbashi (no dragging luggage up stairs) equals a journey at around 30-35 minutes. You take the Yaesu South Exit and turn right to walk 1-2 minutes to the hotel entrance, past a McDonald's and some coin lockers. Upon arriving at Tokyo Station, you might see some stairs but there is always a ramp as well, try looking for this if you are travelling with heavy luggage. From Narita, there is a limousine bus that drops you off at Tokyo Station bus stop 7, which is a short 1 minute stroll from the hotel.Staff, overall, was very polite. They sent around some Halloween cookies to all the rooms on Oct. 31 which was a nice touch. Communication with the hotel was prompt and efficient. The concierge also helped us make a few dinner reservations prior to our arrival. Just one hiccup - I was returning to the hotel after lunch and was stopped at the hotel entrance with an unfriendly look and a "How can I help you?". Perhaps she didn't believe that I was staying there. However, this was a one-off incident and I must commend the other staff at the reception and the gym for being very kind and welcoming.The room is not sound proof and we unfortunately were assigned to a room at the back, facing the train tracks. Earplugs, however, solved this problem very effectively. I would like to warmly thank one of the housekeeping staff who went to a lot of trouble to ensure that I had pillows with the right "firmness". Gym is small but well equipped. Shower facilities were excellent and welcome after a workout.We had breakfast once in the restaurant and was quite happy with it. Didn't opt for the buffet as we like a light start and loved the different types of homemade marmalade that came with our continental breakfast. Am a little surprised with the limited buffet offering.I personally disliked the small and cramped lobby as it gave it more of an soulless office feel but I suppose you don't spend much time there. I have stayed in the Four Seasons San Francisco and Macau and found this branch to be a little lacking in terms of atmosphere. Overall though, the location is very convenient for public transport and airport transfers.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Small hotel very conveniently located adjacent to the train station (with easy access from Narita Airport and right next to the bullet train if you want to travel to Kyoto) and a short nice walk to the restaurants and shops in the Ginza district. Large rooms and everything very well fitted.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I visited the Four Seasons in October of 2015. The hotel is wonderful but it's the staff which make the hotel truly amazing. Ricky made every meal warm and friendly. We looked forward to breakfast just to see him again. Tetsuya took the time to escort us all the way to our outbound train to Kyoto, even to the point of buying a ticket so he could come into the train and help us with our bags. Yuki not only recommended a nice restaurant for ramen, but also took us there and helped us order our meals, taking into consideration our dietary restrictions. As a regular business traveller to Asia and a Four Seasons veteran, I would say the staff here went above and beyond the call of duty.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: 1 night fly in, early morning arrival, relaxed in spa, full day logistics organised for me, best sleep on 1 full week Asian trip, and outstanding team on staff! This has become my no 1 hotel choice in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed at this hotel twice in October 2015, on first arrival in Japan and on our return to Tokyo.Staff are all proficient & friendly, meeting the train and carrying your luggage to the hotel is a nice touch.Rooms are comfortable, large and well appointed. The bar & restaurant are stylish and the staff attentive.Concierge arranged for our bags to be shipped to Kyoto, plus stored our luggage until it was time to leave.Location is excellent, easy walking to the Palace, Ginza etc with a huge selection of restaurants in the area.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Pros: +Great service. Concierge was extremely helpful securing high demand restaurant reservations. Hotel offers greeting and escort train service. Hotel held our bags while we were on a 3 day trip to Kyoto.+Great location. 5-10 minute walk to Imperial Palace, Ginza, Metro & JR lines, and Ramen Street. Narita Express (53 min to NRT) and Nozomi Shinkansen are very easy to and from the hotel.+Comfortable rooms. Separate shower/tub inside spacious bathroom.Cons:-Only two devices with no charge on Wi-Fi. I suppose I shouldn't complain since there is no charge, but it was a bit of a pain being locked to only my iPad inside the room since my friend used her device separately.I normally stay in Shinjuku, but on a whim decided to give this hotel a try and was very pleased with the stay. The reception and concierge are very helpful and prompt. Hotel breakfast was relaxing watching the morning trains enter and depart Tokyo station below.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A very well located hotel. Walking distance to some nice shopping area and extremely close to the Tokyo train station. The rooms are very comfortable and well decorated with lots of space. I recommend it...

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: For travellers, we’re expected we’d stay in a hotel that’s conveniently located in the heart of the city we’re travelling (here I just took 5 min from Tokyo Station and 10 min to Ginza) , that it’d a tranquil and spacious bedroom (the room we’d at FS Tokyo even has two queen beds) with comfy bed linens and mattress (by comfy I mean a 10" thick mattress, not a 6” ‘firm' bed pad)We all take it for granted that a hotel will have alternative choice of pillows, should the one in the room is either too soft or too hard?But in realty how many hotels we’d come across with a pillow menu (here at FS Tokyo they have a menu of two pages and they even have Tempur!)We all had experience on our first night at the new room, struggling to sort out which light is which and where the hack the master light is but after all we’ve got to climb down from bed to turn off the floor lamp? Here at FS Tokyo all ceiling lights are controlled by just ONE button, and the curtains and drapes are all electronically controlled-with all these controls handily located at the side panel of the bedside table without having need to completely stretch my arm? There’s also a night light in the bathroom, a light that is at the dimmest lux but serve the purpose in a completely black-out room.All these ‘taken for granted’ requirement indeed in realty many hotel chain would not want to spend money to deliver the service to ensure their prices be competitive in the market. Four Seasons is not one of them. They give traveller quality and services and that explains why it comes in a price. (They still even insist to employ cleaners to do the cleaning of the hotel’s external window)Four Seasons brand also makes it an advantage for them to recruit better people from the industry (in every country as well). All the staffs I’d had met here they all speak fluent English (have he/she be a local that speaks fluent English or is a foreign staff speaks fluent English and Japanese) and are ‘sensible' smart people. This is especially important that when unlucky things happened, for example, my wife lost her passport, I didn’t have to repeatedly explaining the story. They can start right away to call the shops that I’d visited and do the talking. When the staffs knew we finally tracked down my wife lost passport (it'd been sent to a local Police station by a good Samaritan), they’re cheered out in happiness.Although FS Tokyo at Marunouchi is small with only less than 60 guest rooms and just one F&B outlet, it's superb location, their attention of details, gourmet food quality and excellent happy staffs (if they’re not happy, how could they make us happy?) make it impeccable and impressive.The only thing I could comment is the hotel smoking policy at their bar area (though it’s really the Government to be blamed for not imposing stringent indoor non-smoking policy), of which the bar locates just outside the non-smoking restaurant, Motif. But the area where smoking is allowed is close to the lift lobby so you could imagine how ‘stuffy’ would that be.But it shouldn’t be that difficult for the management to turn the FS Tokyo into a smoke-free hotel since there is already another luxurious hotel Tokyo Andaz is completely smoke free. I’m very look forward the next time I visit Tokyo FS I can enjoy the night view at the bar with a cold Asahi or Kirin.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Attentive helpful staff enabled us to plan our trip and sightseeing. Concierge booked us day trips and gave us restaurant recommendations and booked us an English speaking guide for the day. Without the help of concierge we would not have had such an enjoyable or memorable trip.Great location near Tokyo station and Kyobashi so great for Metro and Train.Room was spacious and incredibly comfortable beds which were greatly appreciated after hours of walking!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our second stay at this hotel and we were once again very impressed by the level of service we received. The staff were very professional yet friendly, greeting us by name, and making our kids feel very special. The location is convenient- close to transport, shops and food. The view from the room was great. . Up close to the trains providing us with hours of entertainment. We were given a battery operated train set with tracks to play with in the room, which the kids enjoyed. Upon request, a microwave, high chair and bed rails were provided for the duration of our stay, making travelling with young children so much easier.Will definitely be back!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed here for five days this past August, and I must say the experience was lovely... Everything you would expect from a Four Seasons.The bar staff, Erina in particular, were excellent. My favorite thing about this hotel was probably the peaceful retreat that I was able to find in such a bustling city, in the form of the bar. It's elevated on something like the 14th floor and it has a very peaceful and sophisticated atmosphere. A wonderful domestic and foreign scotch selection as well, for the scotch fans out there.Rooms were excellent, as expected, location was great, and an overall wonderful experience. If I'm ever back in Tokyo and have the funds, this will be the first place I check for availability!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: You must read this review in context of being rated as a five star hotel in a City with other options for luxury accomodations and charging over $1,000/night! The furnishings in the room seem cheap and more suited for a business hotel room. The guest rooms are located on the lower floors so there are no views. Our dirty sheets were not changed ( I know this from lipstick marks), and the reception staff seemed too accustomed to unhappy guests. the spa area was cramped and dingy.  The bathrooms have a single sink - and is poorly laid out - no wonder there are no photos of the bathrooms on the Hotel's website. There is no pool - I thought a pre-quisite for 5star rating. The manager realized were we're less than satisfied and offered us massages - but although we appreciated the gesture we still felt compelled to warn other travelers.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I found the staff in this hotel both professional and considerate.
