Elderly people need extra care, and their consideration, from the room arrangement to the careful introduction to the facilities of the gym (which are great!), and even to the details of the meals and so on, makes our trip more comfortable that expected. My parents and I had a great time there.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The FS is based directly adjacent to Tokyo Station and we found it a perfect place from which to explore Tokyo.The hotel is beautiful and we had a lovely room on the 4th floor with a great view of the station. As you would expect from a FS hotel the amenities and bedding are of the highest standard. The room was also very large and spacious. having a 3D TV was also a nice touch.The best part of the hotel is the staff. We could not have been better looked after. From the team who met us at the train station (on two occasions), the front desk who ensured we had everything we needed and finally to the concierge who booked us some fantastic restaurants and tickets to the sumo tournament.The staff were all very efficient but everything was done with a smile and you felt that they genuinely wanted to make sure you had the best stay possible.The hotel has a beautiful bar and restaurant on the 7th floor as well as a nice spa (including a modern onsen).The hotel has a selection of bikes which you can borrow for free to explore the city. We came to Tokyo to celebrate our wedding anniversary and the best choice we made was booking the four seasons.If you are looking for a big hotel (with pool) then this will not be for you. However, if you are looking for a small boutique property with a spa, restaurant, bar and above all exceptional service then this will be perfect for you.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had a wonderful time at the Four seasons. The service was perfect and the staff were just beautiful and so kind and helpful. We wish to particularly thank Yuki Shibata and Takahiro who carried our very heavy luggage and would not let us help! They were both extremely polite, friendly, happy and dedicated and we wished we could take them with us!! The champagne gift for our wedding anniversary was such a lovely gesture, flowers and chocolates too all in silver service and white linen! Best mattress and best pillows we have had in our many overseas hotel stays. Great location, staff collected us from Tokyo station with all our luggage and escorted us to the platform for the Narita Express upon our departure. They also purchased our train tickets and checked we had all our documents before we left. Thank you so much Four Seasons Tokyo, we will definitely be back. xo

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very strange four seasons hotel to me, very small building without swimming poor and the club lounge, even we are staying at the suite room. But the room inside is big enough with a funny JR station view. the bed for me is super soft, I feel very painful with my back every day. So bad I can't sleep very well here. Only one restaurant here to have our breakfast, breakfast area is like a club floor to me, breakfast is very weak compare to all other four seasons branches, for me is really just a 3 stars standard, coffee was okay, very disappointed, I stayed here 7 nights but I only had one time breakfast. Many taxi driver doesn't know how to go, you have to tell them next to Pacific Century Place. One things they have 5 stars hotel standard is their staffs, very friendly, especially the guy name : Takahiro San, he help us a lot with a big smile every single day, actually Im not sure if they have enough staff in the hotel, haha, why only him? house keeping-send us extra towels, room services-send us food, bell boy-call taxi for us, talk to the kids about DVD, recommend places for us, even send us to the station, keep standing at the station and say good bye until you are gone. He is amazing, I think this is the best experience staying in this hotel, he make us always think about him. He is the best hotel staff we would never forgot. Anyway, I won't come back and recommend to my friends although the room is nice, sorry to say that, I have to be very honestly here, because it is not really 5 stars hotel to me, also overpriced!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We recently stayed here with our two young children. The staff are amazing & the rooms beautifully appointed. We arrived very early and they had a breakfast tray ready for our arrival. Little touches for the kids - robes, chocolate cookies and kid centred toiletries - all made the stay smooth & enjoyable. The most comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Well done!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is my favorite hotel in the world. The location is perfect as it is a short walk from the central train station. The lobby area is very small with just a few seats but I don't spend much time in the lobby any way. As you exit the elevator, there is fresh fruit on the table to help yourself to. The rooms are well designed with floor to ceiling windows. This gives the entire room a much more open feel. The bath area is clean with high end bath products (as expected from Four Seasons). The best part though are the beds. They are by far the most comfortable mattresses I have slept on in a hotel. The restaurants in the hotel offer great food as well. The spa area is nice but could use an upgrade. This hotel does not have a pool. I have stayed here on 3 separate occasions now and always choose this hotel as my first choice when in town.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: If you are used to the Four Seasons resorts or even FS city hotels, this one is just ok. The service was the same as any 3/4 star hotels. We came to Tokyo from the Four Seasons in Shanghai and it was a disappointment. The front desk personnel were almost bothered that we were checking in. The finishes in the room were not the level you expect and the service was just missing when you spend $900+/night. Nothing special and many other better hotels in the 5 star cat.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I are frequent travelers but we have never experienced the professionalism, care and support that we received during our stay at the Four Seasons at Marunouchi.My wife unfortunately went into premature labour on the third night of our stay at 0300. This was obviously an incredibly traumatic and frightening time for us but the staff rose to the task, acting as our "Tokyo family". They ensured that my wife received the best medical care that she could, while at the same time assisting enormously with the logistics of reorganising our holiday. Future bookings were seamlessly cancelled, our stay was generously extended and everyday challenges (setting up local telecommunications, assistance finding local long term accommodation) were addressed efficiently and effortlessly.More than just providing wonderful 5 star accommodation in the heart of Tokyo, the hotel was literally our travel agent, real estate agent, IT and logistics support, medical triage service and psychological support.All of this culminated in the delivery of a healthy - if very premature - 2.1kg baby boy.All of the staff were wonderful from the front door on arrival to the staff at MOTIF on the top floor: the personalised concierge services were simply the best that I have ever experienced; the front desk staff were calm, composed and efficient. Bell boys personally walked me the 15 minutes to the local SIM card store to pick up our SIM cards concerned we would get lost in Tokyo station.The greatest thanks however must go to Emi, the guest relations manager, who must be the most singularly impressive hotel employee that I have ever met. Despite the fact that her shift had already finished on the night that my wife went into labour, she accompanied us at 3am to the local hospital to ensure that everything went smoothly. Despite the fact that she was helping us enormously, we repeatedly asked her to go home concerned that she had not slept for so long! However her sense of responsibility was so strong that she declined to leave until she felt the job was done, even to the point of accompanying us in the ambulance to a larger hospital. Finally - confident that we were in good hands - she went home at 8am, although prior to going home she organised a generous breakfast for me in my room. She has since visited us in the hospital on several occasions to ensure that she is going OK, she has brought flowers to her and has even provided advice about where to get baby clothes!This level of service really goes beyond anything that we have experienced or even heard of. I say that the staff was like a family this week, but I am not sure my family would be so helpful and so efficient!In a world where personalised service is frequently espoused but rarely delivered, our stay at the Four Seasons in Tokyo was a revelation. It transformed what could have been one of the most difficult weeks of our lives into something that we could manage. Our experience at the hotel redefines "hospitality" and has spoiled us for all future travels. That being said after the adventures of this "holiday" we may elect to stay at home a bit more in the future!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There is only one problem with the 4 seasons Tokyo, they will spoil you rotten with the most amazing service in the world. Mami, Misato and Shoko truly made Tokyo for us. Also we had an airport pickup and they are waiting for you the moment you get off the train and escort you to your room. If you want to take the subway they will take you to the train and buy a ticket to go on train so they can safely leave you on the correct line. There are nicer rooms at bigger properties in Tokyo like the peninsula and Conrad which we also visited or stayed at, but once you arrive you realize that although close to the four seasons they are a universe away. There is nothing like feeling at home so far away from it and I would never stay anywhere else but at the four seasons in Tokyo. Finally a special thank you to my buddy in the picture who was also amazing at making us feel at home. I made an account on trip advisor just to make this review because that is how special they made my visit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Large room by Tokyo standards with a well-appointed modern room with large bathroom. Technology worked well and enhanced internet speed was inexpensive. Very comfortable bed and very dark and quiet. Excellent customer service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Best hotel experience I have ever had. The concierge made my trip so easy and seamless, getting me all of my reservations prior to arrival. The room was an Oasis for us in Tokyo! It is large, with tons of space, a very luxurious bathroom, and all the comforts of home. The location is also very convenient, when you include the pickup from Tokyo Station and drop off as well. I just felt like I was being catered to at the highest level and I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Tokyo.
user_name:
Jcohen411
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great hotel next to the main station. The room was very large and nice. One of the best beds I have ever slept in. Offer a pickup and drop off service at the station. They brought us to the platform for the train to the airport.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great hotel with amazing service. Very friendly staff. Awesome location is couple minutes walk to train station. Breakfast is good. Rooms spacious and very comfortable. Nice neighborhood with good shopping nearby.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel offers one of the best concierge service available in the city, they would gladly help you to make arrangement, talk to your taxi driver, buy you a train ticket, book a restaurant, everything seems much easier with the help of the concierge.the room is spacious and offered a modern design, if you feel a bit lazy, just lay back in the hotel will surely rejuvenate your spirit. Location wise, the proximity with Tokyo station and the imperial palace offer a unique experience where you feel everything is within reach.Superb...

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Tranquil oasis steps from Tokyo Station. Large rooms with a fun view of the bullet trains coming and going, comfy beds, extensive pillow menu, quiet. But the best reason to stay here for us was the very nice and helpful staff. Tokyo is very confusing (even natives have trouble finding places), hours can be erratic, many small shops and restaurants speak little English. We worked a lot with Emi, but all the staff was tremendously helpful. They wrote up a note about my food allergies in Japanese that was a lifesaver, helped us get Shinkansen tickets during Obon, called ahead to places to translate for us— everything we needed and some things we didn’t know we needed. Thanks for making our stay in Tokyo awesome.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I am a luxury traveler and I believe I have stayed in my fair share of luxury hotels and yet the Four Seasons Tokyo stands out. From the amazing concierge that replied my emails within the hour before the stay even started to the faultlessly polite pick up service from the Shinkansen it just felt like a whole new level. I had 2 other girlfriends with me and the room we were assigned was more than spacious enough, the bathroom was amazing- I could probably eat sleep and live in there alone. If I could suggest one improvement it would be an additional dressing/make up table with mirror in the room itself. Lastly the final seduction came when our head hit the pillows and the fluffy duvets wrapped themselves around us. We were truly in love, it was what i'd imagine sleeping on clouds would feel like. See you soon Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: we stayed in march 2015 with kids. requested for a connecting room with extra bed. they were able to accomodate our request. upon our arrival, the hotel staff were already expecting us and check in was immediate. hotel staff led us to the room. our children were very excited to find their names on an activity sheet in their room, with welcome cookies. location - walking distance to train station. walking distance to daimaru department store. walking distance to sunrise tours. breakfast was excellent - with a variety of choices for family.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed twice at the Four Seasons Tokyo during August. We had interconencting rooms - our first stay was 7 days - the second was 3 days. The hotel itself - as others have mentioned is quite small and located on low floors. The top floor (F7) featured Restaurant / Bar / Fitness / Spa areas. After spending a month in Japan, I would say that the staff are by far the most well trained we have experienced in Japan. Everyone understands and speaks (some) english. Everyone is of course inspired by the Four Seasons service DNA - so that is always a joy. While the people at the hotel were certainly top notch, the hardware (facilities) were a bit dated in some areas. The rooms are huge for Tokyo standards, but the age shows, especially on the light wood tables, drawers, desks, etc, all look worn. The bathroom is the main attraction of the room, albeit with an odd design, it works very well. For some reason the bathroom doors do not lock. Food quality was excellent. Room service and associated services such as laundry was on par with the property. We did experience minor issues, but they were fixed in a timely manner - which is of course an important parameter. We also had a minor issue with wiring funds to the hotel - this is apparently not something they are used to. It took about 25 emails before we figured out that the hotel had sent us incorrect wire information with typos in them, which delayed payment by two weeks. This of course in turn resulted back and forth communication with banks, finance dept, etc etc. At the end of the day, it worked out. Room cleaning was adequate, we did observe a lot of dust and grime around the window area and metal fittings, but over all it was fine. We travel with FHR. They offered the standard complimentary breakfast which was honored also as room service (with a very relaxed limit) and SPA credit. Upgrades were unavailable during both stays. Over all we would certainly visit again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel's service was amazing. The hotel staff (Yuki) not only met my family at the train station and escorted us back to the station to purchase train tickets upon our departure, she even helped us transfer from the bullet train to the Narita express train when we returned to Tokyo 3 days after check-out. The staff also escorted my daughter to a Japanese character shop 20 minutes from the hotel. What service - so courteous and polite, going well beyond our expectations. The hotel's service created lasting memories for my family about the hotel, its staff, and Japanese culture more generally. Thank you!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: the service and the facility is superb. Erina and the staff in the Bar are amazingly attentive and gave us fantastic service during our stay. i can not say enough good things about this hotel. The beds are comfortable... the concierge gave us great recommendations for dinners out. we had breakfast included in our package and that was soooo fabulous. loved Tokyo and this hotel!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We've stayed at many hotels in Tokyo including the Ritz at Tokyo Midtown, and we definitely put this Four Seasons at the top of the list. It is a very small property, so if you are looking for big and flashy, this is not for you. But if you want discrete and luxurious, this place is great. As others have commented, there is really no lobby. They've wedged the reception desk in a little corner, but it all works. Our room was perfect. We were on a low floor, in the corner, with one wall facing the train tracks (which we requested). 2 entire walls were glass, and the room, especially for Tokyo standards, was quite large. We had two queens and a roll-away, and still felt we had plenty of space. Bathroom was large and well-appointed. We did have some slight train noise at night when we were sleeping and the room was very quiet, but it didn't bother us. Breakfast was very good--nice selection but very high quality, and not overwhelming. The concierge helped us with two dinner reservations. They were not the best picks in the world, but we think that they assumed since we were traveling with younger children that perhaps we wanted casual/fun vs. good/tasty. It was fine though. The spa is very small with just a small onsen and steam room, but it is enough for a short stay. Certainly if they had bigger onsen or a pool, this place would be perfect, but it is Tokyo after all. Service across the board was top notch. We arrived with 2 adult and our 3 children and they were kind enough to accommodate the 3 child even though their stated policy is a max of 4 people/room. We really appreciated their willingness to do this (I would not assume they will do this for you). We tried to borrow movies from the front desk to watch, but somehow we kept picking movies that weren't working, which was a bummer, but they were super apologetic. This property is right next to Tokyo station so a great location for traveling within Tokyo as well as taking day trips. We were able to get to Tsukiji fish market, Akihabara, and Asakusa easily via train/taxi, and also took a nice day trip to Kamakura out of Tokyo station. We would definitely stay at this property again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A perfect stay. Beautiful hotel, friendly service, immaculate room. Easy to find and near the train station. Quick and easy check-in. Spacious room with the most comfortable bed I've ever slept in! Large bathroom with an enormous soaking tub.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As you would expect from the Four Seasons this was an impeccable hotel, with great service and facilities. We had a corner room which was great for the views down the main street when you opened the blinds (automatic buttons of course!).Best thing was the location, just down the street from Tokyo station and within walking distance to the Palace and Ginza. The personalized pick-up service with the bellboy meeting us off the train from the airport right outside our carriage and negotiating us through the busy station was the most amazing thing too!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service at this hotel was superb. Being unfamiliar with Tokyo and the language, I was somewhat apprehensive about getting around. They met me at my train car and carried my luggage straight to my room and I even checked in in my room. The location is excellent for Tokyo station, Ginza, the Imperial Palace, and probably a lot of other things I didn't have time to see. The concierge knows the area and made some great reservations including a barber. My room included the breakfast buffet which was very good. It's not a big American style buffet but there is a lot of food and it is all good. They bring a hot croissant and fresh apple, and orange preserves to the table along with honey. I could make meal on this alone. I had a deluxe premier room which was more room than I needed. The closet is huge and the bathrooms are also large and nice. I can't think of anything I didn't like.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed in the 4 seasons for 4 nights during one of the warmest summers Japan has ever encountered. We arrived at 10 AM and could not get our room which was fine. We used the Spa facilities to our benefit to shower and clean up. Although the spa is small, it was excellent in their amenities. It had everything you needed. We finally checked in to our deluxe premier queen room which had a great view of the train station. Yaesu did a great job in briefing me what features the room had and if I needed anything else. All my requests such as a firmer bed, extra towels, and even an extra sofa chair in the room was taken care of. The concierge also was impeccable. Akhil, Misato, and Shoko were all great. They took care of all our restaurant reservations. What impressed me the most was that everyday in the morning they knew our itinerary so the map of the restaurant or place we were visiting were all printed out in Japanese with the name and telephone number for the taxis use. The bellboys spoke perfect English and even showed us down to the Tokyo Station shops and restaurants and taught us how to go back to the hotel. Jonathan spoke perfect English. Now the downsides to this hotel was the breakfast and housekeeping. We only ate at the hotel restaurant once in the morning and the buffet spread was of a low quality and the chefs didn't cook a simple omelette correctly. They only offered American items and even their fruit wasn't of a high quality. Japan has the best fruits in the world and their restaurant fruits were sour and not impressive at all. I much rather walk down to the train station and eat my breakfast at the amazing fruit cafe the bellboy's showed us to. the other subpar part was the housekeeping. We would come back to the hotel in the evening and glasses still half filled with water and dirty cutlery wasn't replaced or cleaned. Our clothes weren't folded and the room did not sparkle. I experienced impeccable room service in the four seasons HK so this was not acceptable. Other than this, I would still come back to stay at this hotel for the great location and impeccable service. visiting Japan for the first time can be tricky if you don't have an impeccable concierge team that can help you navigate you through the city. I only wish The F&B was better as sometimes it's nice to have a great meal in the hotel if you are tired. The other comment I want to make is about the WiFi. I read that only 2 devices are complimentary and I think this is absurd for a 5 star hotel. thankfully, I cleared this up with Yaesu on the first day and he waived all charges for additional devices. Four Seasons, please get rid of this ridiculous rule as most 5 star hotels around the world include unlimited devices for wifi. I am looking forward to visiting Tokyo again and staying back at the 4 seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Hotel near the Tokyo Station offers an exceptional experience. A small hotel (56 rooms) in a tall high rise, the hotel is beautifully designed with fine wood and stone surfaces. A large room with comfortable beds and all the modern conveniences is paired with wonderfully helpful staff. A real pleasure to stay here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This Four Seasons staff and location is exceptional! All the staff we came into contact with during our 7 day stay knew our name, and were so friendly and nice. The service is impeccable, from the front desk to room service to the restaurant and the management... I could go on but I am sure I got my point across. We travelled with our 9 month old, and the staff were tripping over themselves to make sure she was happy and we were comfortable. One of the best features of the hotel is the outstanding staff. They help us convert our Japan Rail Pass to usable passes and booked our tickets to Kyoto and back.If you want a stress free stay and enjoy being catered too... This Four Seasons should be your only choice. We will definitely stay here again. Thank you Mami, Mr. Takuya Kishi and all your staff for making our stay perfect.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel really doesn't need a great review from. It's an amazing place, but my recent stay at a Four Seasons hotel in Vancouver reminded me of how gracious these hotels can be. My visit some years ago in Tokyo absolutely floored me. When my colleague dropped me off at the front door, the man who greeted me asked me if I were Mr. Burghardt. The answer was yes, and from then on, every single employees of the hotel greeted me by name. I have absolutely no idea how they did it, but everyone -- maids, bar tenders, concierges -- everyone greeted me by name. I suppose the fact that the kitchen didn't know how to do "eggs over easy" should produce a blemish on their record, but even that episode produced a delightful outcome. So, 5 stars!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Honestly I don't usually write reviews but this time I had to. The service at the Four Seasons is impeccable. This was our third stay and we felt like family. Everybody knew us and took care of us. We were travelling with children and the hotel is so child friendly. They had numerous baby amenities ready for us in our room (guard rails on the bed, diaper genie, diapers, baby shampoo, baby lotion, kids bathrobes, rubber duckies, teddy bear sponge and welcome cookies with my daughter's name on it). Their concierge is amazing. They will help you arrange just about anything and have a lot of knowledge about the local area. Their rooms are spacious and very well appointed. The kids loved waking up and opening the blinds to see the bullet trains coming in every morning. The location is excellent as we could easily walk to Ginza or hop on a train right below us. I have stayed at many luxury hotels but this is the first time I felt like our experience was just about perfect! Thank you Mami, Akhil, Misato, Jonathan and all the FS Marunouchi staff ... You are the ones who perfect the Four Seasons experience :)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and had a great time. This was our first visit to Tokyo and we decided on the Four Seasons as we know from previous experiences, you can't go past them. They didn't disappoint. Friendly, courteous staff. Nothing too much trouble. Very good location in the Financial District and near to Ginza shopping area. The hotel is situated by the main rail station but you do not get disrupted by any noise.We stayed in Executive Suite which was spacious to accommodate the 3 of us. Everything you need.We would return most lunchtimes to take a break from the heat and relax and have sushi or various snacks from the lunch menu. Good choice of food. Would highly recommend this elegant Hotel. Exceptional service and staff. Well done Four Seasons!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Flawless visit. Incredibly helpful and welcoming staff in all areas of the hotel. From the moment we were met by bell staff at our train car in the train station ( called and provided that information to hotel) till the moment everything was loaded into the car for us when we left this was a perfect visit. Location is great, staff goes above and beyond to help you with anything you need. Rooms are large and elegant. Couldn't ask for anything more. Stayed here after 2+ weeks staying at Rosewood, Ritz and Peninsula hotels and was still impressed. Fantastic hotel and visit. Only change i would make would be to suggest not paying for upgraded wifi if you have more than 2 devices or want faster service.
user_name:
Lynn B
Clarksburg MD, United States

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Best service of any Four Seasons in all their hotel, exceptionalStaff treated us like royalty Walking distance from the JR Station and bullet train, so good starting point for day visits all over Japan and Mt Fuji

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons name needs no introduction. But sometimes one wonders what's behind the name. No need to look further than this property, which combines an understated elegance near the bustling Ginza district with stellar service for which the chain is justifiably well known. From the instant we checked in to the moment we took our leave - not incidentally at the front desk, but rather at the nearby train station as the staff of the hotel insisted someone walk our family of four to the station in order to ensure our Shinkansen tickets were purchased properly - the experience was nothing short of memorable. The spa offered a good array of new machines, while the shiatsu masseuse was expert at her craft. Breakfasts were particularly tasty, offering a wide range of cuisines (only nit to pick was a slight delay in omlette orders, which often were done close to the end of the rest of the meal). A particular favorite - and not something we've run across at many properties to date - were the in-room 3D TVs, complete with the requisite glasses, which almost caused a revolt from children who suddenly seemed less inclined to tour the city. A specific shout out to Yosuke, who walked us to the station and kindly made sure we had the right train tickets, and to Akhil Tiwari, whose smiling face at the concierge desk was a welcome site whether we had a pressing favor (one involved an emergency visit to the US Embassy, and he couldn't have been more calming or helpful) or simply coming back from a long day of walking and touring. Domo arigato!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons Tokyo was a great stay. They met us right on the train tracks, took all of our luggage and even stopped with me at the ticket counter at the station to buy the rest of our train tickets for our stay. Made sure we were sitting on the side of the train where we could see Mt Fuji. We had a nice big room with great view of the trains coming into the station. Plenty of room with big king bed and rollaway (for our 22 yo daughter). Large bathroom with great amenities. Concierges were very helpful with everything. Restaurant was under renovation so all meals were served in a smaller dining room with no windows (the only negative) but food and service there was excellent. Lots of western options for breakfast, but Japanese options as well. The night we stayed there when first arriving we had hoped to go somewhere else for dinner, but our flight out of Portland left late so by the time we were settled in and ready to get something to eat it was 9pm so we just ended up eating in hotel restaurant but had an excellent light dinner of salad and sashimi platter. Also, hubby is gluten-free, dairy free and egg free and they were extremely helpful with all his dietary restrictions – had gluten free bread and even ordered some almond milk for him for the next morning when they found out he couldn't drink dairy or soy milk. Excellent location in Ginza near tons of restaurants, shopping, bakeries and subways stops. Would definitely stay there again!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Had a very nice experience at the 4 seasons. Excellent location within walking distance to Tokyo station; only a 1 hr train ride from Narita so a great 1st stop while you get your bearings.Kind of a funky view of the railway station from the restaurant. Very delicious breakfast. Saw the buffet at lunch/dinner; didn't excite and we preferred to venture off into the night. The only critiques I would raise are: 1) the hallways are covered in carpeting, very nice carpeting, but which smells really bad. That is what happens when you choose carpeting; however they would do well to use, on a daily basis, a good steam cleaning system (GIOELLE makes a wonderful commercial product). It really detracted from my stay.2- The room was really nice, a nice size and well laid out and comfortably appointed. The criticism is that the dark woodwork in the entryway is terribly scuffed up from the constant traffic of wheeled luggage, I presume. It makes for a first negative impression. A pity really because everything is really quite well put together, with excellent quality.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: To be totally honest I really enjoy the room which was really big with a large bathroom overlooking Tokyo train station and the mystic Bullets train.The staff was very nice and helpfulThe location is very convenient, you can walk to Ginza and the Marunouchi district is niceHowever I was very disappointed by the lobby which in fact is just a sofa and a desk.... I was expecting a bit more from a Four Seasons. For the same price you can stay a one of the Asian Hotel Peninsula, Mandarin Oriental, Shangri la which them have large busy lobby which is what I love in Asia.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I really satisfied with the hotel service, room’s cleanness, room’s spacious, and the room rate. It is truly worth to pay. Staff is very nice. I and my family were greeted warmly. Welcome drinks is tasty and refreshing. I will come again when I visit Tokyo in coming years.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Found this hotel from a link here and got an amazing price for a 700 sq ft room. The hotel was not the easiest to find as it is part of a office building. If arriving via NeX from Narita, call the hotel after you get your tickets and they will have someone meet you at the train station and guide you thru the maze of Tokyo station. If you want to do this on your own, exit at the Yaesu south exit. The staff was excellent and the room was amazing. The extras like WI-FI and gym access are all free. There were so many extras like slippers, bath robes and pajamas that were part of the service though we did not use all of them. Use the concierge or talk to Emi at the front desk for places to see, eat and things to do. It felt very much like home (with a lot of extras) for a five-star hotel. I will return to the hotel the next time I visit Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location, away from shibuya and shinjuku madness but right next to tokio train/subway station and 2 other subway stations within walking distance.Our room was nice, spacious and clean. Great (new) bathroom with large bath and seperate shower.Staff super friendly and helpful and English speaking.The food in the restaurant for dinner was NOT great unfortunately, and also super expensive. But you really don't have to go there anyway since you're in Tokyo! Somehow we ended up there 1 night, late, after a long day, being jetlegged. But that was no success. Breakfast however is amazing!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My family really enjoyed our time at this stellar property. We stayed here mainly for its view of the shinkansen. We called several times before we arrived to ensure we got a room with the right view. Watching the shinkansen is one of my son's favorite things. With our room facing the tracks our son had the best time ever. Its his favorite hotel in the world. The hotel itself is small in terms of number of rooms, but rooms are fairly spacious compared to other hotels we've stayed in in Tokyo. The service is absolutely impeccable with every staff member paying very close attention to every detail. The concierge made some great recommendations for places to eat ( we asked for more local flavors/experience with english menus). Our rate also included daily breakfast which we really enjoyed. It would be nice to have a few dishes change a little more in the buffet (we got a little tired of the same dishes after the 4th day), but overall the quality of the food was excellent.Our only disappointment was that our room was not ready when we arrived (no fault of the hotels). Our flight arrived at 4:30 AM and we arrived at the hotel at 5:30AM so we knew that there was a good chance that the room would not be ready.Overall, this is just a great property with close proximity to Tokyo station. Great shopping and food is all a short walk away.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I stayed for a week in July 2015. Absolutely perfect stay, fantastic service, charming, courteous, professional staff. Couldn't ask for more. 100% recommended. The English was perfect and very helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Like all other reviews, room is large and the location is perfect. However, I am most impressed by their staffs. Upon knowing that we will be travelling with a 3-year-old, our room was already child-proofed when we checked-in. My son really likes the special travel booklet made by the hotel staffs, the giant cookie and marshmallow welcome snack, the crayons and drawing paper that were prepared in the room, and the child-sized bath robe. We would definitely be back in the future!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Location a few minutes walk from Tokyo Central Station is great for access to Narita by train. The palace is close by and the parks by it, which makes a pleasant change from the concrete jungle, but it's within easy walking distance to high end shopping areas nearby. The Marunouchi Building nearby offers many restaurant options too. Rooms are large, comfortable and quiet. The whole hotel has a very private and discreet air about it from the main entrance, through to the lobby and the rooms. Decor is minimalist in a stylish way, but don't let it fool you because service in English is a cut above all other hotels I have ever stayed at in Japan. The day I left, it was raining, so the concierge dispatched someone to guide us through the underground mall to get across to Tokyo station to catch the train.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Feel at home and really appreciate what they have done for us. Services are great. Easy access to lots of restaurants below the hotel. Easy access to train station and stores. Wifi connection were great. Lots of facilities for kids eg ps4, blu ray movies etc.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfect location. Spacious, comfortable rooms, with Queen beds if you need 'em. Fantastic service. Special dining with views and prices to match in the dining room, or yummy, cheap eats just downstairs in Tokyo Station, where you can catch train or a bus to Anywhere in Japan. Just a few blocks away from the Emporer's palace gardens, and two art museums. And when you're heading home, the bell staff will even escort you and your bags to your NEX train. What's not to love?

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We enjoyed amazing service from start to finish over two brief stays. The rooms are spacious. light, quiet despite being right next to the train line and very comfortable. The in house onsen is a great way to unwind after a busy day exploring Tokyo and the shopping nearby is brimming with choice. Having the staff wait for you on the platform when arriving on the Narita Express is a great way to kick off your stay and help you navigate your way through the incredible Tokyo Station complex. Highly recommended if you want to spoil yourself a bit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfect location for exploring central Tokyo on foot. Lots of good restaurants and shopping in Ginza and Tokyo Station is very convenient for getting around the city by metro.The staff were incredibly helpful in recommending restaurants, department stores and suggesting sightseeing itineraries. It's a perfect hotel for a short break for a couple wanting to enjoy Tokyo and relax.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We loved our stay at this amazing hotel. We opted for their service to meet us at the Narita airport to help guide our transportation to Tokyo. Our Guide was very helpful and assisted us with train tickets to Tokyo Station (there is an extra charge but well worth it). Upon arrival at Tokyo Station a Bellman from the hotel met us and guided us to the Four Seasons Hotel.Our check-in was conducted in our room, rather then the front desk, which we really liked. Our room was clean, modern and very comfortable. We are a family of 4 and I was able to book one room to fit all of us which tends to be hard to find overseas. The staff is helpful in every way including booking us a private tour guide. This place is everything you expect from a Four Seasons Hotel. We can not wait to go back!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We enjoyed four nights at the Four Seasons and have to say every employee we came in contact with was incredibly helpful, courteous and their main goal was to make sure we had an enjoyable stay. We requested platform service and the individual met us outside our exact car on the Narita Express. She refused to let us take even one of our three bags even when we offered to help. When we departed, we got the same service, and the gentleman even helped exchange our train ticket for an earlier time for us...all with a smile. The concierge was just as helpful in recommending restaurants in the area. I didn't give them an excellent rating because their wifi is complementary for only two devices and I feel that the level of the Four Seasons should equate to complementary wifi for all that you have. In all other categories they are outstanding .

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were swiftly moved to another room after complaining that the previous guests must have smoked in the roomAs a conference and events organizer I travel extensively but this was by far the best service I've experienced......and their beds are amazing!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Concierge staff at the Four seasons is nothing short of amazing. They got us reservations at the impossible Jiro's, they booked all of our trains for the rest of our trip, they even stored our bags while we went and saw the rest of the country and were waiting for us when we came back through to give us our bags. I will be staying here the next time I am in town.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I had visited this boutique hotel in April 2013, which is now too late , but I will still like to recommend this hotel as one of the best in Tokyo, very suit for very convenient location & best personal service, although small but with typical Four Seasons hospitality you would find.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The reception and lobby is pretty small but staff is attentive and friendly. I checked in at midnight for business and staff was welcoming. When I checked out, they assigned someone to walk with me to the inside of train station. She was truly plesant and helpful. Rooms are big and spacious. Location of hotel is also great because it's right next to the Tokyo station which is at the center of the city. One of the best 5-stars I have seen in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is in a very convenient location if you're arriving by train. We touched base with reception prior to arriving at the station and arranged for someone meet us at the platform, to guide us to the hotel and take our bags.Rooms, facilities, service and food are faultless. Highly recommend the mac and cheese arancini on room service menu.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I tore my pants on the way to Tokyo and was panicking when I arrived to the hotel around 10pm (as I assumed no nearby tailors would be open to patch me up before my meeting the following morning). The concierge made no promises but offered the services of their in-house tailor (who would be arriving the following morning at 8am). They returned my (repaired) pants around 8.30am, with a fabulous repair job! They saved me in my time of need and I will certainly be repaying the favor in coming years by continuing to stay here on future business trips. On another note, I believe this hotel, along with the Conrad in Shiodome, are the two most underrated/under-valued in Tokyo. This one flies under the radar due to the smaller size (I think just 57 rooms?), but proximity to Tokyo station and easy taxi access (far superior to Shangri-la, another hotel adjacent to the station where one must go through an underground labyrinth and two elevators just to make it to the room) gives it one of the best locations for doing business in Tokyo (err needing to deal with the blue chips ins Marunouchi!).

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We all know about Four Seasons’ impeccable rooms and services, and here is no exception. Having less than 48 hours in town, we stayed here because of its location. We arrived and departed in a Shinkansen at Tokyo Central Station; and the hotel sent us one of the staffs who met us at the train platform and carried our luggage and escorted us to the hotel; and they did the same when we left. Our room was spacious with a bathroom that was about a half size of our room; and full of luxuries and modern conveniences. Everyone was friendly and extremely helpful, particularly the folks at Guess Service. 57 room proporty, quiet and no crowd. Easy to get in and out, by taxi, metro or walking. It’s the way to live and travel!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Surprised how small this hotel was for a Four Seasons. Also extremely expensive. Rooms, reception staff, and concierge are first rate. They will help you with last minute bookings, airport transfers, etc.  did not eat here, so can't comment. Can not imagine bringing family and young children here. Downtown environment close to Tokyo Station-- which dominates everything and even makes a taxi ride twice as long as it should be, as they have to traverse the one way streets around the Station. My room overlooked the train tracks, which made sleeping difficult.  I would recommend this hotel to business travelers or those who wish to spend time in Ginza and adjacent areas.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: One of the best hotel I ever been. Fiv minutes from Tokyo station. Five minutes from Ginza. Great service. But above all Great room! Big bed and great pillows. AFTer long walking days and getting to our room was comforting. We will definitely be here next time we visit Japan, because we will be back to this amazing country.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: You have to stay here - for absolutely exceptional service on every level, superb location, room size is amazing (more like a small modern apartment with blonde timber), gorgeous large bathroom, two toilets, a separate lounge, great storage, close to every conceivable restaurant including some gorgeous laneway eateries, walking distance to the main train station and the 5th Ave of Tokyo - always something to see in Ginza amazing stay! Do it!!!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A great choice if you want to be close to Ginza, and the Tokyo station. Although the price is very high, the service, amenities and breakfasts were outstanding. The rooms are quiet, the staff very helpful, and the spa facilities excellent.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We decided to splurge and chose to stay here for our last few nights in Tokyo. We specifically chose this hotel because we thought there was a pool(it was advertised on hotels.com), but we were disappointed to find out that was at their old location. This is definitely one of their smaller properties, but our room was HUGE. The beds were really comfortable, and I had the best nights sleep out of all the places we stayed at while in Japan. Our room faced the street, but we couldn't hear anything outside. This hotel is about a 5 minute walk to Tokyo Station. It's pretty much next door. We had a wonderful stay despite our initial disappointment.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed there for one night before flying back home after two weeks of traveling around Japan. It was awesome! The staff was very friendly, doing their very best to make your stay as pleasurable as possible. The hotel has their own private onsen, that one can use even with tattoos. The breakfast buffet was splendid: the food was very fresh and delicious. Since we inquired about the vegan possibilities for breakfast while checking in they made all the requirement and called several times our room to confirm what kind of bread and milk will be ok. And in the morning there was special soya milk and bread from the bakery that was still warm. It was very thoughtful and greatly appreciated!The Room had everything that could ever be required in terms of hot tea water, coffee machine and hygienic accessories. However, in this price range it is expected. The only really minor thing that could be considered negative would be that, at checkin I got asked if I wanted to upgrade,for almost double price to a suite. Well, no thanks, please don't ask unless it's discounted.Bottom line, outstanding experience. This is as good as it gets. Definitely worth the pricing of 600$ per night where you expect it all. And you'll get it all.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I had our wedding here. It was the most painless and beautiful event ever. It was our first time to Japan and we really had no idea what to expect but our wedding planner, Chitose, took care of every single detail and made me feel 100% confident in the event. I could not have asked for a better wedding planner. The entire Four Seasons staff made us feel very welcome and comfortable. They were professional but they had a warmth to them that made us feel so welcomed. They even greeted us at the airport limousine stop and carried our luggage to the hotel in the rain. The room was amazing but the staff was what made it incredible. Even after we left, we ran into one of the staff members in Shinjuku and she remembered us and said hello. I have never stayed at a hotel with a better staff. I loved every bit of our stay and our wedding. Chitose and the rest of the staff made the whole experience the greatest thing ever. We will be back for our anniversary.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here for our last night in Japan, in a Premier Twin room, which was squeaky clean, vast, very well equipped, and had large and very comfortable beds. The front desk directed us to great lunch and dinner venues and we finished the evening in the bar looking down on the comings and goings in Tokyo Central station. Bar prices were reasonable. Breakfast was a buffet but brought to our table and service was impeccable. An English-speaking hotel porter took us and our luggage through the rabbit warren of Tokyo Central and delivered us on time to the Narita express. Perfect.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Fantastic location, great hotel, everything is new, first rate service, wonderful food, last minute technology. If you take the train to Kyoto, the Concierge will walk you to the station with a bell boy and put you on the train (huge plus). Would stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is what service is all about. It made me think twice about whether or not I can act in ways the Four Seasons acted towards me to be a better human being towards others in general. I am not talking about subservient or haughty/exclusive type of service, but more of a reciprocal, respectful and gentile type of service. One that really makes you want to up the ante in how to treat others, mindfulness and the golden rule at it's best. Exemplary!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed during golden week for 4 nights with a three years old. Our superior room is quite spacious and really make us feel close to being at home which is crucial when you are in a country half way across the globe. The staff is amazing, they are extremely friendly, polite and always smile at us which may actually may help our daughter came out of her shyness a bit. The service is also top notch, they actually escorted us along the basement to a convenience store when we asked where is the closest convenience store since we didn't see any on the street level and actually wait for us to finish and escort us back. The level of attention my three years old received is amazing, I think she got more attention than we did but that make the whole trip so enjoyable (happy kid, happy mom and dad). We love having breakfast there, the food was delicious (my daughter loved home-made tofu and onsen egg and I loved hot grill salmon where other places often give me cold grill fish and I have not seen onsen egg in breakfast set at other hotel nowadays). However, if you order Japanese breakfast then you will not have much choices. My husband had Japanese breakfast for four day straight (I would have got the same if they change up some vegetable a bit) but being said that, the buffet was also amazing. They have fresh baked croissant which my daughter and myself love so I would say that two day Japanese and two days buffet were PERFECT for me. Also I am addicted to onsen since our other trip around Japan, the onsen in the women spa area are free to use and I don't think people use it as much, the water in the onsen has mineral added which good for your health and skin (I asked the spa attendant) and your skin will feel so smooth after using the onsen. Everyone (at least all women) should use this facility if you are in Japan I used it every day! All in all, because we knew that we will have warm and welcome place to come back to everyday after a long day of excursion, it make our trip so much enjoyable and I cannot thank you enough for all the things the FS teams help us which I can't really put all in here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four seasons at Maronouchi is one of the top hotels I have stayed in Tokyo . Very important advantage is the location of the hotel - just two minutes walk from Central Tokyo station . It's based in few floors of skyscraper office building . The first impression : modern . Very clean . Excellent front desk service and admission . The best view is the one that looks towards the station with trains passing every few minutes but isolation is good so no noise id present . The decoration is modern . Spacious rooms . Very clean . Electric curtains ,Reading lights ,Big screen TV ,Creams , toothbrush ,toothpaste ,shampoo , conditioner , good quality towels , bath robes , clock , description how to use the toilet are there . Very clean bathroom and WC . Gym and Very good restaurant are on the top floors of the hotel . The price is a bit high but also depends on the season . I have no negative comment except the price .
user_name:
Melina B
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I couldn't have been treated to better service anywhere. The staff attends to your every need. I had mentioned a restaurant I had wanted to try and they not only made reservations for me, but wrote a card for me to present to the taxi driver so they would know just where to take me. This hotel has excellent food, is very close to the trains, parks and many other sights. Absolutely modern and comfortable.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hotel is perfectly located. Next to Tokyo train station, Ginza district and Imperial Palace. Staff was friendly and helpful. Room was one of the best I've ever stayed in. Clean and modern. Restaurant/Bar was excellent. Can easily reccomend this hotel and will stay there again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staff is very friendly, helpful and attentive. Hotel very clean and comfortable. Quiet room. No noise from the trains. Floor to ceiling windows-spacious room. Restaurant has nice buffet breakfast. Close to Ginza, Imperial Palace and Tokyo station. Would not hesitate to stay there on our next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Loved the very helpful service here, especially since I was visiting Tokyo for the first time. Great location & spacious room with lot of big windows & natural light. Took the free bikes parked out front one day for a whole day tour, was a fun way to the city.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Above and beyond hospitality is what I've come to expect of the Four Seasons brand and the team was unfortunately nowhere near delivering that level of service. It was my wife and I's first trip to Japan, our first trip together without our children after some time, and my wife's first experience at a Four Seasons property. A man in glasses who worked the front desk during my check-in and check-out was purely transactional. There was no sincerity, spirit to serve, hospitality gene, you name it. Perhaps it had something to do with my wife and I turning down an "upgrade opportunity" inappropriately suggested by this fellow upon check-in that would happen to cost an additional USD1,000 per night? The same man handled a straightforward currency exchange for my wife during our stay and failed to follow through on hailing a cab for her. The concierge did not impress. Although always courteous, they simply did enough to respond to my queries and I never felt that they were invested in facilitating for a great stay for my wife and I. We were never asked any questions - no one on the property had cared to ask if we had been to Tokyo before, and what we were looking to do and see. I will give credit where credit is due – the location is fantastic, and breakfast at Motif was excellent. The hotel pyjamas laid out for us nightly when we returned to the rooms was a nice touch, and the restaurant recommendation to dinner at Yakiniku Ushigoro in Ginza was first rate. Ultimately, we were not made to feel truly welcome and will look at another option for our next visit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We lucked in staying at the Four Seasons. In future we will look for 5 star boutique hotels.The location could not have been better, the service was impeccable, the massage was one of the best ever. We quickly realized our lack of Japanese language was irrelevant. The rooms were well appointed to the extent we could not fault them.The concierge service would have been difficult to beat. A new bag we bought for top up services broke at the last moment and the staff dealt with it immediately without blinking an eye-lid. We would highly recommend it and hope to return soon.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons occupies just a few floors on the building. Extremely luxurious, outstanding service by all staff/concierge. Breakfast is amazing. Nice 24-hour fitness room. Perfect location just north of Ginza...I could go on!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Ideally located a short walk from Tokyo Station and adjacent to The Royal Palace I've used this hotel for years. Rooms are excellent, service top notch and food caters for all tastes. As a runner I just love heading up and round the Palace or Hibaya park. For business meetings in and around Chiyoda you simply walk. Ginza is close at hand ad obviously with Tokyo Station next door you can access Tokyo Metro or Shinkansen lines.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is close to Tokyo station on the yeasu south exit and walking distance to GINZA area. There are DAIMARU, shop and restaurant very close by also you have convenient store and airport limousine bus stop across the road. The fitness also open 24 hr and they have onsen and stream open from 6:30 am -10Pm which i found it nice and relax on the 7 floor inside the spa area by the way they don't have swimming pool.The hotel are clean and still in good condition. The staff are very organise and helpful with very good english. The breakfast are vary in choice a bit over price but they use a very good ingredient and worth to try.The room i stayed was comfortable and quiet. The amenities are same as 4 season standard good as usual however I really found it funny that they don't have toilet in the lobby area you have to go up to 7 floor to use the restaurant toilet. It's might be because the hotel are very small.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were met at the train station and brought to the Hotel as it can be confusing trying to get to the Hotel. Be prepared to pay a high premium to stay here cos the location is really convenient. The room is really big for Tokyo and we had the view of the train station but the noise is muffled, good sound proofing windows. You can take a 10 min walk to ginza .

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have stayed in hundreds of hotels, but this one is the clear winner of the title of "best hotel" in my experience. From the minute you step into the (small) lobby to the minute you leave, you will receive the best service that can possibly be given. Add to that a beautiful room and world class dining as well as a top-notch workout space, and you have all the makings of a perfect accommodation. The staff was impeccable and truly seemed to be there to make your stay as wonderful as possible. You never got a sense of them being fake or overbearing - they were simply perfect. My brother and I ate several times in the main dining room and chose the tasting menus each time. Our food was Michelin level quality and well worth the price. For breakfast, we recommend the breakfast buffet over the specialty breakfasts like the Japanese breakfast (not enough pickles and fish). The hotel provides services whereby they will accompany you to your train if you are traveling to other cities (e.g., Kyoto) or back home via Narita airport. I recommend you make use of the services, as the train station can be extremely confusing.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We have stayed at Four Seasons hotels around the world, and Tokyo was one of the best. The service was unsurpassed--always polite, friendly, and on-target. The concierge recommendations were spot on. We travelled with our 23-month old and the staff was so so accommodating and helpful. We enjoyed our one-bedroom suite with all the luxury and space we have come to expect. Our daughter especially enjoyed the floor to ceiling windows where she could watch the bullet trains. She would say, "zoom, zoom, zoom" when one went by. The view of the train station was great, and not loud at all. The hotel's location is ideal at one block from Tokyo station. If you are in Tokyo for sight-seeing and have a JR pass, Tokyo station is where you want to be. We did day trips to Nikko, Kyoto, Himeji, and Hiroshima. I especially want to recognize the room service crew--we ordered a lot through room service with a young one. Room service was always on-time and delicious. My wife's gluten allergy was accommodated well. We have warm memories of our stay and of Japan.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent 5 lovely days at this very nice Hotel. The location was excellent, two minutes walk from Tokyo railstation. What we enjoyed the most, besides the beautiful suite we had was their lovely staff. They were so gracious, polite, professional and went beyond their duties! My husband needed a Doctor and they made an appointment inmediately and as the Doctor did not speak english, one of the Concierges accompanied my husband twice during our short stay without accepting any tip afterwards! Their staff is just amazing, from the front desk, the Concierges, room service, housekeeping and also the staff from the Spa too.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I had the most amazing experience at this hotel. We have stayed at many 5 star properties around the world, and this would definitely the best customer service experience we've ever had. The front desk staff was always extremely helpful, room service was outstanding, and we were treated like royalty! The hotel is also in an excellent location - you can get to Tokyo Station without having to go outside (which is great if it's raining) - just take a couple of escalators / stairs inside the building you are connected to and you are in the station! The bed was also super comfortable :) I would definitely recommend this hotel as a great place to stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel does not even have a lobby. The bar and restaurant were closed during our recent stay, which no one mentioned prior to arrival. The service was terrible. They served the breakfast in a room with no windows. Four Seasons should be ashamed!!! This was a bad experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Hotel in Tokyo is an exceptional hotel and a great choice for a first time stay in Tokyo. I can't say enough about their greeting service that will meet you at the railway station (they will also escort you to your train at departure). This made my first visit to Tokyo much less stressful and therefore enjoyable. Their staff is outstanding and goes out of their way to help you in every way. The concierge recommended some excellent restaurants which I very much enjoyed. They bar and restaurant were amazing, and the breakfast buffet was very memorable. The Four Seasons is a great choice for your stay in Tokyo, and which I will return to on my next visit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: That is a remarkable property, with quite a good and central location if you are visiting Tokyo for business (at least relatively close to our Asian head quarter in Japanese capital), you can enjoy the urban chick of Tokyo through the windows. The room itself is not that large however all the amenities are modern and the room is very clean - this is all that counts for a business traveler for 2 nights stay. The staff is friendly and well trained which is always an additional asset for any property. To make long story short: i would come back there again and I can definately reccomend this property to other business oriented travelers.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A true experience in Japanese excellence. This Hotel is within a large corporate building set up and close to many nice parts of the city. The rooms are spacious and with all needed amenities, the staff is extremely helpful. The bar is beautiful and has great views. It is a true jewel within this amazing city.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at this hotel during 4 nights.The location next to the Station is strategic! They have a wonderful service where they meet you at the platform of your train and escort you to the hotel. Perfect for Shikansen trains and Narita Express. Also the limousine to Haneda leaves from across the street and they escort you there too! The staff speaks very good English and concierge, reception and bellboys couldn´t be more helpful. Rooms are large and comfortable. Also, when we booked we were not explicitly warned that the lounge, lobby bar, and restaurant would be under refurbishment during our stay. That diminished the enjoyment for us because we wanted to use those areas given our group configuration. We were four guests (family and friends) of different ages staying in two rooms, and we would have liked to hang out at the bar/lobby. The GM was very attentive when we complained and gave us a handsome discount, very much in line to what was expected. His answer was swift and that was appreciated. Great Service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have not stayed at this hotel yet, but I am would like to make some comments regarding the excellent concierge staff.Just like other gaijin, we often need the assistance of the concierge to get reservations at the various sushi-ya's and other restaurants around town. The staff here was able to make reservations at Kaneska, Yoshitake, Sawada, Mizutani, Miyaha, Sho, Harutuka and Iwa. This is very impressive! If the concierge staff is this good pre-stay, I can only imagine how good they will be during my upcoming stay.I used to stay at the Peninsula but the concierge has gone way downhill. I picked this small hotel for the level of service and they have yet to disappoint.See you soon 4S!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great service level from staff being very attentive and helpful. We stayed only two nights and did not use all the facilities. The beds were very comfortable. The room was modern with an excellent large bathroom. The location of the hotel served our purposes. Per

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the Four Seasons where the concierge team met me at the train station to assist with the luggage. In addition, the team itself helped out with making reservations for restaurants in advanced as well as on the spot to some recommended restaurants in Tokyo. The room was well furnished with comfortable bedding and pillows, allowing for a good night sleep. Overall, it was a pleasant stay in Four Seasons Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From the moment we entered the walkway leading to the hotel, we were impressed by the helpfulness of the Four Seasons staff. Always ready with a smile and an answer to our many questions, each staff member showed us warmth and hospitality in every encounter. Our lovely room was an oasis of quiet and calm between our explorations of amazing Tokyo, with elegant modern furnishings, a serene color palette, and beautifully outfitted bathroom. (And great wifi!) A number of reviewers have mentioned the restaurant renovation, but we were pleasantly surprised by the excellent dinner we enjoyed in the temporary dining room. The location of this hotel can't be beat, especially if your itinerary involves train travel--it is just outside Tokyo Station, which with its luxury shops and food markets is a world unto itself. The Ginza district and upscale shopping is just a short walk away, as are the grounds and gardens of the Imperial Palace. Other tourist sites are easily reached by city trains or Japan Rail lines. (All signboards in Japanese and English) And of course the wonderful Four Seasons staff will help you find a way to check off everything on your Tokyo "must see" list.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is very business centric and nothing too fancy to talk about. However I'd like to commend one particular staff - Jonathan Sato - who was so gracious and carried both our heavy suitcases all the way to the train station platform(like buying himself a ticket to get in)! In fact he stayed with us till the train arrived and even helped put our belongings to storage - wow. What a wonderful and attentive guy, good job and thank you much Jonathan!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Spent a long weekend at the Four Seasons at Marunouchi, right next to the Tokyo Station and Ginza - we have nothing but positive reviews to give. The hotel is small but have all that is required for a pleasant stay (only negative was that the restaurant was being renovated - but there were many great restaurants to pick from in the neighborhood). We were two adults and two kids and we all loved it. In particular the staff were fantastic, always helpful and ready to help out with bookings, directions or an umbrella. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We knew the restaurant was being refurbished and was moved to the 7th floor. However, there seems to be no other public space during this refurbishment. We asked if we could have a drink and were told there was a Yen 3,000 per person offer to drink as much as you could in two hours alongside dinner, but no other options. Something may have been lost in translation but even we didn't fancy speed drinking. This had the benefit of forcing us to go out and explore the many watering holes in Ginza, of which there are many and no doubt cheaper than the hotel.On the positive side, the staff were excellent, collecting us from the platform at Ginza station, which is a warren of tunnels and walkways. They helped us with restaurant bookings and other queries. We booked a standard room, which was large in a warm wooden colours verging on minimalist. The bathroom too was on the big side and very well equipped. We liked the in-room check in and knowing the room would be cleaned at 10am each day, such a pleasant change from getting back in mid afternoon to find your room still not made up.Being next to Ginza Metro and Tokyo station we found the hotel very convenient as a base to explore Tokyo and get the Bullet train to Shin Fuji. Once the restaurant refurbishment is completed I'm sure The Four Seasons will be a great choice when staying in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Small boutique hotel, quiet but in perfect location, near the main station. Lots of restaurants nearby, shopping in ther Ginza area and the imperial palace gardens, The staff were very helpful and friendly, breakfast was very good, the beds were extremely comfortable, although looking onto the rail tracks, there was hardly any noise!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We arrived very late and entered our corner room that appeared to have no windows. The two walls were covered in a heavy fabric?? We were too busy enjoying the beautifullly appointed bedroom and high tech bathroom to fuss with the "dark" room. In the middle of the night I thought I pushed the button on the headboard panel for my light and suddenly our wall coverings lifted to expose floor to ceiling windows looking down the Ginza! Spectacular! The staff could not have been more helpful. I was able to arrange a 5 AM tour of thefamous fish market to see the tuna auction. From the welcoming flowers in our room to lovely breakfasts and gracious lobby staff, this Four Seasons Hotel will long be remembered.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Marunouchi in Tokyo is quite nice with excellent service and very well designed rooms with foreign as well as USB plugs for charging, very comfortable beds and a team that is very well trained and incredibly nice.The hotel is missing facilities, specifically now with some renovations, there is no lounge/bar.In terms of view: the hotel either faces the station or a street with some office buildings so don't expect an amazing view, specifically because it occupies the lower floors of the building.Tips for travelers:- The entrance to the hotel is from Yaesu so exit Tokyo station from Yaesu south exit and you'll find the hotel about a 3 minute walk if you take a right. If you exit from Marunouchi side it will take you 15 minutes to walk around the station to get to the hotel.- Ask for a room that is not facing the station, if you are a light sleeper it gets a bit noisy with the busiest train station in Japan (Maybe the world) right across.- There's an ATM that accepts foreign credit cards in the Tokyo square gargen center in the grocery store in the basement. (5 minute walk)- Walk 10 minutes away to Ginza for a livelier area with more retail and food options.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Room 413 was Spacious and had everything we needed. Surprisingly, the room was facing the main road but you cannot hear the sound of the busy street below. Keep the room drapes down though as anyone in the office buildings across the hotel can see you. The JR Tokyo welcome service by the hotel is highly recommended ( it's free ) and is very useful when you arrive at the JR Tokyo station from Narita. Service is incredible and excellent. It's the Four Seasons and you could just stay in your room the whole day if need be. The hotel's location is very convenient, near the Tokyo station and a 10-15 minute walking distance to Ginza. Thank you Four Seasons for a wonderful and memorable stay. Would definitely come back!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We did not know what to expect on our trip and the Four Seasons made the introduction to Tokyo very easy. The service, location, facility were outstanding. That alone is worth the investment. Next to Tokyo Station and in the Financial District allowed for a top of the line experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed a week over December/ January 2015 at the Four Seasons Japan. Reservations was easy online and confirmed via email. The staff also arranged to meet us at the airport, escort us to the Narita Express train and another staff member met us at the Tokyo station to escort us to the hotel. Thank goodness they did as its a little confusing finding your way out of the subway!
