The Four Seasons staff are all incredibly helpful, friendly and accommodating and to me that really makes the experience so much nicer and relaxing. The hotel itself is quite small, only 7 floors, the top floor being the restaurant, bar, lounge/sitting room and spa & gym. I had a lovely massage at the spa so I would highly recommend that. Unfortunately I didn't get time to try the gym. Food in the restaurant, which is also the breakfast dining area, was nice and of high quality. The location is great, about a 5 minute walk to the Tōkyō subway and Shinkansen and a little further to the Demaru shopping centre. Check out the ground floor amazing food hall! In the opposite direction it's about a 10 minute walk to the Ginza shopping district. Fabulous shopping, 12 floors of Uniqlo the original flagship store. Restaurants, bars and cafes aplenty. Note that if you haven't been to Japan before, the Japanese queue for everything! They are orderly and queue for a seat for any cafe, restaurant or bread shop! Oh! The Japanese do excellent desserts!!! Another attraction just 10 minutes walk from the hotel is the Emporer's Palace. The palace opens on 2nd January each year and the Emporer gives a little speech. It's one of the two times per year you can go into the palace grounds. If you make it there will be thousands of people. It's well organized and once again the Japanese are very orderly, no pushing. The hotel is a boutique if you can imagine, not as large and commercial say as the Park Hyatt. The rooms are well sized, bathroom lovely. My only disappointing factor for want of a better word is the price / tarrif to stay here. It's a small and limited services hotel when compared to Four Seasons Hong Kong for example but costs the same. Maybe the tarrif is reflective of Japan hospitality. That said, the staff and location are spot on, perfect location

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The rooms are beautiful, the staff is unbelievable, and the location is great. A few examples:- They meet you at the airport or train and escort you to your room. - They got us reservations to Michelin 3-star Yoshitake (which you have to try if you can get in)- We bought something a bit unwieldy in Ginza, and they offered to pack it for us to take home, even putting a handle on it so we could carry it easily

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our first trip to Japan and I originally booked in at the Park Hyatt, however once I realised the location I moved over to the Four Seasons and I'm very glad I did. The hotel is small and all the better for it. The location is great with easy access to the main station, subway, Ginza and the Imperial Palace.The highlight was the wonderful staff who were very polite, spoke excellent English and were very accommodating. They even realised (from my passport I assume) that my birthday was coming up and arranged for a cake to be sent to the room on our last day. A wonderful and much appreciated gesture.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The room we had was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was large and well-equipped with quality amenities. We had a room with a beautiful view of the train tracks allowing us to watch the bullet trains silently glide in and out of the station. The fitness center had a spacious and well-equipped gym and a small but functional onsen, very pleasant for our winter stay. The staff were extremely professional and friendly. The many small courtesies made us feel special and welcomed. This hotel is like a boutique hotel in scale, small and intimate but not much in the way of F&B facilities. The location is very convenient with restaurants in an adjacent basement mall and Tokyo Station just a minute's walk away.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a fabulous hotel right by the Tokyo train station. It's luxurious and service oriented with great staff and great food for all palates. We stayed for three nights. Don't accept a room over the train tracks unless you are a very sound sleeper.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi is exactly what the Four Seasons Brand represents. the hotel was selected for an overnight stay after arriving from the US and before leaving for Nagano Prefecture the next day. We were met at the Tokyo Station platform after taking the express train from Narita. As expected everything was first rate. Kudos to all of the staff. The rooms are elegant and large. The bathroom is also exceptional. The location is also centrally located and would be a good base of operation to explore Tokyo. The Four Seasons is next to Tokyo Station.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: What distinguishes one luxury hotel from another is the service of their employees. The Four Seasons at Marunouchi stands out as one of the best. Everyone, and I mean everyone, knows your name and wants to assist you with a smile. They truly do not seem to know how to say "No" to a guest request or situation. We were met (and later dropped off) at Tokyo Station from both Narita Express and the Shinkansen trains and escorted to the hotel; since Tokyo Station is huge and navigating through all of the shopping streets can get overwhelming, this service was greatly appreciated. A staff member also escorted us to his favorite ramen shop in Tokyo Station when we told him that we wanted some ramen. And when something horrible happens to you (in our case a medical emergency), they go the extra mile to ensure you are taken care of. The Four Seasons arranged for medical assistance, accompanied us to the doctor and pharmacy to provide translation services, then ensured that we were accommodated in the same room when our stay had to be extended by another four nights. Thanks to managers Mami and Yasu and the entire staff of this boutique-style hotel; it's our new home in Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My friend and I used the Four Seasons at Marunouchi as a layover stop between Tokyo and Sapporo. We arrived at 8pm and departed at 4am the next morning but even in such a short time, we both came away very impressed with the personalized level of service.Everyone, from bellhop to front desk, were more than eager and helpful. Our room was elegantly designed and immaculately maintained. Even though this is the smallest of all Four Seasons locations, it certainly made a big impression.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Anybody who spends 3 days searching for a lost wallet dropped in a train station and finds it in a coastal town 2 hours away deserves 5 stars, or 10. Thank you, thank you, Ms. Suzuki and the rest of the concierge staff at the Four Seasons! During our week in Tokyo, we managed to lose a wallet, a handbag, and an expensive camera, and everything was recovered thanks to the honesty and efficiency I've found only in Japan. However, that wallet was the proverbial needle in a haystack. It had over $1500 in cash, plus credit cards and documents. Another plus is room size. Who knew you could get so much space in prime Tokyo real estate for such a good rate? The small lobby and highly personal service give the hotel a boutique feel rather than that of a big international chain.Our two children got a lovely, personal welcome. Many top hotels greet young guests with toys, treats, and a note, but the welcome packet at the Four Seasons went one step further and introduced our girls to the children of a hotel concierge. They also received an activity book with recommendations for child-friendly things to do in Tokyo. The coloring pencils were first-rate, much better than the cheap crayons typically given out.However, I am afraid I can give only 4 stars for this review because, as another reviewer remarked, the concierge service does not have any relationship with many of the top restaurants that we would like to try. On previous visits to Tokyo, the concierges at other hotels were able to leverage their relationships with hard-to-reserve restaurants. In Tokyo, where one needs almost a personal introduction to reserve a restaurant, this is important to a foreign gourmet who come to eat here.Because of renovation, there was no restaurant or bar in the Four Seasons. The location within walking distance to Tokyo Station was excellent, but it was hard to meet friends in the hotel. There was not even much of a lobby. Given that we were traveling with 2 small children, this is a hardship.I also have to give very poor ratings for some of the meals we ordered from room service. One very expensive fish dish had an extremely small, overcooked portion--even for Japanese standards. It was not enough for a child, let alone an adult.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed in this hotel and the service is up to the best 5 star available in some of the international capitaleAdd the commitment to service of the Japanese staff combined to this small boutique & luxury hotel and you obtain the perfect property for a stay in Tokyo Suites are spacious and perfectly designed including a small tv in bathroom.Near to Tokyo station and some of the usual corporate places Also Ekki bar & grill located at 7th floor is one of the best restaurant in town with a Japanese and French sophistication Glad I havd stayed in this property I recommend if you can afford it and pay the price, you will for sure get what you paid for.
user_name:
Roger Georges D
Noumea, New Caledonia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is first class. Arrived off the Narita Express had a short walk to the hotel. It is all undercover so there was no need to feel the cold of winter. Hubby and I stayed in a lead in king bed room that was large, spotlessly clean with calming decor of light timber, carpet and comfortable soft furnishings and a very comfortable bed. The room had a full wall of floor to ceiling windows which over looked the street and was completely quiet. The bathroom was large with a good layout of a separate shower, bath and toilet. We staying in the Roppongi Hills area with relatives on our last stay but found this hotel to be in a much better location as you can explore the tourist areas by foot. The gym has a great view of the skyline, it's well equipped with clean. The staff throughout the hotel are outstanding!! A member escorted us to the Narita Express, bought tickets on our behalf and escorted us to the platform all so we didn't have to battle the language barrier. We will always stay at this hotel when in Tokyo. I highly recommend this hotel and I am a fussy traveller who has high expectations.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Conveniently situated close to Tokyo station was a great plus considering my heavy ski equipment. The location is otherwise not really that exciting. I'll remember my stay mainly thanks to the superior hospitality service as demonstrated by the front desk and the concierge. The only thing I missed was a pleasant lobby and bar facility (the restaurant was during our stay under renovation).

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There are a number of very good things about this hotel. The Four Seasons is nicely located near Tokyo station close to Ginza shopping and many business destinations. The service is very attentive. My wife lost her wallet and the staff went out of their way to find it. They also accompanied us to the station to buy some complicated train tickets. It is also very family friendly like all Four Seasons I have stayed in. The room was nice and large (for Tokyo) and the price at the time of the year was fairly reasonable (In room dining and other services were less reasonable but not out of the ordinary).The hotel bar and restaurant were being renovated so the hotel lacked a bit of life. I am sure it will be better once reopened but judging for the menu of the temporary restaurant, I am not sure it will be attracting any local clientele.Their concierge seems to have limited knowledge and pull with local hard-to-book restaurants (as compared to many other hotels I have stayed in before in Tokyo). Given this is very important to me, I will likely be staying elsewhere next time.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was my first visit to Tokyo, as one would expect the service was first class, the staff now all guest by name - impressive.The hotel is in a fantastic location (adjacent to Tokyo Station) and walking distance to most attractions.The hotel bar / restaurant was under construction, so only breakfast was served.The hotel is small, the lobby is understated, but elegant. The hotel occupies the lower floors of a mix use building, while it is very quiet, you will not have any views of the City.Rooms are quite large (versus my perception of Japan) and well appointed.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was my first time in Tokyo and the Four Seasons made it truly memorable. The lobby is not very grand for a Four Seasons Hotel but everything else was truly wonderful. Not a step was missed during our stay. The concierge team was extremely helpful and made sure everything was special. Only downside was that there is no hotel bar as it is being renovated until April. We will definitely be staying there again on our next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Amazing hotel, convenient right next to Tokyo Station. Great staff and service! Highly recommended!We were travelling with a heavy snowboard bag, the staff stored the bag for us and organised the bag to be sent to Nagano Hakuba hotel for us.They were going to show us where to eat the best ramen in the station, but we kindly declined because we knew exactly where to go. Great experience!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at Four Seasons Marunouchi for 2 nights at the end of our 2 weeks holiday in Japan. Location is perfect - right next to the Tokyo station. Easy walk and you will find an array of eating and shopping options. Staff wonderful and professional. Spa facility is excellent. There is Onsen (natural hot springs bath) you can enjoy after a workout at well equipped gym. There is also a sauna and mist shower. Very well equipped change room area where you do not have to worry about taking anything with you to go for a workout and a dip in onsen. There are hair brushes, make up remover, moisturiser, toner, hair elastics, towels, slippers, robes, toothbrush etc.I had a massage at the Spa and it was wonderful. Highly recommended. There is no lounge area for guests but in the morning, there is a coffee and tea station with small selection of pastry set up in the lobby area where you can grab refreshment before you go off for your adventure/business in Tokyo. You room is also equipped with Nespresso machine. The room we stayed at was the Train View room - excellent view of the Tokyo station with Bullet trains leaving and arriving. Also a nice view of Tokyo tower from the room. Nice large room you can relax in. One of the best thing about the hotel is the meet and greet service at the Tokyo station. Tokyo station is HUGE and would be very easy to get lost in. If it was not for having this service, and attended by a wonderful hotel staff, we would have had a real trouble navigating through the maze of shops underground Tokyo station. We had many luggage as well and it was so helpful to have help carrying them when we were leaving as well. It is such a lovely hotel, with nice big rooms, with excellent staff, best location, great spa facility (with Onsen!!!!!), and superb Spa treatments. HIGHLY recommended.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Have stayed in most other hotels in/around Tokyo station, but this was our first stay at Four Seasons. After a tiring flight, what a wonderful rest and sleep. The bed was like a cloud and I slept very well. It is just minutes to Tokyo station, restaurants and subway to get around Tokyo. The room was booked for triple as we had our adult son along and was priced similarly to 2 smaller rooms in a lesser hotel. toiletries, amenities ( no pool though) pyjamas etc were all top class. Best Tokyo station hotel stay ever!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff there are friendly, the view from the restaurant is nice.The food quality is exceptional.Hotel is close to Ginza which is the main shopping area for luxury shopping.Close enough to fish market where I have a pleasant 20min morning walk.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The best of everything. I'd move in if I could afford to. Incredible rooms including Four Seasons pyjamas - everything is just as it should be. Save this for your last nights in Tokyo, it's so very special. Oh, and don't miss a glass of champagne and some truffle popcorn at the bar. Heavenly.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Had a night in Tokyo on the way home. Chose the hotel due to location at Tokyo Station. Got off the Nagano Shinkansen and was met by concierge who took our luggage and walked us to the hotel. Very luxurious room and amenities. Next day, they could not give us a late check out, but let us freshen up at the spa before getting us to the station to catch our train to Narita. Kind concierge got our tickets and walked us all the way to the platform.Great location and great service. Exactly what is expected from this brand name.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons Tokyo is perfectly located metres from Tokyo station and a short walk to the Imperial Palace and the Ginza shopping area. Concierge meets travellers at the station platform after arriving from Narita airport via Narita Express.Rooms are meticulously presented and large for Japan. However, it is the service and personalised care that make this hotel stand head and shoulders above the others. Yes there might be hotel rooms in this city with better views if this massive megapolis, but none would match the typical Four Seasons reception. This hotel is an oasis in the middle of a huge and exciting city. Perfection has a price, but on this occasion it is well worth it!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is quite small (7 floors) comparing to average 5 and 6 stars hotels in Tokyo. We appreciated that we didnt get room in 35th floor or more because we had awful earthquake experience in skyscraper in Mandarin Oriental hotel 2 years ago in Tokyo.This little pearl is quite hidden next to the Tokyo central station and therefore we would recommned to order welcome service at the train. You just need to inform reception about number of train and your seating number and they will wait for you at the platform.The hotel is beautiful as all Four seasons hotels, but the big difference is great location, more family - boutique feeling and staff which recognize you second day.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff at this Four Seasons worked as a team to make our first time visit to Tokyo truly amazing. They took care of us even before we arrived. They answered our questions thoroughly and promptly and made our preparation easy. Our stay was exceptional because they anticipated our needs and went beyond to ensure our comfort. Their attention to every detail and sincere desire to please set them apart from the rest. While the amenities and location can be compared to other 5 star hotels, it would be hard for find one at this level of service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed 12/26 to 1/1/2015 with our family on holiday. The hotel greeted us with a driver at Haneda airport. Our room was modern, elegant and well appointed with Nespresso machine, high quality green and black tea,( have to mention the elegant serving tea pot and cups by Nikko) well stocked minibar, fresh apples in the hall way, pajamas, nice plush robes and slippers. HIgh end bath toiletries, deep soaking bath tub and large showers. The beds are quite comfortable. The spa is quite nice. We also enjoyed very attentive room service. A kids basket of treats was provided for our teenager, truly brought a smile. The Ekki restaurant served well prepared meals that were serviced by highly attentive staff. Also, excellent views and great location near Tokyo Station and Ginza. The Four Seasons in Tokyo exemplifies what a 5 star hotel should be.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Attention to each and every detail and willingness to please you are the priorities of everyone that works at this hotel. If you think that a few days in paradise after a full year of hard work are well deserved and money should not be a limiting factor, this is the place to stay in Tokyo. Concierge, Front Desk, Lounge/Bar, Room Service...all of them were flawless. Thank you for making my stay in Tokyo so enjoyable!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very convenient (right by the main station) and very friendly, this Four Seasons makes it very easy for a first time visitor. We asked for the airport greeting (which picks you up after immigration, gets you to the JR Counter at Narita, puts you on the train, and then meets you at Tokyo train station_, all perfect if you're tired from a long flight and new to Japan. The bar/restaurant is busy with business folk, but fairly relaxed. The rooms aren't huge but are very comfortable.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Rooms layout very functional yet designed elegantly. Concierge amazing and willing to help any requests. Hotel very accommodating to children. All this makes the hotel better than other five star hotels in Tokyo. If you want a combination of luxury, great service and a child friendly setting, this is the hotel to choose. Location perfect near Ginza. Definitely staying here again when coming back to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great choice when you are travelling with children. Kids absolutely loved the personalised services. Room size is great! Lots of space & Location cant be beat! Excellent Hotel & we will definitely make this hotel our CHOICE on our next trip to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This small, modern hotel is 2 minutes from Tokyo Station , so it's really convenient to get to Tokyo's main attractions. It's also close to Ginza - about a 5 minute walk - which is one of Tokyo's most glamorous neighborhoods, with fantastic shopping and restaurants. The concierge, especially Akhil (?), was very helpful. He helped me map out my travels around the city and to Nikko, which was a 2 hour trip from Tokyo. He also gave us great recommendations for restaurants and stores to buy gifts. The rooms are large and cozy, and the bathrooms beautiful and luxurious. The gym is small but has everything you need. My only complaint is that the rooms must be all smoking, because our room smelled as though they had just deodorized it heavily with perfume and cleaner. The smell was so strong that it gave me a headache.
user_name:
jwns
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Overnight stay between flights. First time to Tokyo. Requested the airport greeting service plus staff will meet you at the train station and walk you back for the return train. Standard room is actually a studio suite. All around excellent service from the staff. My thank you to the Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was my 3rd visit to Tokyo but my first time traveling to Japan with my two young boys (age 2 and 4). The front desk team was extremely accommodating and thoughtful, the concierge team had already prepared a customized tour booklet for my boys and kids snacks in our room. The size of our room was very spacious (in Tokyo standard) and I appreciate the proximity to the Tokyo station which made taking any subway line extremely easy. It was by far the best Four Seasons experience I had and I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was our first visit to Japan. Small hotel, but in a perfect location next to Tokyo Station. The service was always patient, gracious and cheerful, special thanks to Andrew in the "ekki" restaurant and Yuki the doorman/bellboy. The manager in the lobby on the morning of the 13th of December was also very helpful ( so sorry I didn't get this name), he retrieved my ring which I had left behind, as we were checking out. The rooms were very good. Sound proofing almost perfect, couldn't hear the trains, but there were ambulances and police cars going by 2 to 3 times a night, every night. Hmmmm. The bathrooms were great. The heated toilet seats were blissful. Room service is very good, and all meals came on time and were kept hot. We would definitely stay there again, many thanks to the wonderful staff at the Four Seasons Marunouchi!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My favorite brand when travelling is four stars and this hotel in tokyo is one of my favorite.It feels more of a boutique hotel and the staff are incredible.It offered us a wonderful stay and amazing memories

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I visited the Four Seasons during December 2014, and wow was it brilliant. Their level of service was outstanding. During our stay, they personally escorted us to the Tokyo train station (main trainstation only 200m away) and shows us how the system works and took us to the platform and showed us onto the train. The rooms were outstanding also meeting all our needs. I'll be definitely visiting the four seasons Tokyo ago.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel has a terrific location a four minute walk from Central station -- easy to catch the subway and high speed trains, great shopping inside -- in a upper end part of town. Location makes it easy to access all parts of Tokyo and catch high speed train to areas outside of Tokyo. Small footprint hotel. My room (King) was terrific, bathroom great and as you would expect in a Four Seasons. The restaurant (had breakfast and lunch) was excellent and workout facilities good for a business hotel. What set the experience apart was the service level of the staff -- from the bellman / woman, to front desk, concierge and employee's I encountered at the restaurant -- world class! I've had the good luck to stay at many 4-seasons and high end hotels and the service level here was better than any I've ever experienced. I love the 4-Season's properties, but management should train all of their hotels to be as service oriented as this one. It was personalized and above and beyond.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: You really can't beat this location, as it's right next to Tokyo station and you can get anywhere from there. As other reviewers have said, the train platform service is necessary and wonderful. When we arrived, a hotel representative met us at the train car and helped us with our bags as she took us to the hotel. We also utilized this service to get us onto the Narita Express train at the end of our stay. The hotel representative waited with us until the train arrived, made sure we got to the right car, and helped us get our luggage onto the appropriate space in the train car. The room had an amazing view of the Tokyo skyline and of the trains, with floor to ceiling windows and powered blackout curtains and also powered sheer curtains. All of the curtain controls and the room light controls were next to the two beds. We had a twin sized rollaway bed for no charge for our daughter. The room was spacious and elegantly and comfortably furnished. My favorite was the Nespresso coffee maker and the TV speakers in the bathroom. Everything in the room was conveniently and thoughtfully placed. On the slightly negative side, the room and the restaurant/spa level smelled like stale cigarette smoke. While that would be unacceptable in the USA, it seems to be not so rare in Japan and is probably one of those things that you just have to accept when you travel internationally. The hotel staff brought up an air purifying unit immediately when I noted the smoke smell, even though I told them I didn't think that the smell was a big problem. They really should do something about the smell on the restaurant/spa floor, though--it was significant. Throughout our stay, if the staff said they would do something, they did it immediately and we hardly had time to put down the phone before they were at the door or calling us back. The selection of TV channels was excellent and broad, and you could even order 3D movies at no charge. As is typical of Four Seasons hotels we were treated to a welcome plate of cookies and fruit with our daughter's name on it in chocolate syrup. There was good counter space in the bathroom, as well as a separate large shower and a large soaking tub (from which we could look at the city lights). This is a very small hotel (52 rooms). That's really nice when staying in the most populous city in the world. If you are looking for a hotel up to the standard of the Four Seasons Resorts, this is not quite it. This is pretty consistent with other city-based Four Seasons, though. My only complaint is with the restaurant. We've stayed in many Four Seasons and other luxury hotel brands around the world using our American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts benefit, and this is the only one that did not provide a good breakfast. If the hotels don't have a breakfast buffet, they usually let a person order anything off the menu as the free breakfast for 2. FH&R specifies that there is a continental breakfast that's supposed to be included, but we've never been limited so strictly anywhere else to just a continental breakfast. We were allowed to order off the menu for up to $30 per person. One would think that would be more than adequate to get any breakfast on the menu. Sadly, $30 would only buy coffee and a muffin (seriously). An a la carte bagel with cream cheese was $9 (not including beverage). The food was not exceptional. That being said, I would choose this hotel again. By the way, every staff member we encountered spoke English fluently and greeted us upon sight by name.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo is a lovely property. Size wise, it's more of a boutique hotel and the lobby tells you that. A simple driveway and two small counters for the Front Office and Concierge are all that greet hotel guests. In my case, I took advantage of their complimentary meet/greet service at Tokyo Station. This being my first visit to Tokyo, I was certainly not looking forward to the daunting task of navigating the labyrinth that is Tokyo Station. A member of the bell/concierge team met me on the platform of that my Shinkansen train came in on. Greeting me in English, I felt relieved that I would be able to communicate better with him as I have a very poor understanding of Japanese. I must commend this service as he guided me from the platform to the underground network that led to the hotel (took me a day to memorise the route but once I did, it became easy to navigate from the various train lines straight to the hotel).Upon reaching the lobby, I was usher straight to my room for the check-in. The rooms are located on the lower levels of the building, which lends to the more boutique feel. My room came with an excellent view of the Tokyo Station tracks and I could constantly observe trains moving in and out. Surprisingly, one could barely hear any noise from the tracks. The check-in formalities were completely very quickly. Not only that, but having asked the hotel for assistance with a restaurant reservation, prior to my arrival, I was presented with an envelope containing the restaurant confirmation and a fairly detailed map for the location. Furthermore, the luggage I had sent over from Kyoto was nicely placed in my room and the luggage covers removed and folded nicely in the closet. Bravo. The room itself is rather simple, a bit too simple for my liking but still comfortable. The rooms looks a little dated and could use a little sprucing up, still it was in good condition. The bed itself is very comfortable and the sleepwear equally good.One thing I have to praise is the location of the room's control panel. In most hotels, the panel is on the side table and facing outwards, meaning someone in bed has to adjust his/her body to see which buttons to press. At Four Seasons, the panel faces inwards to the bed, meaning a person in bed just has to turn left or right, very convenient. The mini-bar is rather well stocked and the fridge is big enough to store some of my own drinks. I liked that there's a full length mirror near the fairly big closet. Entertainment wise, the latest 3D TV is available, with a reasonably good selection of movies available for rent from the in-house library. Cables and international adapters were provided, again very helpful and very much what anyone would expect from major luxury chains. The bathroom is spacious enough although perhaps they should have installed a rain shower by now. The amenities are decent, soaps etc from Etro, but the simple plastic wrapping seems a bit cheap. Oddly enough, the spa/onsen amenities looked better than the ones in the room, those had proper boxes that promote the Four Seasons brand. Another issue is that the faucets did not indicate which were for hot water and which were for cold water, so it was a bit of guesswork the first time around. The handheld shower at the tub was also a bit too hot to handle when using hot water, they might wish to look into that. On the whole, minor issues aside, the location is quite unparalleled. Direct links to Tokyo Station meant being able to avoid the rain and the nearby Kyobashi Station meant I could go straight to the Ginza line easily. The staff were also most helpful in securing me a taxi to Tsukiji at 3am in the morning as well as arranging a taxi when checking out. Another praiseworthy act was that the staff called ahead to my next hotel and provided the taxi details, so that when I arrived, I was greeted by name. Excellent way to send off a guest and ending a very comfortable stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: nice place i enjoyed it love the place i want to visit again really super place wonderful place should use it open do your homework no yes go ahead right come on more than two hundred characters yes cool come on how many words i cant count help me haha

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Nothing is too much trouble at the Four Seasons in Tokyo. Personally picked up from the station, given advice about what to see and bookings for difficult attractions. The rooms are amazing - plush and luxurious. Lovely hot tub area to lounge in after a work out in the gym. Food amazing but expensive and the drinks on the top floor is a lovely thing to do before going out for dinner in the evening. A little oasis of luxury amongst the hustle bustle of Tokyo. Booked and got a deal via Booking.com.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I arrived late at night (1130pm) and were surprised by the tiny hotel lobby. There was only one person manning the counter. We checked in and found the room to be spacious, with all the amenities we wanted. The restaurant in the hotel and all eating places nearby had closed for the night. We had to dash across the road in heavy rain, to a nearby convenience store (Lawson), for some sandwiches. I had previously communicated with the hotel several times via e-mail regarding my visit, and it would have been good if they had told me regarding the lack of dining options at the tentative time of my arrival. The hotel was a little more lively the next morning, but still very quiet for a luxury hotel. Strangely, there are no restrooms or shops in the lobby area. Fortunately, the hotel is located over the wonderful Tokyo Station which had everything we wanted, including a Tokyu Hands store (within the Daimaru Dept store). We had outstanding service in almost every shop we walked into in Tokyo Station, and were often amused at the way waiters and shop assistants would bow repeatedly and smile and fuss over us, while speaking in Japanese! We generally had a wonderful time in the hotel, and in Tokyo. The room we stayed in deserves a full 5 stars. The lobby is just too small, however. Service too, was not up to 5 star standards. The staff were helpful and courteous, and the concierge, efficient. The young men especially, were very helpful, dashing about with umbrellas when we arrived from our trips in the rain. BUT....there was, to a large extent, a polite restraint which didn't quite do justice to the standards expected from a Four Seasons hotel. The staff often didn't make eye contact, did not look up to greet guests walking out of the lifts (tiny, empty lobby meant staff were less than 10 feet away, and there were no other guests around), and often seemed immersed in their computers and work. No one made any small talk nor did they inquire about our stay, or the trips we made to various places, some of which were planned through the hotel. Perhaps, this was due to a lack of proficiency in the English language among some staff members, although all the staff we met could converse in English. Regardless, our thanks to Misato, who was the concierge who helped book our tour to Mount Fuji, and to all the other staff members who made our stay a pleasant one. We would certainly like to return to the Four Seasons, and it remains a good place to stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location! A little bit hidden but walking distance from the train station and Ginza. Small but beautiful rooms. Really small lobby and amenities. Delicious breakfast. Great service! Very helpful and friendly concierge and staff. A little bit overpriced.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As a family of four, this was one of the only top level hotels that allows four persons in a suite. It actually saved money (not the mention the added on-line shopping time) of purchasing two separate rooms. The confectionary turkey (very cute) that they created on Thanksgiving was a nice personal touch which the kids loved. Of course, the rooms were spotless with the usual comfort and style that one would expect from any FS. The one special difference that made this hotel perfect was the location adjacent to Tokyo station. Tokyo station is a ridiculous labyrinth. The hotel has a service where we were met as our flight arrived at Narita. This service helped us purchase Narita express tickets, Suica card, walked us to the train with our luggage, placed our luggage on the train and showed us our seats. The FS staff met us on the platform and carried our luggage to the hotel. When we took the Shinkansen to Kyoto, they walked us to the platform. Finally, the hotel staff carried our luggage to the Narita express train platform when we departed.While the above may seem relatively simple, anyone who has traveled and experienced the frustration which only detracts from a vacation, understands and appreciates this benefit. To all those travelers who enjoy a good challenge and have no fear of getting lost, good luck in Tokyo station. We are convinced that the Kanji characters for the Tokyo station translate to 'you are now lost'.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staff was fantastic. They had a greeter for us at Narita and helped with the train to the hotel, a must for a couple. Smallest Four Seasons I've stayed at, but had everything we needed. Rooms were very large, only 57 in total. Food was good, ate breakfast, snacks, and dinner. Waking distance to Ginza and next door to train station. Cleanest city I've been too. Felt like we were in a high end condo building. Very quiet.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: the rooms are wonderful and the location is great ! the customer service is wonderful. However the price is very expensive for what you get. The breakfast is very basic and not up to the price you are charged for. I got free breakfast with my stay but only continental i.e basket of 2 toasts. Other hotels with the same price will offer you open buffet with everything you can imagine included in your rate. As platinum AMEX holder i usually get free stuff, not at the four seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A truly wonderful place in the heart of one of the most exciting cities in the world. Walking distance to everything (via train/subway). Once you conquer the foreign language and money difference (we speak little Japanese and this was/is our first time in Japan); you will find that this oasis is in the 'hub" of Tokyo. I could go on and on, but what sets this Hotel apart from everything, is the service. Total 5 star in all aspects without an air of pretension. The decor is modern and welcoming. A total surprise were the complimentary BMW bikes to use around the city. We rode around the Imperial Palace (located nearby) and neighborhood one morning. Be advised that most room are located right above the train tracks. It takes a bit getting used too, but the noise was not a problem such the floor to ceiling windows are very well insulated; and actually to watch all is the action in such a pleasant environment is fun. Yes, we will hopefully will be back soon!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As you can see I am totally raving about the beds,they are so delicious it is almost criminal to get up in the morning-just one more minute....Everything else normal high quality Four Seasons,extra helpful staff,huge room,not cheap but you wouldn't expect it to be.Love,love,love it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. It certainly does the 4 Seasons brand credit, by far the no 1 hotel in Tokyo.Perhaps the greatest feature is the location, just steps away from the Ginza, and Tokyo station.I like to jog every morning and the close availability of quality running routes is amazing!This hotel has my vote.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I return on business for about my tenth time over the past 8 years. The welcome is still very friendly and room quality has been maintained. Good access to Tokyo station and Ginza.They have finally updated the toiletries - now Etro.One of the top hotels in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a short tale, not a review or complaint, just a wish for promised excellence.We are a recently married couple who have decided to take our honeymoon in the 4 Seasons Marunouchi. We have been so impressed by reviews of this establishment. We are thinking of booking our short and well earned rest there.One of us, having been diagnosed a few years ago with an illness which can exacerbated by digestion of certain foods, we explained this to a very efficient and creative member of the Four Seasons - Marunouchi Staff. We shall refrain from mentioning a name and look forward to thanking this individual personally. What we are looking for is a memorable honeymoon experience as detailed by Nanithiya (thank you) as well as a way to avoid hidden extra charges. It well known that a hotel of this calibre commands a high price. Excellence, of course, lives in this domain.We did mention our schedule for one of two days in a message to another member of the 4 Seasons Staff and received a reply recommending that I do almost exactly what had been outlined in detail in the first mail. I was worried then that our message had been given only a cursive glance and the response had been nothing more than a mail signature in which our name had been incorrectly written. With that in mind, after everything experienced so far we shall try to remain positive, trust that you will make this a truly memorable (in a good way) experience and will be delighted to crown our next review with a well-earned 5 stars.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I stayed 4 nights at this hotel. We booked a deluxe room as the suites were not available. The hotel is very conveniently located close to Tokyo station ( you are at walking distance to Ginza). Room and bathroom were spotless . Service was extremely friendly and professional. Breakfast was good and prepared with very fresh ingredients. The hotel is very small ( only 4 floors + one for the restaurant and the fitness center): so, do not be surprise by the tiny lobby...

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed with my family for 3 nights. I took 2 rooms with a connecting door. No doubt that this hotel justifies its name. This hotel meets the highest standards Four Seasons sets for its hotels.It is an excellent hotel. It has a prime location-close to Tokyo station, close to Ginza and near a lot of shopping centers. Rooms are huge and beautiful, and very well equipped. The fitness room was very good. The hotel's staff is the highlight of this hotel. One evening, when we entered the hotel after a long day, someone asked us if our son has a birthday. We confirmed, and went up to our rooms. After 10 minutes one of the hotel's staff arrived with a birthday cake for all of us. She took a picture of us (which they put in a nice frame and gave it to us at the check-out process), and said some warm words. That was a superb gesture, and those small things, upgrade the quality of the guest's stay at the hotel. Every time we stay at the Four Seasons, we are more than happy with our decision. No doubt that we will return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here for a few nights in February/March 2014 with our 2 year old son. Quite simply, it was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. The staff was exceptional, including the concierge and reception. They coordinated a number of complicated activities for us, including a challenging photo shoot to announce the upcoming birth of our son.As for the room, our 2 year old loved the huge windows overlooking the train station. True to other comments, the hotel met us at Tokyo Station and helped us considerably upon arrival.The food and room service was exceptional.We would recommend the hotel to anyone, and will definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent seven nights here and loved every minute of our stay.If you are after a hotel that is close to everything this is the place to stay, it's a 10 minute walk to Ginza for shopping, a short taxi ride to the fish markets (¥900). It's close to the subway to go to Asakusa and Tokyo sky tree as well as being in walking distance of the Imperial Palace.The staff walked us to the bus stop and got us on the airport bus and will also meet you/take you to the train.The hotel itself is small but the rooms are huge. The staff are super friendly and Speak English and can't do enough for you and I must single out the concierges (especially Yoko) who can help you with any request.The hotel breakfasts are amazing with both Western and Japanese options. The restaurant is fine dining though the service and timing of meals doesn't match the price, but the food is excellent. As other writers have noted though the prices in the bar and light dining section are outrageous.The gym and small Onsen are excellent, the rooms are quiet and amenities first class, I could easily live here.This hotel meets the highest standards Four Seasons sets for its hotels.I have one complaint though Four Seasons, get with the 21st century and ban smoking in the hotel and bar/eating areas, your staff are being smoked on as are all the other non smoking patrons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights in Sept. We took the Narita express from the airport. We were met by a Four Seasons representative in the train station and escorted to the hotel. We thought this may be unnecessary but the train station is very busy and on first arrival challenging to navigate. The hotel is very close to the station ( less than a 2min walk). Our room was in a great location to watch the bullet trains arriving and departing the station. Ginza shopping area is very close to the hotel. The breakfast service was excellent. The concierge was very helpful with restaurant recommendations and information about the surrounding area.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Smaller hotel that is very conveniently located next to Tokyo station. That was a relief after navigating the craziness of the station. Beautiful and spacious room. Service was excellent, though the attention to detail at the restaurant was perhaps not quite at the level of other FS properties we have visited. Great location close to Ginza, but really, Tokyo is so massive there are many different parts of the city that one could choose to stay. But for a property close to shopping and fish market, I wouldn't this was perfect. I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A rather small property for the Four Seasons - part of a large office tower complex just south of Tokyo Station. Very convenient if coming in from Narita on the Narita express train. Four Seasons offers a complimentary service to greet you on the train platform and escort you to the hotel. I found it with out this (good to know you want the Yaesu Sotuh exit if on your own) but might be helpful for some travelers.Rooms are nice, all the amenities a business traveler needs (robes, desk space, outlets that are easy to reach, nice deep sink to rinse out sweaty work out clothes, hair dryers that are less effective than American hairdryer due to lower electrical output in Japan. Gym is small but in the several days I was there never say more than 1 other person in the 6-7 AM time frame when business oriented hotels often have crowded fitness rooms full of jet lagged guests.Nice walk/job around the imperial palace from the hotel- a little under 4 miles from the hotel around the loop and back. Also a nice and easy walk to the Ginza area. Felt safe doing both in early evening hours as woman alone.If business puts you near Tokyo Station a good location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a first rate hotel in a very nicely located section of Tokyo. The staff is attentive and you get the kind of experience you expect from a luxury hotel. The food is first rate. Very close to the Ginza if that is a consideration. Many thanks!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This might be the 4 Seasons smallest property, but the service is above and beyond, as expected from a Four Seasons property. The small size means that the staff is able to focus a lot of attention on its guests. The staff is fluent in English and in English slang so they have no problem conversing with English I speaking guests. We did find out from one staff member that they are sent to San Francisco for English language class (for a year...2 years?) which explains their command of English and casual speaking.The hotel is located in the business district, just steps from Tokyo Station which meant it was easy for us to get around using the subway system and rail system. The location is not as exciting as many popular areas of Tokyo, however we found it to be a nice location and not as crowded. And it is located a block away from the Ginza area so we were plenty close to great shopping and restaurants.We picked this hotel because it is consistently ranked as the best place to stay with kids and I can attest that it is true. The kids are treated as special guests also and there are many kid and family-friendly elements at the hotel. The best being that they served American kid food. With 1 kid who is a picky eater and 1 who has food allergies, it was nice to have a backup of familiar food.You can't go wrong staying at this property. Sure, it's not as star-studded and trendy as other chain hotels located in Roponggi, but you will be treated as if you are the only guests in the building.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Wonderful hotel with really nice rooms and exceptionally good and helpful service. Delicious food (breakfast and dinner) in restaurant. Very central location by Tokyo Station, Emperor's Palaca and Ginza. Nice fitness room and hot bath. Would love to go back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have recently been staying in this excellent hotel for 10 days.Room and staff were fantastic. Food excellent and service in all asbects super.Everybody speaks english. This is the best hotel I`ve ever stayed at in my 40 years of travelling a lot.Simply amazing.Keep it up.I will definetely come back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I traveled with our two kids (age 2 and 4) and stayed at the Four Seasons. The view from the room was amazing. Basically a direct view of Tokyo Station with all the JR trains and Shinkansens coming and going at all hours of the day. The view was especially cool at night, our son loved it. When we arrived, the hotel arranged to have cookies delivered to our room with our kids names written on them, milk was in the fridge, color pencils, coloring books and activity books. The bathroom also included rubber duckies, soap and shampoo especially for kids and even slippers for kids. They pretty much thought of everything. Despite the hotel being right next to the train station, the noise was hardly noticeable and never a problem. Being that it's right next to the station, going to different parts of the city was a breeze and not to mention the hundreds of restaurants available underground. My wife did the spa, she loved it, I worked out several times I loved it (but felt sorry for the people I saw still working in the offices at 11PM on a Friday night). Throughout our stay, all the staff went out of their way to make our vacation better, but I really have to single out Yoko Tsuji for really going above and beyond. We stayed in a one bedroom suite , it was bigger than we needed and think families could easily be comfortable in a smaller room. Thank you Four Season at Marunouchi, we had a great time and we will stay with you on our next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Per other reviews the location supports exploring Tokyo to the max. Concierge was very helpful with local maps, trains routes, etc to support your outings. Gym at the hotel was excellent, large with great views and usually empty. The Onsen on offer was good - not authentic or very large but seemed nice to squeeze in. Received some great personalized service from Ellie and exceptional outdoor attendant, Yuki (?). Large room, lots of closet and storage spaces, lovely bathroom, and fruits in the hallway, a great space. Drinks upstairs were outrageously priced, as were any food and beverage -utilized great cafe on first floor of office building attached for take out breakfast of coffee and pastries to support reasonable expenses most days. Borrowed hotel bikes - was a nice plus to tour the city - no helmets to fit my head available. A fun stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We visited the hotel in mid-August. It was my wife and five year old daughter. I mean there is no hotel like the Four Seasons Tokyo. First of all, their level of service is amazing and the hotel itself is just so perfectly understated that it really is luxury and relaxation right in the hear of Tokyo. There are so many things to say but really will list a few important things here:1. The train platform greeting service is amazing. After taking the Narita Express to Tokyo Station, we were greeted right at our car and our luggage was taken by two employees right to the hotel which is a 5-8 minute walk from Tokyo Station.2. The area is a perfect place to stay. Sooooo close to Ginza and have all the trains right outside the door meant that taking the metro was a breeze.3. The are FANTASTIC with kids at the hotel. Its almost as if kids get their own personal service. From a kids size robe and slippers, to a great kids menu to a manager survey just for kids to fill out (color in), they have this completely taken care of..While this is not our blog, I would say this is a complete guide to the benefits of family travel at the Four Seasons in Tokyo: http://familyholidays.fourseasons.com/parents-insider-guide-to-family-travel-four-seasons-tokyo-at-marunouchi/4. The hotel was amazing helping us book restaurants or anything else we needed...well in advance5. It may seem illogical but get a room that looks down at the train tracks. So cool to see bullet trains and other trains coming in and out of Tokyo Station6. The hotel is so peaceful and quite. The facilities from the spa and restaurant were wonderfulBottom line, this is a small hotel that can really look after your needs. It may not have all of the larger hotel facilities like a pool and etc but who cares. The service, the closeness to Tokyo Station and Ginza, their ability to look after their guests (including young ones) and the overall quality of your stay is truly amazing. Great job Four Seasons at Marunouchi. Will look forward to saying with you again in the future...

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very nice room,service excellent, location good. Gym smallish but has all you need including dumbells freeweights. I'd rate this hotel 5 star easily even before they got my passport to Haneda in half an hour from I called having realized it was in the safe - that would warrant six stars rating!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I arrived early in the morning my room was already available, it was wonderful,during breakfast all options are available,The concierge helped us with restaurants sending our luggage a head all with a smile and very positive attitude.I will decently recommend

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I've visited Tokyo approx. 50 times over the past 15 years and stayed at many hotels in the city but have found the Four Seasons Marunouchi to be the best!! While they have created a sanctuary of quiet and sophistication in Tokyo's busy city center which is conveniently located one block from the Tokyo train station ...the Four Seasons team has found the formula for not only delivering great service & hospitality but lasting good memories to the people fortunate enough to stay there. All my positive experiences at this hotel are sincerely FAR too long to list in this review but I highly recommend that you... STAY THERE ...and look closely. You will find far more than what you expected and leave like I have every time thinking that it was a truely wondeful experience and...when can I come here again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons has a great location. At first on a map I wasn't so sure, but once I learned how close the various metro lines really were, this location was really ideal. Lots of food and shopping is within walking distance. Of course, Four Seasons was top-class in service all around. The amenities provided for our 22-month old made it easier to have a toddler on our vacation!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Nothing compares with the Four Seasons! Excellent service, Elegant and luxurious accomodations.But the best thing about Four Seasons Tokyo is the location . Its next to the Tokyo Station and shopping. We went there winter time and we did not have to brave the cold weather because the buildings have connections underground. They have a personal bellhop to greet and assist you at the train station. Upon arrival at Narita, we emailed the hotel our train schedule , car number and seats . When we reached tokyo station, the bell hop was by the trainplatform holding our the fourseasons sign. It was remarkable! The rooms are all big and spacious.My kids were also delighted to receive a japanese snacks goody basket when we checked in. Check in is very personalized and private, you dont check in at the lobby although theres the usual frontdesk. All guests are led to their rooms upon arrival and all paperworks are done at your desk in your hotel room. The very steep price is worth every penny.Loved our stay!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons is very well located to Tokyo Station. We had the misfortunate of arriving on the wrong side of the building, and entering via the office foyer, which was confusing and uninspiring.But once inside the hotel, we were greeted by the delightful Sachi and proceeded to have a very enjoyable dinner upstairs.The dining area was uncrowded and has a quiet and refined feel. Staff were very good, particularly Takeshi that served our table. I had a 3-course dinner that was reasonable value for a location like this. Takeshi advised that my chosen entree and dessert options were quite similar (both featuring figs, balsamic dressing, etc), which was a nice touch.Drink service was attentive without being intrusive, and they had my preferred and somewhat obscure preferred type of gin (Hendricks).Mildly disappointed that when I felt like a coffee-flavoured "dessert", the bar staff couldn't figure out an espresso martini, or an affogato... But that aside, everything was perfect.While this is clearly not a cheap hotel, I would definitely return here to dine or stay for this location and service level.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had a superb 4 nights holiday stay in August. The rooms and hotel is nicely designed with a big TV. We had a room on the 3rd floor, facing the road, and it was fine, as we heard no noise. The bathrooms feels luxurious with a bathtub and nice shower. you can tell they use expensive material. The room is also considered big for tokyo standards. The wifi was free. The location is excellent, next to 2 lines, namely the ginza line (Kyobayashi station) and the tokyo line (tokyo station). It's convenient to get to and from the airport with the narita express. There are lots of food to eat around the area and shopping in particular in the Yaesu shopping mall and 1st Avenue tokyo, (the underground shopping and eating tunnels) which is 5 mins walk from the hotel. There is also the daimaru shopping mall with lots of food in the basement. The hotel is also about 10 mins walk to ginza which is a shopping and eating area. The service was excellent. The staff was very nice. The gym was well equipped. There is also an onsen in the spa. The hotel also offers bicycle to ride around the area on the weekends. If you are there on a sunday, you can take the bicycle for a ride to the imperial palace. The hotel also offers pick up service from the train station which is very helpful. On the day we left, the porter help to transport our bags to the train station airport express, and it was great as it help save us a lot of time finding our way in the tokyo station which is huge.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed here with my sister in December as part of my usual stopover in Tokyo before boarding a plane back to Australia. It's so convenient to have a hotel right at Tokyo station for the Shinkansen and also for Narita Express - plus it's an easy hop to shopping districts (although with the great train system in Tokyo it's not difficult to get anywhere).The hotel is clean, comfortable, and the staff are very professional. We were treated very well, and we had a package that included breakfast and an afternoon tea (coffee and cake). Both were excellent. And we were high up, with a great view.Great hotel for both business and pleasure.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Traveled in Nov '13 with my husband and 4 year old son. Stayed at the Four Seasons at the tail end of our Japan trip. This Four Seasons is a fairly small hotel so I suggest booking in advance to get the room you want. We stayed in a deluxe premier room. Although we wanted to stay in a suite, this room ended up working out fine in terms of space. We could hear the trains going by but over time we started to drown it out.The proximity to Tokyo Station is extremely helpful for when you are arriving into and leaving Tokyo. FS has a complimentary platform service in which a bellman will pick you and your bags up from the train and also offers the same service when you are leaving. Overall though, the service was not as friendly and helpful as I was used to with Four Seasons properties or properties of similar caliber. We needed to head across town and asked the concierge how to do so. She suggested taking a taxi, which was the wrong idea. It took a LONG time causing us to almost miss our train to the airport. The saving grace was the bellman helping us with platform service. He went ABOVE & BEYOND to help us make our train to Narita. The room service selection was fairly limited given our dietary restrictions. We had trouble the first night getting room service to answer and when they did, it took multiple people to answer questions about the menu.All in all, not a bad stay. Great room. Great location for getting in and out of Tokyo. Nicer hotels in Tokyo in my opinion.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Room with a wall of glass on the outside so you can see all without any effort (if I can say so), may be it was formed to be an office before. But the room is big and nice to stay. nice and friendly staff with lots of fruits in the corridor at every floor.Just a little walk to Tokyo station and long walk to Ginza so it is great location to stay in tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great stay. Friendly staff. Hotel offers service whereby they will walk you to nearest subway and help you buy ticket and get on train. Stylish hotel. Japanese toilets! 5minutes walk from Rose Bakery. Trendy shops very close by. Close to Joel Robuchon cafe.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Personal service from both front desk and concierge. Beautifully decorated and quiet and clean rooms. Great location next to Tokyo Station and Ginza. Very nice restaurant and spa and fitness center. Staff speaks English.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This time I stayed at Deluxe one-bedroom suite:First, the staff were excellent and professional. The staff treated every customer as their families; it was such a positive attitude that really impressed me. I booked the restaurant and already arranged a map to help me find its location. The check-in and check-out were smooth; when I checked out, everyone again said goodbye to me. How respectful and pleasant!Second, I love the one-bedroom deluxe suite, and thanks so much for upgrading! The room was spacious and the facilities were gorgeous. I love the 3-D TV and Bose speaker. The bathroom was also huge and the bathtub was relaxing!Third, the location was awesome. It was close to Tokyo station and every area in Tokyo was easily accessible.Finally, the gym was very nice too!Other than the hotel itself, the restaurants were superb! The food and drink were tasty too!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: WE went to TOKYO for summer vacation and we Stayed aT this GREAT HOTEL, with an excellent SERVICE, GREAT ROOMS and calm and elegant AMBIENCE. ALL The staffTwas READY to Serve and help you. The main RESTAURANT HAD AN INCREDIBLE CITY VIEWand theE FOOD WAS also great THE gym and spa are VERY clean and full with your necessity WHILE YOU WORKOUT YOU Can enjoy a great city view also.Just a block away from THE TOKYO TRAIN STATION and A FEW blocks away from GINSA.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I may be biased but the 4 Seasons hotel never disappoint. This one is absolutely fantastic,From the staff at the reception to the restaurant and the concierge, they all make a maximum to make your stay with them unforgettable.They go to the station to book train ride for you.They gave you excellent tips for visiting, shopping, eating ...They are the best, but this property is absolutely fantastic, design is beautiful, rooms are well design for two people in them. Nespresso machine...I will go back.They have 57 rooms and are 57 steps away from the main station. The hotel bar face the station with train coming and going, fascinating! Loved it

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I recently spent a week long vacation in Tokyo. After reading all the positive reviews we decided to stay at the Four Seasons Tokyo at Marunouchi.We were quite confused about where in Tokyo to stay - not only the hotel but the area. So much is written about the areas and what to do in Tokyo.We ended up emailing some hotels and I have to say, the staff at this hotel are absolutely AMAZING. Excellent communication from the start.We did decide to book at the Four Seasons. Once we did, we also arranged transportation from Haneda and a number of restaurant reservations.Every communication was so fast and so professional... EXCELLENT job by the Concierge team!Once we arrived in Tokyo, there was zero issue with the transportation pick up; check in was so quick and the room, amazing.We stayed in the Four Seasons Executive Suite... separate bedroom and a little more space. Very nice.The hotel is on a few floors of an office tower - next to the Japanese Rail station and a 10 minute walk to Kyobashi station which is on the Ginza line and you will want to use that line as Ginza is the place for shopping and food.Room service was impeccable, delicious and always prompt.Our day to day interactions with the hotel were so incredible. The staff truly want you to enjoy your time and give so much attention to detail.I cannot say enough about this property and of Tokyo itself.... we want to return to Tokyo very soon, and I can't wait to see our home away from home at the Four Seasons Tokyo Marunouchi again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Another great stay at a Four Seasons property. We chose this hotel for our family's four nights in Tokyo because we wanted two queen beds (impossible to find in Japan, except here). We didn't know we would enjoy the location, the views of Tokyo Station trains, and the atmosphere of the small boutique property as much as we did! From the first encounter while planning our trip, the concierge service was exceptionally helpful (better than any other FS we can recall), even through our family's return from Kyoto through Tokyo Station to Narita -- staff met us and led us through the station maze. The location provided easy access to the Imperial Palace and to Tokyo Station for local travel or transit to other Japanese cities. The hotel gym was a good cure for jet lag. The small spa offered a relaxing massage to aid sleep. The restaurant was ideally situated for train watching at Tokyo Station below -- mezmorizing. The restaurant food was unremarkable but we appreciated the 2AM room service (steak and fries) to satisfy a US time zone hunger attack. We slept well each night and returned to the hotel each afternoon for a relaxing, cool respite from the city. Highly recommend the FS Marunouchi.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is close to perfection. We went to Tokyo for a 5 night City break, and it wouldn't have been as good as it was without the service from the FS. Communication before we arrived was excellent and really helpful. We upgraded to a suite when we arrived, as we had our two kids with us. We were not disappointed - 800 sq ft, 2 bathrooms, 3D tvs, great views etc. Personalised welcomes packs and cookies arrived for the kids an hour after check in. We found Tokyo a bit difficult to get around, but if you enquire at concierge, you will be escorted to the train station and put on the right train for the place you want to go to!The best example for me ( and there were many over the short break) was on check out. It was early morning, and I was arranging transfers while my wife and children were getting the last few things from the room. I asked if there was a bakery on the way to the platform as we had skipped breakfast (it was 6.30 am). When I collected my family and came back down, the guy at reception had arranged for a selection of pastries and drinks to be handed to us for our journey. If we went back, I would stay no where other than here.If there was one criticism, breakfast is expensive (but nice),

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Had a really nice stay. Room was spacious with great views. Staff friendly and keen to assist. Location could not be more central. Nice high end shops within minutes from the hotel. Will be back in 2015 with the family. Tokyo is such a vibrant and exciting city.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staff makes you feel at home, important and valued as a client!Great location next to the Tokyo Station and the Ginza. Also in a very trendy area with the Shin Marunouchi Building with nice shopping and many interesting restaurants!.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: hotel is in a great location, walking distance to GINZA, best part is the help provided by the staff to navigate tokyo station which can be very confusing especially catching narita express to airport or catching bullet train if you want to go to Mt Fuji by your own. also you can save taxi fare as the hotel is next to tokyo station. rooms are also very nice

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were deciding between the FS, Peninsula and Mandarin Oriental for the last part of our trip in Japan. On hindsight, we should have followed our initial impressions and stayed at the MO. We love the MO chain and have had many fantastic experiences in their outfits throughout Asia, but given its location near Tokyo Station and that it was closer to the main shopping belt in Ginza and the Imperial Palace, we opted for the FS. We have previously stayed in several FS hotels, but this stay (in addition to our other experiences) confirmed for us that FS has not reached the standards that MO has accomplished. Don’t get us wrong – the FS Tokyo is in no way a bad option, or that our experiences was in any way lacklustre, but we felt that there was nothing particularly special or memorable about our overall stay.Pros:What the FS in Tokyo does excel in is the service rendered to us throughout our stay, though we have come to accept this as part of the norm of fantastic service during our entire stay in Japan. Special mention goes to the concierge staff who responded to our requests via email promptly and made dinner reservations for us, as well as Yuki who brought us to the limousine bus service station and stayed with us till we boarded the coach. We appreciated Yuki's commitment to service very much.As mentioned, the hotel was located very close to JR Tokyo Station which would be excellent for those arriving on bullet train or Narita (Yaesu South Exit). There are also limousine bus services to/from Haneda and Narita airports across the street of the FS. The FS also provides Meet and Greet services at train platforms in Tokyo Station if you come in by train and let the hotel know in advance. It is also accessible to several subway lines which would bring you to other parts of Tokyo quickly for sightseeing and shopping. There are many dining options in Tokyo station itself and the Daimaru department store. As with all the department stores throughout Tokyo, a special highlight was exploring its food and supermarket section. Lastly, the hotel is a short 10-15 minute walk to the heart of Ginza (Mitsukoshi, Matsuya, Uniqlo, Mikimoto, etc.) and the concierge provides a useful map of the vicinity. Cons:If we were to be fastidious and especially given the cost of the room, small and minor details on the part of housekeeping could be attended to more closely. This was surprising given that this was Japan, the land where attention to details is almost second nature. Small touches could be incorporated into the overall experience which we assumed was the norm in many luxury hotels we have stayed in before. This could include leaving a piece of chocolate or a Japanese treat on the bedside during turn-down; or even replenishing the welcome fruit plate the next day. The room could also be kept neater. There was also no hotel booklet documenting the services provided on our desk. We could have overlooked all of these if not for the fact that FS is a luxury hotel in a competitive market. We also felt that there could be some elements of 'Japanese-ness' incorporated into the aesthetics and design elements of the hotel, which could easily be accomplished. We did enjoy the complimentary Wifi and the bed, which was very comfortable for our busy days in Tokyo but the room, while elegant and spacious, was nothing particularly special. It is also surprising that the hotel management has not addressed this when other reviewers have also made mention of this. The FS is a good hotel that has an enviable location especially for those who would like to have access to Tokyo Station and we enjoyed the boutique, intimate feel of this hotel (with only over 50 rooms). However, as other reviewers have mentioned, we do not find it sufficiently compelling to return to stay in it again, unless the price offered was good and if we needed to take a train in Tokyo Station to travel in Japan. Otherwise, we would certainly opt for and recommend the MO the next time we visit Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service level provided at Four Seasons, Tokyo is outstanding. The staff goes out of their way to be helpful, including assisting with train tickets and transportation of luggage to and from the train station. The room was beautiful and very well equipped. I would be extremely happy to stay at FS Tokyo for business or pleasure on my next trip to Tokyo. One element that I did not expect, was the complication in communication. I was a bit surprised that the English speaking staff did not have as good a comprehension level as I would have expected. That said, they all made a tremendous effort and there were no problems. There was an Arab gentleman working at the concierge desk and his English was flawless. Language issues were not actually a problem, it was just the one element that was less than what I expected. We had a complicated schedule because we were arriving at Narita at 6pm and wanted to have a very nice sushi dinner.
