Being a Sunday pm, this was complicated, but prior to arrival we worked with the concierge and were able to secure a reservation at an outstanding restaurant, Sushi Kanesaka. I would highly recommend this property to any visitor to Tokyo. It's beautiful, the service is excellent and the location is perfect. Although only in Tokyo overnight, we truly enjoyed our stay.
user_name:
nyctuna
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is adjacent to Tokyo Station, a major hub for train service. That makes it very convenient for getting around. It is also 5 minutes walking from the Hop On/Hop Off hub at the Mitsubishi Building. The imperial Palace and Park is within a short walk as well.It can easily be reached from Narita airport by direct train service and that places you in the center of that city. Rooms, room service and the 7th floor restaurant were all fine.Prior to our getting to Tokyo,the concierge was most helpful in arranging a day trip to Kyoto via Shinkansen with Sunrise Tours and then a private guided tour for the next day. Once there, staff was very attentive. On the day of departure, a staff member even escorted us all the way to the boarding platform of the Narita Express to the airport. That really helped because Tokyo Station can be a maze to those unfamiliar with it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel in Tokyo for six nights in July 2014. This hotel is in my opinon about as good as a hotel can be expected to be. We were met by a very nice and helpful receptionist, Rikky, who took good time to show us around the hotel facilities and helped us get installed in our room. The staff were always very friendly and polite, and they all seemed eager to help. And they spoke english, and that is not a given in Japan yet. The room was a standard room, but there was not anything standard about it. A great, very comfortable king size bed, a spaceous room - space is expensive in Tokyo - with all you can possibly need. Nice, modern, light and expensive furniture, a big flat screen tv with blueray player and surround system. Lots of tv channels in different languages and a film library to choose from + possibilities to connect your own equipment via bluetooth or cable - a selection of connectors were supplied, 24 hour room service (a little bit expensive though), Bose sound system with music and radio, electric operation of room lighting, curtains and blends from both bedsides, dimmers on the lights etc. The room also proved to be very quiet. The bathroom was also first class with a big tub in the middle and separat shower and toilet rooms plus a big counter with sink, all in beautiful stone and glass, The toilet seat was heated, and had all the gadgetry you expect in Japan. The spacious bath was equiped with nice bath robes, toothbrushes, shaving equipment, hair dryer, magnifying shaving mirror with lights and a good selection of very thick and nice towels etc. In the hallway there was a minibar filled with good stuff, wine, beer, liquors, fruit juices, water plus more. Next to it a cupboard with crackers, nuts, chocolate, chips, a high quality whisky selection, coffee, tea, a Nespresso machine and a good selection of high quality glassware from Schott Zwiesel. The hallway also had a large clothing cabinet with lights and things you may need, like a large brush, slippers, shoehorn etc. It also featured a large floor to roof mirror that was possble to hide for those who doesn't want to see themselves ;-) The hotel has a very nice bar with a quiet and comfortable lounge and a very nice restaurant with a great view of the surrounding area. The service there was also great. Furter more the hotel has a spa, but we never had a chance to try it. There is also a small gift shop. Then there is the location! This hotel is located about as centrally in Tokyo as it is possible to get. It is right next to Tokyo Station in Maranouchi, next to the Emperors park and with Ginza with it's 6000+ restaurants on the other side. Just outside the hotel there was a staircase that led down to the underground station area with access to the subway and the Shinkansen and other trains, e.g. the Narita Express plus what must have been 100+ restaurants and shops. Luxury food stores, all sorts of restaurants and all very clean and nice. We had a great stay and would love to come back. Tokyo is also the cleanest city we have ever been to, we saw no drunks, beggars etc. neither and we always felt very safe. To top it all of, Tokyo didn't at all turn out to be as expensive as we had expected. Coming from redicuously expensive Norway it actually felt cheap. Highly recommended!!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is perhaps one of the best hotels in the world. The service is unbelievable. The friendly and accomodating staff will cater to every request and if they don't know the answer they will find it. The rooms are functional and comfortable. All amenities imaginable. If you are not concerned with money or someone else is picking up the tab, this is definitely an excellent choice for Tokyo.
user_name:
Jon7709
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our first trip to Japan and we picked this hotel because of its location near the shopping district and next to the train station. We were very pleased with the service and fully English speaking staff. The hotel is not that big but the rooms are rather large for Japan and very modern. Wait till you get used to the Japanese toilets. I highly recommend this establishment. They were very helpful in hiring taxis, reserving restaurants and had a special attention to our 12 year old daughter (welcome personalized cookies) Bravo. The hotel restaurant was also very nice but somewhat pricey. Arigato gozaimasu! :)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff of all departments make this hotel great, period. Service, service service!!! They arranged tours, physically guided us to transportation, made recommendations and reservations for dinners, helped with our luggage walking with us to the bus terminal for the airport. By far one of the best hotel we have ever stayed in.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My kids ages 13 and 10 loved the customized experience. The service and staff were excellent even by Japanese standards. The corner room was very large and beautiful. The beds were Western size Queen's (so no problem sharing) and were the most comfortable bed I've ever been in. Slippers, Robe, Pajama's, fruit and cookies, espresso machine, tea were all appreciated. No hesitation staying there with the family. I would highly recommend this hotel to any person and/or family. Worth the money.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is relatively small hotel just a block or two from the Tokyo train station, a very convenient location. The hotel itself is peaceful and quiet, with wonderful, helpful and friendly staff. The concierge was very helpful in arranging a tour guide for us and making recommendations for dinners and reservations. We used their airport meet and greet service to assist us in getting money changed, train tickets bought, and they met us on arrival in Tokyo and helped us with our luggage walking to the hotel. (All this cost extra.) Breakfast was not included but we ordered room service for breakfast, and that was beautifully done and served. Our room was spotless, comfortable, and our only complaint was the lack of coffee or tea making in the room. We also had dinner in the restaurant one night. The dining room is lovely, the view is great, and the food was terrific. The place seemed quite popular. We did not have good service in the restaurant, though, and seemed to have been forgotten until we finally gave up and left without dessert because we couldn't get service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is one of the best I have been ever!! The staff was incredible, the rooms were super clean and I loved the japan hospitality.Good value for money.Everything was great!! Highly Recommended

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights. It's a great location. A 3 minute walk from the Yaesu South exit of Tokyo Station. The hotel only has a few floors about a few dozen rooms so actually is rather small . In other words, no big crowds, so seems quite peaceful inside. While all the rooms are on floors 3 through 7 so no huge city views, our room was a corner with wrap around windows along two entire walls so was very bright. There were automated drapes & blinds which worked well to block the light, and proximity to the street didn't cause undue noise. The room was a good size (we paid extra for the Deluxe Premiere Queen room). For our daughter, they had a gift basket prepared with candies & treats. The hotel location is great as you can get pretty much everywhere from Tokyo Station.The restaurant is pricey, but nearby there are many restaurant options. For breakfast we went twice to the restaurant immediately before the entrance to the train station which had snacks & bento boxes; they spoke some English there which was helpful. If you have JR passes, you can go into Tokyo Station past the gates to buy snacks, water, or whatever else you might need from the stores therein.Note there is no pool at the hotel although they have a fitness center.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A recent 10 night stay at this hotel with my family did not disappoint. Service was outstanding and gracious. Room was fantastic (bed was heavenly). Amenities too notch. I highly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Tokyo.
user_name:
Stacy P
Sacramento, California, United States

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: While other more resortish FS might trump thus one in the luxurious front, no other comes close to the personal service here. This is not too say that the rooms here are not luxurious, contrary, the rooms are well appointed and very comfortable...and huge by tokyo and any standards. However the level of service at this four seasons is above all; starting from the meet and greet from the platform of the narita express line, to the attentive but not over bearing attention at the bar and spa.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I am a frequent business travel and have a hotel management degree (although no longer in the business). I can honestly say that my five day stay at the Four Seasons at Marunouchi was the best experience I have every had at any hotel. I stayed in an incredibly clean, well appointed room overlooking the railway. I found the room to be adequately quiet, despite the proximity to the tracks. I spent many hours in the room either working or fighting my jet lag. The technology worked perfectly at all times, and I felt extremely comfortable. The bathroom was nothing short of stunning - Full marble, separate shower from the giant bath with completely hidden drains (astounding), and at all times spotless. What makes this small hotel stand out is the quiet, dignified service provided. It was overwhelming and at the same time, completely invisible. My favorite time each day was returning to my room at the end of the day. No matter how neat I kept the room, I always found my things better organized than when I left. I was shocked to find my dirty laundry folded each day! I have never, ever seen that anywhere else. When going to the gym, I would arrive at the spa entrance to find no one attending to the shop. Initially this took me off guard, but after a minute, a hotel employee arrived and greeted me. This happened every time I went, and I began to realize that it lent a completely different feel to the hotel - I was being taken care of, but no one was hawking over me. It made the whole hotel feel like it was my own and gave me a sense that the hotel trusted me with their property. At the same time, I always felt that I could have exactly what I wanted when I wanted in an instant. I asked for directions once, and the concierge offered to walk me to my destination. I declined, but I am absolutely positive she was sincerely prepared to walk a number of blocks with me to find what I was looking for. By the way, everyone spoke perfect English - expected, but contributed to an effortless stay.The last thing I will say about this hotel is that I felt like I was home (or at least what I want home to be). It was a combination of American, European, and Japanese all at once. In Japan, which remains perfectly foreign, it is an oasis of familiarity and comfort. I will never stay in any other hotel in Tokyo, no matter what the cost.
user_name:
J5855YKdavids
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location for business travellers and hotel is child friendly. As soon as we arrived, they have prepared cookies and candies for kids. The staff also have print outs of local attractions ready. They have arranged restaurant booking and very helpful with our needs. I can't complaints about the locations. Only minutes walk from Tokyo station (there is underground entrance right next to the hotel). We love Japanese cuisine, and there are lots of restaurants within 15 minutes walk radius. There are many office buildings on the other side of Tokyo station, and on ground floor or basement floors are many restaurants. We wished we could spend more time there because every meals we has been a treat. Highly recommend this place to travellers who will be spending lots of time in downtown Tokyo, for business or leisure. Well done. Four Season Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed for two nights with my wife and six year old son. The overall impression is very good, and comparable with other Four Seasons properties around the world. The location is excellent, being a 5-10 minute walk from Tokyo station for trains from Narita and other parts of Japan. Its also a gentle stroll to the fantastic Imperial Palace & Gardens and from the main Department Stores in Ginza.Staff could not be more welcoming, anticipating all our needs and are very friendly.The rooms themselves are reasonably sized for the price, with hi-tech 3D TVs well kitted out bathrooms. Being on low floors the view is not great, and without the drapes down the traffic can be heard (we were on the 6th floor which I believe is the highest floor).Breakfast was average, however the service was excellent.For families the Spa is not great as the facilities are separated by sex, and although there is a small 'Onsen' there is no swimming pool.The hotel bikes that are available are in adult sizes only.Overall I think there are better hotels nearby for families, and similar ones that offer better value for business trips. Ultimately it's the value for money that let's this small hotel down.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed in this hotel for a family holiday in Tokyo. The experiences that I had from making the booking up to check out are truly wonderful and impressive. I made the booking by calling the hotel reservation directly. The staff was very helpful with excellent English. The check in was impressive. They greet us in the Shinkansen platform as we were arriving from Osaka. They escorted us to the hotel which is only 10 minutes walk from the JR Tokyo Station. The location is great, it is located in PCPM building, the central business district, right in the heart of Tokyo. The breakfast is served ala carte, no buffet breakfast in this hotel. We stayed in the 3rd floor, just right next to the train station. However we did not experience any noisy disturbance from the trains at all. The staffs were great. All English speaking staffs. They were really helpful.Overall this was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend this place for a family holiday in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service is always top notch - what you expect from Four Seasons. Hidden on the lower floors of an office tower, right beside Tokyo station and a short walk to Ginza. Always look forward to my stays here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our family of four stayed from June 18-June 21. From the affable employee who greeted us at the train station (His name was Christopher, I believe) and escorted us to the hotel, to the lady who escorted us back to the train station (and insisting on wheeling our four heavy bags) for our train to Narita, the experience was flawless from start to finish. The room was incredibly spacious, with views over the business district and the train station, and had extremely comfortable beds and an amazing bathroom. A special mention must be made for the housekeeping who cleaned and arranged our room with an extraordinary level of detail. Breakfast at Ekki was incredible (try the french toast!) When we were checking out, we couldn't decide whether we were more sad about leaving the hotel or the city (which says a lot, because Tokyo is really an amazing place).

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed at the Four Seasons for two nights at the beginning of our honeymoon. From start to finish, the staff provided us with incredible service. We REALLY appreciated the (complimentary) pick-up and drop-off between the train station and the hotel as it would have been difficult to navigate (particularly with our large bags) without assistance. Our room was very large, with a separate living room and bedroom and two bathrooms. On the first night, our shower flooded but the maintenance person came immediately and was extremely apologetic. In general, whenever we called with a request, it was completed within 5 minutes (couldn't figure out DVD remote, asked for ice, etc.). Breakfast, turn-down service, concierge, and spa were all great as well! I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at The Four Seasons Marunouchi. The location is excellent. It's about one block away from Tokyo Station, walking distance from Ginza (Tokyo's luxury shopping district), and walking distance from The Tokyo Imperial Palace. Our room was spacious, the bed was super comfortable, and the bathroom was pristine. The staff was very accommodating and helped us plan out our trip. We ate dinner in the restaurant, which was good food but expensive. The fitness studio was nice and not crowded. I would definitely stay here again. For more about our Four Seasons experience: http://www.blaineanderin.com/tokyo-hotel-review-the-four-seasons-marunouchi/

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: To whom it may concern,I would highly recommend anyone that would like a 5 star stay in Tokyo to choose Four Seasons.The staff throughout the different departments made this a very nice stay!Everything from the work the concierge did to how the SPA worked was really nice.I'm still dreaming of the Spicy Tuna Roll they served..top notch!Happy to recommend this hotel to anyone that would like a nice hotel with perfect connection to shopping, Tokyo station and other nearby tourist attractions.RegardsMr Kristell

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Booked this hotel during an around the world trip w/ my husband several years ago. Immaculate property with great amenities. Service was amazing. Room was HUGE. Very nice. No complaints at all! Would definitely go back one day.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Came here for dinner with a friend, situated a short, 10 minute walk from Ginza station the Four Seasons restaurant is situated on the seventh floor gives great views of Tokyo at night. Calm atmosphere perfect for evening drinks or dinner. The food was very good although would have been nice to see some Japanese options on the menu. All in all an enjoyable experience, would not however make a detour to come here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There are parts of this Four Seasons that I feel can be improved upon: fitness center needs to be bigger and a greater selection of television channels (at least more than 1 in English). However, that is literally the only complaints I have for this property, and those are not really complaints...only suggestions for improvement. The rest of the property is fantastic and the staff is top notch. The restaurant offers great dinning, service and a very nice view if you are lucky enough to secure a window table. If staying around the Palace in Tokyo, definitely consider Four Seasons...it is was great.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Amazing! Our choice was excellent! It was our first visit to Tokio and our stay was made extra special by the fantastic service we received! No hesitation in recommending! We look forward to coming back really soon!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Perfect service, good location, next to Tokyo station so also especially good for business travelers. Love that they have bicycles available. Fitness and Spa are good too. The hotel is small enough such that personalized attention to specific needs can be and is given.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Simply my favorite hotel. Understated, amazing service and luxurious. The Maranouchi is a perfect place to start a holiday in Japan - easy walking distance to the shopping district of Ginza, the Imperial Palace and the arrival station from Narita.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Terrific hotel and special rap for the porter Christopher who took us al the way to the platform for the airport train, bought the tickets and then have us all the right advice on the Narita Express. The Ekki restaurant is superb. Best eggs benedict of my life! Super location, well maintained, it was impossible to fault.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: WOW! This was an amazing Four Seasons. First, we were met at the Train station by Miwa, who spoke fluent English, carted all our bags and was so sweet to us our entire trip. Second, we were upgraded to a beautiful corner room which was spotless and spacious -- it even had room for a rollaway. As a family traveling with two preteen girls, we really appreciated being able to all stay in one room. The hotel also treated the girls to gorgeous little books, sweets and treats. We appreciated the krups coffee maker each morning as well as the complimentary waters each day. Little touches like that are key. The Concierges (Anka and Jonathan) were very knowledgeable and helped us write out our destinations in Japanese, find family friendly dinner places, and overall answer our multitude of questions. In short, stay here! It is great!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in May 2014 with two kids. One of the few hotels we found that had 2 queen beds so that we could all sleep in one room. The hotel is the same block as Tokyo station (2-3 min walk one you leave the station) and occupies the lower 7 floors of a high rise building. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and made our stay so much more enjoyable. The staff really differentiated this hotel from others on our trip. They all speak great English. We also liked the Nespresso machine in our room for good morning coffee. There are many reasonably priced restaurants in the area around the station (some are underground). A convenience store is close by.We could hear the train a bit from our room but it did not bother us.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: With only around 60 rooms, the Four Seasons really can be counted as a boutique hotel. The staff is very welcoming and recognizes every guest by name, throughout the whole stay. Celebrating our 10th anniversary there, we were surprised with a bottle of Champagne and a personalized card, signed by at least 10 members of the staff. We really felt at home in this hotel. As we were continuing our travel by train, the hotel's location was perfect to us as the Shinkansen tracks are only a 10 minutes walk away. In addition to that, a member of the staff accompanied us to the station and carried our baggage right into the train. All in all, our stay here was fantastic and we are already looking forward to returning.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed 4 nights in a deluxe premier room. The room was large and equipped with ultra modern amenities like a 3D TV, Nespresso machine and Japanese toilet. With blackout curtains, a super comfy bed and pyjamas laid out for you at bedtime, you will have the best sleep ever in a hotel room. You will even probably oversleep if you don't set an alarm. Location was perfect and minutes away from Tokyo station. Service was impeccable and the bellman picked us up from Tokyo station on arrival and delivered us and our luggage directly to the train platform on departure. (Shangri-La also picked us up from the train platform on arrival whereas the Four Seasons only met us at the exit so they lost that round.) Their concierges are absolute rockstars and were able to secure me a reservation at Sukiyabashi Jiro Sushi in Ginza, which would have otherwise been nearly impossible to get. The only flaw in this hotel was it's WiFi. While it was complimentary, it was also unacceptably slow (dialup internet slow) unless you paid for the faster service. The Shangri-La provided super fast WiFi and so this is just not acceptable for an otherwise very modern 5 star hotel in a technologically advanced city like Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great experience, nice staff. Good area and location in Tokyo. Good rooms, very clean, good and comfortable bed. Restaurant. Breakfast and dinner excellent. The location is great, near Ginza with the best shops and restaurant in Tokyo

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here at the end of a cruise. Everything was done superbly from the moment we arrived until we left. The location was walking distance to the Ginza and Tokyo station. The concierge arranged a private car for us one day and we had the best sashimi I have ever experienced and then the same night the concierge suggested a Teppan restaurant that was out of this world. Our room was not only clean and spacious but had an amazing view of Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I would be pushed to find anything wrong with this hotel. The location (less than 5 minutes from Tokyo station) is about as central as you can get with easy access to most of the city by public transport and there are loads of places within walking distance.The hotel itself is very small (57 rooms I believe) but it is attractively furnished. There is a small lobby on the ground floor and the rooms start several stories higher up. The rooms are fantastic - very large and well fitted out with extremely comfortable beds. A real plus (for my teenage sons) was the huge 3D TV with surround sound. The bathrooms were also very large with separate bath and shower and luxurious products.Best of all was the service - from the moment we were met at the side of the train, this was exemplary.Food was also good in the restaurant. Dinner was quite expensive but the food was delicious. Breakfast was great - served at the table rather than a buffet.In fact, this is one of the best hotels I have stayed at and I would definitely stay again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My family of three occupied a room with 2 queen-sized beds. The hotel staff provided an extra bed for our son. The room was huge by Tokyo standards. Upon our arrival, there was a personalized welcome note accompanied by fruits, some macaroons and coloring materials for our son. Their attention to details was noteworthy. Hotel guests may avail of their DVD movies (including 3 D movies, complete with 3 D glasses and surround sound) to watch in the privacy of their hotel room. The bathroom and amenities were both excellent. The location is very near the Tokyo Central Station and Ginza. The staff was friendly and accommodating. They even stored in the freezer some stuff we bought to fly home. Definitely a hotel one would want to visit again and again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was the last place I stayed before I went to airport.Room are super nice. Had parcel sent to the hotel as we shopped, by the time I checked in the boxes are already put nicely in my room. The hotel is next to shopping mall and about 8-10 min walk to JR station.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: 57rooms so less people working at hotel.when fully booked, you got to wait long even when checked in/out.also no shuttle services around hotel, specially when it is in a hidden location, TAXI drivers can not find it.Room is great.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Returning after a 7 day trip between Tokyo and Kyoto. The Four Seasons at Marunouchi took care of us (family of 4) in an impeccable manner. From the cookies in the room on arrival (with the kids names on them) to escorting to Tokyo station when we left- we could not fault any aspect of our stay. We had a spacious room in which a 3rd bed had been put in and still had plenty of room.The location cannot be beaten- Ginza a 5 minute walk with all amenities, Imperial palace a 20 minute walk , subways and taxis at hand, Tokyo station 1 minute away. This was a very special holiday and the Four seasons added a very touch to our stay.Staff were so wonderful and friendly!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I chose this hotel based on the location and based on other reviews, but I could never have imagined the extent of the service provided. Before arrival, I asked for help with shinkansen tickets to Kyoto and the concierge was able to purchase these for me, which took away one headache. On arrival, we were greeted like members of the family and were shown to the most amazing room I have ever experienced. It was so large, it seemed like an apartment and waiting for us was a selection of pastries, orange juice and coffee - just the thing to set us up for the day. The bathroom was a dream bathroom, with an enormous tub and fabulous shower stall, which didn't appear to have any drain - the water just disappeared as if by magic! But the best thing of all about the bathroom was the delicious Japanese toilet with heated seat. You don't know you need a heated toilet seat until you sit on one and find out that your bottom was cold after all! This seat even had two heat settings - perfect for chilly days!We also had a side view of the railway tracks at Tokyo Station which is much more glamorous than it sounds. We watched the bullet trains coming and going - seemed like there was one every minute.But the best thing about the Four Seasons at Marunouchi was the service we received from the delightful staff working at the Concierge desk. We have never been treated so royally in our lives. They helped with restaurant bookings, reconfirmed tours, forwarded luggage, and walked us to a currency exchange desk in Tokyo Station that we could never have found on our own. In fact, they walked us to Tokyo Station on several different occasions - most memorably on leaving to catch the bullet train to Kyoto, but even on our return to Tokyo, when we were on the way to the airport, they met us again and escorted us through the maze that is Tokyo Station to the right connection for the airport express train. We could never have managed this on our own, or if we could, it would have taken twice as long and involved a heart attack in the process. I must especially name two individuals - Jonathon and Miku - who went above and beyond the call of duty helping us with our train journeys. I almost shed a tear when we had to wave them off - it was like leaving a member of the family! I have never before experienced service like this and it makes me want to hurry back to this hotel, just to experience it again.If I could give six stars, or ten stars for this property, I would. Don't hesitate to make this your temporary home in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great Hotel, good area. Easy access to trains. Concierge was helpful. The food is all American in the bar & restaurant, definitely eat out instead of staying in the hotel... unless you want a cheese burger.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I and my husband chose Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo for celebrating our wedding anniversary. The hotel had great city view, although it was a little buzzy at night. The room was spacious with large bathroom. I care too much about bathroom, because I love spend time taking a hot bathtub. At the hotel, I could both lie in bathtub and enjoy city view. It was great.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I can't say enough good things about the Four Seasons. The best feature is certainly the exceptional staff, who were welcoming and helpful. They personally escorted us to our train to Kyoto and held our baggage while we travelled even though we had checked out of the hotel. The room was clean, peaceful, and housekeeping was extremely attentive. The location was perfect for many reasons. As first time travelers to Tokyo, we had no idea how difficult it would be to cross from one side of Tokyo Station to the other--it can take 15 minutes just to walk the equivalent of one block west. The Four Seasons is located on the side of the Station that is most convenient to Ginza, other subway lines, and taxi access to the rest of the city (and conveniently nearby Kitchen Street and Ramen Street as well!). We even loved the hotel bar, where we had drinks before going out at night and took in the great view. This hotel made our trip to Tokyo so much more enjoyable.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here with our 2 kids in the 1 bedroom suite and were thrilled with our stay. The room was huge and well done, the bathtub had amazing night time views, the beds were clean and comfy, and the service was stellar. We would absolutely stay here again and loved how kid friendly it was. The concierge was very helpful and followed up with anything that we needed.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: What fun, discovering all of the unique qualities of the perfect room, including a 3D television in this boutique property. Their staff was available to fulfill every need and always greeted us with warmth and friendliness.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had a wonderful stay here. The hotel is very modern and relaxing but very much within the Japanese aesthetic.The location was perfect for us. We took the train from Narita and then left on the Bullet train and just had the very short walk from the train station.Although the hotel is centrally located, it is also very calm and all of the staff was very nice. We would recommend the property strongly and would love to be able to stay again.
user_name:
Scott J
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I give this hotel a "5", and I'll review the restaurant separately. In case this is all you read, I'd agree with other reviews on it: pick one of the zillion other restaurants nearby. The (excellent and helpful) concierge will set it up.As for the hotel, it was excellent and the staff performed perfectly. We usually stay at hotels at this level, and even given the price and level of this hotel, it was excellent.The first thing to note was the reception on the platform of the train station. Yes, a butler was there to meet us as we got off our train at Tokyo station, take our bags, and escort us to the hotel. While this isn't a big deal for business folks traveling alone and already know Tokyo station, for our family who had never been to Japan before, this was a great stress-reducer. As for the room itself, we had a suite facing the train station. While I was initially nervous about the noise (you could hear a faint rumble as the Shinkasen went by) it turned out to be a non-issue and we are NOT heavy sleepers. (And the room was otherwise pin-drop quiet). Meanwhile, the view of the train station was huge amounts of fun, even for the adults.The location of this hotel, as others have mentioned, is epic. It just doesn't get any better. You are right next to Tokyo station, and a block away from the Metro. You are basically 30 minutes (max) from just about anywhere in Tokyo at this hotel.We were in one of the "normal" suites. The room itself was not huge, but probably pretty big by Tokyo standards. It was plenty big enough for the three of us.As is the case with other 4S properties, they were very welcoming to children. The room service for breakfast was good, although the menu was somewhat limited. It was a full western-style breakfast though, which isn't easy to find in Tokyo.Room service for dinner was also somewhat limited in selection, but it worked great for what you should use it for: that off night where you simply can't get out of the room or are too tired to walk a block away to a restaurant. Oh, and it's super-expensive but that's not unexpected for a 4S.The minibar was decent, but a highlight was the pod-based coffee machine which makes *real* espresso.All and all, a great hotel, and worth the (very expensive) price.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Personal greeting at door of shinkansen, with escort from platform to our room. Very large and comfortable room with 2 queen size beds. One of beds set up with no down duvet or pillows per our request. Very private feel, as there are only 57 rooms. Spa was empty - nice after crowded bustle of city. same for restaurant. Great location convenient to best parts of city.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed for one night in transit from Osaka to Tokyo airport. Positives - really close to the station and a not-to-be-missed service to accompany you and push the bags to the airport train which must have saved us at least 10 minutes. Really comfortable rooms although they are showing some signs of age and were certainly less high-tech than those at the Peninsula. Very good lunch and breakfast and very conveniently located.On the other hand, whether you enjoy staying here depends upon whether you like trains. Our first, fourth-floor room seemed to be directly over the train tracks and the noise was too intrusive. Our alternative, at the front of the hotel, was far quieter. Service in the restaurant was pretty slow on both occasions with staff not really in evidence.Definitely preferred the Peninsula

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There’s not a lot to add to the positive reviews of this wonderful hotel. We loved our deluxe premier room for space, comfort and the wonderful, constantly changing view over Tokyo station. The location was ideal. A couple of things set this hotel apart in a city full of great accommodations. It’s truly a boutique hotel with only 57 rooms. The staff is able to know their guests on a very personal level at this size, something rather extraordinary for a large city. And those who work there are what truly make the hotel. I arrived in Tokyo and immediately became quite ill. A visit to a clinic was easily facilitated. I was treated with tremendous kindness and thoughtfulness by everyone. Tea was sent to the room, cough drops purchased by the lovely desk clerk; my well being constantly inquired after.It was unusually cold for early March in Tokyo but I never left the hotel without someone checking to be certain that I knew what the weather was. My mother never looked after me this well! When we moved on to Kyoto, The Four Seasons called ahead to the hotel to facilitate and inform the next hotel of my illness. It was quite amazing and so very much appreciated!This is absolutely a hotel I would recommend to anyone!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The concierge staff at the Four Seasons Maranouchi exceeded our expectations. We are particularly grateful for their help and advice with making Tokyo fun for my very picky and seasoned traveler of a husband and my exuberant 15 year old son. The concierge team arranged for personal guides and tailored restaurant experiences to create a joyful time for us all.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We spent eight faultless nights at the hotel. The staff were wonderful without exception. Cannot praise the hotel more highly. Yoko the concierge was highly knowledgable and could not have been more helpful. The rooms overlooking Tokyo station are fab if you like trains.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: There is NO better place to stay than in the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo, the service and luxury and location is unbeatable!!!! I was escorted to the Bullet train by a very helpful young man named Christopher who insisted on helping me with my luggage. He came all the way into the station, helped me on the train and waited till it departed. This was a small example of the type of service to expect.FOUR SEASONS IS THE BEST OF THE BESTWK

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were celebrating our anniversary. The hotel came and took our picture and gave us a bottle of champagne with a card signed by all the staff!!!!! A wonderful start to an amazing hotel.The rooms/bath are huge and gorgeous . The concierge and staff are very special beyond anyexpectation.They took us to the Bullet train with all our luggage and assisted in purchasing our tickets to Kyoto. When we return to Tokyo we will be back to this wonderful centrally located hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First experience and it was so pleasantly memorable, we still talk about it to our friends with a big smile on our faces. From reserving the rooms all the way to the end of our trip, the attention to detail and to our children was impressive.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Felt a little like staying at an airport hotel (this above/near the train station) in the sense that it didn't really feel like its own, separate, cozy hotel. Felt like they borrowed space in the tower.Very clean, modern, spacious, comfortable. Access to trains, shops, and Ginza (short walk). Access to the royal palace.Very nice hotel, but not like other Four Seasons I have been to. Probably not worth the price we paid.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff in this place are the resort’s greatest asset, which is just as well, as there is nothing much special about this hotel. I was impressed by how the reception staff did their best to help us with whatever triviality my wife bothered them with. Room, location, food – not so impressive.
user_name:
jsonholiday
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Tokyo seems to have a void of truly luxury hotels which is a bit strange. There are only really three choices to consider: Shangri-La, Mandarin Oriental, and the Four Seasons. Unfortunately the Four Seasons is last on my list as it doesn't meet the usual Four Seasons standards. Its quite small with only 58 rooms which is quite nice as it has a "boutiquey" feel to it but the design is quite dated and the hotel is showing plenty of wear and tear as it hasn't been renovated since it opened in over 10 years. The staff is wonderful which is nice and the location is prime of power shopping. Additionally, there is no breakfast buffet which is a shame as the 4S is famous for their amazing breakfasts.The real winners in Tokyo are the Shangri-La and the Mandarin Oriental. The Mandarin is quite new which is nice and the design is simply fabulous. Same goes for the Shangri-La. All three hotels are near the Ginza shopping district which is by far the best location in Tokyo. Unfortunately the Mandarin is a bit far from Ginza so its not really ideal to walk when going shopping but the Shangri-La and 4S are only about 15 mins away from some of the best shopping in the world. I hate to say this but I think you need to skip the 4S when in Tokyo. By the way, Aman Tokyo is opening in a few months and that should be the new champ of Tokyo hotels for sure!!! ;-)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: In the past month we stayed at the hotel on 2 occasions and highly recommend it. Firstly, the hotel is in a great location - less than 5 minutes walk from Tokyo station, so if you are coming from the airport or elsewhere, you are very close. And don't worry about finding your way to the hotel, because guest services will be waiting on the platform to carry your bags and show you the way. This experience continued throughout our stay - EVERYONE was on the ball and more than willing to help. So we were personally walked to an ATM; taken to the station; had seats found in hard to book restaurants; had customised room service; were remembered and felt taken care of. Our room was fabulous - very large with a living area, separate dressing room and huge bathroom. We had a great view of bullet trains coming into the station. The hotel is quite small, very intimate, brilliantly located for everything in Tokyo, quiet and a lovely place for a 'grown up' break.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: When you stay in a 5 star hotel in Tokyo - and I have stayed in the Peninsula, the MO, both the Hyatts, the Imperial (ok - more 4 star) and the Ritz Carlton, you can be certain that the service and standards will be the best of the best. The 4S at M is no different - great, personel service (including letting us change in the spa when we arrived early). So, why would you choose this hotel over the others? Firstly, for train buffs, there are great views over the tracks leading into Tokyo station. Secondly, for those using the train (either to/from Nairta aiport or the Tokyo metro) this is an incredibly convenient location. Thirdly, it is the closest 5 star hotel to Ginza for those who want to shop. Fourthly, it is one of the easier hotels in Tokyo to arrange connecting rooms for those traveling with family.Rooms are large with lovely bathrooms. Used room service twice - both times it was excellent (especially the hot chocolate). Hotel is extremely small, which probably helps with the personal service.Only issue was explaining to taxi drivers exactly where it is - take one of the location cards from the front desk!No swimming pool, which wasn't an issue for us but maybe for some.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Having stayed at Four Seasons Hotels worldwide with wonderful experiences, Tokyo hotel left us wanting. Facility was great as well as overall service. Location great also. The exception and disappointment was with the restaurant food, service and also room service. Cold coffee, tasteless fruit, cold omelette etc etc. loved Tokyo but would hesitate to return to hotel. Left note for general manager. Never did that before
user_name:
andreae403
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My wife and I celebrated our 10 year anniversary here. They upgraded us to a suite and gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne but I was really impressed by the personal card with the champagne that congratulated us and was signed by five or six members of the staff! It showed a real personal touch that one would expect of a five star hotel. The food at the restaurant Ekki Bar and Grill was also delicious and not as expensive as I expected so overall, I would rate the hotel 4.75 stars.Three minor reasons why it didn't get the perfect score:1. Not the staff's fault but the hotel is located on the first seven floors of the building. Our room was on the 3rd floor and you can hear the shinkansen below. Also, for the price, one would have expected a better view.2. The wifi in the room is really, really slow. 3. The suite was very spacious and the furniture was really nice. The tvs are the best (3D tvs with very large screens). However, in the bathroom, there was only one sink and it felt a little cramped with all the toothbrushes, hair dryer, etc... next to the sink. Not that convenient for couples. I would have expected double sinks (one of those minor things that you only notice when you're there).Other than that, a really great hotel. I would definitely recommend it to friends and family looking for a place to celebrate a special occasion.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel has the best service available for guests travelling with luggage and arriving/departing by train. Only place I know of in Tokyo where they come collect you and your luggage from Shinkansen or narita express and take you to your hotel.... Actually right to your room. Apart from that everything else is also brilliant. Tiny little attentions to detail like personalised kids books hand made in hotel, welcome snacks with kids names written in icing, heaps of advice and directions from concierge and reception that make you feel like you have your own personal guide. Location is awesome for transport, access to yamanote line (quicker and less stressful to walk to Yarakucho station to south of hotel than to go back into Tokyo station), good for Ginza and Marunouchi shopping. Can't recommend enough and pretty reasonable compared to other top end Tokyo hotels (Hyatt etc)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A very well managed hotel offering a superior experience. Everything was in order before our arrival including emailing me to ask me to let them know if we would be arriving by bus or train so their colleague could meet us and escort us to the hotel... the also escorted us to the train upon our departure. The room was good size, clean and very comfortable, as was the bathroom. This was one of the better Four Seasons experiences.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From the moment we arrived by train and was met by hotel staff helping us lug our skis thru the crowded tunnels of Tokyo station, I was impressed with the service and staff. The rooms were top notch and spacious. Over the years we continue to return here due to the great experience and central location. You would be hard pressed to do better.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We only booked Four Seasons because a lot of the other high end but cheaper hotels were booked. For that price a lot of the bells and whistles are to be expected. We booked two rooms and even the pull away bed in one of the rooms was really comfortable. The hotel had cookies, candy, a booklet of activities for the kids upon arrival. We were there for only one night so we didn't use any of the facilities.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: An amazing experience. I stayed 8 nights in total with my family. Tokyo can be a confusing and intimidating city for non Japanese speakers and I greatly appreciated the level of service this hotel provided from the time we arrived at the airport to our departure. The airport greeting service is highly recommended. Our kids where made to feel so special with personalised greetings, snacks and items, this will be an unforgettable experience they will remember. The staff were so helpful in helping arrange bookings, tours and giving detailed directions.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We traveled as a family of three and have stayed at here for three nights. We have stayed in some of the Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts around the world- the experiences were never disappointed. I have to say, the staffs in Tokyo were the most helpful ones. Before arrival:I have sent several emails to the concierge telling them to help me book the tickets for the Ghibili museum. Also, I told them to help me book our train tickets. They did my requests fast and correctly. I think that the best part is that I received the reply from them the very next day I sent an email to the concierge.Upon arrival:The check-in processes very smoothly. We were accompanied to our room immediately. Warm greetings from Four Seasons Hotel staffs no surprise.During our stay:We stayed in a premier room for a night and a one-bedroom suite for 2 nights. The premier room would be good enough for a family to live in for several days. It was bigger than what we expected from the photo on the official website. The one-bedroom suite is very comfortable, though it was not the biggest Four Seasons suite that we've lived in, but it had the best bathroom design in our own opinion- a free-standing bathtub beside the floor-to-ceiling window overlooking Tokyo station. We had a very comfortable stay in our suite. Highly recommended.Departure:A staff helped us taking our luggages to the Tokyo station platform as we were going to take shinkansen to our next destination. This service helped us save a lot of time finding the platform. Location:3 minutes' walk from Tokyo station Yaesu south exit. There are several department stores and restaurants within 15 minutes' walk. Tokyo station itself is a very big station, no transfer needed if traveling to shinjuku, shibuya, or even Kyoto if you would like to.View:Not spectacular, but kind of interesting and unique. We do enjoy watching trains to and from Tokyo station. Service:Four Seasons standard- even exceeded than normal FS properties!Dining:The breakfast is similar to other FS properties worldwide. In room dining is quite expensive, but there are many good restaurants nearby(within 10 minutes' walk).If there were any annoyance that troubles you, don't hesitate to tell them. They are extremely helpful.Overall it was a memorable stay. I will stay at here every time I visit Tokyo. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is very conveniently located right by Tokyo station and close to the heart of Ginza. From here you can reach all of Tokyo even Japan relatively quickly. Unfortunately the hotel is located at the bottom floors of a high rise. This has two major draw backs. One is that the view is not impressive and second is that giant pillars disrupt the interior of the hotel. I had a big one right in the room. The staff was extremely catering and helpful. From check in to check out. They even had a service to carry your bags to the train platform for you which was also very useful. Breakfast was beyond disappointing. We booked the room with continental breakfast. This translated into Coffee plus orange juice plus 5 slices of toast with jam. For a hotel in this price category this is unimaginable. There is no buffet and only a la carte breakfast. The hotel is certainly not a high value. The great service didn't compensate for the lousy breakfast or the lack of view. I would not recommend this hotel. Unfortunately I didn't have the time to check out the spa.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff at this hotel have the highest level of service we have experienced. The location is great if you plan to do a lot of shopping in the Ginza area, you can walk to everything. The train station is around the block, the staff helped us with our bags walking us all the way to the train station and then waiting until we actually stepped on the train - WHAT SERVICE!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As usual at a Four Seasons, truly an exceptional stay. The hotel is excellently located directly adjacent to Tokyo Station, one of the busiest in the city, allowing connections and easy access to many train lines serving the entire city. The hotel is small, and boutique-style, but with the phenomenal service Four Seasons is known for. The gym, locker rooms with hot-tubs, steam rooms, showers are beautiful. The service from the front desk staff and concierges, (even escorting us via walking us to a nearby destination) was just over the top! Thank you for a great stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is one of the best metropolitan Four Seasons I have ever stayed in. The train pickup service is the start to a very memorable and pleasant experience. The concierge is outstanding and the guest service is the same. I hope to be back shortly as the hotel was incredible and they made Tokyo easy and enjoyable for me.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Based on a previous stay two years ago we decided that the Four Seasons at Marunouchi was a competent and comfortable base to explore the city again this January.And once again this small, elegant hotel has supplied a smooth, relaxed and welcoming stay but more importantly our second stay has proven that this hotel is, as we suspected the first time around, flawless. The service is exceptional. The staff organized airport transfers, train transfers, local information and restaurant bookings with seemingly effortless efficiency and great inside knowledge. Some of the things I love about this hotel include it's quiet and calm attitude, the superb location close to the main train station and the fact that the metro station access is a breeze. You can be on a train to anywhere within 5 minutes.It just doesn't feel like a normal hotel with the usual edge of frantic coming and going. This hotel, the staff in particular, have found that secret ingredient (perhaps it's the elegant efficiency that the Japanese have perfected) that makes this hotel flawless.You just feel comfy here. Relaxed. You can shop all day in nearby Ginza (window shop in my case!), squeeze onto trains, be a tourist, walk for miles then walk back in to the hotel, take a big breath in and relax. I know there are bigger and shinier hotels with famous restaurants in Tokyo but this one will be our go-to place whenever we're in Tokyo because of that secret ingredient - that special intangible atmosphere is efficient calm.We traveled as a family with two teenage girls in January 2014.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I recently visited Tokyo on business with my associate partner and stayed at the luxurious Four Seasons Hotel in Marunouchi. We booked the Premier room that offered us an array of amenities. The décor was well done-up with contemporary furnishings and the room was equipped with a 3D TV and a built-in-Blu-ray player, and also had a private bar and safe. The queen size bed lay sprawling and welcoming with soft pillows and a comfy mattress. The bathroom had a shower and a full-length wardrobe mirror and was pretty roomy. We dined at the hotel’s restaurant and enjoyed our delicious meals. The staff was friendly and warm and helped us greatly when we needed a printer to be brought into our room on request. A great place to stay if you’re on business.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our family stayed at the Four Seasons in Tokyo for a week. Prior to our arrival, the people at concierge were already hard at work for us, getting answers about obtaining a visa for China from the embassy there, helping to obtain the famously difficult reservation at Jiro (Ginza station) and offering to help us get tickets to the sumo wrestling tournament. Upon our arrival, the concierge staff continued to help us every day. They escorted us to a close-by sushi restaurant for lunch on our first day so that we wouldn't get lost. They printed out mulitple pages I needed for the Chinese visas and my daughter's online course. The recommended excellent restaurants and offered tips on how best to plan some of our outings.The cleaning staff was also excellent - going far beyond perfunctory cleaning to make our room perfect each day and evening. The Four Seasons has 2 sets of pajamas in the top drawer of the dresser. I decided to wear them so that I could keep my own pajamas clean for the next stop. I folded them up and put them away in the drawer each morning. By the second morning, the cleaning lady realized I was wearing them and started putting a fresh pair out for me daily. Unnecessary - but so nice. She also saw that I was using the bathtub and put an extra set of toiletries out next to it for me.These are all small things - but it's all done with a quiet smile and nod. Tipping is not done in Japan - so there was certainly no going the extra mile for any sort of monetary reward.The location is excellent. If you have never been to Tokyo - which we had not - you may not realize it at first. The immediate vicinity is a business district. But as you start becoming familiar with your surroundings, you see that you are a few blocks from the beautiful Ginza area - full of high-end shops and restaurants, and right next to the Tokyo Station - which is convenient for catching subways around town and the train to/from the airport as well as the high-speed to Kyoto - but also the station is huge and has a lot of shops and restaurants.It's expensive of course. But I felt at every turn that it was "worth it" - that you get the excellence you pay for - which is not always the case.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Take Four Seasons Hotel best practices, hire top notch Japanese talent and service attitude to implement it, then set the result on a 57 room boutique hotel, and you have the Marunouchi. I've tried out every room type in this hotel; all excellent. Most, if not all the reception and concierge staff have lived, studied, or worked some time in and English speaking country and so are culturally fluent in English and western attitudes. The staff throughout are superb professionals whose depth of knowledge is impressive, for whom no challenge is a challenge, and who spare no effort to make a stay in Tokyo seamless and effortless.In our last visit both my wife and I arrived with colds which developed into more serious infections. We were beyond sick, and needed help. The hotel brought a doctor in for my wife, and two days later, when I had to go to clinic and was told there was a 3 hour wait, I was seen within minutes. "The lady from your hotel was quite insistent," said the doctor. We left the room briefly each day; housekeeping instantly did up our room. Extra water bottles and tissue appeared. Honey lemon water appeared at breakfast.Having stayed in this hotel several times I could cite countless examples of excellence, but it would make for a long review. Perhaps just one: we walk out one day, it starts to rain, we turn around to go back and get a hotel umbrella. Enroute we ran into one of the Four Season's reception staff walking to Tokyo Station, and mentioned to her casually as we passed why were returning so soon. We hadn't taken another 20 steps when we see Four Seasons reception staff #2 is running towards us umbrella in each hand.For newcomers to this hotel, the hotel actually entirely occupies the four or five middle floors of an office building adjacent and linked to Tokyo Station. There is a welcome reception area at ground level, after which you take one of two private elevators to the main reception. You won't find the activity level you would in a mainstream hotel, but it's vibrant enough. There are no shops apart from a small gift area outside the spa, and with the vast shopping and dining offerings of Tokyo Station right next door, it would be superfluous. The Ginza is within a few minutes walk, and the area immediately surrounding hotel is comparatively restful relative, say, to the likes of Shinjuku.I can't say how this hotel compares to other 5 star properties in Tokyo. I am never ever going to try to find out.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It was a very good experience for me , the service is very personal and professional , the best I've seen in Tokyo so far it's unmatched , the location is prime next to Tokyo station , the Ekki bar is one of the best places to have after noon tea set . Would have given them a full mark have they had a rain shower heads and higher quality bed sheets and cover . Given it being pricer than other hotels that do provide Rain showers and greater quality sheets in the superior rooms . Overall highly recommended

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We have now stayed at this hotel 5 times over a 12 month period and have had a great experience every time. On each occasion I've stayed at this hotel with my 2 kids aged 8 and 10 and my wife. We have stayed in smaller interconnecting rooms and in a large deluxe room most recently which comfortably accommodated all 4 of us. This is a small hotel which always feels very personal, welcoming and never crowded. The lobby is a small intimate space and the service is superb at every level. There is a great restaurant and bar on the 7th floor and the spa is excellent. The concierge has always been most helpful on each of our stays and most recently when my wife needed some medication from a pharmacy he not only suggested the closest pharmacy but accompanied us to the store and assisted us with language and interpretation with the pharmacist. The day spa is also fabulous and location of the hotel is a very easy walk to the Ghinza and Tokyo station. The hotel feels like a small luxurious and friendly club, never like a large impersonal hotel. As with all Four Seasons hotels we've stayed at they are always very welcoming to the kids and provide plenty of excellent, healthy and tasty meal options for them. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again when we next visit Tokyo and would highly recommend it to anyone.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The customer service is second to none at the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo. The staff is very friiendly and accomidating. The train system is very easy to use so the need for a car is not required. The rooms are very comfortable and inviting. I would stay again and not have any second thoughts.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Travelling so far to a completely new culture was an adventure. We had the priviledge to stay at our much loved four seasons. Always reliable and well trusted we were not disapointed. Fantastic service as always and the hotel gave us great peace of mind.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: If we had known how close & how easy it is to navigate the Tokyo train system, we would not have taken a car service. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a young & enthusiastic front desk team. They escorted us to our rooms ( we travel w/ our son who acts as our Sherpa). The room was large w/ a very comfortable bed & bedding. They leave night cloths to sleep in. The bathroom was huge w/ a large soaking tub & a large enclosed shower. Once you have tried heated toilet seats it is hard to go back. We went up to the gym & there is a steam, sauna & hot tub which was just right after traveling. The dining room ( expensive, $38.00 Wagu beef burger) was overlooking the train tracks & I was amazed at the number of trains passing. The front desk was very good about recommendations for meals & attractions. The location is in the Ginza district & easily walkable.They walked us over to the train station & put us on the Shinkansen (bullet train)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our stay at the Four Seasons was truly one of the highlights to our recent Japan vacation. From the very moment my family of four (two young children of 8 and 5) stepped out of our cab, the reception desk welcomed us with open arms. Our room with prepared beyond my expectations, and as a business owner who travels quite a bit, this is high praise! Room service and in-hotel dining also exceeded my expectations. Do indulge in a Waygu burger if you have the chance. The conceirge desk was equally fantastic. They helped to secure our dinner reservations and also provide alternatives. Our thanks to Nana for entertaining our frequent questions and providing a lovely introduction and welcome to the hotel. During our morning excursions, they offered to send a bellman with us with the Tokyo Station in order to ensure we booked the correct tickets. While we did not accept their gracious offer, we did take them up on an offer to escort us through the underground complex of Tokyo Station on our last day. We had such a shopping experience that we needed more luggage! Many thanks to John, who escorted us and provided some wonderful insight, translation assistance, and friendly conversation.The hotel is caters to just about any traveler. They were quite child-friendly with little welcome gifts, custom informational guides, and a basket full of Japanese treats. Our deepest thanks to the Chief Conceirge, Akhil, who secure extra treats for the children and even offered to send more back to the States if needed! We appreciate the hospitality and extra care to ensure we arrived at our destinations in a timely manner.
user_name:
Jean W
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: this was an exceptional few days in tokyo. excellent location on the train stations. we did not use the meet and greet at the station due to unsure times with our shinkansen, however i would absolutely recommend it if you are new to tokyo. we arrived early, yet our room was ready, but we headed straight to disneyland. the concierge immediately walked us to the train station, bought a ticket himself to get us onto the platform as we were very unsure of where we were going!! he waited with us until the train came and he waved us on. wonderful. we returned able to find our way back as the station is just under the hotel, where we had the most amazing bath,seriously these bathrooms are unexplainable. the beds were the most comfortable bed i have ever slept in, the view at night was breathtaking, and the food from room service matched a high end restaurant, no exaggeration, the trolley turned into a table for four!!! . the room is a huge size for japan standards and in fact european standards! superb superb superb fit out in every way. we had breakfast upstairs in the morning, which was also so well presented and incredibly good. not your usual eggs and toast i can assure you. excellent. right from the moment i booked this hotel online, i received the highest service and professionalism. when we left we were walked back down to the ticket counter and platform and waved on our way to Nagano. truly, this is a hotel that we will always have fond memories of and indeed intend to return to next year on our annual japan trip. our teenage children even had age appropriate bathrobes and slippers in the wardrobes. our room was so expansive and please note, this is the only hotel i could find of 5* (true five star) quality that would allow 4 of us in the one room with 2 massive queens beds. trust me if you are travelling with family, this is the only hotel to stay for absolute luxury and exceptional service. do not look anywhere else, we could not recommend this hotel enough!! we cannot wait to stay again. thankyou fourseasons tokyo. xx

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Not your typical Four Seasons. This is a rather small hotel. It is in a great location, with easy access to the Tokyo Station - a bellman met us and took us to the hotel - and within easy walking distance to the area around the Imperial Palace and the Ginza. Access to trains and the subway is very easy, so we were able to get all over town with no difficulty, although we walked much of the time. The rooms are large, light, and comfortable. The hotel has all the features one could want, although we did not use the restaurant, since there are so many nearby restaurants to try, nor did we use the spa/gym, both of which looked great. The staff was especially nice and extremely helpful. We thought they really were interested in our having a great experience in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The physical attributes of this hotel are excellent. Firstly, it is situated a 3 minute pleasant walk away from Tokyo station. Although the immediate surroundings are offices, there are many restaurants in the underground complex of Tokyo station which is connected to the hotel. If shopping is a priority, there are a number of shops in the underground complex, including Daimaru, and it is about 10 minutes walk away from the glitz of Ginza, although the hotel itself is not situated in a shopping area. From the reception to the rooms, the whole place feels new and well kept. The rooms are outstanding, as they are of a good size and are clean. The temperature and humidity settings are perfect; beds very comfortable and has a large bathroom with separate shower/bath/toilet.What makes this place stand out is the service. The staff are very friendly and even though it is a small hotel, you always feel that there are more than adequate staff to meet your needs. For us, Ms Yoko Tsuji, a concierge, was exceptional, warm and going out of her way to assist us in our reservations and finding our way around. Given its location, this is probably more a business hotel. However, given we were travelling as a family with kids, we felt warmly welcomed in our hotel stay, all the conveniences we needed as a family were met and in fact, my 4 year old, was given such special treatment, being pampered with customised cookies, sweets, toys etc, it helped make his time in Tokyo magical.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Had to write to congratulate the Four Seasons staff on the wonderful level of service they provide here; be it the meet and greet on the platform of the Narita Express, and the return to the train on departure, or the quality and lengths of the concierge, or just the general demeanor and friendliness of everyone.But, above all we just loved the lengths they went to in making our 2-year old son feel welcome; his own correct size robe and slippers, his own child-sized umbrella, the personalised guide to Tokyo and games, the variety of amenities provided on the room (nappy dispenser, booster steps for the sink, bath toys etc etc) were exceptional.Great location, wonderful large room, would definitely stay here again on return.It isn't cheap, but we didn't expect it to be - but it was definitely worth the money for such a great and memorable experience.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: the staff was very helpful and courteous. Rooms were much larger than other tokyo hotels, and very nicely decorated. The four seasons in Tokyo does not have a lot of rooms and guests, which makes it perfect for people who prefer a less busy hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staying at the Four Seasons Hotel was like a dream holiday come true.The staff throughout the hotel were extremely helpful, very polite and they do the work very efficiently. The location of this Four Seasons Hotel is ever so useful because I can travel to and from just about anywhere in Tokyo. For those of you who love trainspotting and taking photos of trains, then look no further, because the Four Seasons in Marunouchi is the best hotel to stay and perfect vantage point for taking photos of the famous Japanese bullet train, the Shinkansen.Everything about y stay at the Four Season Hotel was out of this world. The TVs are 3D HD, made by Sharp and some of them Panasonic. The bedside radio/alarm clock is made by Bose with a CD player built in. You can also attach your iPod/iPhone connection with the Bose CD player/radio. The bathroom toiletries are by L'Occitane. They also have a Four Seasons Hotel gift shop as well.I must say the bathrooms in this hotel are ever so gorgeous, I could even sleep in them if I wanted to. The TV speakers are also inside the bathroom as well.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Tokyo’s Four Seasons Hotel at Marunouchi is a nice hotel with all the trappings of a large hotel encapsulated in a boutique format. The latest gadgets are made available including an automatic blind. The food is delicious and the breakfast spread quite large. I liked the coffee and felt it had an Indian flavor, probably the monsoon blend. The service is professional and sometimes over bearing, but if you are a first timer, then you would welcome such service that puts you at ease. Ginza is easily accessible by foot. The view of the Tokyo station is awesome. I like trains and made sure that I was given a room with a view of the tracks. I really enjoyed the bullet trains zip by. The other plus point for me was the floor to ceiling glass windows that allowed me to see the happenings outside.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I was here on business recently, and found this hotel really good. The food, the room, the staff were 1st class. When I got out of the taxi from the airport, I left a bag in the back seat (I was travelling alone, probably jet lagged). I realised this when I began to unpack. I had a camera, some duty free and gifts in the bag. I contacted the concierge service and they said leave it to them. I went out for the evening and when I came back to my room, the missing bag was present wrapped in a bow! Most impressive. I will come here every time I am in Tokyo. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is in Tokyo extremely easily accessible directly from the Maronouchi station is also served by the Narita Express from the airport. I didn’t even realize when I left the station and I was already at the hotel. It is very elegantly decorated. The rooms are bright and well equipped, as usual in Tokyo but very on the downside they are rather small. Internet is available free of charge for Wireless access is obtained on request from the hotel an adapter. Great location, I recommend it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Boutique, modern luxury. My 3rd time staying at this hotel because of the convenience to office and Tokyo station. I've seen reviews of complaints on the proximity to the train tracks, however all three times I've overlooked the tracks, I have yet to hear any train through the sound proof windows. It's tokyo station, get over it. Staff is truly the reason why I stay here. They understand your needs and do whatever it takes to make your trip as easy as possible.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We recently spent a few days at this hotel and the experience was wonderful. It was so peaceful and yet a great location. The design of the rooms is terrific and enjoyed the "hot springs" in the spay. In the evening, the bar is a great place to see the lights of Tokyo - watch the bullet trains as they come into Tokyo Station and enjoy a light meal.
