To top it off they will greet you and take you to the train station- which is really helpful!Can't go wrong staying here!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I think I would give this hotel excellent, but I reserve those for hotels that wow me, considering the 5 star status and price, four seaons Tokyo was what I expected, which is close to perfection, but there wasn't anything about it that really impressed me. The location is quite good. It is a short walk from Tokyo station, which is in itself a hub. Come out of Yaesu South exit, keep walking in that direction and the hotel will be on your right. It's hard to miss it. The service was great. Every staff member we encountered were extremely pleasant, and helpful when we needed. But again, I think that is only expected of a hotel this class. I booked the corner deluxe room. From what I saw, it wasn't much bigger, but had a much better layout, using the space more effectively. Our room was definitely very spacious for Tokyo. In fact, it made me forget the fact that Tokyo has smaller hotel rooms til just now. The bed was comfortable, we had a nice big 3D TV completed with 3D glasses. There is a list of 3D DVDs you can borrow for free. We had a real living area, which I believe a standard room doesn't really. The bathroom was big. I found a single hair in my bathtub before I used it, but it wasn't that big a deal to me so I didn't report it or anything. There was also a big closet area completed with a full length 3 way mirror. We ordered room service 3 times during our stay. My fiancee likes to eat late at night, and everything in the area is closed after 9 or 10 pm. The food was okay. We had actually expected much better. There was very few Japanese items on the menu, which was a huge disappointment. Indian curry was on the menu but not Japanese curry. Fish and chips was on the menu but not their Japanese counterparts - tempura. I am vegan but when I travel sometimes I settle for vegetarian because it can be hard to find food. Not counting salads, I think there were 2 items on that menu that was vegetarian friendly. I had to have the curry two days in a row. With the growing vegetarian, vegan and simply health couscous population, I really expected more vegetarian friendly choices from this hotel. We had breakfast on both mornings.The food was really good. I liked that you can order a la carte rather than sticking to their set menus. Overall our stay at Four seasons Tokyo was really comfortable and pleasant, which is what I had expected. I think I would recommend this hotel for business travels. I wouldn't recommend it to tourists.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is right next to Tokyo Station. It's a smaller hotel so the lobby/spa/etc are all smaller as well. It has all of the normal amenities (nice bedding/linens) but where this hotel earned its five stars was with the service. Everyone is incredibly nice and helpful. The concierge worked with me via email for a few weeks prior to our stay and got us reservations at several restaurants. They also did a few nice things for us as it was our honeymoon.They've got a train greeting service where someone will pick you up and drop you off at the train platform. We would definitely stay there again if back in Tokyo.I read some reviews of train noise. We stayed in 610 which faced the street. The soundproofing was pretty good as we didn't hear any noise.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location, did not realize it only had under 60 rooms, but they were large rooms and very comfortable, quiet and clean. The bathrooms were very spacious and luxurious. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.We had drinks at the bar which was nice and cosy, cocktails were nicely made.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Having stayed at many a five star hotel, there is one thing that can make your experience truly exceptional and that is the staff. One always expects the room to be nice and the food to be good but having a staff that can help you navigate through unfamiliar places and go so far as to personally guide you through the maze of tokyo train station was something I did not expect. They were all very professional, courteous, knowledgable, and very personable. They have made me a "Four Seasons customer " for life...thanks for the experience

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We booked this hotel because of its location and train greeting service at Tokyo station.We found this very enjoyable.But the real bonus are the people, wether at the reception desk, at the restaurant and bar, at the spa or the room service. Night or day, they are efficient, descreet, and extremely nice.We enjoyed our five nights, five breakfasts, and five dinners firstly because of them.I wish I could thank them individually for the great job they did last october for the three of us, my wife, my little boy, and I.Our stay was worth any penny.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Sure, it's the Four Seasons, so you expect it will be amazing. The location is fantastic, basically right next to Tokyo Station, with stunning views and all the comforts you might expect from the brand. It's not one of their most spectacular properties (the Istanbul one is especially nice) in terms of history or beautiful gardens, but that's what you get when you're right in the middle of Tokyo, 20 floors in the sky, relaxing in your bed and waiting for room service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Yes, it is possible to get better -- Mandarin Oriental, Hong Kong is one of a few, but this hotel is top shelf. If you're looking for great, look no further. I especially love'd relaxing in their garden area. Tokyo can be quite hectic so having the chance to unwind in the relaxing presence of nature in the groomed Japanese style was wonderful. Plenty of great restaurants all around including excellent sushi right there in the hotel. Of course, it's not Jiro quality, but still excellent. Don't miss a trip to TOKYO HANDS and be sure to stop in for dinner at the Oak Door, Rippongi Hill.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hotel is small, clean, and exactly what you wud expect from a Four Seasons. Location is probably the best for shopping. Metro station is directly next door which is ultra convenient for a gateway to the sights and sounds of Tokyo. A good solid choice but certainly not over the top in terms of luxury.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Of all the hotels I've ever stayed at this had by far and away the best service. The staff was simply unbelievable. The rooms were very pleasant if a little bland. The restaurant was good and had plenty of options. The location was great for site seeing it was right next to the train station, which is convenient since there is a direct train from Narita airport which is probably the easiest way to get into town. The spa was fantastic, had a very nice massage. Two things I would recommend if you haven't been to Tokyo before the hotel offers a service where they will have someone meet you at your train and take you to the hotel, which is wonderful since the train station is a maze. Also, cab drivers seem to have trouble finding the place so I'd get something from the hotel with directions which the concierge was happy to provide. Overall a wonderful experience which I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very nice hotel.High level facilities and extremely good service.Perfect situation, near GINZA, if you want to go for shopping or if you prefer to visit the very nice gardens of the Imperial palace. Near Tokyo station, it can be very practical if you want to take the train to visit places surrounding Tokyo.Very convinient for business trip.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Being a first timer to this hotel after almost two dozens of trips to Tokyo, I was impressed by the quality. It's a small hotel (under 60 rooms) with a discrete entrance and lobby, little bar and lounge in the 7th floor - so if you value a certain understatement and minimalism, a very good choice yet you might be disappointed if you expect the usual luxury hotel with huge lobby where the "see and be seen" happens. Rooms are large, with the usual details you would expect from a 5* house in Tokyo. Rooms are sound proof, so proof in fact, that I could hear the steps from the room above occasionally. Location is just next to Tokyo station, so just perfect for visiting close-by Ginza and Maronouchi or continue/end your travel in Japan.One word of advice, which basically applies to most 5 star hotels in Japan: You won't do yourself a favour if you travel on a budget, as 15% service fee and 5% (soon 8%) tax is added to every item. Be willing to spend 30-50% of your room rate for extras (and enjoy them ;). I certainly will be back!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Room is so stylish and comfortable. Services never let us down. Location is great.We were so relaxed in clean, quiet room and were so excited outside the hotel.Narunouchi side of Tokyo station has just been renewed. There are lots of shops and restaurants,streets are beautifully paved and night view is so nice.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel is in an excellent location, but it's probably too expensive even I'm booking it at a relatively low price compared to their "normal" price.But frankly speaking, other than the price, there's really nothing you can complain about. I've seen quite a lot of high-end hotels equipped with HDMI enabled TV, but none of them is 3D TV, not even to mention that this Four Season Hotel is also providing you the cables & 3D glasses!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Visited for Business October 6, 2013 and as previous stays with Four Seasons Hotels the Hospitality, rooms and service is Immaculate! From the flawless checkin to last minute changing my pillows to hypoallergenic, room service and concierge (they helped find an obscure pizza restaurant "The Savoy" and made reservations). Four seasons never disappoints! P.S. Japanese toilets are the best!!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I stayed here for four nights on our honeymoon trip to Japan. We arrived at 11am and found we were able to check in early with no problem. The room was beautiful with tremendous attention to detail. Some people on here say the rooms are small--we certainly didn't find this, and found they were quite spacious. Even though we were next to a busy street, we couldn't hear a thing. The bathroom was exquisite, as was the gym and spa facilities.The service was impeccable. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff either with special requests at breakfast, recommending shopping and karaoke bars, booking us into restaurants and even taking our luggage to the train station and reserving seats on a Shinkansen for us. Yoko the concierge in particular was incredibly helpful, but all the staff were lovely. We even had complementary champagne to celebrate our honeymoon.The location of the hotel is excellent--a short walk from Tokyo station where there are lots of shops and restaurants, and not far from Ginza if you like high-end shopping. All in all, it was an excellent hotel with great staff and facilities, and we would definitely recommend it to friends and family.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for one night. The reception was grate and very helpful. First night we arrived very late and we were very happy that the hotel was so grate. We had lost one of our luggage and they helped us find it. We would without question stay there again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a small modern hotel, very well located in the heart of Tokio, close to everything. Excelent staff,always very helpful,a huge room with all the amenities and a generous breakfast. You can't get wrong.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had the pleasure of 10 days here and the service, food, room, location, cleaning etc. is superb. This is by far the best four seasons I have ever experienced. The location is amazing- about one block to tokyo station. From there, you can get anywhere. The staff, oh my God, they were above and beyond anything I have ever experienced. When we checked out, they all lined up to say goodbye like fantasy island or something, it was kind of weird, but fun. The concierges are great, but one was so outstanding, we actually bought him a gift when we left. It is beyond professionalism. I have never had such amazing breakfasts in my life. Room service was also incredible/perfection. The bathroom was great. Their spa was fantastic- they have an onsen there and it is just lovely. They give you gym clothes if you want to work out. The actual architecture could not be more cool, and the building is connected to Paul, from France, for the best pastries ever. We still talk about it and will be back! No better place in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: After spending three days at this hotel my wife and I left it with great reluctance!The location is perfect both with regards to communications and (high end) shopping. Less that 10 minutes lazy walk to Ginza shopping streets, and even shorter to a great variety of good restaurants in Ginza/Marunouchi area.Only five minutes walk to Tokyo Station and the Shinkansen train - and the newly renovated historic part of Tokyo Station is an experience in itself! But what will be exclusively remembered is the magnificent attentiveness and service attitude of the staff in all departments- we felt that they all the time were a step ahead of us interpreting our expectations and needs!Only the reception/concierge is on ground floor - the restaurant and bar is on 7. floor and the guest rooms in between. Our very comfortable guest rooms had recently been renovated and offered the latest in electronic technologies as well as a superb bathroom.Located on fourth floor, we could sense the sounds of street traffic and the adjacent railway, but it was not critically disturbing due to good isolations.This is a hotel which will be remembered as one of the best in our experience!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here with hubby for holiday in early Sep for 5 nights. We arrived at the hotel at around 6.30am and did not expect to be able to check in so early but they let us in, so that was a very nice surprise and really made a difference to our first day in Tokyo. Nothing like being able to refresh and change after a long flight at the comfort of your room before roaming around the city. We got corner room 408 (if not mistaken), room shape is a little strange, like a flatten V, but nothing we would complain about. It was spacious (guessing 40-50 sqm), comfortable king bed, spacious bath room. The room is facing the road and it's quiet. Interior is similar like any other four seasons with some japanese touches (e.g. japanese pyjamas, good quality green tea).Location is super, it's right next to Tokyo station and close to Metro stations as well. Very easy to go anywhere. The neighborhood (Ginza, Marunouchi) has tons of good restaurants, there is no problem at all to get food or coffee. Btw, there is free coffee provided in reception area too. The staff are helpfull and willing to help. We had a wifi modem shipped to this hotel on our first day to ensure we always have wifif connection. The staff gave their best effort to track down the package when we could not find the package in the morning. They called up the party from where we rented the wifi modem and manage to track it down. On our last day in Tokyo, they also help us to bring our luggage to the shinkansen platform and only left when we ensured that we will be fine getting on the train without his help. Will defintely love to stay here again on our next trip to Tokyo!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed with my wife 2 nights and the Tokyo Station is located nearby of this hotel with beautiful well sized rooms and lovely décor . Very convenient location. Staff and service was excellent throughout - absolutely up to standards we have seen and come to expect from the Four Seasons - nothing was ever too much trouble. Likes:Huge rooms Top location next to Tokyo station and 1 minute from Ginza Excellent service in all areasWe highly recommend it.Corner rooms with best views. Don't worry if you face the train station. Noise no problem

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: An overall excellent hotel. Highly recommended. The service and staff set the bar of great service. The japanese breakfast is one of the best in Japan I've had. The rooms are very clean and are very comfortable. This the second time I've stayed at the hotel and I will definitely return.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Although I was only a guest for one night, I was greeted with great courtesy and, on departure, a charming young woman helped me find the right platform for Narita in the maze of the station. I would certainly stay at this hotel again and would have no hesitation recommending it to friends and colleagues.
user_name:
ICAP2013
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This review focuses on the wheelchair access aspects of this hotel only. In summary, the room was not totally barrier free, but was large enough to accommodate my two small children, my wife and myself - T4 paraplegic in manual wheelchair. It therefore offers a very rare option in Tokyo for a wheelchair user traveling with a family. I ended up in the Four Seasons because I found it very difficult to find any hotel in Tokyo that offered a wheelchair accessible room that could accommodate two adults and two children (6yo and 7yo). There were plenty of accessible rooms (max occupancy 2) and some family rooms (not accessible) but very few with both. After much emailing I settled on the Four Seasons because they offered to put a roll out bed into their large premium bedroom. The service and engagement I received from the staff at the FS during this search phase was excellent and certainly influenced my decision. The hotel is hidden in the bottom seven floors of a skyscraper in Tokyo's central business district. There is level access from the street to a small reception area with hard flooring. The restaurant and bar are on the seventh floor and fully accessible via elevator (lift). Our room was on the third floor and a short distance from the elevator over deep pile carpeting. The room was spacious with plenty of space around the bed (although of course the roll out bed made it difficult to access part of the room by wheelchair). The work desk was very large and the power sockets were mounted on the front and very easy to access. The TV remote was left within easy reach. The minibar and accoutrements were all easy to access as was the closet. All room lights could be controlled from switches by the bed as could the electric window blinds. The bed was at a very comfortable height for transfers - about 24" or 600mm. The bathroom was very spacious. There was a shower and toilet, each enclosed in their own smoked glass cubicle. Outside of these was a bathtub and sink. The door to the shower cubicle was too narrow for a wheelchair to fit through (52cm - 20.5") - not even the front castors - so I did not use that (despite the hotel provided a free standing shower seat). The door to the toilet was wide (82cm - 32") and there was enough room to execute a 180 degree transfer to the toilet. There were grab rails on either side of the toilet for support and assistance. The bathtub was easy to access but was very deep (about 27" or 675mm) and getting out could be a challenge if you don't have good upper body strength. The hotel will supply a bath chair if required. The bath had a hand held shower rose as well as taps (faucets). The sink had ample under space for knees and the towels were placed within easy reach.Despite some nice decor and excellent personnel the hotel has a kind of impersonal feel to it. The staff were superb and our children were welcomed with personalized guide books and gifts. The room worked for me and I would recommend this hotel if traveling with family. For a wheelie on their own or traveling as a couple I would recommend checking out some of the other barrier free hotel rooms.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Good hotel. Decent and clean. Had a good business trip stay. Hotel's cost alot in Japan I must say. Happy that the location is near Ginza where i spent the weekend shopping and EATING. Will recommend but prepare to pay a little more than average rates. Staff very friendly and most helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed at the Four Seasons for about 3 days and it was perfect! Once you step into the entryway, you can feel the Serenity that is Four Seasons.One of the highlights and lowlights of this hotel is that it is connected to the train station. I had a room where the view from the window is the train tracks and you can literally see the train pass you buy. My son enjoyed it, but I didn't enjoy the view too much. Around the hotel are a lot of businesses and offices so there are a lot of people who takes breaks outside your window too.The hotel offers a spa and a restaurant which is popular for the locals. Just steps away is Ginza. It's in such a prime location that any direction you take, you are bound to find something exciting. My best find was the 100% Chocolate Cafe.The Four Seasons was very accomodating to our needs. The bathroom is huge! It's a bit expensive but overall worth the price.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Upon entering the lobby, I was surprised to learn that it was just slightly bigger than my home bedroom and bathroom combined. Unlike other Four Seasons I've stayed at, this property was really small.However, my room was spacious for Japan standards and good quality, but interior design was nothing to rave about. Convenient controls for automatic curtains and shades but no reason to open them with nothing but buildings across it. Good wifi connection. Nice L'Occitane toiletries. Excellent minibar. Location is good if you want quick access to the train station... walking distance to Ginza shopping area. For the price I paid, it's not the type of hotel I would return to. I've stayed in other nearby hotels which are equally nice so I'll continue on to discover another property on my next trip this November.By the way, the staff were great and very attentive. Kudos to them.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We had set up a meet and greet airport service that is supplied by the hotel. We were assisted with the purchase of tickets on the high speed train into Tokyo station (next to the hotel) and were met at out train car by hotel staff who escorted us to our hotel rooms. This was a real wonderful way to arrive stress free as we do not speak Japanese and Tokyo station is immense and busy!The rooms were very modern, bright, clean and huge by Japan standards. Amenities were all top notch and breakfasts were delicious.Four Seasons quality from beginning to end!
user_name:
Frank D
Sao Martinho do Porto, Portugal

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stay here only and only for business. For less money there are much better options in Tokyo. Every window you look out to, is an eyesore. Sure its convenient for Tokyo train station but so are other hotels in the area. This hotel just tries to be all things to all people with a painfully limited space. Rooms are indeed big, but with puzzling pillars. Our biggest gripe was that the tiny space devoted to the restaurant/bar is smoking friendly and so renders the entire area unusable for non smokers. This by far is the most questionable Four Seasons location and I bet they are not only actively but aggressively looking for new locations in Tokyo now that they got the 2020 Olympics. In the meantime stay somewhere else and don't get swayed by the good service which is pretty much a guarantee in Japan, they invented courtesy.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was a very pleasant suprise in Tokyo. Very well appointed and very conveniently located next to Tokyo Station. It is small, but our room was a good size and very attractive. The service was fantastic and everyone speaks very good English. The fitness gym is good, and has a more than satisfactory onsen/spa area.We were staying there for our wedding nights and were thoroughly spoiled by the hotel and staff.As already mentioned by others, a member of staff helped us carry our luggage to our train at the station.Fully recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: To start...one should expect excellence when staying at a Four Season property, no matter the location. This property does not disappoint. Located in a great area of Tokyo and close to the most important train station in the city, it is hard to find yourself not in the center of it all. The hotel is small, but the staff is very attentive. If I had to make any complaint, it would be that the food in the restaurant hotel is way overpriced for what you get. I ordered a seared Tuna for my first night there, and at $40, you would expect a lot. Instead, I received 4 small morsels of tuna, that you could pop into your mouth without cutting. The food tasted great, but the value was not there.The rooms are very spacious, modern and clean. Most important to me is that it is a quiet property. My suggestion would be to ask for a room facing the train station if possible. My view was out the other side of the property, and you are left starting a basic Honda building.The fitness room on the 7th floor was well equipped...3 treadmills, free weights, elliptical machines and others. It was never crowded during my stay, and was always kept clean and odor free.Definitely worth staying here if you are coming to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: As you would expect from a Four Seasons the rooms were excellent (large by Japanese standards) and the staff are outstanding. This is a relatively small property and does not have a large/impressive lobby. The fitness area is fine but also rather small. The hotel is near Ginza and the Imperial Palace but does not have great views of either one.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This boutique-type Four Seasons is a perfect Hotel for those new (or experienced) to Tokyo. The location is fabulous, being adjacent to the main Tokyo train station and near many subway stops. The service is exemplary (as an example, a representative of the hotel literally walked us onto our train to Osaka to ensure we left safely). The hotel is in close proximity to many excellent restaurants, which makes the first night in Tokyo after a long flight much easier.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Booked 2 rooms for a few nights. Great views of Tokyo station and walking distance to Ginza. Had some issues with the DVD player working in both rooms, but the staff did their best to try and get things straightened out. Standouts among the staff were the Concierge (Akril?), and Miku who ran us to Tokyo Station to catch a Narita Express- awesome service from these guys. Make sure to try the "Milk Jam" on your toast at the breakfast- a Four Seasons Tokyo exclusive that their executive chef makes in house. Rooms were nice- the automatic blinds were a big plus and helped us stay asleep longer in the mornings. I can't say it was as nice as our experience at Four Seasons HK, but I'd recommend this hotel as a solid property and would stay again in the future.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Just as any Four Seasons hotel should be. You can always count on a certain level when staying at a Four Seasons hotel and this one did not disappoint. They had people meet us as we got off the bullet train from Kyoto and had someone take us to our train for the airport as well. Staff was wonderful and location was prime- will stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It's what you expect from four seasons brand. Our room is very large and well appointed. The hotel is conveniently located next to Tokyo Station where your adventure on the subway and train system can begin. Don't be afraid....use the subway. Lots of local shopping and close to Ginza district. The hotel staff is fluent in English and very helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed 3 nights with 2 kids. The room we stayed was spacious, had great view of Tokyo Station. Kids (and me too!) loved to watch many trains, including Shinkansen (bullet train) come and go all the time. I was not expecting kids-friendliness because of its location, but they had kids amenities and little toys and guidebooks for them.The hotel's name is bit confusing though. Marunouchi usually means the area west side of Tokyo station (aka inside the Yamanote-line) but the hotel is in the other side. Room and housekeeping was excellent but I gave 4 stars because their breakfast service at the restaurant was slow.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I am currently on a train leaving Tokyo just having completed a 5 night stay at the 4 seasons marinouchi. I can't say enough complementary things about it. The staff always went the extra mile. Every request that was made was not only fulfilled, but the staff and concierge would also make sure to trouble shoot anything I had not thought of. Specifically:1) we started out in an amazing room--- we had booked with a preferred agent and had requested an upgrade-- one was not available at check in, but as soon as one was we were called and our baggage was moved--- did not need to keep on asking or checking in with them to see of one had come up-- the room they moved us to was even more impressive2) all of the concierge staff were excellent --- they made reservations for us, prints out maps for to show taxis without us asking and even made a reservation for a restaurant on a night that I was not staying At the hotel. Prior to my arrival they helped me rent a mobile wi-fi hotspot and made the process seamless3). The bell staff was tireless-- one of them walked us to our tour bus terminal, and when we were leaving even purchased a train pass so that she could walk us right to the train platform -- always with a smile, never with any expression that this was too much work or asking too much--- she was excellent-- she remembered where we from, what we had done each day and carried on pleasant conversation effortlessly4) the morning we were leaving I called room service to see if they could make us breakfast sandwiches to take on the train-- this was not on the menu and did not seem like something they had done before-- the results was a beautifully packed box of egg and cheese sandwiches cut symmetrically, arranged perfectly, and without me asking for it also packed two tangerines, two bottles of water, wet napkins, and a container of ketchup.---it was so neatly done I felt bad eating it.Whomever is managing this hotel has done a wonderful job training all of the staf, and is lucky to have excellent, professional people working for him/her. By far the best run four seasons property I have stayed at

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located adjacent to the Tokyo Station and a few blocks from Ginza and the Ginza Station. The room was very spacious and clean. Service was impeccable. Breakfast - could be better. Breakfast was included with our room so no complaints. But if you have to pay for it, please eat elsewhere, like at one of the many eateries in Tokyo Station or Ginza. I would return to this hotel when I visit Tokyo and strongly recommend it, especially to first time visitors to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Staying at the Four Seasons at Marunouchi set the tone for an amazing time in Tokyo!! Comfortable room in impeccable condition (cleanliness in hotels is so so important) and were treated like royalty: complimentary champagne and berries when we arrived in light of the occasion we were celebrating and again made mention of at dinner on our final night (dessert plates were specially decorated). Turn down service, morning paper, complimentary chilled water & hot beverages (and regularly topped up) as well as all the other little details one enjoys from proper 5* hotels. Loved the location for sight-seeing: 5mins walk from Ginza (shopping & all the best restaurants), 2mins from Tokyo central station, 5mins from Imperial Palace gardens and 10mins from the Red Bus tours starting point. Topped with super friendly, eager to please staff - what more can you ask for?!
user_name:
Charlane10
Cape Town Central, South Africa

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We just finished a four day vacation with our children at the Four Seasons. We all loved it. It was one of the few hotels that offered two queen beds. They placed a very comfortable cot in the room without our even having to ask for it. The location close to Tokyo station was helpful for all of our sightseeing needs. As mentioned by other reviewers they really made an effort for our children. A small gift at check in, cookies, fruit and their own slippers. Our children loved the bathtub and asked to take a bath every night and wanted to use the "special" bathrobes. I had emailed the concierge and asked for help getting tickets to the Ghibli museum. They were prompt and very willing to help. It was a holiday time frame. They were able to obtain tickets for me but I was able to get tickets in the US with an unrestricted time frame.In the hotel, we were on the side facing the station and we enjoyed watching the trains. You can hear the NEX train but it is a low noise and did not prevent any of us from sleeping. The privacy blinds allowed for a great view of the city on the other side of our room. Another helpful reviewer told us that the exit from Tokyo station was the Yaesu south exit.Overall we had a great experience. Some other reviewer had mentioned a lack of detail and that they did not even get water. We had coffee from the Nespresso machine in the room, water every day, an electric kettle with a tea set for tea, and there was fruit on the table near the elevator door every day.We highly recommend it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Travelled with 2 kids so the two double beds came in handy.Likes:1) Huge rooms with two King beds & Huge bathrooms2) Top location next to Tokyo station and 1mi from Ginza3) Excellent service in all areas like all FS propertiesDislikes1) No onsen or pool2) No kids facilities 3) No porch so you will get wet if it rains

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Location close to Tokyo Station, Ginsa and Imperial Palace. Great location for runners as the morning run around The Imperial Palace Gardens is beautiful. Rooms are top notch Four Seasons and decor is quite similar to NYC Four Seasons with well maintained wood paneling. 3D televisions with goggles very fun. Complimentary coffee makers and tea in room is nice extra. Excellent workspace in rooms as well. Very comfortable and quiet despite location near train station. Service is beyond expectations with fresh coffee, just-squeezed juice and fresh baked pastries. My son asked for a croissant after the basket in the lobby was empty and the staff brought him a BAG of assorted pastries. This sort of extra touch is what keeps us coming back to the Four Seasons for that last 25 years. Worth every penny.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The hotel was extremely well located and very comfortable. The staff were friendly and service was great. Food was a little over priced (but good) although that is probably true for all Tokyo hotels. The rooms were a good size and I particularly appreciated the oversized desk which allowed me to comfortably get some work done.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Outstanding in every respect but especially the level of customer service and then the little things that make the biggest difference. Like, the quietest air-conditioning we have ever experienced plus the simplest control panel (no IT degree required here), a dial for temperature and a dial for fan speed - so simple, so easy. Conveniently located near Tokyo railway station (don't worry, you will not hear a single train), we arranged for the platform geeting service - just phone ahead once you have your Narita Express ticket with carriage and seat numbers - for the staff to help you with the 5-10 min walk to the hotel. Unless you are very familiar with this area of Tokyo, I would strongly recommend this service as the hotel street frontage is very discrete - no big driveaway or entrance foyer visible from the street. The hotel is new, modern and the rooms are a generous size by Japanese standards. The bathrooms are large and the room is well equipped with automatic open/close on the curtains - and if you like your room dark, the black out curtains are very good. The reception staff are very helpful, be it with directions, advice or recommending a suitable restaurant nearby. I had a friend meet us at the hotel and he was amazed by the staff not only knowing who were by name but also knowing whether we in or out, in fact at the bar!The bar on the 7 floor looks West over the railway station, financial district and towards the Imperial Palace Gardens. The room mini bar has a wide range of drinks, nibbles and free nescafe pod coffee. Once room service noticed we used ice in our drinks, every night without fail the ice bucket had been refilled.As I mentioned it is the little touches that separate the Four Seasons Marunouchi from the numerous hotels I have stayed in across Asia, like the complimentary coffee with your wake up call on our departure morning. As well as the unique question, "and what time would you like to have your second wake up call?" Just in case you go back to sleep after the first call!!!Highly recommended when staying in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons Marunouchi TRULY listened to their customers' needs. I had more than 10 requests and the hotel totally satisfied what I requested. This made my trip an excellent start.1. Upgraded my room to a suiteIt was amusing! I enjoyed the suite very much and its facilities were excellent. The decor was modern and unique. For example:Bed/ Sleeping quality: Absolutely Comfortable! Bathroom: Extremely big! The bath products were L'OCCITANE and I used them for the whole trip. Thanks so much for such complimentary products.View: Tokyo Stations / Tokyo International Forum / Trains (You can see the trains moving around, very special views!)Suite facilities: Coffee machine! Use my iphone to connect the suite's sound system2. Professional staff and customer servicesThe staff were very professional. It was raining before I found the hotel. While checking in, they gave me a towel to dry my clothes. This act was more than words! What is more, I had 10 requests prior to my stay and the staff tried to solve what I needed. For example, I asked them the way to go to Arcana Izu. They gave me a detailed route so that I knew the way to go there. I asked them if I can connect my Iphone to the room's sound system. They asked the staff to help me fix it when I first arrived in the suite. I felt respected. I also booked a restaurant and the staff gave me the map to go there. This was such excellent services provided by the hotel. Very nice!3. Hotel Facilities:I used the gym and it was awesome. The equipment was modern and perfect. The onsen was really special! I enjoyed the fitness centre very much.4. Location:Next to Tokyo Station. Extremely convenient! 5. Restaurant:Ekki Bar and Grill was awesome! Very stylish!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The rating of this hotel as number one in Tokyo did not convince me. In a similar location I slept at better hotels and cheaper. As this hotel is small (with rooms from the 2nd to the 6th floor), the view (facing the train station or just buildings across the street) is dull. My room was large and comfortable, but the window was not fully sound proof. The noise I heard from outside was not intense, just a little, but enough for the trains to wake me up in the evening and early morning. The restaurant on the seventh floor offers no breakfast buffet, only à la carte, with no variety of bread, just muffins and croissants. The gym was well equiped and very good though. I must say, however, that I was impressed with the staff, very friendly, and very, very efficient.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our stay was perfect. Excellent service from wonderful staff. Starting from the airport greeting service who helped us get organized and put us on the NEX train to Tokyo and also the Bellman who met us just as we stepped off the train...we really felt welcome. This great sense of arrival carried on as we walked through Tokyo station out to Yaesu South exit and on to the hotel. The Bellman even pointed out a few interesting features in the station and assisted us in validating our JR passes. Our room was ready and they were prepared for my 2 children as they had a bowl of treats waiting for them. The room was spacious enough for the 4 of us. Loved the beds, the turndown service and all the little extras that makes it all so special. This is a boutique hotel that goes out of its way to personalize your stay. Decor is "understated elegance" with some local elements. We loved the location and would definitely stay here again. The most memorable thing about our stay was how they made our children feel welcome. Our first impression was that it was more of a businessman's hotel considering the location and the ambiance but they certainly know how to pamper their little guests as well. On our first visit, they prepared a little booklet of activities and things to see and do in Tokyo for kids. On our second visit they made a personalized cookie and coloring kit for our younger daughter. Lots of great advice from the staff on local dining and sightseeing as well as tips for the other places in Japan that we were visiting. I look forward to visiting Tokyo and stating here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed in the Four Seasons Tokyo for four nights as part of our honeymoon trip to Japan. Pros -1) Nice enough room, large for Japan2) Great Bathroom - bath and separate shower cubicle3) Comfy bed4) Location (close to Tokyo Train StationCons -1) NO extras included, all you get for your money is the room: no free bottled water, no breakfast included (which worked out at nearly £50 for two when we did pay for it); only one device connected to wifi per person free (then very expensive to connect any other devises per day), extra for use of the 3D aspect of the TV, the list goes on). This was the most disappointing aspect, as it made us feel like they only welcomed the 'super-rich' and looked down on people like us who were there for a special treat!2) Bar / restaurant very overpriced and average quality with a poor atmosphere, and not a great view compared to other buildings in the area. Also they add a service charge onto everything without first letting you know.3) The staff: they were generally nice and friendly, however check in and out was very impersonal. Also sometimes they could be very overbearing: for example, someone would knock on the room door twice a day to ask if you wanted 'turn down' service. They telephoned the room if you put the do-not disturb sign on the door, which irritated us - we asked not to be disturbed, and telephoning DEFINITELY disturbs.4) Generic looking building inside and out, nothing special like we expected for the price. Overall, our stay at the Four Seasons was disappointing. I'm sure there are equally as nice hotels in central Tokyo for half the price without the cons! We saved up for a long time to be able to afford to stay, and we definitely wouldn't bother in the future.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I picked the Four Seasons because of the many reviews on TripAdvisor that talked about how welcoming they are to families with children. I was pleased to find that to be true. My husband and I spent 4 days there with our 2 boys, ages 8 and 11. The first thing that sold me on the hotel was that we could all stay in one room with 2 queen beds. Most of the hotels in this category had a 3-person per-room limit, and we would have had to book 2 rooms. I made the hotel aware that we were traveling with children and they gave us a room facing the train tracks, as requested (although the US-based reservation agent thought I was crazy to ask for that, but my boys love trains!). When we arrived there were treats for the kids, a sightseeing booklet and kid-sized pajamas and slippers, which made them feel very comfortable after a very long trip from New York. The room was very spacious and filled with light from wall-to-wall windows on 2 sides. Furnishings and amenities were just as you'd expect from a Four Seasons, first rate. The noise from the trains didn't bother us at all. I had a lot of communication via email with the concierge before we arrived to arrange two private guides, both of whom were excellent, and to get tickets to the Intercity Baseball Game, which was the highlight of our trip. The location of the hotel is good in that it is close to several subway lines, and after our first day with a guide we were able to get around on our own. The downside is that it isn't a very touristed area, which might be great for some, but we really struggled finding places to eat. The hotel food is very expensive. We wanted to try Japanese food, but we needed a kid-friendly restaurant that would hold our hand and help us figure out what to order. We tried to explain to the concierge what we were looking for, but they had a hard time coming up with suitable restaurants. On the last night they sent us to a place that they thought might fit the bill, but we didn't realize until we got there that it was cash only and we didn't have enough. So we went across the street and had pasta. Oh well. We had a small miscommunication upon arriving at Narita. We had paid for the airport greeting service, but the woman who met us didn't speak English. So when she took us outside to get on a bus, we were confused, because we thought we were going to take a train to Tokyo station. We also didn't have any yen, so we had to make her understand that we needed to change money, which we thought was part of the point of the greeting service. When we were dropped off near, but not at, the train station, there was no one there from the hotel to meet us, so we walked over to the train station because we thought they were expecting us there. From there we didn't know what to do. Fortunately we had an internationally activated cellphone, so we were able to contact the hotel and figure out where to meet them. It all worked out in the end, but to their credit the hotel apologized and removed the greeting service charge from our bill without our even asking. If

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The smaller size of this hotel lends itself to fabulous service. No wait for concierge service, room service or assistance from hotel staff. Our suite was large, quiet (facing street not train station) and perfect for relaxing after a busy day in a busy city. We traveled with our 10 year old son, the hotel amenities for him were excellent, we had our choice of XBOX, Playstation and Nintendo for his amusement along with suggestions from the Hotel Manager where he might find interesting to see and visit. Great location if you are planning day trips via train or for walking trips into Tokyo itself. Hotel located in business district so not much of a view from hotel itself, except we thoroughly enjoyed watching the trains arrive/depart from the hotel lounge - activity on the street entertaining as well.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Booked a supposedly good room, price?.. just a mere $1,018.00 for a night (including tax I must add) .. Taken to the room, it was ok, nothing to gorgeous. Opened the curtains, and lo and behold a wonderful view over the railway tracks at Tokyo Station.. 4th Floor, one of the best rooms in the house. Train spotters paradise.Room itself was average, but don't compare to any other hotel in Tokyo.. otherwise you'll have a heart attack! The elevators were from the 70's.. No Club Lounge, (which I knew), but hey, for a $1,000 a night, what do you expect.. They are very proud of their sound proofing, but I was left unimpressed.. Severe complaint to the Manager, who was kind, respectful, and upgraded us to a higher level room. However, unable to bring this up to 5 star standard that night. Even reception, is on the ground floor, behind a pillar, very dull and most uninspiring. Tieless boys running around just don't cut it.Food average, views from all windows were over the railway lines or pedestrian ways (bathroom), so blinds, curtains drawn constantly.. but for a $1,000 a night,its understandable.Okay, now the good news! for $200 a night less, transfer you thoughts and money to the Shangri-la hotel, just the other side Tokyo Station, and a world away from the dull and dingy Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Very clean luxury hotelExcellent service. Even by Japanese (excellent) standards. Free WIFI. Free assistance to and from the railway station. Very courteous and very helpful staff. Absolutely what a luxury hotel should be. I will certainly stay again!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Outstanding hotel and staff. The best service we've ever experienced from any other hotel. We took a day trip to Kamakura and a staff member walked us to the train station, assisted with purchasing our tickets and walked us down to the train platform..at no charge. I am allergic to seafood and the concierge recommended an amazing Yakitori restaurant (Birdland). DELISH!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We werent there long - just 2 nights but it was a great way to start the trip. Family of 4 - large rooms and beautiful bathroom. Very expensive but worth it. good location near train station so you can get everywhere easily. Clean, friendly staff. Spoke good english as my japanese is minimal

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The smiling faces and helpful gestures made us feel at ease! Having someone meet us at the door of our train at Tokyo Station and walk us to the hotel was such a valuable experience. We were very apprehensive about finding our way and the fact that this is a complimentary service just blew us away. Although it is only a 5 minute walk, we would never have found our way to the hotel or back for our departure. The rooms were lovely (very modern) and so comfortable.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Amazing staff!!!!!! I can go on and on about the staff at this hotel. They went above and beyond for us during our 6 night stay while on our honeymoon. SO helpful and such personal attention that we've never experienced before. The concierge really knows the city well and has great recommendations for anything you might be looking for. They all speak English well. Rooms are great, a good size... super comfy bed/pillows. Very clean. Nice amenities in the bathroom (L'Occitane products). View wasn't anything special (facing the train tracks - but don't worry, couldn't hear the train). Great restaurant on the 7th floor. I would recommend staying at this Four Season's!!!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Just came back from a Japan trip two days ago with my husband and daughter, stayed with the Four Seasons Tokyo Marunouchi for four days. The staff are helpful, friendly and professional. We came to Tokyo by Shinkansen from Kyoto and they sent a bellboy, (with good speaking English) to receive us in the platform exactly at the cabin we got off. We went straight to the hotel without wasting a minute and we started our Tokyo adventure within 30 minutes we stepped out of the Shinkansen, my family and I do appreciate it with all our heart.The room is spacious and spotless as we expected, nothing could be complain, complimentary bottles of water, fruit and free fittness facilities for all guests, couldn't be better though the room was not of a very good a view, but still, no complain.BUT, one thing did disappointed us very much, the wireless service is only complimentary to two guest devices. My husband has a computer with him to keep up with his business in Hong Kong and we have, each of us, one smart phone which, I supposed, is not unusual to most of the family nowaday. As soon as the computer was fixed, my husband and I gave up our iphone wifi to our daughter. However, the hotel policy did take this into account and there is always an alternative - you can pay 1000yen and you can get a total of 4 devices connected for 24 hours, how VERY thoughtful they are !!!! Well, we have been to Japan many many times, staying in 4 stars hotels, 5 stars hotels, 6 stars like Park Hyatt, they all gave complimentary wireless service in room. Even the one we stayed in Kyoto, a small one but they provided 24 hours free wifi, stable and always kept all devices connected. It was the first time we stayed in Four Season Tokyo, if we would have known this fact, we would not have chosen it for our stay, honestly. I clarified again, the staff are wonderful and lovely, most helpful and professional, it is this very hotel policy that let us down. The Four Season in Hong Kong is not all free in room, but at least, it is complimentary to four devices. I never have thought that the 1000yen is so important to Four Seasons Tokyo Marunouchi.To came back to our stay, we surrendered at last and paid the 1000 yen, totol 3000yen for three nights, but the wireless connection was disappointing the same. Whenever I left the phone unattended for 10 mins or switched off the phone, the next time I switch on again,I have to go to setting and reconnect the wifi with the Four Seasons again. I just don't understand.... does it really cost the hotel much for wireless connection for your guests? This policy is not very civilized.Lastly, to be fair, everything in our stay is wonderful, the staff is outstanding as I always emphasized, the food in the Hotel Restaurant "Ekki" is delicious and the ambience is cosy. And Mr Yuuki san, the staff that helped out with our luggages and accompanied us to the limousine station, and insisted to see us off until we got on the bus safely, is most helpful, his speaking English is excellent, very cheerful and easy going, a very promising staff. If next time my family is going for a Tokyo holiday again, which we certainly will; and if we ever consider the Four Seasons Marunouchi once more, it will definitely be the staff hospitality that is so inviting. And we will try to convince ourselves that the several thousand yen for the wireless charge is our donation for the maintainence to this service. It will be happier to think this way.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Marunouchi gave a perfect ending to our three-week magical vacation through Japan. We were a couple taking my niece around Japan for her 16th birthday. Naturally, we wanted her to be left with fond memories of this trip, little did we know that the Japanese standards of service and manners would magically delight us at every turn. The Four Seasons, however, took out a magic wand and bombarded us with surprising treats and touches. Staying there was more like having a very high-end flat in an exclusive residential building with amazing services at our disposal. In order to be fair to the work that this wonderful little hotel is doing, I will break down my review to different categories: staff, aesthetics/physical experience, amenities, location, and service.THE STAFFExcellence in this hotel begins and ends with the staff. They are simply superb. They have managed to find a way of not getting on your way, yet being there moments before you realize you need something, which they will offer before you even ask. Then, as suddenly as they appear, they do their thing and disappear to leave you with your peaceful stay at their hotel. There are many high quality hotels with amazing service around the world, especially in Japan. But the staff at the Four Seasons Marunouchi's know how to leave you with a genuine experience of having been valued. That sets them apart from others. To boot, they speak good English. English Language Skills:The Japanese hospitality industry in general does not seem to pre-occupy itself with making English their first language. We accepted that as another expression of the Japanese celebration of their own culture. But at the Four Seasons, every staff member spoke English well, a few of them in perfect Queen's English. Even the cleaning staff spoke English. That certainly caught our attention. AESTHETICS AND PHYSICAL EXPERIENCEThe Lobby:As other reviewers have said, the reception and public area of the hotel is smaller in comparison with other hotels. This small boutique hotel feels more like an exclusive residential building. Commensurate with that approach, the lobby area is elegant with quiet but high design furniture. The reception desk is a small counter, tucked in the corner near the entrance, with one or two staff members in clean white suits greeting you. There is no sign of the "business" operations of the hotel on display, which we found to be a tasteful and elegant touch. The decor is clearly Japanese inspired, but executed in a modern, clean, fresh look using high design furniture, natural materials, and clearly top notch workmanship. Then the elevators take you to your floor where the same design approach explodes into finer details.Our Suite:We had taken a deluxe premiere suite. Contrary to the small lobby, our suite was large and airy. The door opened to an entrance/foyer space, followed by a hallway, with a beautiful dressing and closet area with a fine blond wood finish went floor to ceiling, including large closets, drawers, a three-piece foldable full length mirror. On the other side, conveniently facing the dressing area, the bathroom was huge, with the sink, toilet, shower, soaking bathtub sections separated by frosted glass walls and doors, providing privacy in each section while maintaining the overall experience of the large, spacious bathroom. The bathroom was stocked with top of the line herbal bathing products and all the male and female grooming necessites. Individual fine bathrobes, plush slippers, pajamas, Japanese comfort outfits for around the suite were provided for each family member.Then there was the amazing room itself. One side of the length of the suite was an expansive glass wall with views of the city's skyline and the amazing Shinkansen bullet trains curving on the side. The suite was fully soundproofed and no outside noise was ever heard. There was a spacious sitting area, consisting of a gorgeous couch and two very comfortable, yet sublimely designed (maybe Scandinavian) chairs, a well stocked tea/coffee/drinks area, with the necessary tools and serving necessities. A slender desk agains the glass wall, equipped with a concealed compartment of all the electronic connections one could imagine and a comfortable office chair continued along the wall to make an entertainment console under the large HD TV connected to the wall with an an adjustable connection allowing us to rotate the TV to any side of the room we wanted. The TV and sound systems were amazing. They had a selection of English speaking channels, which became handy later when my niece wanted to chill before going to bed. The beds were very comfortable, complete with duvets and high count pressend cotton sheets. There was an abundance of electric outlets in the most convenient locations, useful to today's travelers, who will each have several electronic devices needing to be charged and recharged in locations near where they want to hang out.SEVENTH FLOOR AMENITIESDespite being a small boutique hotel, the Four Seasons Marunouchi still provides excellent amenities. On the 7th floor of the building, they have a 24-hour gym, male and female spa areas, complete with the most beautifully designed traditional onsen Japanese baths, showers, dressing areas, fully equipped grooming areas, and relaxation areas. The spa provides a list of fantastic treatments that may be received in private treatment rooms or on your suite. The 7th floor also includes a restaurant as well as a tea room/bar/lounge area with spectacular views and exquisite furniture. The optional breakfast includes a set Japanese option, an American option, or a combination of their a la carte options, all of which are divine and served at a table in the restaurant. LOCATIONBeing steps away from the Tokyo Central station, with a variety of long distance and subway train lines, buses, and taxi cabs right there outside the door, the Four Seasons Marunouchi is perhaps in the most accessible location in Japan. More like Mid-town Manhattan than the village, the Ginza area where the hotel is located contains an array of shops, restaurants, and most important sights, including the Imperial Palace and Gardens. Other entertainment destination are just a subway or JR train ride away.SRVICE! SERVICE! SERVICE!Instead of using more superlatives to explain the quality of the service in this hotel, I will give two examples, which should tell the story.Example 1 (Delight): At the time of our arrival, the check-in staff overheard that this was a trip to celebrate my niece's birthday. They said they would like to send us a complimentary cake and asked how and where we would like to have it. Later a pleasant lady showed up at our door at the time we had requested to deliver the cake. Well, it was much more than a cake. There was a beautifully handwritten birthday card, which every staff member in the hotel had personally signed. Imagine my niece's delight to get that. The lady then set up a beautiful little spread, including a gorgeous fresh fruit topped cake and other snacks. Then she asked if she may take a photo of the three of us, which we agreed to do. At check out time, they surprised my niece once again by handing her a print of the photo they had taken, framed beautifully in a Japanese frame and attached to a fine Japanese card with hand-painted watercolor markings and another personal message to my niece. Example 2 (Unreal):Our departure flight was scheduled for early evening. Before checkout, , as normal, we called the frontdesk to arrange for our luggage to be stored in the hotel for the remainder of the day while we would do some final shopping and sightseeing. At the pre-arranged time, a staff member showed up with a cart and carefully arranged our luggage in a way that our bags containing our fragile gifts were protected. He asked what time our train to the airport would be leaving. Then he asked us to be back at a certain time to be sure to catch our train on time. When we returned to pick up our luggage, another person in clean formal uniform and white cotton gloves had already prepared our luggage on a smaller more compact cart. We thought he was going to bring the luggage out to the sidewalk or something like that. But no, he wanted to make sure we got to our train on time. He graciously pushed our luggage through the confusing maze of the Tokyo Central Station, used his own subway card to get through the various pay-gates, and walked us right to the train. When we proceeded to take our luggage, he wouldn't have it! He personally put our luggage in the luggage compartment of the train, made sure we found our seats, then he bowed, thanked us and left. Oh, by the way, they don't accept tips in Japan and he wasn't hustling for tips. This is just what they do at this hotel. We were astounded!No wonder the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunauchi keeps making number 1 on TipAdvisor's list of Tokyo hotels! We will be telling everyone we know that, if in Tokyo, they should consider staying there.My family and I would like to thank the staff at the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Maranuchi for making our last night in Japan our best night there and making this one of our most cherished and memorable trips ever.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed 4 nights at the hotel after traveling for almost 24 hours. The staff was amazing at getting us settled and making sure to personally walk us to show us something quick for dinner. The concierge was very helpful with guiding us and our 2 children. On top of all of that, the room was spacious and very comfortable. The location is right above a HUGE underground mall with restaurants and shops. That made it very convenient for finding meals and snacks at the end of a long day. We read many reviews in selecting hotels for our trip to Tokyo and we are so happy that we chose this one based on service and location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The outstanding staff is very responsive to your needs. They are able to pick up your family and luggage from Tokyo station and return you to the station at the end of your trip. Very convenient location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is my third visit to this hotel. It has been over a year since my last stay. We took the Narita express from the airport and were greeted by the hotel staff (call ahead and it's free). When being picked up at the Tokyo station next door, the bellboy remembered me from my last visit. It felt like coming home. The concierge was helpful in finding the name of a restaurant I had previously visited. They just checked their records in the computer from my last stay. The room was great overlooking the trains coming and going. Do not worry about train noise, it is hardly audible. There is a pillow menu if you are not satisfied with the standard issue. Staying here is always a pleasure.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in the Four Seasons after returning from Kyoto and an earlier night in Tokyo at the Park Hyatt (see review). We called in advance and a staff member picked us up from the Shinkansen (complementary service), right at our car, walked us over to the hotel, right next to the station en helped with check-in. Staff overall was extremely helpful. Our room was very spacious, modern, with a very comfortable bed, large desk area, bar area with Nespresso coffee maker, nice pajama's and slippers, 3-D TV and all the amenities expected when staying at a Four Seasons hotel. The bathroom was spacious with tub and great shower. Our reservation included breakfast, which was a semi a la carte menu. Great choices, well prepared and the service was excellent, kudos to Gerard the restaurant manager who didn't miss a thing, directed staff kindly, and checked in with all the guests. Dinner was excellent too and clearly included non-guests. The bar area was nice to have a drink and watch the trains coming and going, no noise to be heard. Background music, modern R&B, didn't really match with the crowd, but that was minor. The spa was nice, small, but good services. Little things make a difference, in the relaxation room were reading glasses available, very thoughtful.The location is excellent for shopping, or walking to the Imperial place. Cabs are reasonably priced and next to Singapore the cleanest and most efficient in the world. However, public transportation is also excellent. Upon departure, we were walked to our train, which is helpful in Tokyo Station, which must be one of the if not the busiest train station in the world. Overall and excellent hotel, in which we will definitely stay during our next visit to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo has a much different feel to the usual Four Seasons Hotel. The lobby is quite modest, as is the bar and restaurant which are on the top floor. The spaces are tastefully done but quite small. The rooms, on the other hand, are large in size and very comfortable. The staff are friendly and helpful, and we were always made to feel that nothing was too much trouble. At first we were shown to a suite on the third floor overlooking Tokyo Station, but within a minute or two we could hear the squeal of train brakes as they slowed down entering the station. We asked for a room on the other side of the hotel and ended up in a nice quiet, although much more expensive suite. The location of this hotel is its greatest asset. It is close to Tokyo station and within walking distance of The Royal Palace and the Ginza district. I would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Firstly this is a boutique hotel in size and service....its not your normal full range hotel. Plus it is right next to Tokyo station...in Marunouchi...which means its not cheap. Now that said...this hotel is wonderful The staff and the service they provide it simple first class....from the assistance...to find a chemist...to booking tickets on JR...and helping with luggage onto the train. Rooms are large and appointed with all the refinement you expect form Four Season.We will go back...simply great.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Do not be put off by the high price, the hotel is worth every penny!!! It is right next to Tokyo Train Station, and they will pick you up and bring you to the hotel. This is after a 50 minute Narita Express train from the airport. Everything in the hotel is very efficient, the staff anticipated our visit, and had thoughtful reception gifts for both of my children, personalized cookies in the room. After the long trip we all were exhausted, the temperature environment was perfect, linens inviting, but first we bathed in the nice sunken tub, had excellent room service and were sleeping within 2 hours. Since we were on another time zone we awakened in the middle of the night, hungry again, and of course the room service is ready to serve. After the middle of the night meal we decided to take a early morning walk. Although the concierge was not helpful in this regard, however luckily we found a very nice park after circling around the back of the hotel walking toward the Imperial Palace, and turning to the left toward Hibya Park, and was lovely--very fragrant flowers, and ponds and places to sit and relax had it not been for the rain. Do not expect the concierge to be helpful beyond dispensing maps, and giving instructions to the taxi drivers. I would recommend having a plan ahead of time, then going ahead and booking a car for the day to follow a program. We wanted to go to the fish market to see this famous site, but apparently it was closed for the day as communicated by the concierge. We did not hire a car for our daughter can communicate in Japanese a little and we were able to get around a little bit. We visited the Sky Tree, and the Edo Tokyo Museum, and both were interesting. The hotel sent a bellman with us to help us obtain tickets for the Shinkansen to Kobe, he even helped my daughter to attempt to perform the transaction in Japanese (he had spent 4 years in Santa Barbara to learn English). He helped us to the platform and train, and to set up our seating arrangements. Great service, and everyone in the hotel will refuse tip, so avoid embarrassment and keep tips in your pocket. The service in the restaurant was perfect. Some of the dishes, i.e., the sashimi was not as fresh as I expected, but everything was nearly perfect. The room was great, we had two rooms, 614 and 611. It would have been nice to have 614 and 615 to link the room so we would not need to walk down the hall to visit each other. Room 614 was a corner room, overlooking the Yesasu Street action, as well as the approaching and departing Shinkansen bullet trains. Featuring the most ergonomic bathroom and floor to ceiling glass, the room was PERFECT!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed at the Grand Hyatt Roppongi for many years, and also stayed at the Park Hyatt in Shinjuku. The Four Seasons is as good if not better. It is easy to get to from Narita. You take the Narita Express to Tokyo Station and walk about a block away. The only difficult thing is figuring out which side of the station to exit. I exited on the Marunouchi side given the name of the hotel. That is wrong. You go out the Yaesu side and turn to the right. The hotel is on the right after the BMW dealership.The hotel itself is in excellent shape. The staff are courteous and helpful. Getting where ever you have to go is simple and easy.It has a 24 hour fitness center with excellent equipment. At least for me that is always a plus.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. My husband and I were in Japan, celebrating our wedding anniversary and the hotel definitely made our stay very memorable. The hotel sent Ayumi to pick us up from Tokyo Station, which is an invaluable service because Tokyo Station seemed overwhelming when we first arrived. The hotel had upgraded us to a Deluxe Premier Room and had champagne and fruit waiting for us in our room. All the hotel employees signed a card for us congratulating us on our wedding anniversary, which was very sweet. Their service is exceptional. Every communication we have ever had with them was flawless. They responded quickly by email prior to our trip during our planning stages and they seamlessly changed our dinner reservations when we arrived late due to missing our intended flight. The hotel itself is beautiful, very modern and sleek. The room had a 3D TV with a library you can rent Blu-Ray and 3D movies from. The L'Occitane amenities were also very nice. The concierge staff was great at giving us directions for sightseeing. They had detailed maps of every area of Tokyo that we were interested in going to, which was very helpful. We did not check out the gym or spa as we were too busy exploring Tokyo. My husband and I had such a great experience at this hotel. We can't wait to go back.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Near perfect service. Associates strive every moment to make stay as pleasurable as possible for guest. Best check-in/out ever experienced. Wonderful design of floors and rooms. Very good breakfast and dining location and service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The concept of a boutique business hotel often conjures up the image of an ill-conceived attempt that combines sparsity with a lack of atmosphere, an excuse for budget ambience with no amenities. This hotel turns any notion of that on its head.The location does not get any better than this for a business traveler, in Marunouchi, just off Ginza and minutes away from Tokyo central train station and three other subway stops on foot. With only fifty-something rooms in this ultramodern low-rise building, the staff to guest ratio is incredibly high and the concierge service is one of the best in Tokyo - and that is saying something. The rooms are comfortable, well-designed (as are the bathrooms) and typical Japanese touches such as pajamas, dressing gowns, slippers etc. are provided as standard. Everything is well thought out, the only downside being that the views from the wraparound ceiling to floor windows are either of office buildings or...the railway tracks. The gym is small but well equipped with the same views as the rooms and there is an excellent spa on the same top floor. The restaurant is very good and the bar service impeccable - large, custom ice cubes in the highballs melt slowly so as not to dilute your drink. What really puts this over the top in my view however is the service. When I had misplaced my wallet - something I only discovered after I ordered dinner at a Michelin two-starred restaurant - the guest relations staff immediately responded to my calls and went up to my room to search for it. When they couldn't find it, one of the staff called the restaurant at the conclusion of my meal to get the bill, and promptly cycled over in a few minutes with the requisite payment in cash! He then put me in a taxi and sent me back to the hotel. This was after an earlier misadventure due to a failure on the part of Apple maps (Japan) which necessitated a walkthrough by phone to guide me to my unmarked destination which is no mean feat in Tokyo where addresses are not in any logical pattern.
user_name:
Dreddlox
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: If you can afford it, this is once of the best 'business-class' hotels that I've stayed in anywhere in the world.Professionalism, customer service, attention to detail, politeness and friendliness of even the room attendees were all faultless.Location is perfect for the Int. Convention Forum, but also situated close to the Imperial Palace grounds (if you like a very pleasant early morning run), Ginza district with its buzzing shopping and restaurant choices, and Tokyo Central station to travel anywhere in the country.Gym is modern and with nice view high up and spa is also very relaxing to chillout in.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great hotel. Excellent service. Perfect rooms. Great gym, steam room but no pool. If you have the cash then 100% recommend.Staff really go out of the way to make your stay special. Attention to detail is second to none. Food is excellent all round with both traditional Japanese food and Western style meals available. Presentation of room service excellent.Will be staying again :)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A very convenient location next to Marunouchi/Tokyo Station. Walking distance to shops and eating establishments. Easy access to trains, subway and the express bus. Hotel personnel very attentive and courteous with outstanding personal service. Our room was large and very comfortalbe with conveniences of automatic controls at bedside for the curtains, shades and lights. The room had a large picture window with the view of the Shinkansen which was fun to watch. Overall we had a wonderful experience at this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
