review_body: Incredible, personal service and attentive staff.Wonderful, large rooms.Great location in Marunouchi / Central Station.Personal escort to the Narita Express.Birthday card and cake!Easy room change and checkout.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I agree with the reviewers who laud this property for its outstanding service and decor. I would like to add some info that I discovered only upon staying here, despite having read lots of reviews. Our deluxe double room was really configured like like a junior suite. It was one large room with a king-sized bed. The sitting area had two comfortable lounge chairs and a very comfortable sofa, in addiiton to a very large executive desk, bench with leather seat and wooden inset, and coffee table. Most of the room had floor to ceiling windows with a view of the comings and goings of the trains from the nearby Tokyo Station--lots to look at and absolutely soundless! There are four very accessible plugs in the room for US appliances--one by each side of the bed, which is great for computing or reading your Kindle in bed, and two at the desk. More outlets are available from the front desk if needed. The tv has 3D DVD and special goggles for watching! The bathroom has a private compartment with Japanese toilet, complete with bidet and heated seat, a soaking tub, and a nice shower. The bathroom amenities are plentiful and thoughtful--2 toothbrushes with toothpaste, a razor with blades, a collapsable brush, an emery board, a comb, and Occitane products. The health club is adequate and the spa services are reasonably priced for a big city. The food and drink are expensive and very good. IThe only down side to this lovely hotel is that it has a lobby bar/restaurant and a restaurant with a rather uninspiring menu of continental cuisine. But I guess that's to be expected with such a small hotel--and it's not as if there's nowhere else to eat in town! We are taking the bus to Narita because we have so many suitcases that it will be difficult to handle them at Narita. According to hotel staff, who were kind enough to print our boarding passes at no charge, when you go to Narita by train, you arrive at Narita in the basement, where help with baggage is not likely to be available. We will be getting assistance from the hotel staff in taking our bags to the bus terminal, which is 5 minutes away by foot. The bus costs $30 per person, takes 90 minutes, and drops you right at the terminal boarding area.
user_name:
Stephanie K
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Above and beyond Four Seasons standard. From meeting us at the train station to checking in (in your room) and taking us back when we were leaving to Kobe. All staff and services were friendly and excellent. One of the best experience we had.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is pretty much as good as it gets. The staff in particular are outstanding. From the moment we were welcomed to the property by Shoko, we felt that we were being taken care of by family. No request was too challenging, Kazuki even carried our bags and walked us all the way to the platform of our train to Kyoto at the nearby station, stopping on the way to help with the purchase of tickets. Akhil the Head Concierge is the best I have experienced in any hotel, anywhere. I have been suffering with a back complaint of late and the wonderful Hiroko helped ease away the pain on three separate visits I made to the Spa. The location is outstanding adjacent to the main Tokyo railway station and close to the Ginza shopping area. A fabulous hotel in every way.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: While Four Seasons in Marunouchi was expensive, we recently had a stay there that was memorable. Perfectly located (less than a block from Tokyo Central Station) with elegantly understated luxury in the room and impeccable service, this hotel was probably the best hotel experience we have had in a long time. The room had floor to ceiling picture windows overlooking central Tokyo, the bathroom fixtures were elegant and functional. We are both vegetarians and I had asked the concierge to book us typically Japanese dinners close by. They chose Tofuya Ukai, which was easily the best restaurant we have eaten at in Japan and certainly one of the best in the world. Daily help with places to visit, train tickets, tours, etc was also personalized and unhurried. All in all, if you can afford the Four Seasons rates, we think this hotel is worth every penny.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is AMAZING!Firstly, there is very little to this hotel, the reception entrance is modest, the restaurant is also modest and there is very little bar area, at all.BUT the location is FAB! The Ginza area is central to everything, you can get food in Marunouchi station easily.The room was MASSIVE, every detail was spot-on, everything was top quality and super well maintained. The bathroom was massive, with a fab bath tub and large, double size shower, new marble stone covered every surface.. beautiful throughout!The reception staff were SO helpful, for example, I was keen to get some funky nail art done, the lovely girl at concierge spent 20mins on the phone to the nail salon, organizing it for me and relaying the details (obviously translating the Japanese).Another occasion, we wanted to catch a Bullet train out of town, the staff offered to chaperone us into the station to assist us with the tickets!! WOW.. the staff really cared about our every need, ALL of the time.YOU must visit this hotel, if you value a top class room and top class service, you will not be let down!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: i luv the hotel and the staff were so helpful and i liv the location near by JR i luv the city i luv japan and everything belongs to japan :-pit was lovely ppl were amazing and down to earth .. it was the first time in japan but im sure it wont be the last ..

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It is one of the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The location of the hotel is convenient close to the train station and to fancy Ginza district. The level of service is above any expectation and the staff is amazing. The concierge is the most professional we met . It is the perfect hotel to stay in Tokyo. And justified any Yen we paid.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Definitely would stay here again in Tokyo- and wish we were here more than one night! We flew in and spent one night here before taking high speed train to Kyoto. Very easy ride from the airport via the train and easy walk- if you follow their directions- from station to hotel.Staff is top notch and so accommodating. Our room was great- big corner room overlooking train station. The location is perfect- my husband and I did a great run from hotel to the park around the imperial palace. Coffee and water was waiting for us when we returned.Breakfast was delicious and again the staff was great.Definitely a great place to stay in Tokyo- and worth the price!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seaons Marunouchi is a must stay for business or leisure travelers in Tokyo. I had two stays there in March and April and cannot say enough AMAZING things about the staff, food, guest room and location of this lovely boutique hotel. It is worth every single yen you will spend to stay there.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We choose this hotel largely because of it's prime location adjacent to Tokyo Station and it's large western style rooms that would accomadate our family. The rooms were fantastic, well appointed with floor to ceiling glass view of the city. Even though our stay was short the staff went out of the way to provide exceptional service. (One concierge walked us to a small bakery for breakfast.) This hotel compares favorably to the Peninsula Hotel which we also stayed at during this trip. The Peninsula is more grand, the Four Seasons more intimate.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Four Seasons is located in a tall corporate building right by Tokyo JR Station, close to Ginza and the Imperial Palace. It's an easy 5-minute (if you don't get lost -- but don't worry as someone from the staff can meet you at the platform) walk from the station to the hotel.Check-in was fast and my room was huge, with a large bathroom and cool toiletries, glass walls, a giant 3D TV and automatic curtains. But I don't wanna talk about these things as they should be standard in a hotel like this.What makes this hotel exceptional is the quality of service. My first contact with this Four Seasons was just after I've booked my room on their website. They've sent me an email and they even tried to call me all the way from Japan just to check at which time I'd be arriving in the city and if I needed help in getting to the hotel.On Christmas day I had lunch with some friends and, when I get back to the hotel to decide what to do next, I found a small stocking hanging from my door full of candies. How nice is that?Finally, when I was checking-out I left my luggage for a couple of hours while I went for a final walk in nearby Ginza. When I came back, they already knew my name, which luggage was mine and that I was taking the Narita Express to go to the airport.I travel a lot. And, in my opinion, these are the small things that make a top hotel outstanding.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We chose it because it was so close to the train station, but it was great. We had a great view over the bullet train tracks (OK, I admit I like trains), a very comfortable room with lots of glass. And the staff are fantastic, arranging train reservations and collecting our train pass for us and even meeting us from our return train, purely on the basis that they had arranged the reservations so knew what train we would be on. Restaurant is good and comforting, with an excellent restaurant manager, though usual hotel prices.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent location, especially if you are utilizing the train system. A couple of blocks from the Ginza for shopping and in there are a great selection of restaurants within walking distance. close byBoutique Hotel with fanatastic service!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location: The hotel is a only two blocks from the beautiful Ginza area with great shopping, and is just down the block from Tokyo Station, making getting around Tokyo very easy.  Family-friendly enough: While the modern hotel has more of a business feel, we traveled with our three children, and the hotel was very comfortable for our family and, typical of Four Seasons style, the staff was very kind and accommodating to our kids. We were able to get adjoining rooms. The special touch was there too -- for instance, they provided gorgeous personalized cookies on plates and dishes of snacks for the kids upon arrival.  Exceptional Concierge/Service: For instance, the staff walked us to the bullet train and to our airport shuttle down the block (and carted our luggage for us). They offered to accompany us to find the correct subway in Tokyo Station. They went the extra mile to help us whenever we had questions or needs. Nice Rooms: The rooms and bathrooms were very modern and spacious. L' Occitane products were in the bathrooms. Our rooms overlooked the train tracks with some very slight accompanying noise, but it actually was fun and interesting to watch the bullet trains come and go.  Expensive: Also typical of Four Seasons, room service was crazy expensive (around $45 for a cheeseburger). Basic wifi in the room was free but pretty slow. They arranged our bullet train tickets for us, but the service charge of $50 per ticket was hefty and this probably should have been done gratis given how easily I did it myself on a return bullet train trip.  Overall, I highly recommend. After traveling all the way from the US with kids, It is hard to beat the kindness and service with which we were met at the Four Seasons Marunouchi.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Having recently stayed at the Peninsula Tokyo and Four Seasons Marunouchi, I have come to the conclusion that while both properties are excellent, they serve different needs for visitors to Tokyo. We had a wonderful time at both properties, but want to highlight the differences for those who are trying to make a decision (or decide when to stay) between these two first class hotels.The Four Seasons Marunouchi is a small boutique property located in a business high-rise one block from Tokyo Central Rail station. This makes it very convenient when you arrive from Narita airport as they will send a representative to meet you at the Narita Express train platform in the confusing maze that is Tokyo Station to carry your baggage and guide you to your room. The location is excellent if you want to explore the train station (which is a city in itself) and discover the amazing cheap eats of Tokyo Ramen Street (a must visit) to have the best Ramen on earth at Rokurinsha which is listed in a separate review. If you want to go to Tsukiji Market to witness the tuna auction the Four Seasons will book a taxi to get you there (at 4:00 am) in less than 15 minutes so you are essentially guaranteed to get in. The differences between the Peninsula and the Four Seasons relate to personalized service, location and amenities offered. We loved both hotels, but for different reasons. If you are arriving from the US, I would suggest staying arriving at the Four Seasons and completing your stay at the Peninsula. The Four Seasons concierge staff in Tokyo is the best that I have encountered on numerous trips worldwide. Through their kind assistance, I was able to book (difficult to obtain) reservations at Sushi Mizutani and Ryugin, as well as purchase box seat tickets to the Sumo tournament in Osaka. They also arranged for personalized (meaning meeting us and taking us to the platform) train transfers at Tokyo station for our arrival from Narita and departure to Kyoto. I would like to personally acknowledge concierges Yoko T. and Akhil T. who were exceptional in assisting us in all of these endeavors as well as explaining how to navigate the subway system so we could explore Tokyo independently.We were upgraded to a one bedroom suite (a very pleasant surprise) which was excellent in fit and finish albeit with a view of an office building and a large city boulevard instead of a park view like the Peninsula. The only negatives of the Four Seasons relate to the lack of a large lobby lounge (if that is your preference), as well as a lack of an indoor pool (nice if you have kids), and impressive views from your room (unless a view of the Shinkasen is what you desire). Despite these minor negatives, I tend to prefer small boutique hotels (which was the feel of the Four Seasons) and absolutely loved the rooms, service and location that this hotel offers. I also felt that the Four Seasons was the perfect way to introduce yourself to this vibrant (but complex) city (Thank you Concierge Service!) while the Peninsula was a great way to finish our trip (which has a lobby lounge, swimming pool and nice views but less personalized service) once I was acclimatized to Tokyo and the Ginza district.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: What can you say?Great location beside the main station. The Imperial palace is a short trip away and you are in the heart of Gina so you have access to great shopping and restaurants within walking distance.Helpful staff and a really fresh feel made this hotel a highlight in our trip to Japan.The rooms are a good size and the view of the Shinkanzen trains pulling in and out of the station silently (thanks to the excellent sound proofing) really add to the atmosphere.The breakfast is great and food is of good quality.Downsides - its not cheap - but you know what you are getting into staying at a Four Seasons hotel. I personally thought it was excellent value and a fantastic way to end our family trip.
user_name:
Andrew T
Dubai, United Arab Emirates

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent concierge staff. Superb restaurant staff who were polite and patient.Location is good for shopping near Ginza, Tsukiji fish market and to get anywhere via Tokyo station. I would recommend this area over Roppongi which is louder and although more hip, can be tiring. Shibuya is also very nice but loud with too many teenagers getting drunk.
user_name:
K3218DVpeterp
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The rooms were modern yet warm with natural influences. The bathrooms were sumptuous! Meals were lovely affairs. And the staff was open & willing to help with any question despite our not speaking the language. Finally the location right next to the trains was excellent!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This gem of a hotel is one of the best we have ever stayed in anywhere in the world! From the housekeeper to the general manager, everyone was wonderful, friendly, helpful, & gracious. The rooms were large & well appointed. The hotel is in a great location. The staff will walk you to the train station, buy your tickets & put you on your coach. They will also pick you up upon arrival. All done with a smile. Could not ask for a better experience. This hotel helped make our vacation to Tokyo ideal!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I searched long and hard for a hotel that would be close to Tokyo station and could have 2 adults and 2 children in one room. Four Seasons was absolutely perfect. Located a few steps away from the huge Tokyo station, it was fantastic for us as we left on the last day and caught the Shinkansen (Bullet train) to see the Snow Monkeys and we left our luggage stored at the hotel (for no charge).Four Seasons is a small boutique hotel with only about 6 floors. The concierge are fabulous and nothing was too much trouble. I emailed them prior and asked many questions which they answered promptly. When we arrived at the airport we called them from our train and they were waiting at our platform with a trolley and took us through the huge station to the hotel. There is no charge for this service. They did the same when we left. They will also come with you to show you where to buy tickets for the Shinkansen and took us to the platform when we left for the night. They will buy tickets FOR YOU whilst you are out but that has a fee of 10%. We booked the Deluxe Premier Twin Room (700sq ft) for the 4 of us and it was gorgeous. We asked for a high floor and city views which was accommodated. There were 2 king beds which was enough for us but I had asked for a roll-a-way (free) and that was in the room so we kept it. The curtains were all electric so we could lie in bed and look at the city lights then close them without moving! There was a huge plasma TV and a huge bathroom. There were slippers in 4 different sizes for our 4 pairs of feet all laid out by the beds at night. There were little cookies made with our girls names on them waiting when we arrived, as well as personalized activity books for them. They were very impressed!We didn't eat breakfast there as it was expensive but there was a basket of fruit by the lift so we grabbed a couple on the way out and ate at Tokyo station which has a thousand restaurants. We did see the Spa as when we arrived back from the Snow Monkeys they took us to the Spa to change and freshen up for our trip to the airport. It was luxurious as expected.We would definately go back to this hotel for any future trips to Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I continue to be amazed at the courtesy and friendliness shown by the Japanese people I come in contact with and once again that is the case with the staff at the Four Seasons Maranouchi Tokyo. The hotel is ideally placed for exploring the Ginza and Maranouchi. Tokyo Central is virtually next door

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Tokyo is in great condition with a great staff. I've stayed there three times and at the Peninsula three times in the past two years, and I'm very happy with both. If you are arriving from NRT by train to Tokyo Train Station, email the Four Seasons prior to your flight and they will meet you at the train platform and carry your bags to the hotel for you, at no charge.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: we were greeted by their staff at the JR station platform when our train arrived from NRT. The staff took our luggage and walked us to the hotel which is 5 min away. The room we got was a good size and beautifully decorated. The hotel had a nice pool and japanese hot tub which my husband enjoyed after a long flight form the U.S. Every time we step out of our hotel the staff was on hand to get us a taxi or whatever (water, umbrella) we needed with a smile. We had to travel to osaka by JR train one day the staff took our JR pass to the station and retrieved our tickets and seats for us the day before. On the day of our travel the staff took us to the station and helped us find the platform for our train. All the staff at this hotel was wonderful and always go above and beyond without expecting a tip like the U.S. but we did tip them generously at the end.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Truly great experience here from check-in to check-out that truly embodies the Four Season hospitality. Upon check-in, an employee escorted us to our room which was a very nice gesture. The room and bathroom are truly spacious for Tokyo standards. The JR train lines were right outside the window but we couldn't hear a single sound so the windows must be sound proofed really well (and of course, trains in Japan are really quiet too). So we got the metropolitan feel from the view yet without the noise. I'm a huge, huge fan of L'Occitane so of course that was one of the main factors when deciding to choose the Four Seasons since they provide this brand of bathroom amenities. The hotel also provides turndown service which is a nice luxury to have especially when we were out the whole day and then returning to see that our room has been prepared for us to retire for the evening. Comfortable bed, plush bathrobes, towels... we only wished our stay could be longer.Practical tip:You can walk between the Four Seasons and Tokyo Station via the underground walkway without having to go outdoors. We didn't know it the first time but thanks to the helpful tip from the reception desk, we managed to walk to Tokyo Station and back without getting wet when it was pouring rain and wet. The underground walkway has many things to discover.. shops and restaurants that lead you all the way to Tokyo Station which on its own is a world of its own with so many restaurants and shops. My husband joked that we basically could spend days between the Four Seasons and Tokyo Station without having to step outdoors at all.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: From the moment someone comes and meets you at the Shinkansen train station to lead you to your room where you will be checked in, until the moment when you are accompanied back to the station and seen off in the most polite Japanese way, this hotel is truly a wonderful experience. We had a room that looked like a moderately-sized apartment, with a spectacular bathroom with a full view of the high-speed trains entering and leaving the station and yet another, smaller bathroom, and a working area, fully equipped with telephone and fax.The concierge is great and so are the (à-la-carte) breakfast and the lounge where tea is served.Plus, it's extremely central.Truly, one of Tokyo's best hotels.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We booked this great hotel via American Express Platinum Travel. The rate normally includes an upgrade in the next room category, free breakfast, a spa voucher of 100$ and early check-in / late check-out. All these benefits are according to availability, the hotel is not compelled to provide themWe were upgraded in a luxury suite of approximately 980 sqf. We obtained free breakfast and a 100$ spa voucher.The hotel is located in one of Tokyo's best locations : GINZA. Architecturally talking, it's a modern and design one, occupying 7 floors of a 35 storeys building. However, it has its own entrance so that we are totally independant from the building's activityRooms are oversized and decorated with quality furnishings. Zebrano wood pieces are mounted on some walls or on the ceilling increasing the sensation of luxury. Insidie the suite, we didn't hear any noise, doors, walls and ceilings were completely isolated. There was also a lot of technological devices (117 cm 3D plasma screen with glasses, upscale 5.1 home theatre system, air purifier, japanese toilets, electric curtains, intelligent lights system...). Every details were taken care of to create an atomosphere where traveller feels comfortable and at home.The service was perfect night and day. Whatever your needs are, concierge, reception, or room service staff quickly answer and meet your expectations professionaly and gently. If you plan to book a fine restaurant, the concierge will recommand the best ones that are not made for tourists. For example, we wanted to dine in an upscale sushi restaurant. The concierge suggested the Seamon. It was really an unforgettable experience (intimate atmosphere, michelin star graded, true sushi masters and great food)The hotel's main restaurant proposed an inventive cuisine with good ingredients in a room with panoramic views of the city. However, this hotel deserves a better one. If they recruited an uprising Chef (not Alain Ducasse or Gordon Ramsey) and they proposed rich ingredients (foie gras, caviar, lobster, fine fishes and sophisticated meat dishes) together with upscale wines (Petrus, Mouton Rothschild...), this restaurant could get one or 2 michelin stars and could become the place to dine. Such a hotel needs a top class restaurant...The spa and the fitness room had great amenities and were not crowded. I recommand the free onsen bath, a kind of japanese poolWe travel all around the world and stay in the best palace hotels. This hotel has no opulent style but combines luxury and design. I can assure you, this is the place to stay in Tokyo. It's by far the best hotel in every aspect of your stayIt is highly recommanded.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed at this hotel 3-4 times already. My first experience was awesome. As I stepped out of taxi they greeted me by my name ! How ??? I asked .. they googled me !! Dining reservation was perfect printed with map in separate envelope for each place Everyone ... Everyone addresses me by my name ... How does this happen... Not at any other fourseasons as I usually stay at fourseasons Also second visit ... As I always asked for lots of adaptor... And extended cords It was provided BEFORE and already plugged in and installed in the room !!!What ?? Too good to be true ? It is ! Try it and u will see Y ... I have to return to this place and only select a few others to try ... But then this place and shangrila is the best of tokyo , Japan and possibly the world

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Ladies and Gentlemen. The reason this Hotel rates Number one Chiyoda is because it is simply the best. My Family and I recently had a four night stay at Four Seasons and we all experienced a wonderful stay. Right from the moment when the Concierge met us at the Shinkansen Station upon our arrival to when they escorted us to the Narita Express on our departure, the service and hospitality was outstanding.Four Seasons is positioned very close to JR station and only a few minutes walk into the Ginza district which is one of Tokyo's prime shopping locations.We had 2 adjoining rooms on the 6th floor which were very large and had all the convenieniences and appointments one would expect. All the amenities provided were of the highest quality. The rooms were very quiet and had a great view over Tokyo JR station.We used the restaurant and bar most days for breakfast and dinner and sat next to the open gas flamed fireplace each night for a few drinks at our happy hour. We got to know the staff here as this is more like a boutique hotel where the service is tailored to be more personal than perhaps a 500 room hotel may offer. This what we preferThe concierge was very helpful in arranging tours and providing maps and directions plus the wonderful meet and greet service provided at the train station is first class.We used the onsen regularly and even took up a few massages and spa options. My 2 boys used the Gym and remarked how everything was in perfect working order and condition. Overall, this was the best hotel we have stayed in and I could not recommend it highly enough for a one night stop over or as your base for an extended stay in Tokyo. You will not regret it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Did a fair bit of looking around on TA before making this booking. Booked it having stayed at FS Singapore and loving it. Stayed four days at FS Maranouchi with my husband and our two teenage boys. The deal breakers for me were the excellent central location near Tokyo station and also the fact that we could all stay in one decent sized room. We got one of their website ‘stay four nights for the price of three’ which helped hugely. The rate was still up there but similar to getting two rooms for ourselves in this very expensive part of Tokyo.Have since found out about booking through the FS preferred agents which entitle the guest to extras. I would urge anyone looking at FS to look into this. I wasn’t aware of it till I read some flyer forums.I looked at other locations near Tokyo Station like the Mandarin, The Palace and the Peninsula but decided this was the best, A+ in fact, with a short walk to the Ginza and next to Tokyo railway station Yaesu South exit. I feel to get the most out of your stay in Tokyo you have to stay very near one of the big connecting stations like Tokyo or Shinjuku. Then your down time catching trains is minimised.We got a premier queen room of 52sq m, it was very nicely appointed, comfy beds, luxury bathroom and lots of storage. FS kindly lent us a PS3 with some games for our 13 year old, fortunately he was so busy with tripping around Tokyo it didn’t get used much, but a nice touch nevertheless.The concierge were outstanding, they helped us with arranging Sumo tickets and were prompt replying to emails before we arrived. Akhil at the concierge desk was particularly helpful and welcoming. The icing on the cake when we left was when a lovely young man from concierge accompanied us to catch the Narita express on departure and navigating the myriad passageways of Tokyo to the right platform and also helping us purchase our tickets and get our Suica card refunds. We think we’re savvy travellers but we couldn’t have found our way to the N’ex without the young lad who helped us and even took the luggage trolley down through the station! BTW ALL the staff at Four Seasons speak good English, right down to the housekeepers.Just a couple of pointers if you stay at the F/S Marunouchi:There’s a convenience store in the complex below the building, turn right outside of the main entrance towards the ginza, cut the corner right, over the plaza, towards the railway bridge and take the escalator down when you see the basement entrance. The store is right there.Don’t forget to take a walk along the Nakadori St in the close by Marunouchi area, a gracious, upmarket shopping area, where you will really get a sense of the results of a country that has experienced economic growth for the last 50 years. The Christmas lights down that street were absolutely breathtaking when going for a night walk.Take the Skybus hop on hop off tour, starts at the Mitsubishi building a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Will give you an overland view of Tokyo.The Muji flagship store at Yurakcho (5 minute walk) - I'm a shopaholic -is a fabulous example of anti brand, products that are environmentally friendly in a Japanese way. The Loft shop next door is like a kind of target store with everything from nail clippers upwards.To sum up this Four Seasons isn’t about wow hotel receptions areas, it’s about giving service where it makes a real difference to your stay. The service levels are well above average in a city where there is lots of good service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We were a family of four spending three nights in Tokyo after a few days in Sapporo. We were given adjoining rooms even though we didn't request for this - which was great! The concierge was fantastic - we were given excellent directions (plus maps) for getting to Disneyland, the Pokemon Centre, KiddyLand; reservations were effortlessly made for Jiro's; spot-on recommendations for ramen houses. I did miss not having a pool in the hotel, but the gym was good.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Travelled with wife and two boys (age 5 and 10) and stayed for 4 nights. Small business hotel with beautiful well sized rooms and lovely decor throughout. Very convenient location next to Tokyo Station. Staff and service was excellent throughout - absolutely up to standards we have seen and come to expect from the Four Seasons - nothing was ever too much trouble. We used the Onsen but not the gym. The gym looked great. We were also given a late checkout which was very greatly appreciatedI thought the room rate was great. However what was completely ridiculous was the price of food and drinks in the hotel restaurant and via room service. As an example we paid circa US$32 for two hot chocolates from room service for the kids. This is insane in the extreme. Sure we should have looked at the price before we ordered but nobody in their right mind could seriously think anyone would charge this much. This extended across everything - US$11 for a coffee, $30 for 2 eggs, $12 for a couple of slices of toast and so on. We averaged $12-140 for breakfast each day. We copped all of this but it just left a very sour taste.My wife made the remark that the prime customer is a business traveller who is not paying out of their own pocket so they don't worry and don't complain. This makes some sense. However we stayed at the Four Seasons Beverley Wiltshire and we found the exact opposite - ie the restaurant prices were very good.In many respects they would have been better charging a higher room rate and making the food and beverage prices close to sensible.Would we go back - as a family it is a definite no because of the issues above.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Booked the hotel about 5 months ahead of time... had 2 nights in Tokyo and wanted to be near the train station. Family was traveling with me, so thought that would be convenient. Location is perfect- 2 minute walk from Tokyo Station if you exit the Yaoue(?) South doors (opposite side of Marunouchi exits. Just out the south door and take a right. The hotel only has 7 floors (rest of the building is an office complex it seems) but the staff treats you like you were the only guests in the whole hotel. They were WONDERFUL with my two young boys- made them cookies with their names on them before arrival.... even had a personalized coloring sheet/survey form for my oldest son. Nice touch. Rooms are spacious and well appointed. Concierge falls all over themselves to be of service--- gave us step by step directions to anywhere we wanted to go plus drew it on a map plus gave us phrase cards to use to show people if we got lost (our Japanese is limited). The restaurant and bar are nice, but nothing out of this world. Gym is better than average. Spa is great. Peaceful, quiet, relaxing, and close to the action if you want that. Definitely gets my stamp of approval.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: If you are flying into Narita and taking the Narita express, this hotel is just a few minutes walk from the station. We chose it based on that, and our trust in the Four Seasons brand.Pros: The rooms are quite new and unusually large for Tokyo, very nice decor. Every other pro is what you would expect from 4S --- everything is perfect and service is great. We stayed under the Fine Hotel and Resorts Program from Amex, under which we got free in-room Shiatsu massages, which were excellent.Cons: We had room 510 and 511 and the views were non existent. Tokyo to me is kind of blah anyway, and this hotel is no exception. But if I had to be in Tokyo, it'd probably be here or the Grand Hyatt Roppongi (but that is a real hike from Tokyo station)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My family and I traveled to Japan this past December 2012. We stayed in Osaka at the St Regis and could not have been treated better by the staff and level of service provided. We finished our trip in Tokyo at the Four Seasons Marunouchi, only to find it to be a complete flop. The hotel is not that nice to start with and it is small. Four Seasons sold us on it as being five star. It is NOT. Maybe a two to three star. There was no butler service as we were told there would be, there is only on "casual" restaurant. I was told that there was a couple and the nicer one required a jacket. (The manager of the restaurant told me they never have had a jacket policy.) The conciegre service was poor at best. When ask to provide maps, they did not. They also told us a cab was waiting outside the lobby door for us during a rain storm. It was not, unless you consider 2 blocks away being just outside the door. My wife had to go upstairs to get something for our children one day, as our children and I waited in the lobby. The greeter thought we were just in there to get out of the rain, until I gave her our room number. The restaurant service was horrible. After finally getting our food, we were three quarters of the way thru the meal before our tea and colas came to drink. This was after three attempts to get it from the waiter, two attempts to get the manager to get it done and finally I went to the bar tender and told her that she either get my family something to drink our I will go to the room mini bar and get the colas out of it. We never did see the waiter again. The manager finally brought the beverages to us. The food during that meal was not that great either. It was, however, well over priced. We had to repeatedly order coffee sweetener and creamer. They would only bring a few packs at the time to the room for the free coffee service.The internet service never worked properly for the two computers unless you paid for the package. Then, we ended up having to order two of those as it did not work the four units it claimed to support. This was NOT level of serivce we received in Atlanta, GA Four Seasons, nor was it up to the level of serivce from the St Regis Hotel in Osaka that we stayed at. This was a total disappointment. We called the corporate office about it and the woman there wanted to argue with me about our experience. She continually told me they have never had any complaints about this property. We discovered that there is/was a second Four Seasons property in Tokyo, quiet by accident, as our taxi driver took us to the wrong one. The Four Seasons corporate told us today that as of 31 Dec 12, they no longer have the second property. After reading reviews online, it sounds as though that other property had many of the same problems that the Marunouchi property has. It seems that the entire staff needs to be sent back to the "old style" Four Seasons school to learn what five star service really is. My wife and I both question whether or not we ever want to stay at another Four Seasons property after this. What we got in service should have only cost one third of what we were charged. A lower level Hilton or Sheraton would have been more comparable to what we got from this location.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Other reviewers have said it all. This is a high quality hotel with excellent staff who go to great efforts to help. They found a lost garment from the spa for me and returned it, they booked restaurants and provided directions, they kept our luggage on several occasions in storage for us. It is not a big hotel, it is very well located and whilst we enjoyed eating there, the restaurant options seemed limited to us. If only something can be done to further restrict smoking in rooms it would have been even more enjoyable. Compared to other hotels, it was good value when travelling as a family.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: My husband and I spent Christmas 2012 at the Four Seasons, Marunouchi-- what perfect combination of a luxury hotel with a relaxing, comfortable feel! From the moment we arrived, the staff accommodated our every need. 1) My husband left his iPad on the plane, and Nana at the front desk called the airline, Narita airport, and a myriad of other places to find it and ensure that we were able to reclaim it on our outbound journey.2) The concierge provided us with information, directions, and booking for a wonderful performing arts production in Tokyo. 3) On countless occasions, Gerard and the Ekki Restaurant staff provided amazing food and accommodating service despite the busy holiday weekend. 4) The staff's recommendations for other food/nightlife in Tokyo were exactly what we requested. The service of this hotel coupled with very comfortable beds (sometimes hard to find in Japan), great fitness center/ onsen, and small touches like a Christmas stocking on our door made it a wonderful choice for our Christmas holiday.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed here with my parents and we were all amazed at the service. From booking our shinkansen tickets, to the cleanliness of the room, booking of taxis and the escort to catch our train.Location is very close to Tokyo station, which makes it easy for sightseeing.The only negative comment would be the views (bullet trains arriving and departing became annoying after a few minutes), however travel is about sightseeing not living in the hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Impeccably clean and discreet. No huge hotel lobby, only a handful of rooms. Excellent staff service. Convenient walk to the underground mall which is connected to it. The hotel rooms are large, great views. Superb beds and linen. Huge bathroom, Occitane toiletries. Surroundings mostly office buildings so not much touristy things to do there, but go underground and there are countless shops and restaurants. Ginza is 8 minutes walk away, Imperial Palace 10 minutes walk.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed with our two sons and found this to be one of our favorite hotels ever. They provided personalized treats for our sons on arrival which made everyone feel very welcome. The customer service was fabulous all the way around. The rooms themselves are amazing....all kinds of great surprises that make the stay even more pleasant. We wished we could have stayed longer (although it's fairly pricey). It was a wonderful experience!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here for 4 days while visiting Tokyo in late November. The location is just perfect - right next to the train station and a short stroll to Ginza and the Imperial Palace. The staff here is wonderful - everyone speaks very good English which is always helpful, and they were able to make us very comfortable in giving precise directions of how to get around to different sights. When asking for information on the bullett train for a day trip someone from reception even walked us to the train station and literally put us in our seats on a bullett train to Kyoto for a day trip. Definitely suggest utilizing the airport transfer service where they will meet you at the train station, get you on the Narita express and have hotel staff waiting for you at Tokyo Station to take your luggage and escort you to the hotel. The rooms are very modern, and the location can't be beat. Will definitely recommend this to anyone I know travelling to Tokyo and visit again when back in Japan.
user_name:
Maggie M
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Excellent room, service and condition. To be most recommendedQuiet stay in a moving and vibrant city.Check-in and Check-out performed very smoothlyRestaurant is excellent even if a bit expensiveMost restful for a business stay

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Other than being a very nice hotel with large rooms, and friendly staff, the location is just perfect, close to Tokyo station.Very nice amenties in the toilet, and very well english-spoken and friendly staff .

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It was my first trip to Japan, I was travelling alone and spoke just about no Japanese. I chose this hotel for my first night after reading the reviews as it sounded like it would make for a comfortable beginning - amenity-wise and people-wise. It more than lived up to expectations. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. They took an interest in what I was doing without being intrusive. Their English was very good (unlike my Japanese!). I found I'd been upgraded to a corner room which had great views of trains going in and out of station (my first sight of shinkansen!) but wasn't noisy. There were also views of streets with some autumn foliage. The room and the bathroom were both very spacious. Nice inclusions such as L'Occitane toiletries. Fast LAN internet link (didn't try wireless). Had a delicious meal of sashimi. Location close to Tokyo station and Ginza very hard to beat. Highly recommended!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Tokyo is so large, with so many districts, we settled for the center (MARUNOUCHI, near the shopping district and the Imperial Palace).This hotel is like a small oasis, more a boutique hotel. It is small, and a nice refuge after a day in Tokyo. This is was our first visit to Tokyo, the city is simply overwhelming, Few people speak English, there are no street signs anywhere, and maps rotate (not oriented North as we are used to). All this to say, without the amazing caring staff at the hotel, we would have gotten lost...The best employees are in the lounge. Whenever we needed anything, we went to the bar, ordered a drink and chatted with the servers or bartenders. This is where we learned how to navigate Tokyo, they gave us great tips on restaurants and what to do. At the end of everyday we went back to the lounge to make our report. The team there really made our stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The service is impeccable. Staff was very professional and helped us with all the restaurant reservations we needed. Upon check-in, we were given printed maps with directions to get to each restaurant. Every request was handled promptly and professionally.  The entrance to the hotel is hidden on the side alley of an office building. The rooms were clean with details but lacked the sleek wow factor.  The hotel offers a selection of men/women bikes. There is a jogging trail with refreshment and towel right next to the entrance. The location could not be better...next to the Tokyo station and within 5 minutes walk to the heart of Ginza.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Small hotel, nice rooms, great service. What I liked most was the service - very attentive and nothing was too much effort. The central location makes this the choice hotel for this city. Pity that my stay was too short.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Exceptional hotel staffs and services. Can't praise the staffs and management enough. They exceeded our expectations and made our stay the very best in Tokyo - and we have been to Tokyo at many other 5 stars hotel all over the city. We will definitely be staying at the hotel again and again when we visit Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Without going into exhaustive details, the FS Marunouchi was what you would expect in a Four Seasons. Warm, attentive service, very large (especially by Tokyo standards) rooms, and a perfect location.Regarding the rooms, at first glance they look relatively spartan, but you soon realize they are extremely functional and perfect for a good nights rest or going about business or leisure in Tokyo. There is no grand lobby, or attempts to wow with unnecessary excess, but the reception staff soon learn customer names and do everything possible to assist without being intrusive.Of course, as has been mentioned many times, staff will accompany you (and carry luggage) to or from Tokyo Station Narita Express, which makes the trip very stress-free, especially considering the hectic maze that is Tokyo Station (Narita Express platforms are several levels and two or three lift transfers below ground level).Overall, a great experience, and will be our first choice for our next visit to Tokyo. I've stayed in numerous highly-rated Tokyo hotels over the years, and the FS Marunouchi rates clearly at the top. Very much substance over style, which is perfect for our needs.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff make it their business to help you with everything. They will escort you to and from Tokyo Station, help you to buy tickets and load the luggage on for you. Just amazing! They remember you by name and were extremely helpful.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Elegant, refined Boutique Hotel where the personnel knows your name and you feel the genuine welcome and care. This is my sixth trip to Tokyo in the last 1.5 years - and my first experience at the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi - This is now the only hotel i will be returning to. Fabulous hotel; the rooms impeccable, the service even moreso ! My recommendation: don't hesitate and choose this hotel - you will not be disappointed !

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff of this elegant hotel are as one would expect. They are also more. It was our 20th wedding anniversary and not only did we receive a welcome with fruit and champagne to celebrate, they took a photo of us and while we were at dinner printed the photo and made us a card filled with well wishes and tiny origami cranes.The room was large , the bathroom elegant and I enjoyed the quiet after a busy day in Tokyo.. Thank you Four Seasons

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Four Seasons Marunouchi was a fantastic hotel. The rooms are large & very clean. Our room looked right onto Tokyo station & we could watch the Shinkansen train go by every nine minutes. Very cool to watch at night also. There is very little track noise in the room & at midnight the Shinkansen stops.The room is fun & has an excellent bathroom with a giant bathtub.Room service was food was excellent. The location is great for getting around Tokyo.Easy 10 minute walk to Ginza.I will return to this hotel.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Can't say enough about it! You must stay at his hotel to understand how truly brilliant it is. From the welcoming we got, to the staff at every turn knowing all our names. To the amazing concierge going out of their way to help us find places. Love love love this hotel!! Our kids were treated like VIPs - unlike many other luxury hotels we have stayed in where they are treated like unwelcome guests. Stay here - you will not be disappointed!!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: we stayed at the four seasons with our two children (ages 7 and 9 ) for four nights. I have never had such outstanding service. Our children were made to feel completely at home - down to chidren;s umbrellas when it was raining. the concierge recommended great and appropriate restuarants for us all to eat out. The onsen bath and steam room in the spa were a highlight of our japan trip. Having a drink in the bar and watching the shinkansen arrive was also great fun.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The Japanese have an amazing tradition of hospitality and a contemporary obsession with hotels and hotel experience, so it's no surprise that this small luxury hotel is such a pleasurable place to stay. The rooms are very large, larger than the apartments of my Japanese friends, and they are beautifully designed and maintained.One of the best parts of the hotel is it's gym and spa. The gym is great and the spa includes an onsen bath in a slate cave--a great place to decompress after a long flight or day in Tokyo. The spa services are excellent. The last time I stayed here I had a 90 minute "tree of life" and was really impressed how far it transcended the typical hotel massage. The massage therapist was extremely well trained, combining a gym-massage understanding of anatomy with the relaxing art of a balinese massage.Throughout the hotel service is excellent, attentive and helpful. Although I've been to Tokyo many times, I lazily accepted the offer to be escorted to the Tokyo station to catch the train to the airport. This service really exemplifies the hotel's above and beyond service. It was very nice for me, and I can imagine it could be amazing for someone visiting Tokyo for the first time to be picked up and looked after.This is my third time staying at the hotel, and my only gripe is that the food isn't as good as it was when it opened. Then the restaurant ekki seemed on track to become one of Tokyo's special top restaurants. Instead of soaring, it has slumped and now served first-class hotel food. Nothing wrong, but nothing memorable. I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here if I weren't staying here. The night I stayed, I booked through American Express platinum and my rate was extremely reasonable. This hotel feel like it should cost at least $1400/night. That it feels like such excellent value made it that much more enjoyable.The location is ideal, lots that you can walk to, trains to take you anywhere else.
user_name:
Gandaratravels
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here in two segments, after our trip to Kansai we decided to come back. Our room had just the facilities we wanted, without the need to impress and without being intimidating in its opulence. Less is more (as long as there is enough)!Location: UnbeatableStaff: Unbeatable-er!The only thing we liked less was the menu selection of the restaurant (too little to choose from, also not enough wines by the glass) and the availability of seating (we had to go elsewhere twice).It does not come cheap, but the 4th night free offer made the deal a bit sweeter for us.Too bad that you are nickel & dimed for the internet connection.Next time in Tokyo, we will be back here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Its in the middle of everything and the staff treats you well, what you expect from a FS! The food is on the money , pricey but that's Tokyo! I was there a few times and just started writing reviews on TA , so I wanted to mention how great this place is! If you need anything just ask the staff and they will do everything in their power to get it done! I wish I could have found a place like this when I visit Shanghia , but to totally different cultures . Rooms are larger then most hotels in Tokyo so if you are traveling to this area this is the place to stay!
user_name:
Knicpo
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This hotel is the ideal first base for anyone arriving from Narita into Tokyo as it is close to the station and central to most of the major places of interest.The rooms are spacious and comfortable, and the staff do their absolute utmost to settle you in, make you feel welcome, and assist with any aspect of your stay, from recommending and booking restaurants to assisting with travel requirements.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed with my family for a week in September. Chose the hotel on account of glowing trip advisor reviews and am glad I did. Not only is the hotel brilliantly located at the centre of Tokyo, it is also very classy with great rooms, very comfortable beds, quality food and outstanding sound proofing - honestly did not hear a sound outside the room. This alone would have been sufficient to give it 5 stars but the magic ingredient to make our stay memorably special was the service and staff. They would have to be the best I have come across from 20 years of travelling internationally at top flight hotels. Thanks very much to the great four seasons team

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: A great hotel for my first (business) trip to Tokyo. The staff met me at Narita Intl ( for an additional charge) and made sure I got to the hotel ok on the Narita express . The room and bathroom were fabulous. The staff were outstanding...they were kind , warm , welcoming and helpful in anyway possible. I couldnt have asked for a better stay in Tokyo. I'm probable being harsh by giving 4 stars instead of 5 , thats just because I think they could do better with their tv channels. More english channels would have been great ! I'd definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who can pay the price.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: We stayed here in room 514. All I can say is WOW! The room itself exceeded all expectations. Absolutely lovely- luxurious bedding, deep tub, large shower. Only an easy 5 minute walk from Tokyo station, easy access to Ginza. Taxis are accessible. Staff will meet you at the stop and take you to and from the hotel with a trolley so as to make it easier to get your stuff to and fro. Intimate bar with delicious offerings upstairs on the 7th floor as well as a spa. Additionally, this hotel is situated right over, and has access to, the underground labyrinthine that makes up the retail area (restaurants, pharmacies, bars, clothing, ETC) of Tokyo Station. If you have the means, then you will not be sorry if you stay here at this gorgeous boutique hotel with all the power and prestige of the Four Seasons behind it.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This was my first trip to Tokyo, and one of my splurge vacations so I wanted to stay somewhere really nice. I poured through the reviews here for the top hotels and finally decided on this one because most people said it was quiet, close to transportation and had great amenities. I have to agree on all points, it was an excellent stay.Since it was my first time in Tokyo I opted for the greeter at the airport, which I understood I would pay extra for, but it was worth it. She was extremely efficient and managed to get me on the train to Tokyo in 15 minutes from the time I got out of customs...and that was with a stop at the ATM! The greeter at Tokyo Station was also great and very necessary since the train and the hotel are at opposite ends of the station, and there was construction going on which was further confusing. I might still be lost there if she hadn't guided me to the hotel.The staff at the hotel were all great. I was meeting a friend to celebrate a special event and they not only prepared the little welcome champagne I asked for, they also put together a congratulations note and signed it from the staff! I thought that was a very thoughtful touch.The spa, the bar and the restaurant are all top notch. Food was great, drinks were great, tea was wonderful, spa treatments also excellent.As some had recommended I asked for a room not facing the station and the one we got was quiet and huge, and wonderful.One thing I don't remember seeing in other reviews is that there are a lot of good places to eat really close. There is a French bakery/bistro in the office building, several types of restaurants in the basement (Korean, Japanese, Chinese, etc.), you don't even have to go outside. And just a block away is another building with maybe a dozen restaurants of all types, "fast food" in the basement and Mexican, Spanish, Chinese, night clubs etc. on two floors above the street. It was nice to have so many options so close to the hotel.If I have one piece of criticism and advice, which for the seasoned travelers might be obvious but I was really tired when I got there, it was that I wish I had figured out how much cash I would need, and the exchange rate, before I went to the ATM, really before I even got to Tokyo. The greeter at the airport suggested I would only need a little because everyone takes credit cards and she recommended 10,000 yen. As I only had a few minutes to get to the train I just went with that. She then proceeded to use the 10,000 yen to get my train ticket, which took a hefty chunk out of it and made me realize she had woefully underestimated how much cash I would probably need considering cabs, convenience stores, etc. I did use credit cards for a lot of things but I definitely needed more than 10,000 yen to get around Tokyo for the time I was there. So don't go with the greeter suggestion, figure it out in advance.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I stayed here with my husband and two sons (ages 17 and 20).The hotel is small and low-key, which is just what I wanted in Tokyo. If you are coming from Narita, I highly recommend taking the Narita Express train. The hotel also provides (for a fee) a meet and greet service, where their representative will meet you outside of customs and escort you to the station and help buy tickets and get you to the platform. On the other end, at Tokyo Station, their staff will meet and escort you to the hotel (which I don't think I would have found without them!). The rooms are super-comfortable and modern. As the sign in the bathroom says, don't be afraid of the toilet. It is a Toto Washlet, which looks complicated and intimidating, but is actually very efficient, and these toilets are found in most restaurants and public restrooms. We ate breakfast upstairs in the restaurant every day, and while it was good, I would have liked to see a little more variety in the menu. The daily juice specials were always delicious, and the service was excellent.I did not use the gym or spa, but it was very hot when we were there, and I was wishing that they had a rooftop swimming pool!The hotel is lovely, the staff is so kind and accommodating; I don't think you could do better in Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Stayed here after selling our Pied a Terre in Asakusa and loved it. Our stays in Tokyo are usually GO GO GO. But the Four Seasons shifted us into low gear as we just enjoyed the facility and service. Tokyo is a very service oriented city, but The Four Seasons sets the bar. We won't be staying anywhere else in Tokyo and have just booked our next stay.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a very low key hotel but the execution is perfect. This is certainly not a large bustley bling hotel, if that's what you are looking for look elsewhere. However, if you are looking for a well located luxury hotel with spacious rooms and exceptional service this definitely is the place for you. Pros:Spacious and luxurious rooms (getting a little bit old)Great foodGood location (business district and on the door step of Tokyo station)Exceptional serviceReasonable priced roomsMeet and greet on train platform on arrival at Tokyo station Nice gymOnly small detail was we had some noise coming in to the room from trains passing until around midnight. Not a big problem but it may ug some people.I fully recommend this hotel. It's hard to go wrong with the Four Seasons.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Our experience with the 4S Marunouchi was overwhelmingly wonderful. Traveling with 2 teenage boys, 15 and 17, can be exhausting as they never seem to tire. We were so very grateful to the hotel staff for their help and genuine kindness. From the meeting at the train station, to breakfast, to purchasing tickets to the Tokyo Giants baseball game(the staff actually ran to the ticket office to buy them for us), to the spa.....the hotel staff was always present and went out of their way to care for us.They called for taxis and gave printed instructions to the drivers, helped us decide which trains to take, made dinner reservations, and even left candy in the room for the boys.The room was calming and the beds were extremely comfortable. Bathrooms were perfect. Our view was great, the boys loved watching the people of Tokyo streaming to work in the morning and the city lighting up at night.We've stayed in beautiful hotels all over the world, from Paris to London to The Via Veneto in Rome, and I have never experienced such great service. Thanks for making our trip to Tokyo a great one!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is a quiet, well run, and comfortable oasis in the hectic center of Tokyo. The staff is friendly and very service-oriented. I have stayed here several times and it is always excellent. The staff really goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. (Note, the fitness room is somewhat lacking, especially in the summer when it gets hot.)

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great central location. Staff is super helpful with directions and recommendations if you need them. We stayed there with our two boys (10&12) and took a room with two queen beds which worked out much better than taking two rooms at a Japanese hotel
user_name:
Nick G
Tiburon, California, United States

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: First time go to Tokyo for my wedding party, we stayed at Four season Hotel. Great location, friendly staff, beautiful room and the please was clean.Hotel prebooked all our restaurants beforehand which was really helpful - great concierge service. Team at the hotel are all really helpful and go out of their way to make your stay a perfect one. Look forward to come back again

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Traveling with two kids in Tokyo is just asking for punishment, but coming to the Four Seasons has been a sanctuary in a sea of the big city. The hotel is next to the Tokyo Station, and offers an amazing serviceaof pickup and dropoff of luggage right on the platform--just call ahead and tell them what train and car number and they'll meet you there. Awesome. Room was prepped for kids--padding on coffee table corners, special cookies for the kids, coloring books, and kid sized bathrobes. Really a great option for families visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Great location; right by Tokyo station - we loved the platform meet and greet - just called from the train on the way in and all went very smoothly. Bought JR Pass and used lots during the few days we were there - good trains to most places from the nearby station. Hotel prebooked all our restaurants beforehand which was really helpful - great concierge service. Team at the hotel are all really helpful and go out of their way to make your stay a perfect one. Would definitely go back and cannot recommend highly enough.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: In the last year, I have twice come to Tokyo for business and both times I stayed at the Four Seasons Marunouchi (make sure you get the right one -- not the other Four Seasons). The extrmely high standards of this hotel proved consistent over the year. The rooms are large, comfortable, thoughtfully laid out, and seem to have everything one might reasonably be expected to need. If you think of something else you want, just call the staff. They simply will not fail to do what you need. Among other things, they have wrapped gifts for me, walked with me to Tokyo station to show me the way to express trains, helped me explain my desired to location to cab drivers, corrected internet trouble, and arranged last minute meeting space.You may find cheaper hotels, but you will not find a business hotel that is more convenient to Marunouchi center and that is so reliable and consistently committed to excellent service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They went out of their way to help us.Can't find a better hotel than Four Seasons Tokyothey made our 31 wedding anniversary so memorable, since it's also our first visit to Japan. We will surely go back there again in our next visit.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have experienced phenomenal service at the 4S everywhere I have been and this no exception. They will escort you wherever you need including helping with bags from the airport and guiding you through Tokyo Station (can be quite confusing for even experienced tourists). They offer over the top help in ways that make it very easy to accept, this is truly a unique skill, to the extent that I'm contemplating incorporating aspects of it into my business. You won't go wrong here.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: This is undoubtedly a great hotel, the service is typical Four Seasons outstanding but with a Japanese touch that makes it seem far more sincere. We were greeted as arranged at the train station having arrived from Narita airport and escorted to the hotel. On arrival we realised the lobby was incredibly small. It really was just one desk. Our room was excellent though, high tech, great beds, 3d television and very spacious. However we overlooked train tracks and although the windows were solid, we heard light rumbling every 3 minutes, slightly annoying.The thing though that was really bugging my companion and I was that the place was too tucked away, too corporate and far too quiet, it was just a bit depressing. I like to go back to a hotel where there are other people and walk into a spacious lobby. That was simply not the case here. Breakfast was limited, although the service remained excellent.The hotel is just so perfect for business people and there's actually not much to fault about it (hence the 4star rating) but unfortunately it's not what I was looking for. I promptly checked into the Peninsula, a great hotel for a more leisured stay, fantastic pool etc, cheaper and equally good service.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: It has been a few years since I stayed at the Four Seasons so on a first trip to Tokyo I checked out Trip Advisor and decided to book a reservation. The Four Seasons at Marunouchi is small (57 rooms), has a forgettable hotel appearance in a skyscraper as well as forgettable lobby, rooms, halls and dining spaces in terms of decor. Service is efficient not always effective for example I booked with my AMEX Platinum and received some special deals like a $100 spa credit but was told when I booked a shiatsu massage that it wasn't covered under the credit because it was an outside vendor. After a look of disappointment, the staff checked with the powers-that-be and I was granted the use of the credit. Also, be careful when you book the staff to meet you at the airport. It isn't their staff. And Four Seasons charges $80 just to meet you and show you to the train entrance!!! The worse add-on was the required 15% service charge to compensate for the fact that the Four Seasons either doesn't pay its staff well and/or it is a ripoff to high paying guests. Mind you service was very good for which I had been tipping unaware that 15% was automatically added on to EVERYTHING including when you use the Conceirge to book a tour. The restaurant food was good not great. The menu was simple and only included one Japanese item for breakfast and one or two Japanese food items for dinner. The portions are small and I left hungry after spending $100 for a soup and entree. The room was luxurious, had many nice amenities, a bathroom you would want to have forever and a bed with a choice of pillows. Would I stay at the Four Seasons Tokyo at Marunouchi after spending $2,000 for 2 nights? No, it was not the luxury value I could get at say a Raffles where the service is exquisite and endearing, they don't nickel and dime you every chance and the experience is more memorable at a more fairer luxury investment.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Every time I go to Tokyo I try to spend a little time at the Four Seasons at Marunouchi, my favorite Tokyo hotel. They always take great care of you and extend a kind, personal touch that is always welcome when traveling far from home. I have been there many times and never gotten anything but the best service from warm and helpful people who try so very hard to make your stay comfortable.For those new to Tokyo, or if you travel with lots of bags, the hotel will be more than happy to send someone to meet you at the railway station. The hotel is only about a 5 min walk from Tokyo station, but if you are not sure of your way around the station this can be of a bit of help. If you hit Tokyo station at rush hour, and you have bags, it can be a bit of fun to get out. :-)On my last trip they knew I was on my way (because I 'tweeted' my status) and were kind enough to meet me at the door and made me feel welcome. I was even a little surprised that they were following my twitter feed. The social media team at this hotel go above and beyond! Each and every one of them adds to the value of this hotel.The hotel rooms are great, and very large by Japanese standards. The location, a short walk to Tokyo station is perfect if you plan on traveling around Tokyo area. While Marunouchi area is very business centered, the proximity to Tokyo station makes it perfect for the tourists as well.The restaurant in the hotel is very good as well, with great views of the Shinkansen as they come and go from the station. They put on special dinners very often, so it may be worth asking the hotel if they have one going on when you are there. They are very well done and worth a try. Lots of more casual places to eat in the area around the hotel. Most to them setup to feed the 1000s of people that work in the area and that offer a mix of price points.I can not say enough good things about this hotel. While not a cheap place to stay, you do get great value for the money you spend. I look forward to my next trip!

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Third time in FS at Marunouchi, this time for 4 nights.I like everything about this hotel and its staff.The staff is attentive and always helpfull, the food is great, the rooms are large and the beds are fantastic. With less than 60 rooms it never gets crowded - and You always feels welcome.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: For us, this was a slightly different Four Seasons experience. The Marunouchi hotel is smaller and a bit more intimate than most of the other FS properties we've visited. But it's still a Four Seasons and a very good one, at that. We had been looking forward to visiting this property for a number of years and we were not disappointed. We thoroughly enjoyed our two night stay: highlights included the service (of course!), the restaurant (particularly the great breakfasts) and the location (right near Tokyo Station and the Ginza). Our room had a view towards the Ginza, yet was quiet and very comfortable. The bathroom is beautiful in a typical Four Seasons way, and we enjoyed the L'Occitane amenities. The decor was a bit more subdued than some Four Seasons properties, likely because it feels more Japanese and slightly less Western. Overall, the room felt very calming. The service was typical Four Seasons: excellent. The restaurant staff in particular were very friendly and helpful. The bar - taking up part of the lobby and the entrance to the restaurant - felt a bit less special than some of the other FS properties we've visited, but it wasn't bad. This definitely feels like a business hotel because of its location, but we'd recommend this hotel even if you're a tourist on vacation like we were. Our visit to the Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi was an excellent way to start our week-long Japan trip.
user_name:
MJPBAF
Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: I have been a repeat customer for years, visit twice a year for business 2 nights each. The hotel is small and in a mixed use building. Location is very central, design is superb, service is unbelievable and friendly English speaking staff, restaurant is amazing, both Japanese and western choices. The attention to details is beyond expectations, they remember the little things from my last visit (iron board, room preferences etc). The hotel is expensive and the strong yen does not help.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Wonderful service. Wonderful rooms and facilities. Caring staff.
user_name:
Mark A
New York City, New York

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Hotel is well located near the Tokyo Station and within walking distance of Ginza.The rooms are good size, comfortable, modern, but can get noisy with the Shinkensens running close by.Do avail of the "platform service' if you plan to arrive at the Tokyo Station, it is very helpful especially if you are going to arrive with luggage.

hotel_name: Four Seasons Hotel Tokyo at Marunouchi
review_body: Examined the options in Tokyo and this was the best choice by far. Not only is it beautifully designed, it is in the best location. Close to both Tokyo station which takes you anywhere, it is also an easy walk to Chuo-dori in Ginza and all the great shops and restaurants. It was a very safe area with lots to do all the time. The rooms are spacious and beautifully designed with floor-to-ceiling windows overlooking the street or the train station. After two weeks in a small basic hotel in Kyoto this was like heaven!But the staff at the hotel are the real stars. They are the nicest, kindest people. Starting with the valet who met me at my train through to the sweet young woman who took me (and my luggage) to the airport limousine bus (and waited until the bus left) they were all lovely. The restaurant and bar are beautiful and the food is delicious (and the staff terrific). One thing you have to watch is to make sure cab drivers take you to this lesser-known Four Seasons.
